The main course was a selection of prime beef flat iron, grilled skirt steak, and diver scallops.  The scallops were to die for, but the steak was good too.  Despite thinking of skirt steak as something I buy to cut into strips for stir fry or steak sandwiches, I preferred it over the flat iron.  It had a really flavorful crust and was tender and juicy.  I didn't know skirt steak could be made like that!  We also had 3 sides to go with our meats: shitake mushrooms, yukon gold potato puree (yum!), and sweet corn with green onions.  We ate all of the potato puree and sweet corn, but the shitake mushrooms were a little bland compared to everything else.    For dessert we had a selection of chocolate panacotta, cheesecake with blackberries, and a pastry with peaches and raspberry sorbet.  Get the chocolate pannacotta.  You will be happy.  I really enjoyed myself at Craftsteak, especially after the disappointment that was Mesa Grill.  I'd like to go back and try a "fancier" cut of beef off the a la carte menu, but I can't complain about the taste and value of the meal I had for Restaurant Week.

DPAKql0OzOsPmNvGLpVOCA.text: My wife and I ate a late dinner here after arriving in Vegas. Beautiful restaurant. Took us immediately to table even though we didn't have reservation. Because of the late hour we split a large New York strip and potatoes au gratin. Excellent steak, potatoes were awesome. Server was highly attentive. This restaurant is definitely on our list when we return to Vegas next month.

a3I8tSaDgooANOt4RSDyCw.text: Simply an awesome meal. T-Bones were outstanding and all the salads and side dishes were delicious. Service impeccable. Best shrimp cocktail I have had in years!

OMvuGdSBab8ythvvnZNFrA.text: WOW! That's the first word that comes to mind when it comes to Craftsteak. After all the superb recommendations, we had to come here to give it a try while at Vegas.   We looked at the menu days/weeks before so we already knew what to order. We started out with the lobster bisque. I ordered the braised short ribs and hubby ordered the Kobe Waygu skirt steak with a side of hen of the woods mushrooms.   The lobster bisque is the best I ever tasted. It has chunks of lobster in it which is rare since I have tried others. The short ribs were tender, succulent, filled with robust flavors and melted in my mouth. I tried some of the Kobe waygu which was cooked to a medium perfection. If you never tried this type of beef, it is definitely worth the money. It is just different in a VERY good way. If you are a mushroom lover such as myself, you will like the Hen of the woods mushroom. I am not sure if they season it or how they cooked it, but it was delicious. It has a great earthy taste with a great texture that is hard to describe.   We also tried their Chocolate souffle and oh my, oh my....it was warm, chocolaty and satisfying. Dinner was so good, we didn't want to end it so quickly so along with the souffle, we ordered the banana brown sugar ice cream.   Eating here was just a blast and I can't wait to go back. From the atmosphere to the EXCELLENT service, there is nothing to complain about.   By the way, the complimentary dinner rolls are also addicting. It comes to your table warm and slightly salted on the top.

orIF7TnDT5jAAO4ZSw_UfA.text: During dinner my partner asked me who was it that said,"Risotto should be creamy and spread over the plate when served?"  She almost choked when I said,"Tom Collichio!"   Our rissotto did not spread over the plate and some of the pieces were a tad crunchy.  I had the foie gras as an appetizer and it was delicious, but a little on the oily side. I greedily left none on the plate and will order it again if I return, since it is about to be banned in my wonderful home state.  My rib eye was cooked well, but really nothing to write home about and I am a fan of bone in meat.  My girl likes meat too and ordered the filet, hers was delicious.  Apparently she was quite happy with the meat that she received that night. She liked the steak too! ;)

hdLmig1zAczto-Xtl0x09A.text: We did the tasting menu and had a few different cocktails. We had the steaks done Medium rare and everything came out perfect.   My favorite of the night was the NY Strip, perfectly seasoned and seared.  If you do the tasting menu, make sure everyone is VERY hungry, we were barely able to eat 3/4 of the food brought to us, which made for a very full rest of the night.

DST7q9gAP35K8sTZrxv98g.text: I watch fights at the MGM arena every week. I typically get hungry after and I want to take my wife and guests to a classy place afterwards.  Several months ago I found the absolute best restaurant. The service is excellent and the food rivals any 5 star place on earth. More importantly the front door manager Mark remembers my name every time he sees me and provides me with the utmost service and care. He always treats me like an absolute VIP which is another reason for me to keep coming back. At this point I eat here just about every other week.  Thanks Mark, keep up the great work!

r7rUz1KSH-CNF8psSDtJ5w.text: Definitely one of the best meals of my life. Shared the 32 oz Ribeye with a friend, it's served sliced along with bone with meat attached and bone marrow. I could seriously finish this myself, yes that good. My steak was cooked to perfection, outer char was very flavorful, inner meat flavor was dreamworthy. I drool just thinking about it.  Kobe wagyu tartare, fucking delicious. Service was impeccable, bartender knowledgeable, we had a semi private table in a room for our bachelor's party. Definitely a place I would revisit when I return to vegas

hucjPWUvBCkIhksnC6pfVw.text: We had a 6:30 reservation for dinner prior to a 9:30 show.  We were seated promptly and politely.  Our server was jovial and reasonably helpful.  There were three people in our party, so we ended up with three different apps, steaks, and sides, and then shared a dessert.  Everything was executed reasonably well, but not amazing.  I think our appetizers were better than the actual steaks.  I had the beet salad with roasted beets and pickeled eggs.  I think that the salad lacked a bit of acid, but overall good.  Another person had the quail appetizer and thought it was tasty.  We ordered braised kale, sweet potato puree, and brussels sprouts as sides.  I felt that the sweet potatoes were too sweet, and could have used some salt to contrast, but another in my party enjoyed them.  The steaks were average.  I felt like mine was almost over-salted and tough, but maybe that's the nature of the cut (flatiron).  I ordered it because it was the only 8-oz steak on the menu.  I would have preferred an impeccably prepared 6-oz filet.  There was also a strip steak and a bone-in ribeye at the table.  They were fine.  Not great, not bad, just fine.  I would say that I've had dramatically better steaks at Ruth's Chris and Capital Grille.  It's a bit dissapointing that we've had better meals at major chain steak houses.  Overall, I probably wouldn't go back.  It wasn't bad, it just wasn't the fantastic experience I was looking for.  I think that for the hype and reviews, I was expecting to be wowed, and I was a bit underwhelmed.  I didn't leave hungry, but I was a little bummed/disappointed/bored.  The best part of the meal was the monkey bread with sour cream ice cream.  I would have that again any day...

4jOr9nV-wJYvcOJFlc-HvA.text: I am so sad to write this review but as a few reviewers have already noted that the service and the steak are not consistently good.  My husband and I came in VERY excited to be back b/c we both had been for bachelor/bachelorette parties but never alone.   We had a couple of complaints:  1) Our meal wasn't paced. The server opened our wine immediately but didn't follow up with the bread. We had to ask for the bread and then our food came out very quickly afterwards.  2) This all would have been fine but we ordered the Wagyu ribeye and it fell flat. My previous experience with that cut was amazing but this was meh...   The caesar salad, bread, sides and monkey bread was delish but the star dish just didn't shine. :(  I would give it one more shot (doing the regular rib eye therefore reducing cost & enjoying the delish sides) but if you're set to do one super nice meal in Vegas, I'd do Le Cirque. Their service was top notch as was their food. It was a bit stuffy but you can liven it up depending on the party. :)

lU_QHNzxdg3RG0ugH7sohg.text: Awesome experience. We decided to do the tasting menu from recommendation from our waiter. And wow it was nothing like other tastings we have ever tried. It was 3 courses where you would select the steak type and everything's else was up to the chefs. Come hungry! The first course came out quick and my favorites are the bread, prosciutto and figs and wagyu tartare. The second course is the steak and the sides. We ordered domestic wagyu filet and it's a huge cut. The dessert was my favorite. Monkey bread was melt in your mouth. Highly recommend this place for food and value.

8RzEDwzSDWlbiTSUtUHn2A.text: Design reminded me a lot of New York restaurants. The service was very good. Can't complain there. Pricing was average for a steakhouse. Menu was a bit limited. Out steaks were undercooked and lacked flavor but the sides and salads were bomb!

1-SzqogWO5OW-9sEuNh_6A.text: I've seen a few complaints about the prices, but it's a fine dining steak house, on the Strip in Las Vegas.  Within that description, everyone should expect to pay more for the quality and experience.    This review is mostly to cancel out the strangest complaint I've heard in a long time.  We were just there recently and heard a woman complaining that there weren't enough vegan entree' options at a steak house.  There were more than enough side dish options that she could have combined to make a nice sizable meal, but with most vegans, it isn't really about what they eat.  It's about what others eat.  This last time we were there, we enjoyed the Tasting Menu which gives you a nice sampling of each meal course.  Because the menu is seasonal, it's not on the menu and has to be requested.  We've been there many times and have never been disappointed by the meal or the service.  I highly recommend you let the Chef's show off and ask for the Tasting Menu.  You won't be disappointed...unless you're a vegan.

tgsnu6dQZKd2T_BfjliUpg.text: Best restaurant I have been to in the last several years. Well done. Service was impeccable, food was different and on point. Loved every minute here.  Will certainly go back.

hjZPEKPQF7DcJKPrvU3iRw.text: I was in search for the ultimate steak and I found it. Unfortunately it's in Las Vegas. I live in Tempe AZ. Now we will measure restaurants by this standard. No real screw ups, no crappy side dishes. Tom C made an excellent place to eat. We are suffering for a good and nice dining experience in the low desert.  Thank you Tom Colicchio.

Dc6QPll9bh2GIQBGM1wQEw.text: Yep, this place is great. Bartender is great, steak is great, side dishes are great.   Simply great food, great service and great atmosphere.  So yes, if you can make sure to walk in. We loved it, I mean honestly it was freakin great. . . . .

_UY93GsQ3zPgKRnw-fUqgQ.text: I got a bone in rib eye.  70 something dollars. No where close to a "craft steak". Probably closer to outback. Not sure what's going on. Chain places are better.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s nice. But not great.
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib eye

dFulrDSb5ZFBM8WtrW1NYA.text: Great ambiance. The steaks are of high quality so the prices they were asking seemed fair. But what makes this place superior that the steaks were cooked to perfection!  The sides were delicious. As well, the wine selection was extensive. And they were emphasizing a Duck Horn cab ( they are known for their Merlot's) and I must say this was a great wine!

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strip steak Wagyu style. Excellent

cHBvueuNjkq_12XAfKfrOg.text: Food was incredible, wine list was fantastic. Ambiance was whimsical but elegant and comfortable, and the service was exemplary. I will be making this one of my repeated stops on each visit to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potato puree

qLKu9rkUXWS5q-dNQK88qw.text: Super disappointing. After making a Reservation for 10:00 pm, the front desk said the kitchen closed at 10:00 pm but they would keep it open for 15 minutes for us. For the amount of money I spent I expected better. Steaks were not even that good.

r_E_hI-A0k3tJD4hXZC4eg.text: I will make this short and start with the missing star. The white corn grits with Gouda and bacon was essentially all Gouda and bacon, you couldn't taste the grits, not at all.  The espresso was burnt and there was no crema on top of the shots leading me to think that they pulled the shots longer than they should have, and that the full porta filter sat in the group before they pulled the shot. So here's the great: The braised short rib was perfect and came recommended by one of our servers. The filet mignon was perfect and also recommended by our server. The heirloom cauliflower was incredible. The carrots with honey were incredible. The buffalo mozzarella was incredible  The heirloom tomato's were perfect. The potato puree (we order to replace the terrible grits) were absolutely epic. The chocolate malt ice cream was great. Service here is great, all of our servers (you get like four of them) were warm and extremely helpful.  All in all a great experience.

BL4JTvo0Y8unycGJwOJI2Q.text: I was looking for a good steakhouse as part of a night out with my buddies. I read some reviews here and saw some of the pictures. It was a must try while in Vegas.  We started with some salads which were standard but then came out the bread which was delicious! Our steaks were perfectly cooked and our sides - mushroom mix, asparagus, and potatoes - were also very delicious. I remember thoroughly enjoying the steaks and leaving with a feeling of complete satisfaction. The service was great as our servers were fast and friendly. My friends and I had a great night celebrating a great occasion. Would go back again!

uDwkMIJpbCPHuj1DML_VTw.text: Fabulous food and atmosphere. The warm salad is incredible enough for two/three. The sea bass and wagu surf and turf melted in our mouths. The corn grits were surprisingly great and I don't usually care for grits. It was our anniversary and we were full, our waiter insisted on dessert on him so of course we said yes. Highly recommend this place. Make a reservation in advance though.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FMUMwR6XInNcr8VPGhHzvg.text: This was an awesome steakhouse. While I am always skeptical to eat at restaurants that have celebrity names attached to them because so many times it has average food and bad service. This place was everything that a celebrity chef's restaurant should be. The food was amazing (one of our favorites was the steak tartar) and the service was just as amazing.  Our server was attentive and gave great advice when it came to helping us create our dinning experience.   While the food was a bit on the pricier side, sometimes you have to treat yourself because you are in Vegas.

6ReK3c5jwZ2umLOIY3vHJg.text: My bf and I dined together on Thursday night at Craftsteak and the service was worse this time around than last year. We didn't get any bread to start and had to ask for some when our appetizer arrived. This apparently inconvenienced our busser as he looked extremely annoyed. In fact, he looked annoyed at us the whole night and never once smiled or made any eye contact. Once we finished our appetizer, our server told us it would be "just a few minutes" before our entrees arrived. We waited a literal 30 minutes before they arrived (I checked). During this time, he did not check on us or explain the long wait. He actually never came back the rest of the night. Another server (I believe his name was Joe) took over, was actually friendly and professional, and made sure we were doing okay.   Food was amazing as always. The scallops are a must. The NY and hanger steak were prepared perfectly. The hanger steak had a great char on the outside but still juicy on the inside. The white corn grits and fingerling potatoes were delicious as well, while the cauliflower was just okay. The tropical mango cheesecake was absolutely amazing.   The hostesses acknowledged our anniversary which I appreciated, however, none of our servers did at all. Food is great, but unfortunately, it does not make up for the terrible service both times we dined. We won't return.

UvaneGnmd7rgFMBoljttRw.text: Top Chef personality and James Beard Award-winning Chef Tom Colicchio brings the Steak ruckus on the Las Vegas Strip.   When Craftsteak landed at MGM Grand in 2002, a new standard was set for the Las Vegas steakhouse. Now the Strip is the steakhouse center of the universe and the choices are seemingly endless - yet Craftsteak remains on the shortlist for almost any carnivore looking for a righteous cut of Beef (or otherwise) while in Sin City. The interior exudes class and sophistication plus the service doesn't let the swagger of the digs or kitchen down at any moment. If you don't feel like you are in a real deal Steakhouse... Well, that is on you.   The menu changes daily but you can count on most (if not all) Beef cuts to be available on any given day and they are prepared either by grill or pan sear. Neither of which you can go wrong with as I can attest to. The restaurant offers a Prix Fixe - and it is a good one to boot - but you are best served by choosing your own cut and then sharing the sides family style. This way you get your Steak your way and everyone enjoys the sides in a communal fashion. The prices are on par with any in LA/OC Steakhouse which basically means they are obscene or fair depending on your stomach for a Steakhouse bill.   Like any stark, raving mad carnivore I love Ribeye, Filet, and Strip Steak - but as an aficionado of the sport I was immediately drawn to the 10 ounce Black Angus Hangar Steak (a consummate steal at $38.00) thanks to the near perfect blend of fat/meat ratio and a mouthfeel so divine your very own butcher saves the cut for friends and family. Craftsteak puts together a very, very gratifying specimen of a Hangar Steak. Softly charred outside, buttery meat within, and a mouthfeel worthy of the gods. You really have to try this, it is that good (Yelp - italics would help with descriptions such as this...).   Happy. Stoked. Loved. Pick your superlative.   The side courses are also mesmerizing and deserve a review of their own but that isn't why you are reading this review, right? It doesn't matter much anyway thanks to them changing daily so go with the server's recommendation and get the cut of your fancy and enjoy.   Craftsteak is the absolute realness. Try it yourself and tell me that I am wrong.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hangar Steak.

9EYmps45gRXYy87ftoXVTA.text: What a great night of dining at Tom Colicchio's.  Went with a group of 4. 2 ordered the Sea Bass, 1 then Hanger Steak and 1 the Skirt steak. Sides were the pureed potatoes, green beans and mushrooms.  The entire meal was a dam pleasure to eat. The fish was cooked to perfection.  The steaks were melt in your mouth good.  The sides were the perfect accompaniment.  Our server Brianne was absolutely amazing.  customer service just does happen like that.  Kudos to her.  We will definitely go back!!!!

xwidjQQ5lo5PhD8eDoo_EA.text: I visited Craftsteak on 11/7/18 & was thoroughly impressed. My reservation was at 9, I was seated by 8:05. The ambiance is low key but upscale. The service was impeccable. I sat at the bar, where both the bartender (Mark I believe) and the servers were attentive while not intrusive. My meal was quite possibly the best steak I've ever had. Requested medium & was served medium ++. The steak was both juicy and nicely seasoned. Seared perfectly. I chose pureed potatoes as my side, which were creamy & well seasoned. Everything is a la carte & portions are big. They give you an option to order 1/2 side. Glad I chose that option. All in all, great experience.

4_du0cfEtZHvAcOXXMVz1w.text: Giving three stars only because the service was phenomenal. Our waiter was helpful, attentive, and did everything he could to get us what we needed. The steak however, was sub par. Both my wife and I got the fillet mignon for $64 a piece. We ordered medium rare and the steak came so rare that it was mushy and tasteless on the inside and the edges were so overdone they were dry and took forever to chew. The sides were unique and generally good. However the meal was not worth the $180 we spent

3YsjCl58F15fFKAozk55Ww.text: A friend recommended this place to us and we just tried it yesterday. And wow, gotta say it is the best steak I've had. The ribeye was perfect, nice and juicy. The beef short rib was also very delicious! I can definitely taste that slow cook. Didn't even need a knife. The wine was great at a reasonable price. Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BN0Fr2gpVZjmcBlriSjoeg.text: I love a good steak dinner when I travel to Vegas. I've stayed at the MGM over a handful of times and can't believe I never tried Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak until last Thursday evening.   Although my husband and I ran a little late getting to the restaurant from the Delano hotel, the hostess was still very welcoming and seated us right away. She pulled my chair out for me and handed me my napkin. The two waiters we had were very friendly and knowledgeable of the menu. They were on point with their service making sure the food was good our drinks were filled, and explaining our courses.   We chose to do the tasting menu and boy were we satisfied and pleased with our choice! Some reviewers were saying the portions were small for what you pay for. You should expect to be paying more when you're going to a nice steakhouse. You're paying for quality and the experience. Although pricey, it was well worth it in our opinion and we definitely felt like we had more than enough food.   We chose the appetizers, sides and meat courses. We had the chef choose the dessert. The free buttery salt crusted dinner rolls were so damn good!   Our first course consisted of the Heirloom Tomato Salad, Italian Buffalo Mozzarella Salad, Prosciutto San Daniele and Shrimp Cocktail. The heirloom tomatoes were so fresh and good, topped with basil and a balsamic reduction. The mozzarella actually was better when paired with the heirloom tomato salad. The chilled shrimp were jumbo in size and plump with cocktail sauce made in house. You know it's a nice place when you're served 4-5 pieces of shrimp rather than 3 pieces when you're a party of two. The prosciutto was great and more slices than I expected were served.   For the second course, we went with the domestic wagyu Filet Mignon and the domestic wagyu Ribeye. Both great choices!! Both cuts of meat were so tender and cooked to perfection. OMG the filet just melted in the mouth and the ribeye had such great flavor!! The meat was already sliced making it easier to share. Our sides included asparagus, assortment of mushrooms and the potato puree. The asparagus was average, nothing to rave about. The mushrooms were okay and were my least favorite. They lacked flavor. I would prefer to try something different next time like the risotto, carrots or maui onions. The potato puree was amazing!! I'm glad we chose that side. So creamy and the chives perfectly complimented it.   So much dessert was brought out. We couldn't believe the amount of food we were tasting. The dessert course included creme brulee, monkey bread, sorbet and fresh fruit. The monkey bread served with ice cream was AMAZEBALLS! I would go back just for that...I tried so hard not to eat it all. The creme brulee was divine with fresh strawberries. The sorbet was very refreshing.   The only thing I didn't like was the lady walking around asking if you want your picture taken. I think a nice place like that shouldn't allow for that, it's cheesy especially when you have to buy the pictures.   We definitely would go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom Assortment
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Italian Buffalo Mozzarella with Hazelnuts
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sorbet &amp; Fresh Fruit

tRr7muz75fFL8ZZqEjg0ow.text: One of my top 3 favorite steakhouses in Las Vegas.  Service is superb and the food is even better. I have to rave about the bread they bring out to you after you're seated. Freshly baked, warm bread with salt sprinkled on top. I have to refrain myself from asking for more and just getting full off of the bread.   I highly recommend starting your meal with the prosciutto and pear. They have prosciutto and fig only during certain seasons which I've been dying to try but I was quite pleased with the prosciutto and pear. They have a small variety of oysters to choose from if you like oysters. Never a bad idea to enjoy some oysters before a steak dinner!  The bone-in ribeye here is SO tasty. I went with my usual medium and it wasn't overcooked or undercooked. Seasoning gets an A from me! The sides were good but none stuck out to me. I'm a pretty die hard carnivore when I go to steakhouses and am usually too busy stuffing my face with ribeye to pay attention to the sides.  Great steakhouse Tom Colicchio! I've been here a handful of times and will be back again soon.

3-5iIHp2EtzyLGBVA8cRsQ.text: For $32, foie gra was prepared piss poorly.  Not sure if normal, but it came out cold and was unnecessarily sweet.  Craft beer can served was 5months old and flat... IPAs should be served fresh!   At least aged bone in filet was decadent.  Extremely tender. Potato puree is a must order.  Service was attentive and outstanding.   You can skip this restaurant.

A2wmdZV8JL_kK9lNfpaFRA.text: Steak was good, but very over priced! My wife and I split a 16oz steak potatoes and broccoli and I had a beer and it was $120. Not much flavor, potatoes and steak were bland. I could spend $16 at the grocery store and make something just as good. However, the service was great, and broccoli was good. Best part of the meal were the rolls that came before

ub-ghEJjyUwawhzc5Egwbw.text: Excellent food and service. A must try if you are in Las Vegas. Been here 9 times and can't wait to go back.  Food was prepared to perfection and delivered at the right time. Was there when the rodeo was in town. Some of the men should have been a little more respectful and removed their hats while in the restaurant.

DENB7g7Rsia_stO8vYwbhA.text: We ate there 5 years ago with my wife, this time with our 2 boys.  Steaks were great and flavorful.  Get New York Strip, medium cooked and add fries with cold stella artois lager for an incredible dinner for yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dFjgWmnvR9relLc0naB9gA.text: Flew into town to go to this amazing place again! Didn't disappoint! The food and service are exceptional and make for a memorable evening.

XMatIItD9PMXwzbsXUmxBg.text: My wife and I came here for her birthday dinner last night. We made a reservation, which worked out great, and sat at the bar for a short time before we were seated. Service was great and the restaurant was nice as well. We had a roasted beet appetizer, with each one of us getting a filet for our main course and some cauliflower and scallops as our sides. Beets were amazing as well as the cauliflower and scallops. My mark down is because the quality and flavor of the filets we got were mediocre.  They were chewy and lacked any flavor. Other than that everything else was great.

t0e5pI6uKwvBJldlNBi4Jw.text: If you want a nice dinner in Vegas, come here. They do it right.   I came here for my Bachelorette party dinner. There's really no other way to say it...my experience was EXCELLENT from beginning to end.   Service - Perfect. Not only was our waiter knowledgeable. He was a sweetheart and answered all our questions about the menu. Food - Delicious. We had about 10 ladies in our party and we of course all wanted different items. You can't go wrong here. EVERYTHING tastes amazing. Our waiter knew the best wine pairings as well. They even brought me a free dessert as treat for the bachelorette.  Atmosphere - Classy. Upscale, modern decor. I even ran into Charles Barkley. He wished me a happy marriage. Can't get better than that!

BNgDoFrQbV-LByPb07PeNQ.text: Favorite new steakhouse in Vegas!  I'm a huge fan of SW steakhouse in the wynn, but this one wins.  The most delicious ribeye you'll ever have and amazing sides.  The service is top notch and the ambiance is absolutely perfect, a perfect mix of old school charm and class with modern day trend.  I highly recommend craftsteak if you are visiting Vegas.

zX9K9Vwj27hL5GPH8c6ehg.text: Absolutely amazing!! Every single thing we had was insanely delicious. My favorites: that filet!!, the risotto, bisque, and that warm frisee salad... I can't stop thinking about it. The staff was incredible. I felt like royalty the entire time. The ambiance was perfection. If you don't eat here, you're seriously missing out.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our beautiful appetizers. That salad!!!

uZHGi0dQs2ETMN2YydND4A.text: Ate at the bar while staying at the MGM for a work conference. This is a solid steakhouse and delivers on expectations. it has a nice modern sophisticated feel and you can almost forget you are in a casino. I started out with a mozzarella and hazelnut salad that had nice textures and fresh ingredients. Then I got a roasted filet and the potato puree. As mentioned by others the potato puree was sinful and honestly I would go back just for more. The steak, was cooked perfectly and melted in my mouth. I just wish there was an option for a steak smaller then 10oz as I could not finish and I don't like to take food back to my room. They did have a smaller half size version of the salad and potatoes, so that helped. I wish I could have ordered dessert, but I was too full. The service was great, the bartender made great recommendations and made everyone at the bar feel welcome. If you are staying at the MGM,  and in the mood for steak, this is your place.

5v6KJJ9qQmrpr6AdIRCnPw.text: Great pick! I had the bone in ny strip and potato puree Impeccably cooked steak, great service, concerned staff, especially the manager (walked the tables but gave the impression he really wanted to hear feedback rather just the perfunctory how are you. Don't get some of the negative feedback on the potatoes, they were great, probably have to swim ten miles to make up for them, but well worth it.  Loved the entree served in its own serve my dish....would definitely come back....

HnLaCMb7sSxD4853jL9kqg.text: If you're going to eat here, do the tasting menu. It's a ton of food but it's a great deal. You get 4 appetizers/salads, two main dishes with two sides, and 3 desserts (4 if it's your birthday!) The service was impeccable. We had two waitresses, both very knowledgeable about the wine and food. Our waitress recommended merlot for me after asking two questions about my taste in wine, which is crazy because I didn't tell her merlot is my favorite! My only complaint was that our ribeye came out uncut, and it was supposed to be sliced for us, but the food and rest of our service was so good, I didn't even care. Thoughts about the food:  The warm frisee salad was AMAZING. If you like bacon and blue cheese, get it. We also got the peach spinach salad which was mediocre, the charcuterie board (was good) shrimp cocktail (really good) and the assorted mushrooms, which I was not a fan of. Bland and weird textures. The button mushrooms were good, though. On to the main course: The grilled ribeye was amazing. Way better than the filet. You can ask for certain dishes but we let the chef pick. The filet was average. It tasted a little under seasoned to me, but was tender and cooked just right. We also got the potato puree and the roasted cauliflower and broccoli. The puree was the mashed potatoes of my dreams. Get it. You won't be sorry. The roasted veggies I could live without. They do come with roasted garlic cloves though, which I love. Dessert was bomb. I have no more words. We got the mango & raspberry sorbet, the monkey bread for my birthday, the banana pudding and the fresh fruit. All delicious, you can't really go wrong. All in all, one if the best dining experiences I've ever had.

UUMxWaEJUpeCIJ5ywRzCng.text: Came here for dinner on Friday before heading to watch a show. We were greeted when we check in for our reservation and shown to our table. Everything from the service to the food was suburb.  It's pricey but everything was delicious and worth every penny. Would recommend this restaurant.

W6HrtcTdtqXBKgEykR2bPg.text: We had high expectations of this restaurant. CraftSteak is located inside the MGM Grand in Las Vegas. It has a great reputation for a steakhouse in Las Vegas. The dishes are presented very well in a skillet and the presentation brings immediate delight to the visual senses.  Maybe it's us or maybe it's not but the steaks, Filet Mignon & Bone-in Rib Eye did not taste anything special. The meats were tough to bite into and the expectations of it melting in our mouth led to a disappointment. The steaks were too dry in my opinion.  The side dishes, on the other hand, were great. The Brussels Sprouts and Potatoes were so good that we finished eating them before we finished the steaks.  I think the restaurant may need a renovation project to bring its ambiance back to modern steakhouses in the area. The service was slow however I must mention that the restaurant was busy.

y8YbK9dR7xLBTABGUItTnQ.text: Ate dinner there on Friday night in a party of four. We all ordered different cuts of meat.  I tried the bone-in ribeye and the flavor was tremendous!  The sides were prepared just right and the service was awesome.  Definitely recommend this place for dinner.

Gf_R7bQMnvsguhliDGwaHg.text: 5 stars for the mouth gasms the A5 wagyu New York strip steak produced.    Wonderful dinner to start the new year.  We were grinning from ear to ear, that was after we closed our eyes and tilted our heads back to enjoy each fatty burst of marbled goodness.    The A5 filet was really great also, but didn't have the same visceral reaction.    Skip the willamette and go with the CA Pinot noir.   Go for the lobster salad and seasonal greens, bright and light to start your meal.  I would say lighter on the butter for the mushrooms next round.   End with the monkey bread.    Fantastic memorable meal.  Consistently sets the bar for steaks in Vegas.

PF-eFMeKflVUspHf0fxhrg.text: Hubby's birthday and he couldn't decide what he wanted until he saw the seafood tower and it was over. . Best service hands down in any Las Vegas restaurant by far. Especially the attention to detail. Steak, seafood tower, risotto, monkey bread, all on point. It was a great evening.

0UYebvExKbmIzD8r3VFcqg.text: Potato puree was to die for.  Filet was good but not the best I've had for the price.  Service was attentive. BEST I mean BEST lobster bisque I've had.  Nice dinner.  Was it worth the price?  HMMMM. Maybe - maybe not. It's all about how much you're willing to spend for a nice but not over the top meal.  Disclaimer. I was freezing with the air conditioning so anxious to finish the meal and leave.  Would have loved to linger a bit more over coffee they have French press coffee.   Peter was a great waiter.  Cute as my daughter called him. Enjoyable to talk to.

4bvAXCkVZmFo-usEs21eqg.text: I've been to many steak houses before. For the price, this was really not great at all. Food was extremely salty. The food was bad, but the device was very good.

tcsIJxeka6sTjnl4PUZE8A.text: I was excited to try this place,  but unfortunately, it fell short for me. To start, the restaurant itself is nice, but unfortunately we were there on a Friday night and got seated in the back at a large round table that made me feel like I was at a conference room having an expensive meal.  The food was presented well, but was just ok. The cocktails were not great...lacked flavor (other than the taste of hard liquor) and looked boring.  The only positive at this place was the staff.

1NU7RDxb4O0Bo7BjiVw8nA.text: After contemplating many times on whether to try this restaurant, we finally did last night. I found hair in my food...totally ruined the experience.

aPfZXpibsErYG_qHZUiaXg.text: Awesome steaks and scotch selections. A must try if you're visiting the MGM. We came with a group of 7 and they accommodated us with no problems. Good service with even better food.

Kq5ZEi3Gr-HMjQyhmb6Rcg.text: Steak and food here were divine!  Steaks were so tender,  salmon was flaky and moist and lava cake and monkey bread were yummy!  We were there for a bachelorette and they complimented our desserts.  Portions we're very generous so totally shareable. They also hand out complimentary bread which was lightly toasted.  I liked it except for the sprinkled salt on top which was just really a personal preference.  For sides,  we got string beans,  mushrooms,  corn, Yukon potatoes.  Mushrooms were awesome!  However, potatoes were hard and dry and the cream corn just tasted like corn with 10lbs of butter lol also, servers were great but food took a while.  We were there at 7pm and food was served just a little after 8pm.  Thanks Craftsteaks for a memorable dinner! Can't wait to be back

WY09aRMCxHf9Te3D4Rc1rQ.text: Not only is their food amazing, but their service is ALWAYS impeccable. I make sure to go to Craftsteak every time I visit Vegas. Because I look young, waiters often don't deliver me with their best service. However, at Craftsteak, I am always so impressed with how attentive their waiters are.   I always order the Wagyu tartare and braised short ribs. Absolutely delicious. Whenever the sweet potatoes are in season, you should also try the puree. I wish they had it year long!

q21Y_x_PGLo8l7aQL5mmWA.text: Last year, I experienced Craft Steak for the first time and was blown away.  For months, friends had to bear with me as I repeatedly bragged that my meal there was the best dinner of my life.  I wasn't exaggerating either, as everything from my pineapple upside-down martini, to the pretzel bread with dipping mustards was unbelievably delicious.  As far as my steak was concerned, I honestly had never enjoyed the act of chewing meat as much as I did at Craft Steak, last December.  Finally back in Vegas, it's not surprising that the first restaurant I visited was Craft Steak.  Like a druggie trying to recapture that first high, I hoped for that same magic once again.  Well?  Don't get me wrong, Craft Steak is a top notch restaurant, but even a great spot can have an off night.  Unfortunately, the off night happened to be the night I had looked so forward to. What happened?  When tonight's steak arrived, I noticed something was wrong from the start as it was a bit tough and took more effort to cut than one would hope for from a $50 piece of meat.  Not only that, but that first chew revealed the steak to be cold.  Sadly, and embarrassingly, I had to send it back.  When I let my server know the situation, she was very willing to accommodate me by having a second steak prepared, but, in the interim, the potatoes and spinach we ordered as sides just sat, as they too, waited.    Finally, my replacement steak arrived, but by that point, my companion had already finished her entree, AND our side dishes had become cold, so basically, I paid $200 to NOT receive a warm plate of food, nor the opportunity to dine with my wife.  Don't get me wrong; I have nothing but respect for Tom Colicchio and I know Craft Steak is a fine restaurant, but tonight I merely ate, when I wanted to dine.

RtREJlF6sJn4AJl9bNJSfA.text: A most enjoyable evening.  Here for business and they delivered.  Great selection of whiskey for a great Manhattan.  Meal was fabulous- bisque, ribeye and Brussels sprouts. Staff is very friendly and attentive. If at the MGM and looking for a nice dinner, go here.

XmzIHJuID1bu6Uxv823elQ.text: We eat here last week. Second time for me. This time our steaks were not hot . When we shared that with them, No apologies just OK we take take them Back and warm them up . Second time around still not hot ! Manager then checked in and asked is how the " flavor of everything was" like he really did not want to know , we eat At lots of great Restaurants . If you want a great steak there are many better choices in Vegas than here.

BtXHixVInPJJN0nct3RONQ.text: The food was excellent but my rating is low because of the service and ambiance. The service was way too intense! We had 4 waiters and not a minute of peace to look at the menu. One waiter gave us a 10 minute explanation of the menu. It all felt very pressured and they kept pushing us to do the chef tasting menu when we preferred Alla carte. I'm from NYC and have been to amazing steak houses. This one was stuffy and maybe a better match for someone who has never been to a restaurant and wants constant attention.

Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet corn and green bean sides - delicious

dgg6-dz2g2GOJIPO3QytrQ.text: Amazing grilled bison steak!  Blue cheese stuffed olives.  Prosciutto served with two tiny poached pear slices.  The kale was tasty but offered too much slab bacon and drippings for my taste - I was instantly transported to the south!  To be fair, everyone else in my group of 8 liked it.    The focus in the restaurant was food expedition.  Everywhere, food was being served all around, and it took a long time to serve it all as it is all ala cart.  However they let us sit with our dirty dishes, empty glasses and without our bill for too long after the meal, while other tables were served endless plates of food.  Overall this was a very good experience.

O-pmbehaxZG5X9ieISnzoA.text: Dinner was amazing! We came for our anniversary. Our server Eric was awesome! Very helpful and down to earth. I ordered the steak and lobster, mushroom platter, risotto, and a dirty martini! Everything was sooooo good! Would deff come back. They were busy but our server made sure he was checking on us constantly! I would deff come back! Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My handsome in this beautiful restaurant!
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Martini please!
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and lobster!

cQtu9vE5YG0a88njOGcXwg.text: CraftSteak absolutely lived up to its name and what you would expect.  The Steaks (yes we all had more than one) were perfect and exactly what you would expect from a high end steak house.  While the atmosphere, I feel, could be better and more sophisticated for this level of service and quality steak, it is still nice.  The only part I thought twice about where the plastic place mats at each setting (can we say 50's diner).   For food we opted for the prefix steak meal ($130pp) and I can honestly say this was one of the few times it was definitely worth it.  The amount of food you get with this meal is outstanding.  Course 1 is pretty much every side and salad they have on the menu.  You get them all and in quantities that are enough for each person.  Course 2 is your steak, also served with additional sides and veggies.  The steaks were perfectly cooked and again you get to try 6 different cuts of meat (filet, ribeye, new york, etc.).  Course 3 is dessert and again you get all of their signature desserts.  A delicious way to end a feast and considering the price you would ultimately pay for a salad, steak and dessert ($100 + pp), the prefix definitely makes sense.  Highly recommend!  I will be heading back to craft the next time I need a good steak!

ZSlYllqwnN9f9S6pojSDkA.text: After dining here, my husband and I decided that we will never, ever eat a fancy Vegas restaurant.  The service was spotty and the food was good, but definitely not good enough to justify the price.  WAY overhyped and expensive.  After living in the bay area for a few months, we know what good, quality food should be like and how much it should cost.  I can't remember exactly how much each item was (not listed on their online menu), but let's just say that we ate 9 courses combined with 2 wine pairings at Gary Danko in SF for the same price.  I'm usually a bread FIEND, but I was not into their bread at all.  It didn't taste like much even with butter.  We started out with their lobster bisque and it was good, but I know I can find better for cheaper in SF.  For our entrees, we ordered the shortrib and scallops.  The shortribs came out in a little pot still in its juices, so it stayed moist and flavorful and the scallops were average.  So, for the sides, we didn't realize that they were meant to be shared, but we had leftovers for a midnight snack.  I would think our waiter would've told us the portion size when we ordered the braised kale, potato gratin, baby spinach, and baby shiitake mushrooms just for ourselves, but oh well.  All the sides except the spinach were delicious.  Spinach was good too, but I'm sure it would've been better with bacon.  Ha.  Overall....................... seriously not worth it!

c-7e8WkIjyprjVcPzKs9Rw.text: If you can't afford a $300+ meal(for two) you should probably just stop reading this review now. It will only make you sad to know that you can't enjoy it.   This most recent trip to Vegas was my first time as an "Adult" meaning I wasn't a drunk, poor college student trying to get by on $50 a day(for food). So, obviously I wanted to go big.   And boy did we go big. This was the most food I got in Vegas, and I went to two different Buffets too. Most importantly though, the food was amazing.   This was a 5 star dining experience from start to finish. We had made a reservation and arrived early to grab a cocktail at the bar. The cocktails we both had were delicious. We showed up wearing fancy clothing, so the Hostess realized it was a special occasion(although, not really, I just like how my boyfriend looks in a tie) so we were given a private booth in the back of the restaurant. It was very quiet, and romantic.  We each ordered the Chef's 3 course meal(must have at least 2 people). We went with the American Wagyu for $140 each. And it was worth every penny. We started off with an appetizer, we had the Hand-cut Wagyu Tartare which was delicious. I have never had tartare before, and we both loved it. We also got our choice of 3 of the salad choices. We had the Italian Buffalo Mozzarella, Roasted Red Peppers and the Wild Arugula. They were all fantastic, but I think the Buffalo Mozzarella was my favorite(which included a roasted red pepper relish, which was fantastic).   Then came the steaks. Oh man, the steaks. We both got the American Wagyu which comes from Snake River Farms in Idaho. I had the New York Strip and my boyfriend had the Rib eye. They were cooked perfectly and so, so delicious. Each cut was 14 oz, and I couldn't even finish it. I felt weird leaving behind delicious, expensive steak.   With our steak we also got our choice of 3 sides. We had the Mushroom Assortment, Potato Gratin and White Corn Grits  with Bacon, Gruyere, Chives. They were all good, but once again we had a favorite: White Corn Grits. We polished these off. The addition of the bacon and Gruyere was amazing.   After eating ALL OF THE FOOD. We also got a tasting selection of desserts including the Cinnamon Monkey Bread, Vanilla Cheesecake, Farmers Market Fruit and ice cream and sorbet. At this point we could barely even touch the food, but it was all very tasty. Our favorite was the Monkey Bread(which we surprisingly somehow managed to finish, probably because it was delicious, but also because we are fatties).   Overall, I think the Chef's 3 course meal is the way to go. The Steak by itself was $105, for $35 more we got ALL THE FOOD.   We also shared a bottle of Malbec, which is always my favorite with Steak. They have a very extensive wine list.   The service was all top notch, and wonderful.   It was a delicious dinner and a fantastic experience.

dsnEePQqCiVlx4A3K29alQ.text: Somewhat disappointing.  My steak came out overlooked- my wife's too but she said hers was still edible so she didn't say anything. Had to send it back. They did try to make it better by giving a free side but overall were disappointed for the price. The steak wasn't bad but for less money could get much better steak at Brand at Monte Carlo.

ggqa4aTg6owpVFAYtBMZiw.text: Excellent service!! Excellent food!! We got the sampler 3 course dinner it was phenomenal!!! Very pleased with this joint:)

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desert smorgasbord

uX5ij-tras635PcjF0UygQ.text: Amazing food, atmosphere and service.  Definitely 5 stars.  The Ribeye was cooked to perfection, but the Braised ShortRib was the best.  The meat was so tender and the flavor made me moan with each bite. We had the potatoes gratin and Brussels Sprouts for sides.  I recommend both of them.   I wanted to eat the entire tray of fresh baked rolls,  but I resisted the temptation.  I did take them home and had them the next day. For dessert, the bf ordered the Monkey Bread.  While it was delicious, he said mine is better.  ha!   The bill was around $200 (we weren't drinking that night), so be prepared to spend some money.  But this is Vegas and you don't eat like that every day.

ltLEgizgujDknk6dN-29zw.text: I can't say enough good things about this restaurant.  Three of us got the filet; it melted in your mouth!  One of us got the rib eye; yummy!  The potato puree was amazing!  The asparagus was delish!  Our service was awesome.  It was WAY more expensive than we realized, and our waiter picked up on that.  He made suggestions that assured that we did not order too much food, spending more than we needed to.  Our water glasses were never below the halfway mark, and the young man filling them was so very polite. This is not a restaurant where you would go for a casual night out; it is pretty expensive.  But, for holidays or celebrations, I would definitely recommend it.

2Oal4T2QJteKOWlw_ymbpw.text: A good meal on 10/1/14. Very reasonable price for the quality of the meal and great service. Not my favorite meal in Vegas but worth the visit.  The interior of restaurant is less than special and reminds you of a low end Vegas buffet versus a fine dining establishment. I would visit again if on this end of the strip but would not make a special trip.

90eimaej_8cupMum5wFHtw.text: Try the Kobe flat iron steak ! Beg borrow or steal its worth it along with everything else we tried.

1CEKN-gRxbEQN9VBAxMrMA.text: Made RSVP using open table, thinking we would get a decent table. We were placed right next to the bar, it was loud and a bit crowded.  Our waitress was really nice, she took attention to answer all questions we had. For our first course, My hubby had the lobster bisque and i had spinach salad.  portions were pretty big, we should have shared the salad.  Main course, he had  NY strip and I had filet mignon. He said his steak was good. Mine was good, cooked to my liking Shared green beans and fingerling potatoes. They were really good. We left stuffed, was bummed didn't get dessert. Oh and side note, I loved that the waitress made my meal dairy free when I told her I was lactose intolerant.  Overall, It was a great experience. The restaurant itself was not what I expected and we felt a bit overdressed but in Vegas no one cared.

LdxL68x-NlnObrvTNeztJg.text: Delicious!  My fiance and I are fans of Top Chef, so Craftsteak had been on our "To Dine At" list for awhile. We made reservations for Saturday night and sat in the main dining room.  We ended up going with the tasting menu, which ended up being way more food than we should have ate. The highlights of our menu included the Warm Frisee Salad, my New York Strip Steak, the cauliflower, and the Monkey Bread. All together, the 1 appetizer, 3 salads, two steaks, and four desserts were delicious.  Bill ended up being just a little under $500 with a bottle of wine and tip -- more expensive than we're used to paying for dinner (expensive for us is usually $200), but for a one time dining experience, it was worth it.  The service was amazing with all of the staff being extremely welcoming. The bartenders in the lounge chatted up my fiance about some record being broken in the Detroit Lions game, then our waiter joked around with us about our upcoming wedding. My fiance also requested to get an appetizer that wasn't included in the tasting menu, the scallops, which our waiter accommodated.

KWjzU1bhr1irOtrbV07ccQ.text: When we called to make a reservation at this steakhouse, we had to accept a time 15 minutes later than our requested time.  We didn't mind, but when we got there at our reservation time, we had to wait another 30 minutes for a table.  I understand that we were in Vegas and at a popular restaurant, but why bother to make a reservation at all?  Once we got seated, it took more than 10 minutes for our server to arrive.  It seemed like he wanted to be somewhere else - he never smiled, never came back to see if we were happy with our food, and never asked if we wanted to refill our drinks.  That being said, we all agreed the meal itself was quite good.  They begin by bringing a small "loaf" of tiny buns sprinkled with sea salt.  I didn't have any, but it must have been good because my two dining companions had the busboy bring us a second serving.  For dinner, I had the tuna but asked for it to be cooked, not just seared. It was really good, but I still could have been cooked longer for my taste.  My friends had the short ribs and the salmon, and both loved their meals.   I highly recommend the food here, but the disorganization and bad service may not make up for the meal.

LssEQSqhj9rcNeTAlxTiIQ.text: We had a lovely dinner last night. NY strip was perfectly prepared, cauliflower, mashed potatoes and carrot sides were unexpectedly tasty. Server was warm, very friendly, helpful and made us feel well taken care of. Bread was good though salted on top which we didn't love. Overall excellent experience.

GZ4Q7HXe_4y4k5zw0Sekow.text: Had a few friends visiting from out of town this weekend, so we decided to get together for dinner here.  The Better Half & I have been here once back in July 2007.  We didn't really care for it then, but decided to give it another shot.  I ordered the Filet & she ordered the Salmon.  The table split a bunch of side dishes; Fries, Creamy Potatoes, Spinach, Mushroom & Peas Risotto, Asparagus, Potatoes Au Gratin.  My Filet was cooked to my liking, but it was underwhelming.  The flavor was good, but it was missing "something"....it didn't make me want more.  Wifey enjoyed her Salmon, but said it wasn't great.  The sides were underwhelming too....the Potatoes Au Gratin were very runny, the highlight was the Fries.  I split a Buffalo Mozzarella Salad with a friend of mine for an Appetizer & it was too soft & runny for my tastes.  The best part about dinner was the wine.  We had a Magnum of 2005 Faust Cabernet Sauvignon, which was excellent!  It had a nice bold flavor and had hints of Blackberry & a slight peppery taste to it.  It went well with the steak.  Overall, the experience was underwhelming.  Certainly not worth the $355 for Wifey & I.  We've had much better dinners for much less.  Will we return?  Unless someone else pays for it, probably not.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jTat64RFgkFCp9eTFjQgnA.text: Great food, decent service, and downer of ambiance is the only way of describing Craftsteak. Almost everything we ordered was amazing. The mood of the restaurant was a downer on the night that we went. No subtle mood music, in fact, I was more aware of the staffs conversations then what was going on with my party.  Onto the positives! The Kumamoto oysters are ordered individually and were delicious. They come with the traditional mignonette, horseradish, lemon, and cocktail sauce. The steak tartare is a staple for my group now. We are trying to find the best in Vegas. Tom Colicchio has a solid one, but not the best. The flavor components are sound, but something more impressive than a plain crostini is needed. The stand out appetizer was the warm friscee salad with blue cheese vin and a poached egg. All very simple ingredients that combine to make magic. Once the salad is tossed and the egg broken, it adds another dimension to the dish. I have never been more dissatisfied with dining family style. I wanted it all to myself.  Moving on to the 8oz of Australian wagyu. It is seriously butter. It melts in your mouth and makes you go limp. At a hefty price tag, it is still worth it. The filet and New York strip were delicious, but pale in comparison to the wagyu. The rack of lamb comes in four pieces and marbled to perfection. No need for forks and knives, they are to be treated as lollipops once my party got to them. The diver scallops are tender and the fennel salad compliments them so well. The yukon gold mashed potato is what everyone raves about. Are they good? Hell yes, please keep dishing it out. The assorted mushrooms are rather dreamy as well. The Maui onions could keep on coming.  The one downer were the grits. They sounded awesome but fell short.   All in all with two bottles of wine and split between 5 it still comes out to a hefty price tag. It is just hard to put too much emphasis on money when the food is of this standard.

ITUqISUE7mAO2Pue6CJssg.text: One word: Delicious. Yes it's pricey, but you are paying for the experience, and I'd say, it is worth every penny. The steaks were cooked perfectly, the potato puree is the best I've ever had, and the service was excellent. I love the modern interior and it actually wasn't too loud inside, even with a party of 18 "frat boys" behind me. They even uncorked a blue label johnnie walker like it was nothing. Wine corking...sure? Scotch...AWESOME. Tom Colicchio...you've done well.

5HDVOygtr7XRmzhPWFshiQ.text: I was there last weekend and it was freaking awesome!!!  Let's start with drinks.  They had my favorite bourbon so I ordered it neat.  Perfect.  Then it was food time.  I ordered the surf and turf which included lobster and a ranch fillet.  To be honest, the ranch fillet was ok, but the lobster was AMAZING!!!  I did have a piece of my friends ribeye and that was amazing as well!  When I go back, I'm definitely getting the ribeye AND the lobster.  We ordered a bunch of sides and shared it as we had 9 people total.  Lastly, the service.  Holy cow was the service above and beyond!  Our server was awesome and the staff in general throughout the entire restaurant was amazing.  I've never been smiled at or greeted more in a restaurant my entire life.  I truly felt like my business was appreciated there and to me, that goes a long long way.  With that said... this place was absolutely fantastic and I cant wait to go back!

kmRVrW7Bk-2n9EiFp93M8g.text: I was very disappointed tonight in Craftsteak. I probably go into this restaurant 3 or 4 times a month. I understand they were extremely busy tonight, but I was all but forgotten by the wait staff. I was given a very small table in the lounge, which normally would be fine, but tonight it was to crowded to do this. I asked to be moved and was basically ignored. The table was way to small for the food brought out and both my wife and myself had utensils fall off the table. We find were fed up and packed everything up and left. My recommendation, do not go to this restaurant on busy nights.

2lpGtK_0D6WvnIg9qwpykw.text: Excellent staff and excellent service.  Phenomenal food.  It's a steak house in the MGM Grand so it isn't cheap, but it shouldn't be!  Huge portions, family style sides, beautifully cooked meats, and wonderful desserts!

_EhzoSaM11Zrhpy2hcV8wA.text: I went here for my birthday last September and thought it was amazing.  So when restaurant week rolled around this year, I begged to go back and managed to convince a few friends.  We all did the restaurant week menu.  AND IT WAS AS GREAT AS I REMEMBERED!  The three course menu has been well-described by other reviewers.  I will just say that I am a huge fan of Tom Colicchio's style of cooking: simple and awesome.  He understands that good food doesn't require foie gras or a bunch of fancy crap.  I would recommend this place to anyone who likes unpretentious, excellent food.    It's definitely worth mentioning that the service was impeccable.  The server's assistant even gave us pens and magnets and told us about the episode of Top Chef that was filmed in the restaurant with Natalie Portman.  Yes, I'm a huge dork! haha.  Love that show.  This was a wonderful dining experience.   They even managed to squeeze us in on the last day of restaurant week.

GR0p-a4U18vQrXw2YaOsgQ.text: Was in Vegas for both SEMA and daughter's 21st birthday; she's not into the Vegas show thing, so rather than spend our money on show tickets; we invested in a dining experience evening (daughter likes a good tenderloin/filet)  There were 4 of us dining and we went for the Domestic WAGYU -- WOW!!!  Our server talked thru the multiple appetizer options with us -- trying to get a feel for what we liked vs. didn't and thru conversation our server knew what he was going to recommend and order on our behalf.  Then we discussed steak cuts, sides and desserts.  Appetizers - Shrimp cocktail / Prosciutto San Daniele w/fresh figs / Caesar Salad w/Anchovy on side / Italian Buffalo Mozzarella w/roasted red peppers and toasted hazelnuts --- all these items were presented and set in the middle of us -- each of these were servings enough for 4 people;  if you loved shrimp and nothing else, perhaps 2 shrimp would be in order if you could talk one of your dining partners into giving up theirs.  This was very similar to a small plates experience of sharing and conversation.  Next was the steaks - New York Strip / Ribeye / Skirt Steak / Filet Mignon -- now my daughter would have originally preferred to order a Filet all to herself, but she went along with this WAGYU dining experience and as each beautifully charred and sliced steak was placed in the middle of the table, she tried each of the cuts and declared that she couldn't choose which was her favorite.  This is a girl who orders nothing but Filets!    The sides chosen were Asparagus (daughter loves) / Potato Puree / Mushroom assortment -- again these were in serving dishes portioned for 4 to share.  I had my way with the mushroom assortment as it turned out nobody else was really interested in them.  Now on to the desserts.... Monkey bread / sorbets n icecream / chocolate molten something / chocolate torte w/chocolate gelato / pane cotta w/raspberry sorbet  A wonderful and memorable dining experience!

UKHKsSmYESe4v8AzyYG8Rw.text: This was possibly the best meal I had during 2015.  I am looking forward to another visit!  They don't have the most impressive surroundings; but they do have VERY good food!  Ample portions for an upscale restaurant.  A very helpful staff, and you can trust their recommendations.  AND you can see Ka right down the hall!  Flexible attire.

Q0RZybmQUVOSYin7ozZWiw.text: Totally underwhelmed!  With other fine dining options at MGM, I sure picked the wrong one for my fancy birthday dinner.  Slow service, unjustifiably arrogant attitude by the staff, cold lobster, ho-hum sides.  I was expecting to be wowed, but man o man, did this place fall flat!  The only re-deeming aspect were the grits.  The only thing I tasted that night justified by the hype and price.

1zplqENSpEacB2OtCI8mXA.text: I  visit Vegs primarily for the eating extravaganzas and the buffset, but maybe in between, I just might throw in a visit to Craftsteak.  I mean hey If you've won a notable amount of dirty cash and you're looking for a worthy meal to splurge on, this is where you absolutely must go.   It is recommended that reservations are made, unless you like to spend a lot of time people watching in the casino.  The setup/ambiance is very contemporary, but not ostentatiously  trendy. The strategically dimmed lighting seems to bring out your dinner mates' best features, and possibly hides a bit of that post meal pouch you'll be harboring later on.   Started off with the mozzarella caprese salad. It seems simple enough but I think it was prepared very well, or it could have been the presentation. In any event,  this already got my mouth watering for my second course, the rib eye cooked bloody rare. Holllly! Bite after bite and I could barely contain my tummy fairies from playing their golden harps around me.  It was just that f@cking good. The hangar steak and filet mignon were just as good, but I fancy the slight buttery marble in my prime rib.  Got the mushroom risotto as a side and there I was, yet again, trying to contain my excitement over excellent meal. This was by far, the best risotto I have ever spooned into my greedy little mouth. Everything was so masterfully prepared, I can't even express that enough without sounding redundant.  I really wish I had room for dessert because my eyes ooogled as I saw goodies passing by me to and fro, but sadly, I was defeated! Sigh.   Either way, I was in awe over and over again as each food item crossed my lips....  Oh and service was stellar.   A typical 3 course meal will set you back about $90 with gratuity, oh it ain't cheap, but it's sooooooooooooooo worth it. I can't wait for the tummy fairies to sing their tunes to me again......

kjVpX8_ii1j9AXbxUyLmmQ.text: After wassailing between 4 and 5 stars, it seems 5 stars is much more appropriate considering the group didn't eat one thing they didn't like and we ate there two nights in a row.   One of Tom Colicchio's feature restaurants doesn't simply aspire to make great food. They start the diner off with an extensive wine, whiskey, beer and alcohol menu. Although very few wines find themselves south of $100 a bottle, a few great buys can be found to complement the meal. And if you are a scotch, bourbon, whiskey kinda guy (or gal), the list is almost too exhausting to review.   As far as the food, in one word, decadent. From the charcuterie plate that could be a meal in and of itself to the whipped potatoes that seemingly have as much butter/cream as potato (in a good way) to the baby carrots drizzled in local honey to the steaks (all phenomenal, but we split the Wagyu Flat Iron), the group enjoyed every bite. Add a finishing layer of monkey bread, a cinnamon roll on steroids with velvety scoops of ice cream, and you may just need to retire early instead of testing your skills in the casino.

6Wi_7Ew-AFaKPK5O9SXlPA.text: Each time i visit a new city, one of the first things that i check is if one of my favourite contestants from Top Chef has opened up a restaurant in that particular city.  Well, i thought it was about time to switch our focus from contestants to judges.  I will admit that when i first started watching Top Chef, i had never heard of Tom Colicchio, i blame part of it on being Canadian.  So on our recent trip to Vegas we made sure to make a reservation at Craftsteak.  We walked from the Trump hotel, and really underestimated how long the walk would take.  We were about 10 minutes late, but luckily and surprising the restaurant was behind schedule.  We ended up waiting an additional 15 minutes to be seated.  Upon walking into the restaurant it was grand, and the sheer size was impressive.  Our server shortly came over and we both placed a drink order for a pomegranate martini.  The drink had pomegranate, lime and tequila.  The drink wasn't memorable, it was very straightforward, i was expecting something different for $15.  I did appreciate though how each drink came in a mini shaker and was poured tableside.  For our mains, we both ordered a steak (sorry i dont remeber the cut), and 2 sides per person.  I had the sunchokes, and shiitakes, and my sis had the fingerling potatoes, and mushrooms.  We debated about how many sides we should order, they averaged about $15 each, i would've preferred one each but i was expecting the portion size to be miniscule.  This is my issue, a server works at a restaurant day in and day out, they are experts, and when we ordered our mains and four sides, he should have stepped in and and be honest and say that that would be enough for two linebackers, not too young ladies.  I have read Waiter Rant, i know that servers drive up the bill for a bigger tip, but if he was straight forward and suggested something lighter, for a similar price, i would have respected him.  Our food arrived to the table and the steak look great, but the only thing that i could look at were the sides, and how i just wasted so much of my hard earned money on food i knew that i couldn't finish.  Each side was good but at the end of the day it was roasted in fat, and served, that was it, it was very basic.  I was unimpressed with the entire concept of the restaurant.  I know that it is a steakhouse, so you order your meat and sides, but the whole meal was disjointed, it was simply meat, mushrooms, and starch.  I wish that there was a sauce to bring the entire meal together.  I wanted to eat at Toms and get his vision, i didn't get it, i was so disappointed. Overall, i am going to use a line of Toms that i recently heard him recite on Top Chef, "you go to a restaurant for the food, and you return for the service", unfortunately i wont be going back for either.
