Y9DRv8NaJn3PWflMw9MFKw.text: Good food. But service was sub par. Given the price point and targeted demographic you will experience a number of Guido's attempting to service the wrong clientele. Or perhaps they want and prefer other Guido type... They've lost my loyalty. There are other steak houses; which are much more welcoming and attentive!

IJDj-BsOhK2O1P4nV4XIWQ.text: Holy moly - run, don't walk to get these 24-hour braised shortribs! I have been dreaming of returning to Craftsteak to devour this dish after visiting last year. The meat is fall-apart tender, and the au jus has the most amazing flavor. The bartender told me the secret to making them even better (I wasn't sure this was possible!) was to take the rolls that were served with dinner - split them in half & put the shredded meat on there to make mini-sliders. I don't know how it was possible to make it even better, but it did!! Insanely good. The bartender offered to do a small/half portion of one of the sides for me, and even the small portion was very generous. I will be dreaming of these shortribs until my next visit! YUM.

jcYRdxS-opImi6avKg4stQ.text: Very disappointing. I expected the Craft NYC experience but it def. wasn't. The menu was different and the everything was super salty. For a better dining experience The Manhattan location is where to dine at.

ngizPWjxA4SlHVT_z871dQ.text: I went to this restaurant 2 times and I can say that they have one of the best steak ever! When I went, I had the course meal with wine pairing.  Honestly I got full before the steak came out. It's totally worth the price you're paying so I recommend you to get that . Service never let me down . They were so kind as well. I will be back!

yyaTm7ThdLN9klsjuWbE0g.text: I was very disappointed with my dinner at this "high end" steakhouse. I relied on yelp for this place and got burned for the first time. Yelp is my go to, but I guess it's still a crapshoot. I took a very good friend to dinner who craved a quality steak. We both ordered the ribeye which was 60$, and that's just for the steak. I don't mind paying for quality, but I've had better steaks at Outback. My steak was all gristle and fat. I asked for a medium well and received a steak that was red on inside and black on outside. The meat  was tough. "It still had marks from where the jockey was hitting it" My friend ordered a medium and it was well done. I was extremely disappointed. I can't believe the Mirage closed Kokomos in favor of this place. Maybe mine was an isolated incident, but it was terrible. Also, the hostess and waitress need to work on their customer service skills. No smiles and basically handed me my silverware and brought out the food. There was no briefing on recomnendation of their menu and didn't even ask us how our meal was. They are lucky they didn't! The Mirage has lost it's luster. There were prostitutes all over the place and the dealers are just going through the motions....no smiles, no banter, nothing. Do yourself a favor and head over to the Linq across the street. Mirage you have been warned....get your act together. You have lost a 20 yr customer.

DISkmanBSRzpL46kU5crkA.text: Best dinner I have ever had.  Took my son for Christmas dinner and had the Wagu Chef's Selection.   Worth every penny.  Everyone needs to try it once.  The Monkey Bread however is TRUELY the one thing you have to get.

2lEe1pE-lY_1i6mrnzZ1EA.text: Unfortunately it did not live entirely up to the hype for us.   It was definitely good overall, but for the price point ($225 dinner for 2), and the Chef's awards, I expected a lot more--perfection, or darn close to it!  The appetizers of shrimp and oysters were fantastic.  The big problem for me was the Caesar salad.  It was warm, slightly wilted like warm lettuce is want to do, and just pretty lousy in flavor.  I've had better Caesar salads at inexpensive chain restaurants.  I was also disappointed the staff did not notice or remark that neither of us ate the salad.  A whole entree sent back to the kitchen unnoticed.  The steaks were cooked to perfection and we very much enjoyed the butternut squash risotto.  We did not get dessert because the choices were less than stellar for gluten free options.  Overall, the food was good, but minus one star for inedible Caesar salad, and minus one star for no gluten free dessert options (sorbet and strange flavored ice cream does not count).   I would recommend you try this restaurant, but temper your expectations.

gvK5Q449HRKkH5KBWDQQBg.text: We had mixed reviews about this place. In order from dishes I liked from best to worst, it would be the t-bone steak, rack of lamb, ribeye, duck and then the porterhouse. We also ordered sides of the potato puree and assorted mushrooms.  I was pleasantly surprised at how tender and flavorful the t-bone was, and the rest of the table agreed. The duck portion was rather large, but the skin was not crispy and the cherries that accompanied the dish were too tart. Although the most impressive looking in size, the porterhouse was not tender, even though it looked it and was cooked medium rare. It also came with a bearnaise sauce that seemed a little too acidic and really didn't enhance the flavor of the steak.   The potato puree was absolutely delicious - you can tell they put a lot of cream, butter and love into it. The assorted mushrooms were also very good and were a good compliment to the steaks.  Our server, Kevin, was really friendly and gave us lots of options in order to get more bang for our buck in terms of amount of food for our group to share. But we knew our limits and I'm glad we didn't order too much because we still had leftovers.   I didn't get to try the bread because I didn't want to fill up, but my friends said it was good and we got some to go and had it for breakfast the next day.   I don't want to say the service was slow, but I did feel we waited awhile after we were done eating in order to get our food packed up and get our bill paid. But the overall service was amazing - they constantly filled our water glasses and various employees would stop by to ask if we needed anything. Not a bad steakhouse, but there are definitely better ones in Vegas.

-SuDCpcBf89FpvsZaAWFzg.text: I really like this place! The layout, atmosphere and ambiance is just right. The bartender is topnotch. Out booth was very intimate and our waiter was very attentive and professional. I really wanted to try every single appetizer on the menu, and this is what I should have done. Yes, our scallops appetizer was fantastic, and our entrees (New-York and Rib-Eye) were cooked to perfection. And the side dishes are not your usual steakhouse side dishes, not to get into the details (see the menu online) Bare in mind that the meat are a good portion, and If you order generous sides, it will be a challenge finishing the meal...Unless you have just ran around the Las Vegas airport and you are super hungry! Next time, we will focus more on the appetizers and less on the main course... By the way, their wine and booze menu is over the top. There is a serious Single-Malt selection my friend! As the matter of fact, I believe their drink menu is about 20 times mores extensive then the menu...If you like the good stuff....

bVOI8XdhucRZJ9nzhGW0XA.text: I'd give it 3.5 stars! Overall a really good elegant restaurant. However, one of our steaks was not cooked properly, it was rather fully cooked than medium rare (pink). The side dishes were just ok. Mashed potato was tasty but the risotto wasn't good, had a little and didn't want any more, considering I LOVE risotto. The brussels sprouts  were not anything special either. The cooked potatoes were just ok as well, I had one and I felt like it was very hard, not fully cooked. Watching chef Tom Colicchio criticizing all chefs on top chef TV show I expected more than just ok.

bDQ-PHQ1Yv1RJ5lMIooSng.text: Nothing special. Came here for our Anniversary dinner & unfortunately we weren't WOWED. I got the RibEye Bone-In (medium) & my BF got the Wagyu Ribeye...pricey and they weren't even tasteful/juicy. It was OKAY. I like lobster but I wasn't a fan of their Lobster Bisque...the Potato Puree was good tho. Buttery. I've had better steak. Wayyyyy better. I recommend trying some other steakhouse! Like Mastro's, Westin Bonaventure, Morton's!

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was a nice surprise.
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yukon something Potato Purée
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Bisque

GuNfVi2xVFF1rftO898mdw.text: Got porterhouse for 2, lobster, lobster bisque. Sides included  risotto, potaots au gratin, spinach and corn.   I didn't love the steak. The lobster and lobster bisque were amazing. Sides sans spinach were awesome.  I've been to Heritage and thought it was a lot better.   If I had to go to Craft again I would try the Wagyu.

O8Jsb3zXk702Yn5oS8BVAg.text: What could have been a disaster turned into a great experience. My wife and I had booked a show that evening that started at 10:30 and we decided to go to Craftsteak beforehand. We had cocktails and then ordered a bottle of wine and ordered appetizers and main courses. The wine arrived before the food and we sat chatting and sipping our wine and I realized it had been 45 minutes since we ordered and no food was on the table yet. We got caught up in conversation and didn't realize it had been so long and then I realized we had finished more than half of our wine. I grabbed a manager and asked for our waiter and also asked what was taking so long. He left and our waiter came back and looked like he had seen a ghost. He obviously forgot to put our order in. He ran into the kitchen and about 5 minutes later ran back out and said we'll get it out as soon as possible. The manager came back by about 10 minutes later with some sort of vegetable plate and said that this should hold us over until our food comes and at that point my wife jumped in to voice her concern about the fact that we now ran the risk of missing our show and let him know how disappointed we were in their service so far, as now we were almost an hour and a half into this ordeal. His rude response was "Well bottom line is your food's on the way" and just turned and walked away.  We looked at each other and both repeated his ridiculous bottom line comment and I flagged down the waiter and asked for a check for the drinks and wine and told him I thought his manager was a jerk. At that point another manager, older tall gentleman, came by and whispered something to the waiter. The waiter ran into the kitchen and came out with another bottle of wine and several other waiters carrying our food. I said that I didn't order that wine and he then said it's fine and poured us two glasses and left us to eat. We had to rush through the dinner and I asked for a check right away as we really had about 15 minutes to get to the show. he said "oh no you can't leave yet, we called over to the theater (The show was right at the MGM) and let them know not to start without you. Right then every desert on the menu was put on the table in front of us along with coffee and Cognac!! When I got the bill I realized they didn't charge us for the second bottle of wine and of course the deserts were all comped, and gave us a percentage off of the bill so basically we paid for entrees only! Nice save!! We all screw up as we are all human, but how many businesses go to this extent to fix a screw up and make an everlasting impression on their customers? I've been back to Craftsteak several times since and I've told this story and sung their praises many times.

cdsalNsgelSTBNPPsAXvZw.text: The food here is high quality. Our favorite thing surprisingly wasn't the steak, but the scallops. The outside was seared to perfection, while the inside was nice and tender.  They also have delicious mussels, bathing in a yummy broth.    One issue we had was initially they sat us at a table right in the front, completely exposing us to the drunks walking around the hotel. This might appeal to some; however my husband and I were looking to enjoy a romantic evening alone. We asked to move and thankfully got seated in a more secluded location, providing the intimate experience we sought.    The service was a little on the weak side. Much of the time we were waiting on our server instead of him waiting on us.  I don't know that we'd return, but we had a nice time.

jYNP11k094-sLmJfiud5EA.text: I'm not sure what's happened here.  The service is still great, but the quality of the meat was really different than when we were here last.  We ordered the bone-in ribeye and it was chain grocery store quality at best.  You know how lower grade meat has that mealy texture?  We ordered it medium rare and it was still that way.  We were really disappointed because the last time we were here it was a delicious experience.  Maybe their purveyors are pulling a fast one on them.  To be fair, we are used to prime steakhouses and this wasn't listed as prime...but we still didn't expect it to be as low in quality as it was.

PlIwFr7bZRS9HcOzM5zldQ.text: Off to sensation at Vegas a couple weeks ago! Since the event is at MGM Grand Garden Arena, decided to get a quick bite  at craftsteak before the party began lol   We didn't make a reservation so only be able to sit at their bar area which is perfect for our quick dinner.   Their lobster bisque is really good with chuck of lobster in there. Ordered the foie gras(good), wagyu ribeye, new york strip, potato gratin and hen of the woods. It's just an ok steak!!! Definitely think CUT has a better steak! But love the foie gras!!!!:) as I'm not able to eat that at CA anymore...  Overall, nice ambience, ok food  But when I ordered my second cocktail, there is a fly inside my drink!!! I let the server knew but she didn't even apologize and just walked away with the drink. I really think the service is horrible in a so called fine dining restaurant!!!!! She came back with a new drink without even said anything. I felt the server is so rude...  Honestly, I think it's just a fair steakhouse. The best food they can offer is their bread!  I really love the bread!

xKzpZSMdevna_JWUzFiH3Q.text: let's begin by clarifying that I don't give out 5 stars haphazardly. It's gotta be special. Craft was, indeed, special. I had the task of trying to find somewhere for a business/client dinner after a conference day. We decided on steak, so I looked for steakhouses in Vegas. Of course I love Tom Colicchio, so I figured Craftsteak had to be a good bet, coupled with other Yelp reviews, I made my choice. From calling to set up the reservation for 11, to arriving and being greeted, seated, and served, the entire experience was fantastic. I was not disappointed in one single thing. The 11 of us opted to order separate entrees and a bevvy of sides to share. I'll get to that in a minute. First, I want to comment on the Dark and Stormy that I ordered. One of my favorite drinks, a close second to the Moscow Mule, this one was hands down one of the best drinks I've ever had. Try it, prove me wrong. As far as food, I ordered a fresh mozzarella with tomato and balsamic reduction appetizer, and it was creamy, fresh and delicious.  I also wanted to try the famed Hangar steak after hearing a co-worker rave about it. It was every bit as good as he made it out to be. Tender, yet packed full of flavor. Not too fatty, but not too lean. I could have cut it with a fork, and I'd order it again if I ever get the opportunity. The sides I tried, from the french fries to the grits to the sunchokes, were all super. After dinner, we of course had to have dessert. I opted for the tropical sorbet, and the mix of passion fruit and mango was so flavorful, I didn't want to share it. I also tried the monkey bread, amazing as well. Bottom line. Worth it. Worth every penny. If you love meat, and you get the opportunity, don't pass this one up.

oVwKapDitctJS8moKMe0uw.text: Hubby and I wanted a yummy bite to eat before seeing Ka at the MGM Grand - well this was definitely the place to go.  We have been fans of Tom Colicchio for years and have always wanted to eat at one of his restaurants and we were dying to eat here.  Only problem?  We had about 30 minutes to drink, eat and run to make our show in time.  Our waitress was up to the challenge...  She recommended a few items that she knew could come out quickly -  Wagyu Tartar, potato puree and the short rib.  Our martini's came out and were delish as was the Wagyu tartar.  They then brought out this piping hot set of dinner rolls with a beautiful salted top and fresh butter.  It was like crack -- hot, delish with the melted butter.  I'd like some now, please.  She then brought out the mashed potatoes and the shortribs, which were fall off the bone perfect.  Their sauce was amazing and complimented the buttery mashed potatoes.  Those potatoes were so good, I wanted to slather them all over myself when I tasted them but then thought I'd really ruin the pretty dress I had on...  To say they were buttered would be an understatement -- they are probably close to 50% butter to potato ratio but they were well worth blowing the diet.  We got out of there extremely satisfied and in under 30 minutes.  I've already got my eyes set on another trip to Vegas in early 2013 and I'm going to make sure we get a full, unrushed dinner here.

vrvhJUXQibNKsLgJGrE0Cg.text: I had the pleasure of dining with my GF and our friends on a double date night.  I had such a great time that my memory of our splendid meal is but a series of metal snap shots of the evening.  Do yourself a favor and do not drink to excess before your dinner.

bFAHkbFJXoN-wv-jfAgY6g.text: So I was a bit torn about whether to give this restaurant 4* or 5* cause I didn't like it as much as my husband, but I don't like steak as much as him, so I have to go the trusty 4.5* rounded up to 5*.  Now, even though it was 5* and a great restaurant, there were some definite pluses and minuses.  First pluses:  AMAZING steak tartare - this was SOOOOOOOOO good!   Wagyu skirt steak - really tender and tasty Potato gratin - perfectly cooked, but I wish it had a bit more cheese and a little less cream  The minuses: Service was a little spotty. It was weird not to have bread plates (the bread, btw, was very tasty, but not OMG AMAZING) I just expected a little more from the steak  That being said, if you like steak and you want a good steak, come here!  Things were cooked perfectly and everything was really tasty!  You will not be disappointed in the quality of the steak.  Oh, and we ordered 1 appetizer, 2 glasses wine, 2 steaks, 1 side, and 1 dessert for us and we were pretty full!  So if we would have done the tasting, we would have DIED!  Ordering a la carte really shouldn't be a problem :)

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potato gratin
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak tartare
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Restaurant

4jXBx4mwsLaLu_L5XIL7Kg.text: I LOVE the bread and drinks. Now here is a secret of the place order ALL the sides. They are known for their sides. You cannot go wrong! Steaks are okay but I would just go back just for the sides.   PROS: sides, service, ambiance, drinks CONS: steaks

t3qQx0BeisnmQg8QlP-iCw.text: The best steak house on the strip.  The roasted steaks are great.  Fries should not be missed!  Quite expensive.  Awesome service.  Incredible wine list (study it before you dine).

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Craftsteak surf and turf with roasted filet and lobster

ae9o4fu6fImNOy3W_xPYzQ.text: I love Tom Colicchio, really, I do. It pains me to say that my experience at his MGM restaurant was less than stellar. If this had been "Restaurant Wars," I don't know if we'd see Tom advance to the next round...  When we approached the hostess desk, four hostesses/servers were present and not one greeted us until about three minutes had passed.   I had the lobster bisque and found it overwhelmingly over seasoned with cinnamon. It tasted more like cake batter than bisque.   Next, I had the arugula salad with lemon vinaigrette. They actually refused to add tomatoes to it! For the first time in my life I had to send food back to the kitchen. The taste of lemon was so intense, I felt like I was biting directly into one with each bite. I couldn't muster the courage to finish the dish.   The risotto that we had as a side had a taste that reminded me Betty Crocker Instant scalloped potatoes. It was sticky and undercooked.   I must say, the service was wonderful; very attentive and friendly. Other dishes that we got (scallops, Wagyu tartare, and hangar steak) were delicious.   Overall, a disappointment. I still love Tom though.

T1cvWOOPUB__vDtae5MPTg.text: The food, ambiance, and waitstaff is great at craftsteak. Upon arrival my husband and I had some delicious free rolls which came in this nice hot pan with a sprinkle of sea salt on top. Then we shared the diver scallops for our appetizer. They were jumbo sized and cooked perfectly in a light sauce with lemon and fennel.   For our entrees we shared a rib-eye steak and shortribs. The rib-eye was a huge portion. It was enough that we could have split that alone and been stuffed. I ordered it medium rare and it was spot on, really flavorful and tender. The shortrib was only okay, so I wouldn't order it again. Comparatively the steak was much better. For sides we split the potato puree and the corn grits. Again, huge portions! The potato puree was really smooth and a great complement to the steak. The grits were tasty but pretty heavy. I would only get 2 sides again if I was there with 3 or 4 people. We were beyond full and had to leave a good amount of food on our plates.  When the check came we expressed how full we were to the waitress and she said next time we could totally share an entree. Score! Next time I'll save some money and have enough room for dessert! I love that they are an uber fancy restaurant but don't mind people sharing.

0RVfqKMB9P1ZJL8K9ccU7g.text: I came here with a group of 11 guys while in Vegas. We were happy with our choice and thought it was worth the price tag. The service and atmosphere were great, although we all thought the cartoony cow pictures on the wall were a little unsettling.  We were able to try a lot of things being in such a big group, which definitely added to the experience. The rolls we were initially served look incredible and tasted almost as good as they looked.   As for sides, the Shiitake mushrooms and whipped potatoes were both mediocre and the fingerlings were bland. The potato gratin was delicious and creamy, and the broccoli was superb with unique seasoning.   All of the steaks I tried were superb. I had the Wagyu skirt steak (a suggestion from the server), which was incredibly tender, moist, and flavorful. I wouldn't put these in the top steaks I've ever tried, but they were close to reaching that bracket.  For dessert, a couple of us shared the monkeybread, which was like a cinnamon bread pudding served with ice cream. It was spectacular--probably the biggest wow of the night. Save room for this dessert!

CxsUas_DANzMEuZ8ZCnEOQ.text: I want to start out by saying that our (me and my wife) previous experience at Craftsteak was top notch with many best first time experiences.  Such as the best rolls, steak, and sides that we have ever tasted and for that reason we made a special trip back to Vegas just to eat at this restaurant.  However, this time it was a completely different experience, where everything was over salted (not over seasoned, but way too much salt on everything).  It was almost not edible as well as the temperature on the steak was way off.  I ordered a medium rare steak, but a large portion of my steak was medium (making it a tough chew).  These are issues that one may expect to run into every once in a while in a single $ restaurant, but not at $$$$ establishment like Craftsteak.  Needless to say, we are very disappointed and will not be back.  As a side note: there were no issues with the staff, everyone was friendly and helpful.  However less can be said about the chef that cooked our meal.

q4YWttpVen_IV6KlOqENow.text: Had dinner yesterday at Tom Colicchios and it was percect. From them meal to service, everything was amazing. Sharon was our waitress and she explained the menu in details to us, recomended apps and main course as a PRO. Later on, Peter came over to explain how the meal was prepared, in details, just enough to make our experience prefect. Overall, the experience was fantastic and I highly recomend Tom's steak house if you want to have serious good cuts of meat with top quality service. Sharon and Peter just took it to a next level.

ASRzqe36J2iK3LMQ9d_61Q.text: The focus: fresh, seasonal menu items that highlight bright and natural notes. I personally enjoyed the heirloom tomatoes, sweet corn and chefs menu beef selection. A bit on the pricey side but definitely a great treat while in Vegas. Sometimes you just have to splurge!

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yQN-7U6qsnN-iinlk9jk4Q.text: While it was a decent meal and the service was exceptional, it was nothing like our trip to Del Frisco's. The domestic Waygu ribeye was perfectly cooked... but im thinking that the meat isn't actually Kobe... it was just okay. Not worth the $104 price tag.MAYBE the A5 Waygu would be better... but at $260 for 8 ounces it was more than we were willing to spend at the time... Three solid stars.

H9uPAO0Glo1vpz7CshZ_vw.text: The wine list is amazing. The service is impeccable. Ambiance is elegant and classy. The food is excellent. If you like sweets...you must get the monkey bread dessert! So good I wanted to cry. Definitely a great place to go to celebrate a special occasion if you like a great steak house! Best meal we had in Vegas!

_4qrsDafDiSdflRjsg8vdg.text: The best part about Craftsteak was their dinner rolls.  Hot, fresh, salty and perfect with a slab of butter.  Other than that, the steak and sides didn't impress anyone in our group.  I shared the Porterhouse for two and quite frankly didn't even end up finishing it.  The steak wasn't seasoned well and had bit of gristle and huge chunks of fat.  For the sides we went with the turnips which were just ok.  Everyone else ordered the surf and turf and weren't impressed as well.  Next time we'll have to go to CUT.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TrjrY2pHZmSjuU616W3BIg.text: We were expecting a great meal but were let down by our dining experience. The wait staff seemed too busy to tend to our needs such as keeping our water glasses clean or checking on us after our food was served. We had an issue with our appetizer and it took us at least 10 minutes to get our waiter's attention. The steak was average, it wasn't out of this world. I would not return, it is not worth the money for the experience we got.

0qvDcCeiIupTGO4VcnAnnw.text: OMG!!!! A definite must if you are looking to splurge and treat yourself.  Highly recommend the  three course meal for two.  Enough food for 3 people, appetizers, main course and desserts.  Yes all three courses come with more than just one dish.  Wow!!   The corn is like crack, I had to get the recipe.  Don't miss out, make your reservations and forget about the prices!!

QRM2F4bFXENcnEwlsxMTLA.text: I was staying at the MGM so it was quite convenient to have this restaurant downstairs.  The atmosphere was quite comfortable sitting at table in the bar area.  The wine list was broad enough that I was able to find "reasonable" priced selections that worked well.  We split a lobster to start. It was supposed to be 2.5 lbs and maybe it was but out of the shell it was a few choice bites for each. The Kumamoto oysters were divine.  Kept it simple with the dry aged strip that was super tasty yet slightly cooked past my medium rare request. The mushrooms were a very interesting assortment so we got a mix of all of them.   All in all everything was good to very good. The service was spot on and being so convenient in my hotel a short walk to the elevator made for a pleasant dinner.

lrV0dbtEwzyMySMylxh57A.text: hmmm. what can  I say? it was definitely tasty. atmosphere takes the stars down. I expected a little more swank and a little less shorts and frat crowd. that's all I can say.... Location was in the MALL - had I realized this, I would not have made the reservation. Service was pretty good, and food was as expected. I won't rush back to this place.

HbOrl1MVm1yPjkDrYx22pQ.text: Lobster bisque was simply amazing... Over the course of a week, I tried 5 different high-end restaurants' bisque (Vegas and San Diego) and none of them came close.   The Wagyu New York Strip was the best tasting piece steak, outside of some Kobe I had while over in Japan,  that I have ever had the pleasure of tasting. The $35 wine pairings were also a great deal to go with the meal.  We tried the inclusive wagyu surf and turf meal for 3, so we tried multiple different cuts and sides alongside the items I am recommending above.  4 stars for the other items that came with the surf & turf meal.  5 stars for the wait staff, the bisque, the wagyu strip steak, and the wine pairings.

OVCkSY4gqs0n-363zgwj-A.text: NOTHING will top a steakhouse experience like this one. In-credible.   It's located in the MGM hotel.  Reservations are a must - don't try to badger your way in like the rude 6 guys we spotted on our visit. They were obnoxious to the hostess and then threw her under the bus when the GM arrived. Just be respectful and make reservations.   You can order a la carte as with any steakhouse OR do as the best patrons do and do "Chef's Selection." You select how many courses you want, pay a set fee per head and relinquish all control to the chef. It is AMAZING. You don't know what you don't know and you don't get to choose...CHEF's SELECTION. :) Oh, and you have a staff of three catering to you.   Everyone started out with Lobster Bisque. Staple starter.  We were blessed with 3 different salads, 2 Kobe beef steaks as entrees, 3 side dishes and 3 desserts.  Yes, it sounds like a ton of food but it's gourmet. This isn't southern cooking. Everything is small in portion size enough to share and it's supposed to be appreciated and savored. I can see what we ate but can't remember the names. Regardless - it was all AMAZING.  The desserts were outstanding. We had a bottle of chardonnay as well.    Bottom line, just do it. Let go of the control. Enjoy the ambiance. Enjoy the attention from a very polished staff across the board. The prices are not inexpensive but you TOTALLY get what you pay for and them some....it was an indescribable experience. Plus, my sweetheart put this whole experience together for me. I was in heaven!

Lq0jGKAzAk-pdKwHPLJrqw.text: Came here for my birthday over Labor Day weekend with my husband and it was fantastic.  We didn't go all out with the course meals, instead we ordered filet mignon, new york strip, the mushroom assortment, and the potato puree.  Also got a bottle of wine to go with it.    Everything was good.  I ordered my filet medium rare.  Only the center was really medium rare, a good 3/4 inch around the edges were more medium to well done which I didn't like as much but it was very tasty.   I really liked the mushroom assortment - lot of butter but it was unique and I liked the different mushrooms they had.  The potato puree comes - it's literally a pot of mashed potatoes.  Fatty but delicious- the pot was quite big.  Overall I liked it, and it was convenient as we were staying @ the Signature.

QtFubmctqz1QO2VGN9VLag.text: This place was amazing! I had the wagyu tartare and it was very tasty. I followed up with a rare 18oz ribeye bone in. It was cooked perfectly and the taste was impeccable ! The side of mushrooms hit the spot as well. We also enjoyed the grits! Currently to stuffed for dessert. Our waiter Eric was amazing, he knew his menu and his suggestions were on point ! And the rest of the staff was very friendly . Loved this place

ANdrPH_T_rsznLUnrPonxQ.text: Great service and great food. Both the Wagyu skirt steak and Wagyu New York strip (medium rare) was cooked to perfection. Warm centers and warm on the outside. However, I think my boyfriend and I over did the ordering. We were extremely stuffed and did not finish our food. We split the lobster bisque (did not smell like seafood) and the Wagyu tartare. Everything was delicious and not over done, definitely coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $274 excluding tip

7D5OhAL0TynmXqG3gL_Y7g.text: Food was ok but for price not even worth it! Service was terrible in dining room. Plenty of employees but head waiters stood around way to much instead of paying attention to customers. Would highly not recommend!

Q84yYPQ0nvlqFh7Irg3QcA.text: Food was great. Service was okay. Our waiter was emotionless and unenthusiastic. Great atmosphere and nice vibe in the restaurant. The potato puree is amazing. Get it.

g28dqHyFjwnkhyiNGZXYYw.text: Only my 2nd time at Craftsteak - and it was even better than my first!!!  Stunning interior decor, romantic - excellent for groups too.   Spectacular service, outstanding A5 wagyu steak (8oz for $250), vast wine selection. The A5 melted like butter in my mouth - so tensely robust in flavors. Loved our velvety smooth Opus One 1997 - just couldn't get enough.. Spectacular combination together Opus One 97 + A5 wag = Memorable Indulgent MUST!  Was so stuffed, couldn't even try the monkey bread dessert towards the end.  Craftsteak is definitely lick..

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Those fresh warm salted Hawaiian bread buns, topped w/sea salt - yummy!
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu filet (med rare) + lobster, $97..
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Opus One 1997 - $1200 at Craftsteak; beautiful distinct notes of vanilla, oak, licorice - delicious silky smooth finish.

YLF_R4eWHd8F_KKtqDvaqA.text: My fiance and I enjoyed a lovely dinner here before we saw David Copperfield. The show was at 9:30 and we arrived at the restaurant around 8. The hostess did inform us that it would take roughly an hour and a half to two hours to dine with them. She suggested we could eat at the bar to be assisted quicker. We took her suggestion, sat at the bar and was greeted by our server John. He was so kind and very helpful throughout our dining experience. My fiance had the filet mignon, which was so tender and wonderfully seasoned. I had the flat iron, which was excellent as well. For dessert, we ordered the chocolate cake. SO GOOD! The prices were reasonable for the amount of food you received. The atmosphere was slightly dull and not too busy, which is surprising for a Saturday night.

O2zxwUfaO5GIVdITGkjE7w.text: Went here on a Saturday night on July 4th weekend. Reservations were fairly easy to make. When we got there we were seated quickly. Water was served and they gave us iPad menus for drinks.   We actually got served by 4 waiters that night, there were different people checking up on us and we never had to ask for a thing. Everyone was really friendly, talkative and the staff was not overbearing. I asked a waiter where the bathroom was and he actually walked me to the corridor. I've never had that happen before!  The waiter suggested that we order the summer chefs tasting menu... The domestic wagu option was 155 per person. This was really pricey but he said it came with appetizers, Meats, sides and dessert. He said it was a really good deal and between the five of us, we should order 4 and it will be enough food to feed all of us ( it was me, and five hungry boys).   Since we ordered four tasting menus, we got 4 of each course. The appetizers were shrimp cocktail, frisee salad, Cesar salad, and prosciutto. Everything was really good!  The frisee salad was a little heavy on the blue cheese side, and the Cesar salad could have had a little more dressing but the prosciutto and shrimp were delicious!!  For the meats, we had the Ribeye, filet mignon, hanger steak and ny strip. The meats were cooked to a perfect medium rare. I actually liked that they cut it up for us because it was easier to share. I also liked the variety because you don't get tired of one cut, or one texture. The hanger steak was actually my favorite!!  It was juicy, salty and meaty. The sides that came were asparagus, mushroom medley, mushroom risotto and pureed potatoes. I loved all the sides!  They added nice flavor profiles and a change of taste. The potatoes were extremely creamy and the mushrooms maintained their earthy taste and texture.   The five of us could barely finished. We were sooooooo stuffed  Finally came four desserts, sorbets of he day, banana bread pudding, chocolate mousse cake and panna cotta. Loved the bread pudding and panna cotta. The chocolate was super rich and dense. Not my favorite because I'm not a chocolate girl.   Overall it was a delicious meal with great friendly service. Be prepared to pay for a lot!!  We ordered coffee which was not included and that was not worth the price. But all and all a great experience!  If you go you should ask if you can choose the courses served. Because everything came and I'm not sure if it was a set menu or not. Also I'm not sure how it would be for two people. I think with more people you can taste a variety more and order less!

lx54cyiVQyA7vMEPa8Z6Tg.text: The flat Iron is off the chain here and is good bang for da buck! It's juicy, tender and super flavorful!!! Just get it and you'll thank me!

LRTdqMz-dbrljRrl5uNciw.text: Another 5 star experience. I think the service was actually better than before. Felt like royalty even though I don't come here much.   We did the domestic waygu tasting menu @$155 per person (bill came to about $250 per person after drinks, tax and tip), which comprises of shrimp cocktail, 1 salad, 2 half salads (choose from menu; frisee salad was by far the best), choice of three Waygu beef and we did ny strip (best one by far), filet mignon, and ribeye. You also choose 3 sides and includes desserts.   What a feast. Way too much for 3 people but oh so good. Still my favorite steak house and fine dining place in Vegas (Aqua now called Michael Mina at Bellagio is a close second).   Maybe next time we (3 people) will just order 2 waygu ny strip ($108 each), frisee salad, cucumber/avocado salad, that divine potato puree, and split one dessert. Be $400 instead of $750.

Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussel sprouts
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrooms

DlwqggVhAh2J-lNeX8M5ew.text: Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak is located in MGM Grand and has a wonderful ambiance and atmosphere.   When were were seated (9:30 PM), the hostess asked if we had any shows they needed to be aware of. We told her we had a show at 11 PM. She stated she would tell our server.  First thing out was bread (complimentary) It was just a standard dinner roll made in house and served in a cask iron pan. It was soft and tasty. It had large sea salt sprinkled on top. It was served with a pat of butter. These were delicious.   As an appetizer, we got the Warm Frisee Salad to share - Frisee - Panchetta - Bleu Cheese - Vinegrette - Poached egg  This salad was only ok. It was overly dressed and needed to have a texture different. By half way through it was just soft and not very pleasing to eat. Neither of us (2) finished it.  By 10:15 PM we had not seen our entrees. We stopped another server to remind our server we had a show at 11 PM. They were prompt to bring out entrees  For our entrees My cousin chose the 10 oz. Hangar Black Angus  I chose the 16 oz. NY Strip  We shared the White Corn Grits - White corn meal - Prosciutto - Gruyere  My cousin's steak was decent. it was soft and tasty. It had a good mouth feel   My steak (which was pricier) was not cooked well. The steak had too much sinew and even with a nice steak knife, it was difficult to cut. It was over seasoned and wasn't anything too special. The center of the steak felt a little cold. Both steaks were served in a cast iron skillet. I wonder if this is a result of us needed to leave to see a show and they rushed to put out our entrees. Though we ordered within 10 minutes of being seated and the restaurant was at about 30% capacity.  The White Corn Grits were disappointing. I also felt like this was over seasoned. The prosciutto was about half a teaspoon of crumbled and it just didn't have anything to it. I think I would've preferred a simple mash over this side, or anything over this side. It did not complement the steak as a side dish at all and there wasn't much to it either.   Because time was close we didn't even have time to peruse over the dessert menu. Because we didn't finish our wine the server was kind enough to give us glasses we can carry to the show. This was a nice gesture.  Outside of dinner, the restroom left a bit to be desired. It looked like it hadn't been serviced in a while. 1 of 3 stalls didn't have toilet paper and the stall I chose was out of seat covers. They had cloth napkins instead of paper towels. It was abnormally dark in the restroom as well. Darker than the dining room. If you took the lighting in the dining room and comparing it to pitch black, I would say that the halfway point was the lighting in the restroom.  Final review: Food: left something to be desired Service: Friendly, knowledgeable, helpful, polite. Overall atmosphere: nice, restroom needs more maintenance

VW_C6gPY4z7_Qqlq5O058Q.text: Let me explain my rating.  We have been going to the MGM Grand for years and have always seen the Craftsteak and finally decided to try it out. We arrived and were quickly seated.  We were happy that they had a dress code, it adds to the experience and makes it seem special.  When we sat down we notice the man at the next table over was wearing a tee shirt, shorts and tennis shoes.  So much for the dress code.  It was time to order the wine, when we told the waiter that we don't drink wine he gave us a disgusted look.  We we ordered soft drinks he was quite annoyed.  The starters were wonderful.  I had shrimp and my wife and daughter had scallops.  The entree arrived and it was not as good as expected.  I ordered the bone in ribeye, medium rare.  The steak was a cinder on the outside, it literally crunched when you eat it.  It was tough, the knife had trouble cutting it.  My wife had the salmon, the skin was soggy.  She had to remove the skin in order to eat the fish.  I had expected to have a tremendous experience with wonderful food.  We didn't get either.

2vz4w_MGbVUwBPF2ial2xg.text: Work retreat, went and got some steak.  Very nice cuts of meat, Caesar had actual quality anchovies.  Good diversity and excellent wine list.  Service was fantastic.  Bar and cocktail knowledge was a bit of a letdown.

EhePIoKl8B9OdIrIkID3pg.text: Craft steak is a must while visiting the MGM. We enjoy a consistent great experience Every Visit. Highly recommend the Chefs Tasting Surf & Turf with a bottle of Dr. Loosen Reisling. Great for groups or a romantic evening for two.

Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qUQwTBeSG5r2X_jyLoYSMw.text: Went here since most other steak houses that Saturday night (LDW) was reserved for the dinnertime. The occasion was a friends birthday.   This restaurant is located in MGM and we valet because we were running a few minutes late. They do charge for both valet and self parking. We ended up paying $15 for the first 4 hrs.   Though we were a few minutes late it was like 5 minutes or so before we got seated. The ambiance in the restaurant is nice with low lighting.   My group ordered the:  Ribeye Hanger steak Lobster salad  Filet mignon  Grilled corn side  All meat dishes were cooked medium rare  The ribeye and hanger steak were beautifully cooked. Delicious flavor to it and a good balance of meat and fat. I would definitely recommend these two.   The lobster salad was lobster served in the shell of half a lobster on a bed of ice with a pile of seaweed. Which wasn't what I expected. I was hoping it was an actual salad. Especially since what I originally was trying to order was a lobster bisque underneath the salad section but it was in fact a soup (don't get why it was there, but the idea would have sounded delicious if it was a salad) and the server suggested the lobster salad instead. TBH not hat impressed with it for the price.   The filet mignon was good but pale in comparison to the other two meat dishes. It was tender but plain. Unless that's how filet mignon is normally served I kind of wish it was a bit seasoned-even with salt and pepper *shrug  I saved the best for last. As other posts may have mentioned their grilled corn side (don't remember he actual name but it is the only corn side) was BOMB. It has onions in it and cilantro(if I remember correctly) and I must say I can order that and just eat it on its own. Would highly highly recommend this side.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. filet mignon-left, hanger steak-right, lobster salad-front, corn side-back, and ribeye-cut off at top

m8mrvrj37-NNdbOon7qJnA.text: My son Birthday and they really took care of us.  The best bone-in steak and freshest cessation Salad.  Service was 100%

Xxjm8ToBvlgU_8kFDo6zVg.text: BF surprised me with reservations here for date night! Definitely a place that would be a hit with guys, it's a steak and potatoes place for sure. The decor was upscale going for romantic but the kitschy cow art and eclectic selection of music (from the 70s?) kind of threw off the ambiance.    CLASSIC CAESAR: BF's pick, huge portion with several anchovies. I liked how the croutons were served on the side, as I don't care for them, but the full-leaf romaine used made it difficult to serve this dish without making a mess. HAND-CUT WAGYU TARTARE: I am a tartare fanatic and this version, mixed tableside, did not disappoint. Flavorful American beef accented with red onion, quail egg, and parsley, simple but very good. Plenty of crostini provided, too. PORTERHOUSE FOR TWO: $98/32oz, huge portion and cooked to perfect medium rare. This was served with a bearnaise sauce I didn't care for, and the meat was lacking a flavorful crust. The pan sauce perfectly complemented the meat. Porterhouse is served sliced, and brought to the table with the bone marrow.  POTATO PUREE: Portion goes farther than it seems, because it is so freaking rich. Texture was so smooth it was like velvet. Enjoyed this more than I thought I would, definitely one of the must-get sides. CHOCOLATE PEANUT BUTTER LAVA CAKE: I'm not really a lava cake person, but this version filled with peanut butter was quite good. Cake was moist, chocolate-PB contrast is hard to screw up, the vanilla ice cream paired well with this. Wish I had thought to sub the cinnamon ice cream, which sounds even better.   Service, especially from bussers, was attentive, and the booths are intimate for a date night or special occasion dinner with family. Highly suggest making reservations- even on a late weekday evening, the dining room was packed. The three-course dinners (just pick your meat, staff picks the sides and starters) sound like the best experience, will opt to go that route next time.

Ov03TW2r-9Lu8QLMmiXb-w.text: The golden potatoes are everything! Hands down one of the best and most decadent meals I've ever eaten...and I live in Napa, so that's saying something!   Skip lunch so you can really eat, and definitely save room for dessert. It's a meal to savor and enjoy at a slow pace. I was fortunate enough to join a vendor's client appreciation night and truly enjoyed the company and conversations surrounding me; the meal was a great experience to join us all together.  I can't wait to go back sometime soon!

Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Luxurious potatoes!

jBYLJJhiUzbCYRj4b0yqQA.text: After living here for over 3 years I finally had a chance to try this place out. Warm Frisee Salad - Fire and one of the best salads i've had. The saltiness of the bacon, the funkiness of the blue cheese and the acidity in the vineagar sauce mellowed out by the egg yolk all worked together in harmony like the Warrrriooorrrs.... 18oz Ribeye - Fire 16oz New York Strip - Fire again probably a little better flavor than the ribeye...even though the rib eye had better tenderness Potato Puree - Ok... Assorted Wild Mushrooms - Some of these flavors Chocolate Creme Fraiche - There were some interesting flavors it was like a rich, bitter, sour, sweet mixture...excellent as is almost everything on this menu... Bread Pudding - Crazy good and the Apple Pie Ice Cream was bomb.com but by then I was already too full trying to eat because of everything above.... Overall this place after recommending it on a daily basis as a "Top 5 Steakhouse" here in Las Vegas lived up to my expectations. Top 5 for sure...

8G_mkxUIBX_DvZ1z-pd87A.text: A bit of mixed experience. Good steak but the sides were really uninspired. Cesar salad was just long inelegant stalks of romaine, fries were soft and undercooked, the Bearnaise sauce was god awful and the waiters seemed somewhat unattentive - but the price was high enough. Seems a bit like a steak house factory and less like a dedicated restaurant

KW194JosZEttW6B5_1Jhuw.text: My experience with Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak was beyond satisfaction, it was immaculate.  My company had their annual Vegas dinner here back in July and I was lucky enough to take part this year. Right of the batch, I fell in love with the cozy atmosphere with the dimmed lights and soft background music. We were seated promptly after showing up at our RSVP time. The server made sure to greet us, briefly introduce the restaurant's history and most popular items on the menu, then proceeded to take our drinks order. When he came back to take our order, that was when we were informed that we were going to do the Chef's Tasting Menu, and I was ecstatic to hear that LOL.  Appetizer round came with jumbo shrimp cocktail, avocado salad, warm frisee salad, premium prosciuto and bread stick, buffalo mozzarella and balsamic vinaigrette. Unfortunately, I did not take any photos of how amazing they first came out, but I can tell you that they all tasted amazing. The one this that stood out to me the most in this round was the warm frisee salad. The salad came to the table with an egg par-poached, the server then broke it and mixed it in with the frisee. The salad also has pancetta  and crumbled blue cheese in the mix. It was a fantastic starter for our dinner. Aside from the salad, the jumbo shrimp cocktail was also very delicious. They were cooked to perfection and accompanied by a great cocktail sauce.  Entree round came with the filet mignon, rib-eye, skirt steaks, and flat iron. The side dishes were the infamous sweet corn, mushroom, creamy potatoes, sauteed brocolette and roasted asparagus. THEY WERE ALL SOOOOOOOOO AMAZING. My personal favorite steak was between the rib-eye and the skirt steaks. For a carnivore like myself, I was like a kid in a candy store. All the flavor go extremely well together and they all were cooked to the perfect mid-rare that a steak deserves. The side dishes did not have a supporting role in this play, they equally earned their spot on the table. The infamous sweet corn lived to its name, infamous. It is True that you have to get it when they put it on the menu. Don't hesitate, it is a must. Another standout as for the side dishes would be the sauteed brocolette. Cooked to perfection and wonderfully seasoned. The one dish wasn't a hit for me was the roasted mushroom. Don't get me wrong, I love mushroom, all kind of mushroom, so I was excited to see the dish when it got to the table. However, it lacked salt and too watery for a roasted mushroom dish, my expectation was higher.  Dessert round came around and we instantly grew a separate stomach for all the delicious sweet treats: mango cheese cake, chocolate layered cake, banana pudding, assorted ice cream and sorbet, assorted fruits, and the my absolute favorite - sticky monkey bread... YUM!  Service: 5+ STARS! One of the most attentive and detailed service I have had. I love listening to servers explaining the menu and what they are serving. It really shows who loves the job there and who doesn't. There's no way you can enthusiastically talk about food without truly having the passion for it.  Overall, it was a very pleasant experience for time we spent here. Definitely will come back and recommend it to anyone I know paying a visit in Vegas.

TEStksiIHL683o_gr4bBVw.text: Came here on Friday night for a friends bday. Been hearing great things about this place and we just had to try it out for ourselves.  Place: Pretty modern. Decor was nice and the place in general was pretty dim. We made reservations but don't think you really need to at this place unless you have a big party or it's a packed holiday. We got sat a booth and for some reason, there was a portrait of a sad looking cow right above us (still ate steak with no shame though).   Service: 5 stars. Waiter was super friendly and explained the menu. Had multiple people come by asking how we were doing including the manager.   Food: 5 stars. Was gonna get the a5 wagyu but lebron lost me money...so I decided to get the domestic wagyu New York strip. It was a perfect size and seriously cut like butter, SO DELICIOUS. For comparison, my friend got the t-bone and it tasted like he got it from Denny's after eating the wagyu. We got a few sides, I'd recommend the yukon puree and risotto. We also got the asparagus which was alright. Basically long story short : you're already here, GET THE WAGYU.   Only annoying thing was the person that came by to take pictures of us then tried to charge us 25 bucks for a copy. The person wasn't annoying just the theme park feel of that. But besides that, everything else was great, will be coming back to try the other wagyu cuts.

2M1_gQi3MnH-KLiuouDFWA.text: All food, other than potato puree, was underseasoned.  Garlic overpowered the Caesar dressing on salad - yet the salad was bland without adding salt and pepper.  10 ounce domestic Wagyu was chewy ... have had better quality meat elsewhere ... and, again had to add salt.  Asparagus had very little seasoning or lemon zest.  Carrots were okay but I've had much better honey glazed heirloom carrots elsewhere.  Potato puree was spot on (but not as good as Atelier Joel Robuchon in Paris (can't speak to the Las Vegas location)).  The house rolls with fleur de sel were the best of the night.  Wine, dinner and bussing service were great (except when server knocked over my water glass - quickly cleaned up and apologies made).  Expected much better from the kitchen ... good but not great.

KzrT3svjB_kPUNdtikdABg.text: Absolutely one of our favorite restaurants to frequent!!!  From the service, to the ambience, to the delicious food and drinks - Craftsteak never disappoints.  Some of our favorite items to order are:  lobster bisque, crispy skin chicken, filet mignon, american wagyu skirt steak, potato puree, grits, mushrooms, seasonal carrots, and almost any dessert!  Love the complimentary buttered/salted bread, and their raspberry martinis!  During our latest visit - our waiter was welcoming, amusing, attentive, and knowledgeable.  There has never been a time where the wait staff didn't make sure our dining experience was an great one.  We will definitely continue to come back...

0LDzGjLjBpAJ8AQnWNlMNQ.text: I was underwhelmed. The $79 seafood platter had 2 small shrimp, 2 oysters, 2 clams, 3 small,pieces of crab, and some chopped lobster salad, rather than chunk meat. The mignonette lacked shallots. Our ribeye was delicious although when ordered "charred medium rare" the waiter took pause and indicated this would be delivered well done and urged against it. The bill for two was $300plus tip, one appetizer, one shared steak, two side dishes, no dessert, one glass wine. A mediocre very expensive experience.

hfV8Lhjc6fDiMpedD9mTyg.text: I had dinner with my daughter at Craftsteak.  We ordered an 18oz ribeye steak (dry-aged, rare plus), a salad and a side.  The salad and side were mediocre at best.  The steak was really bad. I mean it was really bad. It did not even taste like beef. The texture and taste were both way off. How can you mess up steak at a steakhouse? We left more than half of the food but the server did not even ask why.  A lesson learned - do not trust all the yelp reviews.

Oh-xnJls00PVr7vCZs6MUQ.text: Amazing!!  The staff is extremely knowledgeable and approachable. The Chilean sea bass is one of the best seafood dishes I've ever tasted. The wine list is expansive and impressive. The dining experience is such that you'll want to take your time to fully enjoy it all. You will leave feeling elated and full!

5eumpq50IQcH9QMquUWqiw.text: Terrific experience from start to finish. 5/5 enough said. Very beautiful, romantic and intimate restaurant. I made reservations but opted out and had dinner at the bar instead.   Everything we ordered was exceptional.   Starters:  mozzarella salad - phenomenal not your traditional mozzarella salad but very interesting and delicious rendition.   The cucumber watercress salad was amazing. Very crisp, refreshing and light. This Had to be one of the best salads I've had in a long time. To think something so simple and uninteresting as cucumber and watercress could taste so good, the dressing really delicious.   Mains:  16oz NY strip- AMAZING steak! cooked to perfection. Well seasoned, incredibly tender and just mouthwatering.  Added a side of Scallops to accompany the steak. They were outstanding.   Service was fantastic, I think the bartenders name was Larry, a total rock star. Thank you for the terrific experience, suggestions,and service. Highly recommend this restaurant and will definitely be back!

CtcfVoWaNl3RQ8EnXIfq1Q.text: This place truly deserves more than a five star rating. Every single bite is full of flavor and you don't have to be a celebrity to be treated as one. This restaurant has my heart.

7aMVCDUjt4MQZXH5KkcxGg.text: We went to a conference at MGM this past week and went there for dinner.    It was all in all a 6/10 experience as far as the food and service are concerned.  Food was good but not top notched as expected for such a place.  We have visited a few other steakhouse in lv and this one is far behind in terms of food and service.  Our waiter was nice but the service was not as attentive as it should be.  Every entree was brought out by a different staff and they were just not trained to interact with the customer.    Sorry but good place but not good enough for that price range and especially in lv where so many other choices are available.

ZxNEwT25t9tirAzD2iZDSA.text: Really good quality steakhouse, gets a little too busy so food does take a while. I really recommend the spinach as a side and the mushroom sampler. The bread was amazing so warm and soft and so much flavor from the butter. Ribeye and filet were cooked well and the sauce that came with the ribeye was so bomb! Highly recommend but be ready to wait at all times during dinner rush hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye and filet with spinach asparagus and mushroom sampler!

hP8GYa-7ddtgt159XVP6MQ.text: Do this at least once in this lifetime.   If ever I felt compelled to write a review for a restaurant this is the one. One visit and I found myself instantly hooked. I don't ever plan to visit Vegas again without coming back here. I've dined in nearly half the states and I've never had a meal equally commiserate in both quality and quantity as the meal I shared here with my friend for her 40th. We had the surf and turf option, and it was a bit like being on a blind date. The team semi-surprises guests with choice picks from their phenomenal menu. We ended up with 15 items from starters to dessert and ABSOLUTELY EVERYTHING was delicious to both of us.   We were served: bread and butter, mushrooms, brussel sprouts, lobster bisque, two different salads, pate, lobster tails, ribeye steak, filet mignon, creamed potatoes, mango sorbet, chocolate mousse cake, shortbread cookies with strawberry ice cream, and something else nearly indescribable. With a non-alcoholic drink, tax and tip it was about $200/person. Yes, that was my most expensive meal to date, but it was really several meals in one. You can opt for a smaller meal, but considering the prix fixe meal is more like an incomparable dining experience I can only highly recommend going all the way. As if the delectable food wasn't enough my friend had two cocktails and she barely made it out the restaurant (go hard here and you may not make it home). Without a doubt this feast was absolutely fabulous, fantastic, and enthralling. I must say I also enjoyed the overdose of good service, too. At least four servers and the manager frequented our table which undoubtedly made this a rich experience in every sense of the word.   Warning: Because there's so much food that's decadent and drenched in "top shelf" butter you absolutely cannot eat it all and unless you're going to a room with a kitchenette you'll likely have the misfortune of having to toss out at least a bit or perhaps a lot of your leftovers. Wasting even a morsel felt like a travesty. Vegas has pretty good food, but hands down I'd pick this restaurant as the city's first place winner.

vSkusBZXtLfRr3q_rb1T0g.text: Short Rib to go       Family wanted burgers, so I got my short rib to go.  I was actually pleasantly surprised at the portion size.  The meat was as tender as you would expect.  For me though, the burgundy wine was a little too strong.        I wouldn't get it again, but would go back to try something else.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib

Fpmi7jgMFJ03CJdTHIj4tA.text: This was hands down the best surf and turk I've ever had.  The entrees took a little longer than I would've anticipated but it was worth the wait. I came here with my boyfriend and his parents before a show and the service was great as well.  Everything came out together and was delicious.   The lobster I had was so tender not tough at all.  I like that we each had our on butter dipping pot.  Also the steak was cooked exactly how I like my medium steak cooked.  I will definitely be back for dessert because we were short on time during this visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dWf07Ka7jN5NYsjRFuA27g.text: Food: 5/5 Service: 5/5 Cleanliness: 5/5 Decor & Style: 5/5  It was worth the high price. We all ordered something different and pretty much went "family style". My favorite was the braised beef, excellent. My second favorite would be the Black Angus Hanger.  The portions are huge so I recommend NOT ordering any appetizers. All 6 of us had to take some kind of leftover to-go!

Kr5X0hkpNseavv0n_JD8UA.text: I returned after lasts nights outstanding meal. I like to sit at the bar and they could not have been more accommodating. The Caesar and the sides they allowed me to order half sizes. Most places don't do that. I really appreciated that sine I really don't like to waste food. Caesar with white anchovy's. If you've never had white anchovy's they are more mild than regular with more of vinegar flavor. Really a great taste. Then a 10 oz filet. I don't usually eat filets but most of the steaks here are really large. It was one of the best I've ever had. Half order of sauteed spinach and I was perfectly satisfied. Good guys at the bar.

5vfieXGyN7KzBwkE22kR8w.text: I can't give more than 5 stars...so 5 it is.  if your in town and wanting a fantastic steak dinner this is the spot.   the restaurant staff is always top notch from start to finish.  first you are greeted at the door and brought to your table. the separation from the mgm madness starts to sink in when you turn the first corner. once seated, you are greeted and then served water if wanted, drink and dinner menu are set and the orders are placed.  while you wait for your dinner, you can relax with some delicious bread and butter and whatever drink your enjoying. chat it up, take it all in.  if you get appetizers, those will come first. enjoy that, I do.  next is dinner. now...I get the filet medium rare. it comes on a iron plate with a shallot. the sauce on the plate, superb. the filet cooked perfectly every time.  I also order the mashed potatoes and asparagus. 10/10.  every dish I have had at this restaurant, and I think I've been here over 15 times in the last 365 days, has never ever disappointed.  I'm a fan for sure, and it is my go to restaurant.  lastly, when the bill comes try not to get shocked by the amount in that bottom line. just pay it and know you paid for service, quality and experience.

-zvgYJQmsHrH0f9Zc4rutQ.text: The only sad sad sad terribly sad part is our favorite restaurant has been closed in December the last couple of years did I mention it is sad. Other than that .... perfection without pretentious bullshit...Oh my but don't be fooled my friends @TomColicchio and staff are so so incredibly talented, please do not look for salt and pepper on the table. The food...one moment I need a tissue not only for my tear of joy but for the corner of my mouth. The staff they are a beautiful orchestra playing beautifully in the background. When a restaurant makes you feel poetic...

nl5HOfuLYcjhOHuwSdAjvA.text: Hubby brought me here for our 10 year anniversary and had the most amazing experience.  Service was outstanding and the food was delicious. Started out with lobster bisque (yum) and hubby had caesar salad with white anchovies (OMG). I had the braised short ribs and he had the NY steak ... OMG!!!!!!  Amazing experience ever!

Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dicicco Broccoli

NGNH88N-yty4q-IaJN5yLw.text: We tried the Chef's selection, which basically means "let us surprise you" menu. It was beyond delicious. We had 4 starters, 2 types of beef, with 3 sides & then 4 desserts! The Jabbawockeez show started at 7pm & dinner ran long. They waiter said no problem, come back & have dessert after the show. We enjoyed them a with a drink named for Anthony Bourdain called No Reservations. Oh & the music mix was surprising and fun. One of the best meals ever! The wait staff, bartender & manager were all great and friendly as well.
