ir_Jb3LkZrMliTnzq8t8NQ.text: Wow! So worth the hefty bill! Top notch service and the food was mouth watering. Sometimes you just have to treat yourself and say "wtf"

ONgJOLIiMONBr5R15eooNg.text: Sat down to have a steak but,  although my order was taken,. I didn't get my food for hours. Manager did adjust the bill, accordingly.

uOrkCVBiqXj0NWXIMUyJhA.text: Excellent ambiance, great food plus the MGM what else could you ask for. Went for my Bachelor party.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KpnsOnGu1CviLeJOeT4SSQ.text: We have had some incredible steakhouse meals on the strip and this is one that disappointed. Service was the most disappointing part. Our server and the somm were not friendly. Somm was actually rushed and spilled some wine, and didn't really seem to care - sloppy. The gentleman assisting our main server was by far the best person we encountered.   The filet was underwhelming and not quite the right doneness. Best steak was the tbone - beautiful crust. The appetizer and sides we ordered were good, not great as we expected.

LVJhX-H2D3M65n5z_HDbhw.text: So we have dined at Mastros, Flemings, Ruth Chris... Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak at the MGM is right up there if not better.   To start, the service was great. We started at the bar and the bartender was quick to serve with a nice pour. At the table, our server was very attentive and informative. It felt like we had a team of severs. Our drinks never went dry.   The food, I went with the 18 oz Ribeye (but of course) and it did not disappoint. I can't remember the last time I've had such a perfectly cooked ribeye that was as flavorful without being extra fatty. I wanted to throw the bone in my pocket and save it for later. Great options for sides. However, we were fortunate enough to be friends with a chef and had a couple additional sides (compliments of the chef ) if you are only having one or two sides, do yourself a favor and don't skip on the Warm Frisee Salad (hands down best side of the night). I also heard the Lobster Bisque was quite tasty.   Dessert, oh man, we were celebrating a birthday and the chef did not hold back. The only thing I regret is having to eat in a hurry because we had a show to catch so we flew threw dessert.   The atmosphere was the standard dark wood, low lit steakhouse feel and even though the restaurant was very busy it was still quiet enough to enjoy conversation without having to raise your voice across the table.   Bottom line, if you're doing a steakhouse in Vegas, you need to give Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak a try. You won't regret it.  My first Yelp review! It was that good!! I just had to.

zd5p-N-Scj9yXCKYVgZQbA.text: Craftsteak is not for the faint of stomach or faint of wallet. This place will stuff you like a teddy bear n break your bank like the IRS.   Parking:  Your in Vegas get a ride!  Decor:  You can definitely see the quality in all their furniture and the cleanliness is uncanny. They had just the perfect amount of dim lighting throughout which really sets a nice ambiance in the place. ONLY complaint is that the tables are close together. I mean the table next to us was thrown off when i kept switching between my normal voice and my British accent. I appreciate the support but I feel like I could have put my fork in their steak at times.   Service:  The service was outstanding. I forgot our servers name but she was part of (Team 5)- that's what it said on our receipt. But they are extremely organized and in unison with everything they do here. On top of that with the pricing in the staff is very personal and doesn't omit a False level of sophistication which is awesome. Biggest thing was everything was cleared and brought out within minutes of each other.    Food:  So I will start off by saying papa bear spared no expense on this one and went for the Chef's Choice (Kobe Menu) $155 a person. That came with unlimited bread, 4 appetizers, 3 Wagyu Steaks, 3 Sides, & 4 Desserts. (This was for a part of 3 people)  Appetizers:  Prosciutto: Honestly was good but not great. Probably the worst thing I had that night. It had some great natural oils in; however I feel it was missing a little density in it, which I think is just my preference when it comes to prosciutto.   Cocktail Shrimp: Man these things were huge, like Shaq's toe huge. They were extremely fresh, cleaned perfectly and delicious. Best part for me they made their cocktail sauce in house.   Caesar Salad w/ Anchovies Ok to start if you don't like Anchovies you'd probably want to stay away. They defiantly use the fresh choves in their dressing. I personally loved it, as well the croutons they used with the salad were awesome. They weren't salty at all which is awesome because it set a great counter balance of the salt from the anchovies in the dressing. As well the romaine was fresh and the fresh Parmesan cheese was the closer on this girl.   Shaved Fennel Salad w/ Poached Egg This would not be for everyone, luckily I'm not everyone. The fennel balanced with the poached egg was oh so dank. On top of that the server literally tosses it right in front of you. I took a slomo video of this and it might be one of the most x rated videos i own. The best part about the whole thing, BOOM they put bacon in it. Oh so grateful for such an addition to the dish.   SIDES: Brussels W/ Bacon Done to perfection and the most impressive thing about this dish was the consistency of the Brussels. If you really look at the picture they stayed fully intact and had the perfect body to them. Not going to lie, they were way better then any one I've ever made.   Pureed Potatoes:  Ok so when you look at this, it literally looks like a porridge dish that my great grandma would eat! But no joke like for real. Once you slap that spoon in your mouth it literally taste like what the holidays make you feel like. It had the right amount of butter and creamy taste without messing with the integrability of the potato. This would by far be the best basic potato dish I've ever had. In my life.   Red Pepper Risotto with Buffalo Mozzarella:  Well this is a dish that I will forever remember. I don't want to lie to you but I would honestly go back for this. Creamy, Savory. It really is the Best Risotto me and my friends have ever had. N let's be for real they got the fresh mozzarella on there. Whoever designed this dish had me in their heart because I am seriously in love with it. Like so good have it at my wedding good.   Steaks Wagyu   New York 14 oz.  2nd favorite: Cooked to perfection with an amazing char on the exterior of it. The body was juicy and supple. Oh ya n the steak was good 2 ;)The sheer density of the meat was everything I wanted it to be.   Skirt 14oz ###!1111111. OK I'm a fatty type of guy when it comes to meat n I don't mean and disrespect to what they do with everything here but this was award winning. I could seriously have this as my last meal on earth n die a happy man. Like goodness the flavor packed into this skirt makes me question what type of illegal things they're doing in the kitchen. Bob Marley really said it "Is this love Is this love that I'm feeling". The answer is yes, yes it is!!  Filet 8oz 3rd favorite overall a great filet n the very flavorful for the leanest cut of meat.   Dessert:   Bread Pudding with Almonds Favorite dessert I've ever had in the world. I cant even talk about it cause it gets me excited. Just try it  Lemon Caramel Cheesecake Flan & cheesecake had a baby!!  3 Ice creams: Mango, Apple Cider, Hibiscus The cider ice cream! All I want 2 say  Chocolate Moose Creamy rich and a perfect moose  "Get It While It's Good Cause Don't Nothing Last Forever"

Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate moose!!

i6FVapOtLB7_gzcPyvgCYA.text: the wagyu beef tartar....omg...must order yukon potato puree....solid A...must order NY steak, solid choice, I do not know what could go wrong if you order just these 3 things

oFr7IoVkIndWEdL1Zrem5g.text: AMAZING!!! That is the only word that I can use to describe this place. From the service to the food and everything else in between. This place is just that good. For starters, my friend and I didn't make a reservation. We showed up closer to closing but the staff was very accommodating. They sat us at the bar and that worked out best for us. The bartender catered to our every need and the wait for the food wasn't long at all. Customer service was top notch and there was never a dull moment that wasn't filled with good conversation. It was like there was someone there on staff that would talk to us about literally anything.   I like to try all kinds of different foods when I'm on vacation and this was no exception. For starters I tried the Wagyu Tartare and Fresh Oysters. The Tartare was like butter on the crostini. The oysters tasted like they just came out of the ocean, that fresh! Definitely a must get next time I eat here. For the main course I had the 18oz bone in ribeye. I must say they definitely know how to cook a steak. Most times I eat at steakhouses I end up saying to myself that I can cook a better steak, but not this place. I'll say this place has my approval for steak doneness. They cooked my steak to PERFECT medium rare. Most times I end up sending a steak back because they overcook/undercook it. I also added scallops to the dish, they were fine. I probably wouldn't get it again but I would recommended to someone if they find themselves considering it. To finish out the main course I added some sides. Asparagus, Wild Mushrooms and Potato Puree. Those mushrooms had a vast array of different types adding flavors and textures you don't get from the classic button mushroom dishes. To round it up I had the Pecan Sticky Bun and ice cream. Out of everything, this was probably my least favorite part of the meal. But that was mainly due to me not paying attention to what kind of ice cream that came with it. To balance the sweetness from the bun, they have a sour cream ice cream that goes along. It wasn't bad, it tasted much closer to frozen yogurt and I wasn't expecting that tartness.   All in all I enjoyed my experience dining here. Yes, it does cost a little more but you definitely get what you pay for. The service and experience will make up for price tag. The best part, I left full and satisfied. I didn't pay all this money and was still hungry after the fact. I will be making a return trip to this restaurant the next time I'm in town. No doubt about it.

T6wA9XUAKtVNYu6oKWza1Q.text: The food was ok. It was the very very slow service that got me. We sat forever between each thing and then we waited forever for the check. We did get the photos that were taken because they were good but waaaaaaay over priced. I don't know that I would do that again.

itTqlyB3UFMDeA_o-qKaJg.text: I went many years ago and seemed to recall it being a standout, but this last trip told a different story. Overpriced and decidedly mediocre, i had a steak done at "chef's choice" assuming that wouldn't be roasted to maximum heat containment, but boy was it a tough piece of overdone meat. They quickly recovered with better than average service with a new  piece of meat, but despite better cook temperature, The meat itself was not on par with the pricetag. There are too many good options in Vegas to settle for a mediocre meal.

8PoOtMlDJ8UL7DZaE7bCpQ.text: I'll start with the positives: We were seated promptly for our reservation, on time, even though there were a lot of people waiting to be seated. The atmosphere was pretty good. I am very picky about my martini, and it was perfect!    I ordered the 10 oz filet mignon, and it was nice and juicy. I would have preferred a little more seasoning. It was over cooked, as I asked for medium, but there was zero pink.  I asked for the peppercorn sauce and waited quite a while for it. That was very good. The potato puree side I ordered was extremely watery and flavorless.   I forgot to mention that the waiter was extremely pushy, and I finally excepted his salad recommendation, although I was not even hungry enough. I don't remember the name of the salad, but it was terrible and I sent it back.  It was mostly lettuce, lots of lettuce, and some of it had brown edges. The dressing was nasty. Pungent.    Let me reiterate that the waiter was very pushy. I feel like there must be good compensation for up-selling the customer. It was very uncomfortable.    When the check came I felt like the meal was worth about half of what it cost.

blaX_wKDkopWIt6EytAa3g.text: First time here, knowing Tom from Top Chef first season, the food is very delicious, and the service is very good too! Order grilled New York strip, very juicy, tender! The restaurant is very quiet too, excellent surroundings for the dinner ! Definitely will come more!

3LqdTlyKprFLf_NzTjIMTA.text: Hmmm. Great service good food with some issues. Steak done correctly and potatoes to die for. Good staff. Asparagus is not my fave bit cooked to perfection cooked but crispy. My steak was a good NY strip and he had porterhouse he enjoyed. However when it came time to take leftovers a bag boxes and plasticware were dumped on the table breaking the spell of superior service. For a $300+ dinner for two people why am I boxing up my own stuff? It immediately went for five star to low rent. Carry through service levels to the end or risk a bad taste in our mouths. A warning to all don't think you can get out of here for less than 300 bucks for two people either fixed price or a la carte. I'd say it's a good dinner  but the prices and markup were a bit steep for what you get.

BCxLqY0DvunIvxr0FF6TBw.text: Bread was warm and delicious. Steak was cooked just like we ask. Service was great. Loved it and would eat their again.

vHCO0F_jcPqoz6c7mvs_8g.text: Amazing. Ordered the pre fix Domestic wagyu option. Sooo much food. I've had a lot of great steaks but the wagyu skirt steak takes the cake. For what a skirt steak is, this was so perfectly cooked and tender. Hands down best skirt steak I've ever had. Wagyu ribeye was very good but would've been better had they kept it medium rare instead of medium. But for $40 price difference on the a la carte menu I'd stick with the skirt steak. From salads to sides, everything was on point. Potato puree was awesome as suggested by waiter. But what separates a good meal from a great one is dessert. For two ppl, it was dessert overload. Awesome meal even if it was a bit pricey.

Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert plate 1

_Eyqz9jBQUrqVwSGJ3XG1A.text: Craftsteak was really a great Steak House experience. I came here with 4 of my boys for our big dinner out during a bachelor party weekend. (There are plenty of other reviews covering our Shenanigans)  At any rate they won me over from the start because they carry Hudson River Whiskeys' line of fine whiskeys including, the Baby Bourbon. That immediately got the night off to a great start!   I started off with the Lobster Bisque which was excellent! One of the best I've had with a generous serving of Lobster. The bisque was prepared excellently. Then I got right down to business with my 20 oz Bone-In Ribeye with Blue Cheese. I ordred it medium-rare and it also was prepared excellently. The side dishes were excellent too; sauteed spinach, mushroom assortment, and ground grits with bacon. I paired my main course with a nice Willamette Pinot Noir.  All in all, it was a great steak. I wasn't sure it was the best steak I've ever had, but with the amount of steak houses I've been to I'm not sure I can really tell anymore. The service definitely puts on par if not apart with the big boys like Morton's and Capital Grille. I throughly pleased and unlike the Big 4, it's not everywhere!  It was a great dining experience, if you're in Vegas definitely check it out.

pnMNo63VqGosYeoLy5bKAg.text: All I can say, is WOW.   My boyfriend and I came here for our first meal in Las Vegas. I love top chef and was curious about Tom Collicho's food. My boyfriend was dying to try wagyu beef.  We started out with some oysters. They were heavenly. Fresh and full of deliciousness. We had three different kinds from NY.  The table next to us received one too many desserts, so they passed theirs off to us at this point. Not a traditional order for courses, but it was delicious. We had the flourless chocolate cake with the blood orange sorbet.The sorbet was out of control. It went perfectly with the cake.  For our main course, I had lobster. It was delicious! Perhaps a little too much spice (I prefer butter and lemon on my lobster to let the lobster flavor come out), but it was still great and I ate the whole thing. My boyfriend got the wagyu skirt steak. I have literally never seen him so happy in my life. I tasted it and it was INCREDIBLE. I've never tasted anything like that before! We ate the whole thing.  We also got the brussel sprouts with bacon. Although we didn't have much room let for them, they were still wonderful.   We had a delicious Malbec with our food. The wine list here is extensive and great.  The service was good. A little formal and stiff, but they took really good care of us.  I'd be back in a heartbeat! This place is amazing.

rvPHNrUc_ixsRjlmmqh3gA.text: I had to update my previous review from February after we decided to eat dinner here again after a last minute Las Vegas trip.  Once again the steak was amazing!!!!  The service was unbelievable.  I can't even imagine that it could get any better.  And this night we had incredible side dishes that were on par to the delicious steak!  It was absolutely the quality and service you would expect for the price.

se0fh5wgGlF28NFI8qWTrw.text: Honestly, there was little that was memorable or interesting about our dinner here last Friday. The food is solid, but overly salty (my tongue was swollen the next morning) and verged on boring.

TwDLbumrCSE4ecp2bLvNhQ.text: I love whiskey. Had double shot of Macallan 25 and was $20 more than most places around Las Vegas. Scallops were AMAZING. Must get them when I go there next time!

DULPFxUFt04VI1Ub9wKtiw.text: Bachelor party weekend 1st night kick-off dinner. Had Reservations for 5. They walked us all the way through and straight to the back. OH HELL NO!  Corrected that real quick. Seated us in the main area...ahhhh that's better, nice ambiance.  After all the partying up to that point and with a full night ahead, I didn't want to pass out late night so only ate a lil bit of food.   Ordered a Cesar salad---just ok & Sea Diver Scallops---very tasty! I opted for wine this evening (again trying to pace myself) Riesling was delicious.   Couple guys had steaks and sides. Some ordered Lobster bisque and shrimp cocktail another guy followed my lead and ordered a salad...  With tip the bill was just over $300 so very reasonable for a high end steakhouse.  Service was good but you know it wasn't special... (reminds me of a frat boy saying "yeah I $#%^@* her".   I feel the same way about Craftsteak it's just a restaurant, what you see is what you get. But we did have a good time and enjoyed our meals so recommended without reservation yelpers!

tG497fDkyFm1BZygoOmzAA.text: This place was great, the food and the service are as amazing as you can get. Braised short rib was incredible, and so were all of the sides. Its price would knock it down to 4 stars, but hell its vegas and you expect that.

cRvbcNOq6n9OPRXf_Vo5mg.text: The steak was good and the service at the bar was great! I would recommend the kale as a side dish and I generally don't enjoy kale.

Q11yBFe_zQ1tZaaf1vTRLA.text: Hands down one of the best restaurants I've ever been to. Every single plate they brought out was nothing but amazing and sooooo good!!!! I reccomend anyone who is ready to drop down some serious money to eat here. So worth it!

UMs9h6Q050e_WUY6y6oC2g.text: The service, the wine, the steak, the lobster, the side dishes, and oh those tasty buttered rolls. Seriously, folks. You have to check this place out. Very attentive service and fantastic food.

lUoxmK6jdv5aX9IWxljiFA.text: I have done the craftsteak experience, I have had it where it is above reproach.   Tonight was not one of those nights...  I have been here when it is spot on.  Tonight was bad, sent back twice bad.   This should never happen.  To be fair, Blue, took excellent care of us as did Marvin.  But the kitchen fucked them this day...  Too bad, I love this spot, but you will have to earn my respect again.

8On4SklFS0ovS5FatpKdcw.text: It pains me to write this, but Craftsteak was a letdown. Or, rather, the steak was a letdown, and, at that price, a letdown feels pretty devastating.   Everything but the steak, though, was great. The decor was hip and elegant and comfortable. The service was impeccable.  The corn was the best we've ever had--it was an actual revelation. Ditto the fruit and monkeybread.  But you don't got to Craftsteak for corn or fruit or monkeybread. You go for steak, and our steaks (domestic Wagyu) were overcooked, and not particularly flavorful.  I've had better, several times, and for far less money.   So, if I had to do it again, here's what I would do differently:  No Wagyu.  No tasting menu. Two tasting menus for two people = an obscene amount of food. One appetizer or salad, one or two sides, and two entrees would be a much better proposition.

wP6R7q9RijfvuE96Vk-6_g.text: I'm a fan of Craftsteak, and this location didn't disappoint... My steak was delicious, perfectly cooked, and complemented by some awesome sides. The waitstaff were also great, and very patient with our large group.  They have a terrific wine list here, though it's overpriced in typical Las Vegas fashion  Recommended

bKKIxwRGfDQWUr4PlKR0Cg.text: Before I go to Vegas I'm told you "have" to try Craftsteak. Its Toms place from the Top Chef TV show. Cool!   I'm staying across the street at the Hooters Hotel and I know this place is in the MGM. Great!   After meeting my buddy in Vegas and pretty much drinking all day, there is only one thing I want to do, eat a great steak dinner. Yeah!   We have 6:00 reservations and so I stop drinking at 2:30. I jump in the shower and put on nice clothes. My buddy? He keeps drinking until 5:00, runs upstairs and is ready at 5:40. We walk over to the restaurant.   I was looking forward to this place for dinner. We start talking about Iraq (Herbert Walkers Iraqi war) and how we knew all the blood that was spilled in the mud, etc.. He starts getting loud and is WOLFING down bread that was out of this world. It was baked in a small tray with Kosher salt on top.   We ordered two lobster bisque's that were OK. I'm from Long Island, I want more lobster in my soup, thank you very much Tom.   I quickly order a steak for two, Asparagus and spinach sides and the waiter who was great throws us a free potato dish. We ordered a medium rare steak. The steak was ok, a little too rare in the middle, I give those pieces to old drunky.   I'm coming back to Vegas in a few months with my family, If I would have ordered this meal and was served meat not cooked perfectly at these prices? I'd be calling Tom at the TV studio and have him cook the friggin steak himself.   I still give 4 stars because the bread was really, really good

Fxm3jUQt_FkFANKCpBLA2A.text: Wow, now this is what you call a steak dinner. There were 6 of us and we all had the $125/each Kobe Steak Chef's Tasting Menu. Imagine your table covered with 6 big kobe steaks, each of which was a different kind of kobe steak. I can't remember all the types but the flank steak was excellent and our unanimous fave,  ribeye was very good, sirloin was decent. Overall all the steaks were very good - perhaps I'm not a steak expert but I honestly could not tell the difference kobe beef and regular steak. Not sure if it's just my unsophisticated steak palate or whether the kobe steak here was not that great.   Everything (including the steaks) came family steak so we eat could try everything:   Appetizers: - Steak tartar - Huge scallops - Caesar salad - Ahi tuna  Sides: - Asparagus - Whipped mash potatoes - Vegetables - Mushrooms   Dessert assortment - one of the best parts of the meal! - banana cheesecake - bread pudding - various ice creams (pineapple, coconut, etc)  Wine menu - extensive and the red wine recommended to us was smooth and delicious  Service was very professional, courteous, and helpful as it should at such a fancy place.   Bottom line: This steak place doesn't mess around. All the steaks tasted great but I'm not giving a 5 since I have had better (e.g. Smith and Wollensky's). If you can, the chef's tasting menu is the way to go!

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe steak tasting dinner

l_lnV-28siaDTKeH0Zy2Ng.text: By far the most expensive and BEST meal I had during my trip to Vegas last August. I didn't splurge on the Waygu beef, but my dinner mates did and said it was amazing. I had the Oysters to start, Angus Beef Filet with Scallops, Asparagus, Potato Puree, and sampled some of my friends' dessert. The fact that I can remember nearly everything I had speaks volumes. Service was outstanding.   BTW, What happens in Vegas doesn't stay in Vegas when you're so dehydrated that you fall backwards with your chair. This happened at a large top table directly next to our booth. While we can only assume that the diner (obviously in Vegas with a group of friends) was probably dehydrated from, well, drinking like he was in Vegas, it was interesting to see how management handled such an event (leaving the diner on the floor next to us until he recovered from passing out.) No paramedics were needed and the table left shortly, but certainly an odd experience to accompany our dinner.

ufLJFpmBP5eb2Jukj65NZw.text: Ya, not so much.   I visited Craftsteak for a birthday dinner. There were three of us at the table on a Tuesday night. The restaurant was busy but by no means "Vegas busy". We were seated promptly for our 7:30 reservation and greeted by one waiter and then another telling us that they would both be assisting us that evening. I was impressed!.....but then that was it. Our waiters went totally AWOL after taking our drink orders. After checking back with us 10 minutes later we were finally able to order. I waited 25 minutes for my (cold) salad to arrive to the table. Making the total time we waited for our food about 40 minutes (3 med rare steaks, 2 sides). The timing was obscene! AND when our food came the waiter(s) still never checked back with us. The most attentive person in the entire place was the bus boy (I wish I could have tipped him and left our waiters a goose egg).   As for the food, it left much to be desired. I had the filet ($58) and it tasted like a $20 steak you'd get at any restaurant, anywhere, ever. The other steaks were just as disappointing. The BEST menu item is the free bread.  We did tell the manager how disappointed we were in the service. Whether she did anything or not, I'm not sure but I'd like to hope she did and that the service will improv.  SKIP CRAFTSTEAK (Unless the food and service dramatically improve.)

ltKhsMmWAz5th2jsbRvGZA.text: Did the tasting menu for seasonal items here while in Vegas for a weekend.  The service was excellent, two waiters and the sommelier visited the table. Loved that he offered to split two glasses of wine so I could try the white and red that he had since I am limited to one glass on special occasions due to pregnancy. Easy to get reservations here too, we had them at 8:30 to make Ka on a Friday night. The seasonal menu was lovely and for us, the best part wasn't even the steak! We loved the first part with the veggies and appetizers. The quail was excellent!  Dessert was great, although I have to be honest, what is with this maple bacon ice cream craze going right now? I found it more novel than tasty. Wrote Congratulations on our dessert plate too! (we were on our "babymoon") Will DEFINITELY return. Thanks chef!

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6bzTVjsbKMou-SzTvaLOVQ.text: Made a reservation paid just as much as other tables yet they stuck us in the bar and our $60 steaks came out only after we reminded our server and lukewarm and chewy. I had such high hopes. Too bad.

DD4Q2RHSJWHpjp1KGJJWGg.text: The food was good, but not the quality we've come to expect in high-end steakhouses. The table location was disappointing - far too close to the busy bar area. Service was OK, but again not as good as expected. Overall, far from meeting our expectations for a $450 meal.

RQlFd7XSkKINA4DGyL2NgA.text: Came here with the gfs, and we ordered too much food.  It was all worth it though.    Great drinks, delicious FOOD, so make reservations and you'll be treated like queens.

K8hXxBJj5CdkF5GFH_nAFQ.text: Honestly, I thought this place was overrated. We had the food family style so I got to try many different cuts of the meat. Each cut tasted dry and was overcooked. I liked the salmon the most which is concerning if this is a steakhouse.   Would not come here again.

P8wWdVIhoCejAZh7AiK4_g.text: The food was amazing! The mashed potatoes were perfectly creamy and the steaks were nicely seasoned. We came with a group of 6 adults and 3 kids, and ended up paying about $1400 total. We got a wide range of steaks including their wagyu, bone in ribeyes, and braised short rib was super tender. The hostess was soo amazing. I wish I remembered her name, but my dress strap snapped and she helped me staple it to fix it in the bathroom. She was a sweet girl, and she was very professional about it even though I was embarrassed.  The only reason that I am giving four stars instead of five is because if service from the rest of the staff: servers and bussers. They seem to have lost some filter and sensitivity when delivering messages or providing good service. It feels almost like a sense of entitlement on their side. The server was irritated at simple questions like "do the sides come with the steak?", I understand this might be annoying and irritating but that is your job to properly inform the guest, gain their trust to be able to upsell, and maximize your tip. One of the steaks was too rare for my friend so we asked if he could get it cooked a little more. It's not like it was overdone and couldn't be fixed. He rolled his eyes and took the steak. We had two birthdays and asked him to bring dessert for it. He came by at the end and said we have two birthdays don't we? Whose birthday is it? Isn't there seat numbers? It's awkward to raise your hand claim your "surprise" birthday dessert. I wouldn't care if this was Applebee's, but I do expect much more higher standards from a restaurant of this caliber. The bussers refilled waters recklessly without watching out for accidentally bumping patrons at the table. I asked the lady Busser in the end if there is a plastic cup to be able to take my drink. She said no and snatched my plates away abruptly. The service left a salty taste in my mouth. Good food, but I probably won't be coming back or recommending this restaurant in the future.

Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KDG1JgqvBXG1jfIvoDMWdQ.text: I initially came in for a drink but ended up with a meal. The bar is open early so feel free to grab a drink if you're waiting for dinner reservations.  Wagyu tartare. topped with a quail egg and chives. This is one of the best beef tartare I have ever eaten. It's so good, you will want to have this all to yourself. No sharing!  Dry aged Prime bone-in New York strip 16oz. Roasted. Med rare. This was the only steak that was dry aged for 42 days. The others were only 21 days or 28 days. I think it was the T-bone that was 28 days. I like my dry aged steaks a minimum of 28 days so this left me with the NY. (The t-bone would have been too big of a steak for me to finish). The steaks are in two categories, grilled or roasted. Roasted is the way to go. It is seared first then finished off in the oven to perfection. The temp came out perfect. The distinct flavor of the dry age really shows.  Great selection of whiskey and scotch. FYI they charge $4 for a rock.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted New York strip. Bone-in. Dry age prime (42days). 16oz.
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu tartare

kd5I-cVRAD1qm4R6dnq6ww.text: Yep, can't complain. Everything was good. They got us seated right away, in a nice booth. Service was great, rolls were piping hot and delicious, lobster bisque contained nice chunks of lobster and was delicious, Brussel sprouts were tender with bacon and were delicious, potato puree was delicious (contained a LOT of butter), and the 40 oz, 30-day aged limited edition Double R Ranch ribeye was delicious.

Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rolls
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster bisque (half)

YZXMX2m-DmTmEoLxw8MAUw.text: To me, the prices on a menu amount to a promise: if your steak is 10x the price of another place's same cut of steak, you're saying to me, "the experience of eating this steak is 10x better than that other guy's steak." Better can comprise more than just the steak,itself, it includes the overall dining experience. Colicchio's fails to meet that promise.  Don't get me wrong, they've got an attentive, solicitous staff. Absent that staff, this would have been a one-star rating (lower if the option were available). I ordered a shrimp cocktail and split the beef tartare with my wife as starters. I ordered the surf & turf as my main.  Didn't order wine because this week is likely to be heavy in exertion and alcohol and wanted to save the livery pummeling for later in the week. That said, the wine menu seemed fairly complete. When your wine menu has a ToC and the red burgundies start at page 32 (and that page is maybe the halfway point of the booklet), you can assume the place has a fairly deep wine menu. So, points for that. The wine my wife ordered was fairly decent, so points there.  Where it all fell apart was the food.  The shrimp cocktail was fairly basic ...so didn't really warrant the premium price vice what I'm used to back in the DC area (an area not exactly known for low-priced dining options).  The steak tartare was very bland. Really wanted kicking up with capers and/or horseradish ...or even a peppery type of leafy green accent. To be honest, my wife makes far better tartare at home.  My turf-half of my main was competent if not especially worthy of the price premium. The surf-half, on the other hand, was godawful. Yeah, I should cut them some slack for being 2000+ miles from Maine. That said, if you're going to put something on the menu, you should be confident that your efforts will be well received. The lobster meat was overcooked and dry ...and pretty much tasteless but for the concentrating-effect that the preparation-method had on the iffier elements of distance-shipped lobster. The clarified butter it was served with actually made the experience worse. The only thing that made it somewhat tolerable was lemon juice ...which I had to ask for (it wasn't just served with a lemon).  Oh well: at least the meal got me a decent amount of hotel points. I probably should have considered the fact that "this is a hotel restaurant" before plunking down for $300+ for a meal for two (though, restaurants in hotels like the Four Seasons are reliably better than this place was).

xtwiwnNQTY6542xrOyC2zg.text: Wow, this place is amazing and the service is excellent.  It gets really loud once the restaurant fills up but it's like that everywhere in Vegas.  I would highly recommend the filet and mashed potatoes. Melt in your mouth!  Their sticky buns for desert is out of this world.

_K3mQ-lBQualpcKAYeZ27g.text: Craftsteak was our choice for a big family dinner on the most recent visit to Sin City. I admit that there were some pretty large expectations to live up to considering the location, price and name on the sign outside. Everyone had some mixed reviews of their meals.  Starters consisted of three different salads and a charcuterie board.   The Caesar salad ended up being a bit of a let down. Dressing was a bit too thin, not much flavor of garlic, and the pickled anchovy didn't really add much to the dish. Definitely not enough seasoning. The croutons were excellent.  Cucumber salad was light and tasty. Just complex enough to be a fun start to a meal without blowing up the palate. Crisp and refreshing.  Avocado salad came in a generous serving. Certainly the rich cousin of that light cucumber concoction, it was beautifully presented and worth the order.  Charcuterie board consisted of five or six contrasting meats with a sampling of a handful of unusual yet wonderful mustards. I spent my time trying to determine exactly what each mustard was but to me honest, they were eclectic and delicious. I couldn't do it!  Our steaks were a bit hit and miss. Everyone wanted a different cook and we each chose a different cut. I understand that high end meat deserves high end treatment BUT everyone likes their cook on a steak their way. We made sure to not just order by rare, mid-rare... etc, but by color and temperature.  The filets were underdone. By that I mean the were a perfect mid-rare (purple) but that was not the order of my dining companions. Our wonderful server would have likely delivered the proper info to the kitchen but personal knowledge took the wheel on those two dishes. One was sent back for some more heat and came out medium well to the delight of the customer. I thought it was SLAMMED but again, not my order and everyone is different!  The T-Bone was a shade under but still great.   The ribeye I ordered was the most well done piece of meat on the table. Was looking for a rare +, got a slightly more than mid-rare cook. Honestly I was maybe glad for it as the fat had rendered nicely and it was full of flavor. I will defer that result to the expertise of the kitchen. That was a good piece of meat.  Cauliflower side, amazing.  Asparagus, simple yet nice.  Fingerling potatoes, over seasoned but cooked beautifully.  Dessert was a non cloying, light and fluffy chocolate cake with an absolutely perfect chocolate malt ice cream. It was simple and brilliant.  The service at this restaurant was excellent from beginning to end. The only criticism would be the annoying photographer. We weren't really asked whether we wanted be interrupted for photos, we just were. We then pose in silly ways. Later on she comes back with folios for sale at some exorbitant price. The photos weren't great to begin with and they the photographer seemed put out when we wouldn't throw down $100. Could have done without that.  Again, service was great. Attentive, unobtrusive, friendly and non-snobby.  Decor was hip, music was classic rock. Cool.  All in all a meal with bright moments and small let downs. Maybe I have high expectations but a fancy restaurant should be able to meet those. I enjoyed my meal but the value for money wasn't quite there.

H3hqpZhC4KIyePkO0xpKKw.text: Standard fare in a nice setting. I had much higher expectations and was a little disappointed. The avocado salad looked nice, the asparagus and broccoli were way too salty and the ribeye was just OK.

0ltUtRere1eyubGi8C0uFg.text: From the second you are greated by the hostess, then your server and everyone the service is impeccable!   Ordered the tequila drink specialy only to find they were out of pasion fruit. Since my server suggested the drink I gather they might not have had a pre-service meeting to advise what was sold out. They substituted with cherry juice - well it for sure ruined the taste of the tequila. So, that was a little disappointed and that's were the disappointments stop.... because everything else was outstanding.  Now I will cut them some slack because they've been closed for 10 days and let's face it - things happen.   I ordered a hanger steak mostly due to the fact that all the others were 10oz and larger. They should have some small filets possibly. Anyhow, ordered wood mushrooms and onions and the server was kind enough to make them half orders and ordered the potato puree.  Within minutes of ordering they served the most delish warm little rolls with perfect temperature butter - almost like Hawaiian rolls....yummy and I can assume made in-house   Wow were do I start with the fabulous meal...... The steak was mouth watering tender and just delish ! The potato puree was sooooo velvety smooth and not a lump or bump in site and the smell of chive in it was very nice. The onions were caramelized and cooked perfectly and the mushrooms were very nice - cooked perfectly.   With all that said,  left over was a whole other meal which was such a shame. Couldn't  take a "doggy bag" because going to a show then gambling and stray dogs might start to follow me if I carried it around .   The meal was expensive, however the experience and quality of everything was outstanding.   The General Manager Chris (very attractive young man) popped in to the table to say hi which is always a nice personal touch for a restaurant.   As my server brought the bill and also brought two cookies which I had him take back as i really could not have eaten another morsel (VERY large portions!)  I'm so glad I made the effort to come to the MGM to experience this restaurant which I was really looking forward to.

-Oj3yO_e4g8fd2cVDVmmnw.text: Following up on A.M.'s comment since I was her guest. To be honest I, I could've cooked a finer steak with less nerves. EVERY BITE IN THE RIBEYE STEAK HAD NERVES. It was so bad we both didn't finish our meal and assured the waiter we didn't want any of the food.  Oh yeah, and when i requested for mashed potatoes because I didn't want potato puree, guess what they brought out? POTATO PUREE. After the waiter confirmed there were mashed potatoes.   Complete FAIL in all aspects of fine dining.

mc9cPAMAQt6nRReTNPBJ9Q.text: There's a lot better steaks out there in Vegas. We got the prime rib Oscar style. I am pretty sure that the crab was bad as it smelled that bad fishy smell. Given that not 1 of the 4 waiters assigned to our table asked how our meal was, we couldn't let anyone know so that's 65 bucks down the drain.   The waiters were slow, drinks constantly empty. The last glass of wine i ordered before ordering dessert came after we were finished with dessert. When I pointed out he forgot it and I didn't really want it I got the tough luck you ordered it.   Subpar Vegas dining experience for a $500 4 person meal.

REEFSfGE3b914fMttD6syA.text: Amazing food! You have the option to stay $$$ but why when they have stuff like wagyu beef on the menu? Hubby and I decided to celebrate here at it's defiantly not a every day bill we are willing to pay as it's easy to get in the $300-$400 range for dinner. I HATE peas but he ordered the risotto that has peas in it and I ate every single pea and scraped the bowl! Amazing food, amazing service and an amazing meal we will never forget!

5WGVVRbebGjzRYC6mWxVYQ.text: Tom Colicchio is a pure genius. I really have no words to describe the dining experience (in a good way of course). Beautiful decor with a modern twist on a steakhouse with a variety of music playing in the background (rock to Beatles to Michael Jackson).  Onto the menu, everything sounded amazing. It's hard to choose but my top picks include the Ny strip with potato puree, arugula salad with pine nuts (citrus dressing made it worth it!), and mushroom medley.  Be forewarned - the sharing menu is A LOT of food. Great deal if you can handle that food! We did the double R steak meal - came with two steaks, 2 salads, 2 chef appetizers, 3 sides and 2 desserts. ($125 per person value) Definitely a glutinous meal but very much worth it!   Thanks Chef Colicchio for a great meal! But excuse me while I go run this meal off!

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib eye and ny strip up close
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy buns
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Appetizers

0yhtSuMNmBqsZjbUkQNj9A.text: I saved all my pennies for a fancy, reputable dinner and what I got was a meal of disappointment and regret. We made a reservation and were able to get a table at our requested time without difficulty. This was nice. This place was a little bit hard to find. It's located in MGM and there aren't really great signs directing you. We ended up using google maps and walking the route that came up. It was a good walk from the main entrance.   The servers were nice. We had like 4. The server who passed out the menu informed us that Tom Colichio was in town. "What here? Tonight? To cook for us?" I asked eagerly. "Oh. No," replied the server, "he's just in town." Ok. Thats nice. Don't care.   The prices ranged from normal expensive steak prices to really expensive steak prices ($50- and up to 275 for wagyu). We decided to try a sampler, the wagyu steak which was about $160 per person. Service was soooo slow. So slow. All that anticipation and for naught.  First course: 1. Rolls- nice and buttery 2. Caeser salad- nothing unique. Huge cuts or romaine lettuce lightly dressed with croutons. I would say there were too many croutons. 16$ regularly priced is not worth it. You might as well get a better caeser at red lobster- True story 3. Market spinach- this was weird. It's a salad tossed with peaches. It was not a cohesive dish. The peaches were no particularly pretty to look at and my friend thought they were beats. It did not enhance the salad or make it better. Not worth it at all. 4. Wild arugula- way over seasoned. Mouth full of dressing. Also not impressed. 5. charcuterie- meh 6. Shrimp cocktail- pretty good. Plump shrimp. Large size.   Second course 5. Wagyu New York strip- what a shame. This beautiful slab of meat was totally over cooked. It was like chomping on beef jerky. This was the least enjoyable and most disappointing 6. Ribeye- this was good but not particularly unique 7. Skirt steak- better. Juicy and flavorful 8. Filet mignon- this is what wagyu need should be like. Melt in your mouth delicious.  9. Scallops- these were good. Plump and juicy.   Sides 1. Mashed potatoes super silky and creamy. This was good 2. Risotto- this was well cooked, slightly al dente very creamy 3. Cauliflower medley- too salty, not good 4. Mushroom assortment- total disappointment and a shame since the mushrooms were varied and some exotic. So so disappointing  Third course dessert 1. Sorbet- this came with like 6 different flavors. It was fresh and the fruit ones you could tell were made with real fruit. This was the best 2. Monkey bread- also very good. Has this caramel toffee flavor 3. Chocolate cake- not impressed. Cloying sweet 4. Strawberry shortcake- also not impressed. It's shortcake so it's dry but no unique spin nothing.  I rarely give upper level restaurants two stars but the disappointment was too much. If this reputable establishment is going to charge so much money, everything better be perfect. I should've saved my money for Gordon Ramsey. Tom colichio will continue to live in obscurity in my book. Sigh. So disappointing.

QB4cqVgFWYlTXknshDIj4w.text: ohhh myyy goddd... amazing amazing!!  When in Vegas get a reservation here, you won't regret it!   First of all the level of service here is top notch and The ambiance gave an intimate vibe.   Now the food.. porterhouse for 2 comes with a bone marrow.. man I'm drooling just thinking about that porterhouse.. it was seasoned to perfection and cooked to the perfect temperature. Good sides to go with the delicious steak? That potato puree and an order of asparagus. If it's just two people this is more enough food.. my friend and i also ordered the prosciutto appetizer and it was a generous portion but perfect to share and leave room to enjoy the steak. The bread they give is pretty delicious too.   When I'm back in Vegas I'm making sure I snag another reservation here, perhaps to try the wagyu.

jeRtY3jrCibMocYZFrqy7A.text: Best steak Ive ever had.  Got the 40oz Rib Eye, enough meat for 3 people.  Great ambience.  This restaurant is a must go to.  Make reservations.  The brussel sprouts are also very good.

xazzncrpst-O3Hf2hcllcw.text: This is probably my favorite steakhouse the food was delicious. The steak was very good nothing compared to anything that I've had before the mashed potatoes, Brussels sprouts the dessert everything was fantastic! The servers we are all very nice and friendly the only thing is that our food did take a little long to come out I honestly can say that was the only bad thing about this steakhouse lol if you're by MGM you should stop by you won't regret.

VeNznWdLOw5VYaue52x1oQ.text: Let's be blunt. It should be amazing for the prices he charges. And it was damn impressive.   Let's start with the good. The A5 Wagyu is the greatest thing I've ever consumed. No doubt in my mind. The wife has the skirt steak. Great. The sweet potato mash was perfect.   The butternut squash was tough. Even the server admitted it after the meal - it was often too al dente for most customers. We are a single bite of it- no removing it. It's not expected but if it's continually a complaint- someone should adjust.

T2oC2Pv0KBqjxi2LnW2nhw.text: I swear I gained a good 5-10lbs after my dinner, but it was SO WORTH IT!  My bf made reservations for us to dine here and first things first, when you have 10 different steaks for you to choose form on the menu, you have absolutely no idea where to start. Even for salads they had 10 different kinds I believe and don't get me started on their sides. I'm pretty sure our servers knew I was pretty indecisive on EVERYTHING on the menu so they suggested that we order from the right side of the menu, called "Chef's Beef Selection". Basically there is this small box on the right side that lists i think 5 different choices and you can choose one of those steak/seafood choices and by choosing that, it also comes with the following (see below for reference)  Instead of "what I ordered", it's "what was included": - we each got a bowl of lobster bisque - we had 3 different salads to share (we asked the chef for his recommendation on the top 3 most popular salads and we got the: warm frisee, market spinach, and one with all tomatoes. apparently tomatoes were in season when we went, so I assume that's why it was super popular.) - I got the 24 hour beef short ribs (it was so tender and juicy) - the BF got the Japanese A5 Wagyu (and it was cut into multiple slices, yum) - we had 3 different sides to share, which were: mushroom medley, corn, and a potato side the BF wanted, you can see the pics for reference) - last but not least, DESSERT, came with 4 different choices as well: monkey break, fresh fruit, 2 scoops of ice cream/sorbet, and pudding.  This was definitely a lot of food to inhale for the night but for that price we paid, all this food was definitely worth it as oppose to just ordering one entree per person, when the Chef's Selection came with so many choices. I would definitely recommend the Chef's Selection to those who are just as indecisive as I am because you can never have too many FOOD choices for one meal.

SMewFv8q4SdVS-C_n62MVg.text: Amazing service especially our waitress Sharon whom was very attentive and her personality was out of this world and the food was amazing! What a GREAT first experience!! I ordered the wagyu  skirt steak which was AMAZING, the corn, risotto and potatoes. All were SO good!! Will definitely come back :) @babydashco twitter  http://Http://www.babydashco.com

BzcWQnbJ6LMwM8JKtg6Ldg.text: Service was excellent and portions generous but the food was disappointing. Our $80 cut of waygu was tepid and the bone-in ribeye was very tough. The manager stopped by with an apology and cleared the ribeye from our tab, but I was expecting much more given this restaurant's reputation and price point.

cuaJvRBiZEqL0o-HEO0Tng.text: 5 star for service and 4 star for the steak. My rib eye was too charred    But great ambiance and great people. Would come back but not a 5 star steakhouse as I thought it would be.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A little too charred !

wC5x5DqWFfQ3OwS7v2xMhw.text: I enjoyed my meal but overall the experience was diminished by a manager who was rude and condescending in an awkwardly polite way. I felt he seemed oblivious to how to rudely he addressed us.  The bill was roughly $1500 and we were out to celebrate a bachelor party but instead of   starting the night right we had to listen to a baseless explanation as to why we wouldn't be sat at that time. Learn some manners and learn to holdback on ego and nonsense thinking. The explanation was inappropriate and unprofessional but my friend who we celebrated was happy so success I suppose.

qBPW9ndtNnB1rmEqLnTD0g.text: Seriously, the sexiest meal I've ever had.    My BF and I were here a few months ago and treated ourselves to the Wagyu Beef Chef's menu.  Amazing.  Simply amazing.  Each course of the meal simply got better and better.  I could not believe the tastiness I was eating.    The service was absolute stunning.  Our waitress was incredibly attentive and helpful.  She answered all of our questions, recommended fantastic wines for each course, and let us take our time.    This review is not doing craftsteak justice; I simply can't put into words how delicious everything was.  Please, do yourself a favor and put your Vegas winnings to this.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. wagyu tasting menu awesomeness

45AnUWguOh2ycQ7ISmIDFw.text: The skirt steak domestic wagyu was heaven!!!! Our service was amazing..  this place is top notch. Thanks Tom! We can always count on you

VdUa1Wi5qRAWxnSiIaF7Kg.text: If I could give more than 5 stars, I easily would. Yes, it is expensive but after spending a week in Vegas trying different places, not near that bad!  Service was amazing. Very attentive & super fast even though the restaurant was busy! Food was literally the best I've ever had. Hands down so amazing.  TRY the tasting menu! It seems kinda high but worth it!!! Thanks to our wonderful waiter we decided to give it a try & were very happy. Substituted a main course side without a problem and each course came very quickly  Ambience & noise level were spot on.  Yummy!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Main course steaks &amp; risotto. Best food ever.
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert for two :)

iKoIdEX_9syKz_7d52MN1A.text: After spending a long weekend working, my co worker and I, who were both staying at the MGM Grand, decided to stay in house for dinner, and try out Craft Steak.   Everything from the ambiance, to the wait staff, to the amazing food was perfect from the moment we walked in.   The Pork Belly Slaw was a amazing twist for a stater salad. That followed by the perfect medium rare cooked bone in ribeye was a perfect combination, along with the Risotto. The Mushroom & Pancetta Risotto has to be the best tasting side dish I have had in Las Vegas, and I have eaten an numerous places there.   All in all, I cannot say anything bad about my experience. I would definitely recommend dinning here.

GrkHqC_ZTTTL2Tekm7nVsA.text: While at the MGM, me and my wife wanted to wine n dine, I wanted to impress the wifey with this fabulous dinner, considering it looks great and the atmosphere was nice, then why not. Well to my amazement dinner was by all means not great, I ordered the rib eye steak medium it came bloody as hell also how can you forget the salt Really not great. but the mashed potato puree was indeed great, so I swallowed those bread warm n good. the wife ordered the filet and bloody as hell again, she had to return it finally when it came back it tasted like a dirty wet rag, her spinach salad was good. Finally she return the filet and told them it tasted horrible. they took it of the bill which that's at least what they could've done. 2 stars 1 for the bread and 1 for the salad. That's it.....

UiGYMgvEFyx-sX6Dx-erng.text: Excellent food, drink and service.  We always try to make time to visit Craftsteak when we visit Vegas, and they have yet to disappoint.  It's on the pricey side of things, but worth it.  The staff is attentive, but not intrusive, the food is always perfectly prepared. Share the sides, they are big.  And, try to save a little room for dessert, of you can.

Fhj4ybv1jands_zaj5t9FQ.text: I was very excited to visit Craftsteak because I am a big fan of Tom's, but I left feeling disappointed.  First, the bread that we got was cold and reminded us of King's Hawaiian Rolls.  They were nothing special, which we expected from a place of this caliber.  My husband ordered a strip steak and it was awesome!  The disappointment came with my steak - the t-bone.  It lacked any real flavor.  It was almost as if they forgot to salt and pepper it.  Hence the disappointment.  The side dishes were great, as well as the service.  The manager was also very nice in taking the steak off of the bill.  I would definitely recommend Craftsteak to give it a try, but I know we won't be back.

aR_zp4V1xIHcxMR0BY3DrA.text: We came here expecting nothing but the best and it truly didn't disappoint i went with my for new years diner and the service and the quality of everything was just excellent, amazing wine list menu and the food was exquisite to start i had the lobster bisque which it was delicious and my entree was the ribeye which they told me it was marinated for almost 27 days best steak i've ever had, and also the lobster risotto which it was amazing too, service was on point, amazing ambience i loved this place

eQNRIXvxZmbZXk-sn-KunQ.text: I love Craftsteak.  I love the food, the service, the atmosphere.  Had the filet, medium rare, cooked to perfection.  The sides are large and are best shared.  For dessert, the monkey bread and banana ice cream are sublime.   Hard to get get reservations on short notice so book early.

rLvArIOuy-RcUSro-Xzb3w.text: You know I really cant find any reason NOT to give this place a 5 star rating!  Good steak, good service, good sides (potatoes, salds etc...)  When in Vegas you have a zillion choices for a good meal.  I go to Las Vegas about 10 times per year so have tried just about every restraunt in town and most outside of the strip as well.  This place should be one on your list for business dinner or just a fun night out.   Not so much for a romantic dinner though.

WgSQauVYsgKkFzxS7pGeuQ.text: Wow...Top Chef...Seriously...  Probably best steak I've had this year.  And we didn't have the best here.  We had the Domestic Wagyu tasting with wine pairing.  For the 3 of us, they gave us a filet, rib eye and ny.  Ordered it rare and it was all very very nice.  Especially the filet, it truly melted in my mouth.  Very well seasoned.  Family style included their choice of sides.  Which I liked the surprise of having chef's choice.  These sides were again all flavorful and delicious especially the potato puree, OMG.  I haven't had Robuchon's but I don't know if any can be better for now.  Prosciutto & figs, brussel sprouts, mozzerella tomato, assortment of sauteed mushrooms, potato puree.  All fantastic.  They gave us 5 plated desserts for the 3 of us.  WTF?    Wine pairing was on point.    I will be back to splurge on the Japanese Wagyu tasting menu/wine pairing...I can only imagine how crazy that would be.  The only complaint I have was too much good food.  A lot of leftovers back to hotel room.  Super happy.

MBq90uml3xJvoJofcLRsgA.text: Nice and comfortable decor, excellent service, the waiters (2) were proffesional and nice. Me and my husband decided to give up on the wagu menu....we just ordered whatever caught our eyes on the menu. I have to say that the serving dishes were very  impressive  and most important, everything we ordered was amazingly tasty!!!!  Our dishes:  - Pinkerton avocado salad -Beet salad with pickled egg, veeeryyy tasty  ( I recommend it to all the beet lovers ) - Ribeye steak  with baby carrots as side dish  -Salmon with Fava Beans, Pea Tendrils, Radish with eggplant as side dish  My husband ordered two random drinks from the cocktail menu, that we both shared and loved:) And guess what?? Since we left all the dishes clean lol, we had to give up on desert:( , but we absolutely gonna go back again and have a desert.

FYPxBFRzkO9ugtE4m6Qx_A.text: I JUST HAD THE BEST MEAL OF MY LIFE. asdfklj;asdfjklasjdfkl;aksfjkl;asdfkjl;k;j okay my word vomit begins now:  Ate here for my 21st bday dinner... I have to admit I'm a HUGE Tom Colicchio fan so that was what brought me here... AFTER EATING HERE, I LOVE TOM COLICCHIO THAT MUCH MORE.  For starters, I had the MOZZARELLA with roma tomatoes and hazelnuts. SO DELICIOUS. My mom got this FRIED GOAT CHEESE WITH BEETS salad and IT WAS SOOOOO NOM. The cheese was just OOZING and complimented the beets perfectly. I'm normally not a beets person but I LOVED THIS!!!   ENTREE: My mom and I got the 24-HOUR BRAISED SHORT RIBS. OHHHH MYYYY GODDDD. These babies melted in my mouth. Literally. SOOOOO TENDER. And they give you a HUGE slab. HUGE!!!!! Yes, Craftsteak is pricey, but unlike other "fine dining" eateries I've been to, their portions actually made me FULL and this was worth EVERY PENNY. My sister got the kurobota porkchop, which was quite delicious too, but I suggest sticking to their forte- their beef entrees. My dad got the filet mignon which, I quote unquote, was "the best filet I've ever had." Wow and my dad has had a lot of filets in his lifetime. THAT'S SAYING SOMETHING.   SIDES: Yukon Gold Potato Puree with Chives- IDK how much butter they use in this thing, maybe I don't wanna know but it was incredibly NOM. It's puree, so it's not chunky like mashed potatoes. It's smooth and buttery and just compliments the meat!!!  Spinach- super fresh spinach roasted with olive oil... pretty simple but I love spinach and this was DELICIOUS.  DESSERT: I was wayyyyyy too stuffed to order my own dessert but my sister got a combo of SPICED APPLE CIDER SORBET + CHAI CHOCOLATE CHIP GELATO. Yes, the gelato/sorbets are $6 for 2 scoops which is pretty good considering most places only give you one scoop for the same price. We were having a hard time deciding which one to get so our waiter said we could have one scoop of each!! how nice. These flavors were unique and quite delicious! The apple cider sorbet was so refreshing and got me feeling quite the holiday spirit.   The service was fast, our waiter was friendly and our water was always refilled. The next dish always came out at the perfect moment- not too soon after the previous, but not too long where you get angry.   Bottom line: I LOVE YOU CRAFTSTEAKHOUSE.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. mozzarella with roma tomatoes and hazelnuts
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. short ribs

JHSgN8qd01ZQoRDSXVp4KA.text: I eat at a lot of steak houses around the country and was impressed with Craftsteak. We had a group of 5 guys and were seated in one of the booths which have a private feel as they have curtains separating them.  At each of the tables they have the drink menu on IPad's which was pretty cool. Our waiter mentioned that we would have 4 servers covering our table which was good but confusing. The only downside of our meal is that it did take some time to order more drinks.  All 5 of us ordered the 3 course chef's tasting menu and it was enough food for 10 people! The waiter mentioned that they would choose for us and they did a great job. For the first course we had caeser salad, frisee salad, several orders of shrimp cocktail, and charcuterie.  They then brought out 5 different cuts of steak with multiple sides. It was interesting to try some from the Strip, Filet, T-Bone and Ribeye in the same meal.     Then they brought out the cheesecake, carrot cake, monkey bread, cheese plate and sorbet/ice cream tastings. We were already full before dessert but had to try them and they were all tasty!  We had a great selection of different starters, steaks, sides and desserts and the chef's tasting menu is a great way to go at Craft Steak!

ZVniuUEhDhlJ8JBxR4FCPg.text: I can't imagine a better meal. this place is expensive, but you get what you pay for - in a good way. The ambiance is great, and the food is some of the best in Vegas. It has gotten to the point where we go there whenever we go to Vegas.    The steaks are the namesake and are undoubtedly incredible. We've gone through the whole list - including the overpriced Japanese Wagyu - and they are all delicious and cooked to perfection.    The sides are awesome. It may sound stupid, but this place has some of the best vegetables I have ever had. I am not a big fan of vegetables, but I will eat anything this place cooks - carrots, spinach, brussels sprouts - you name it.  Desert? Yes, please. Monkeybread. Everytime. Essentially it is just like the caramel rolls my grandma used to make. It is unbelievable.  If you can stomach the cost, this place comes with my highest possible recommendation.

n7ku5uYQhs2HBAA9zd1PYA.text: We had reservations @ 7:15pm. . .  We were seated in a booth, which made it better.  The place was pretty full. The ambiance was romantic and modern.  Kevin, our waiter was AWESOME! He was very informative and friendly.  Service with a smile and personality! Very personable! Thanks!  We had the lamb, duck, 32oz and 18oz steaks with the sides of the potato puree and mushroom melody. Steak was amazing! Juicy and flavorful.  I was kind of disappointed with the duck, it wasn't as crispy for my taste.  Servings were so humungous! We had tons of leftovers.  the most memorable part of this dining experience was all the iphone owners raising their iphones as soon as we got notification of the thunderstorm that was happening and cheering! haha sooo funny! iphone users unite.  (which was most of the restaurant)
