wQI0O3ITvWGWJNinyJjiLw.text: Craftsteak is, without a doubt, the finest dining experience I've had in my life.  Skip lunch, order the chef's selection, and enjoy incredible food and unparalleled service in a casual elegant atmosphere.  When you get the check, remember what you've just experienced and that you'll likely remember this dinner for the rest of your life.  This place is what Vegas is all about.  If Yelp offered limited 6-star reviews, I'd give it a 6.

ZnnS9NybsIM6ADwvk31PYQ.text: Absolutely worth every penny, top rate service and the food was awesome. One of our 2 top steak dinners out between our last and this visit to Vegas. Highly recommended, we'll definitely go back on our next trip!

E42RCFLYddiQ-rbVxYWizw.text: Incredible meal and seriously crazy good service. Couldn't believe how many staff there were in this place. Best meal in Vegas by far. Definitely take the servers' recommendations on what to have- we did and everything was amazing (potato puree, and the corn, were especially great!). Highly recommend!

qfECuIhlclwMBaKZdnjCpA.text: The bisque, steak, mushrooms, oh hell, everything here is insane. It's the first stop we make here when we come into town and the last thing we talk about when leaving. My tip: Sit at the bar! The service is impeccable and you will always have a full glass. Make this one of your destination evening spots!

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lobster bisque will change your life
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yeah, you kind of have to order the steak
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No regrets. Do it!

aUPispbrlXKa797-DdD2Qw.text: Came here for my birthday dinner and got the tasting menu. Was a lot of food for sure. Very tasty steak and perfectly cooked to temp. Def be prepared to eat if you get the tasting menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom side
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My dessert .. Monkey bread, choc peanut butter cake, sorbets and fruit
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frisée salad

B-LRtj5us6L5KnwGlTUGew.text: We've been to Craftsteak in other cities, so we knew we'd get a good meal here and we weren't disappointed. The raw oysters were astonishingly fresh, the steaks perfectly prepared and the sides very good. We were in a hurry because we were off to a show after dinner and the staff took care of us in getting us fed and out the door.   My only complaint is we each ordered steaks and when they arrived they came in a cast iron casserole marinated in a wine reduction. Nowhere on the menu did it mention the steaks came prepared this way. I prefer my steak presented simple, no sauce, no garnish. The picky thing is there were no utensils to transfer the steak from the casserole to the plate, creating a moment of nervousness that I might drop a $60 piece of meat onto the floor when trying to stab it with my fork or splatter the wine sauce on my clothing.

NFIfoEnaquVGOwFZhpr70g.text: This restaurant is phenomenal.  Definitely make a reservation on open table.  They were running a bit behind and told us to come back twice for our 7:45 reservation.  Wine list is good but beware the menu and wine list do not match what is on the website which surprised me.  Strip steak was cooked to perfection, the seasoning was probably the best I've had.  It was almost like candy.  The rolls are probably the best I've ever had as well, sweet, yeasty flavor.  Charcuterie plate was ok but kind of seemed straight out of a package.  Service was great.  Overall just a wonderful experience.

5s09dhG7P-1CpX6-kkwp1w.text: Since I wrote this review Craft Steak has apologized and contacted me. Again, it wasn't that a mistake was made by them it was the lack of accommodation. I feel better taken care of now and might return. I don't mine paying for anything but I expect a great experience.

J1gUxXkdj1bZHA9uTaVdSg.text: Classy, but pricey! I loved loved this place, but wow do you pay for it. 6 of us topped 830 bucks for wine, dinner, and apps. Didnt eat a bad thing though, but loke I said, you pay for that privilege! Stop in for a special occasion!

867b53MMGnTtqR8vKvguyA.text: Went during NYE and even though they were busy the service was excellent.  One of the best steaks I've had in a really long time.  Had a terrible dinning experience at MiX earlier and I was a little gun shy but Craft did not disappoint.  Had the flat iron which was buttery and awesome but the veggies really made the meal great.     Definitely worth another stop when I'm in vegas again after I curse out the a-holes at mix.

o0qQxhk4hqzj4liSe1ik3g.text: This is considered a very high priced place (+$100/pp) from my traditional dining, so our expectations were very high from an experience and food quality perspective. It delivered on both accounts. I initially struggled to make my choices for dinner...so many great options. Then when the waiter described the chef's beef selection, we were sold. It is essentially family style with a HUGE variety. You get around 4 appetizers, 2 beef choices, 3 vegetables, and 4 desserts. This doesn't even includes the fantastic dinner rolls. Of the food we had, my strongest recommendations would be: Prosciutto San Daniele, Domestic Waygu Filet, Shishito Peppers, and the Cinnamon Monkey Bread.

ncCwjk9UVuje_3mUTZX73w.text: Oh. My. Gosh.  My two girlfriends and I went to Craftsteak for a fancy dinner our first night in Vegas.  We all enjoy food, so we decided to get the Chef's Menu.  The menu was kind of confusing since there were four kinds of meat listed, and that's it.  We thought we'd each choose an appetizer, a steak, and a dessert...but we were wrong.  We kept asking our waiter, "so, what comes with it?" and he'd say, "we like to do this this this this and this" and we just nodded, not really understanding.  When we ordered the Angus beef chef's menu, we had no idea what we were in for.  We basically got EVERYTHING:  four appetizers, three steaks, and five desserts served family style.  We brought a nice bottle of wine to go with dinner ($35 corkage) and ordered martinis, but all the food soaked up any kind of buzz we could have had.  The highlight was the corn. Holy crap was that good.  It's just roasted corn, browned butter, white onion and green onion.  My tummy is still smiling.  Go to Craftsteak, order from the Chef's menu, then thank heaven for Tom Colicchio.  The only way it could have been better is if I ordered the Australian Waygu and Curtis Stone cut and fed it to me.

MZnXLonPpDrMi8rQMDXdww.text: Had a great dinner last week.  Had the cucumber/watercress salad with an asian style dressing.  It was really great.  The steaks were perfect (bone-in rib eye) and the sides were all really good, not heavy like you get in some steakhouses.  The spinach was particularly good.  Excellent service.

K7mr-1L10E1O_eP_AA-nXw.text: Overall, this was a fantastic experience. We had reservations for 6:30 and arrived about 25 minutes early. They got us in promptly with no issues. The hostess was extremely nice. Our waitress arrived shortly after we were seated and was exceedingly pleasant along with the rest of the staff who served us.  My date and I each got the three course Angus Chef's special (a little pricey at $119/person, but not ludicrous for this type of place). The meal choice was the best thing we could have done. Each course was a surprise of 4-5 dishes, all of which were delicious. Our cuts of T-bone and Rib eye steak were tender and seasoned to perfection. The cuts of wagyu beef are supposedly better, but it's hard to imagine the extra cost being worth it with how tasty our meals were. By the time our four dessert samples arrived, we were pretty full; however, we manged to try everything. Make sure you save room. It's worth it.  My only qualms about our dinner was it took longer than it should have to get our drinks and a long time to get our final check. Otherwise, I'd rate this 5 stars. If you're looking for a fancy dinner with lots of food options, check this place out.

pUgfbaaPF1NTy_RwUe1kNA.text: Craftsteak was very disappointing. We did one of the sampler menu items. The ribeye was tough and way over salted. The breaded shrimp,first course, was dry and tasteless and the cocktail sauce was unremarkable.   The potatoes au gratin were so so and a little undercooked. The balsamic carrots were extremely tough- inedible. The  lamb chops, beet salad, and asparagus were phenomenal.  For less than the $110 per person, we could have gone to a Houston's or Ruth's Chris and gotten a much better meal. The server was in our face agressive.   I am not the kind of person to send the food back. I just will never go back to the restaurant.  I would have given this place 2 stars, but I feel ripped off.

d_30FMdCoZmy50fr3bIOrA.text: I was really surprised we were even able to get reservations...we called less than a week in advance, had a group of 7, it was right after watching the Paquiao fight (which was also at MGM Grand). Plus, on top of all that, it's Tom Colicchio's restaurant!  I ordered the steak and lobster which came with half a lobster and filet mignon. The filet didn't really come with any sauce but it was cooked perfectly and went well with some side dishes. The lobster was excellent, very moist and tender. My bf was loving the lamb.   Overall I'd say it's 3.5 stars. Pretty standard steakhouse. The menu wasn't too innovative so there's no suprises there. I guess that can be either a good or a bad thing. If you like steak, you'll like this place. Great place for large groups in a semi-formal atmosphere. Everything is cooked perfectly, just the way you request it.

hY0Wz6_T39QDFK-EXNpC1w.text: I'm drooling just thinking about this place... *DROOOOOL*  BEST STEAK OF MY LIFE!!!!  My boy took me here for my birthday. It was a GREAT gift!! =) Also, I'm a HUGE Top Chef fan so I was so excited to discover when I go there that this restaurant is owned by Tom Colicchio. =D  This place is for people with deep pockets (or shallow pockets filled with plastic! =D) and a PASSION for steaks. This place might be pricey but it's definitely worth the experience. =)  For starters...  Lobster Bisque: YUMMY!!! =) It tasted great! I just wish there was more of it! There were chunks of lobster in it also. I love this soup, but N9ne Steakhouse at the Palms Hotel was better.  Wagyu Beef Tartare: This was the first time I had eaten tartare. O... M... G... THIS IS A MUST HAVE ITEM!! I could eat this all day! The portion was surprisingly big AND filling. The wagyu beef is so tender. There's so much flavor in it. Even if I can't afford a whole meal here next time, I want to come here JUST for the tartare. I want some nooooow!  We were getting kind of full from the appetizers (and the bread they gave us), but we had to get ready for our entree...  Wagyu Beef Rib Eye: This was the KING of all steaks! Totally mouth watering! It had TONS of flavor. It came in a cast iron casserole pre-sliced. It was cooked a perfect medium rare. It was nice and moist and had nice grill marks on the outside. I definitely suggest to try this if you've got the funding for it (the steak alone costs about $100).  Sauteed Mushrooms (Side): The sides come seperately here. Great mushrooms. It's hard to go wrong with sauteed mushrooms though. =P It went with the steak very well.   The grand total for two appetizers and ONE steak for the two of us to share came out about $200 (including tax and tip). One day I'll come back and be able to afford a steak for EACH person. =P A girl can dream!

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu beef rib eye &amp; sauteed mushrooms *droooool*
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster bisque and TO DIE FOR wagyu beef tartare =D

GUVmr17u7whtlCwTcxsQQg.text: the steak and lobster were both amazing! definitely one of the best steaks i've ever had. the steak was juicy and the lobster dipped with butter was just to die for. we had reservation for dinner right after it opened so we didnt have to wait at all. we had a show to catch at 7 and told the waiter that and he made sure that we would be done with our dinner before then so we'd make our show on time. He definitely kept his promise. Customer service was supreme. we had two waiters who catered to us. both were very knowledgeable with the food, wine, and steak. One guy was even giving us a history lesson on vegas and the strip and the casinos...so that was super interesting!

8u2OZ-vExOsP-p3BgOa3NQ.text: The dinner was good but there are a few blemishes which knocked them down to average. For an expensive steakhouse like this, I expect good service and everything to be cooked to perfection.  We were promptly seated. I was drinking a house Pinot Noir which I started at the bar - $17/glass for Meomi which is a screw top bottle which can be purchased for $17/bottle outside of the restaurant. It was tasty, just surprising that they charge premium prices for a low end wine which doesn't even have a cork!  Starters - I had the heirloom tomato salad which was divine, though it was drenched pretty heavily with olive oil. I scraped most of the oil off the tomatoes and thoroughly enjoyed the dish.  My companion had the cucumber spinach salad which he said was average - nothing special.  The bread was very good and tasted fresh baked out of the oven.  Entrees - I had the filet mignon which was good, but surprisingly not stellar. I like my steaks to have a nicely seared outside with a medium rare center. The sear was not as good as I have had at other steak houses - but then I'm from Texas and we know how to do steaks right here. My companion had the salmon which he said was incredibly average. He regretted not ordering the steak.  Sides - All sides were served family-style with large portions for everyone to get their fill. The brussel sprouts were yummy and the risotto was fabulous. In fact, the risotto was the best thing we had. We also ordered the Hen of the Woods mushroom sides since neither of us had tried it before. I enjoyed it but my companion thought the taste was a little strong - I believe the preparation was done well, it was just personal preference. I wish I had tried the mushroom sampler instead but hindsight...    Service - After appetizer plates were picked up, the new plates which were sat on the table for us were dirty - they actually had dried food on them!!!  We finally flagged the server and let him know and got new plates. I also sat for some time with an empty wine glass until we could flag our waiter.  Towards the end of the meal, our waiter just disappeared and then we were being served by another waiter who offered us dessert (we didn't have time or tummy room) and eventually brought us our check. I thought maybe our waiter left or something but I saw him waiting on other tables. Weird. Maybe he was embarrassed about the dirty plate thing? We weren't mean or anything, so I don't know.  So the meal was good, it just wasn't stellar and I don't think the food and service merit the hefty price tag. I don't mind paying for a good steak dinner, I just want to make sure I get value for what I'm paying. I don't think this restaurant *quite* cuts it, though the meal was tasty overall.

PY_OhNZcmMp4KnEQPTOObg.text: Impeccable service . I can't remember our waiter's name but he used to work on a cruise ship and he was very friendly, attentive and informative.  My husband and I ordered steak, which was delicious, the mashed potatoes- so- so and the mushrooms, which I did not care for. The sampler desert was incredible. I would go back, simply for the experience and try some of the other sides.

VBP15gF1SEmhApHnyjqnWw.text: Don't understand the good reviews. This place is exceptional in being subpar. Service was slow. Food was junky. Also my fiance had an allergic reaction due to cross contamination. The GM Simon promised a full refund as she was being taken out on a wheelchair. Never got the refund. Thanks a lot douchebag. Save your money and your lady's life. Avoid at all cost

8UWdnlCDVYi-jw7sqjlffA.text: This is what a five-star restaurant review feels like. Been a while. Nice to get reacquainted.  So let me set this up. I visited the CraftSteak in NYC a few years ago for lunch, but that was for the burger, and while it was very good, I didn't go rushing back partly because there are so/too many options in NYC, plus it closed to make way for Collichio & Sons (high on the list).  Flash forward to Vegas. Even though it's the buffet mecca, celebrity chef restaurants top the list for me out there. So when my buddy Big J, who's a regular here, invited me to join him and Adam the Pimp, I instantly said hell yeah what time.   The place was not full when we arrived at 6pm, but it had totally filled by 8pm when we left, following a quick tour of the kitchen and meeting the head chef (Matt Seeber, not Colicchio, btw). In those two hours, I had one of my Top 10 dining out experiences.  Craftsteak produced by far the best damn lobster bisque and steak I've had. The bisque had several plump lobster chunks, not those little bits you often get, and the flavor was exceptional. I don't get excited about soup. This was special.   But the real star was the 12 oz. Wagyu Skirt Steak. Served medium rare, by the first bite, I rediscovered that special happy place that a great steak transports me to, but something was different this time. As I kept eating, I realized I'd not had a steak that delicious before. I even closed my eyes a few times to shut out one of the key senses and focus more intensively on the taste. Pimpski, who also ordered the skirt steak, concurred that this was like a steak apex. Big J was going to town on the surf and turf, but had recommended the skirt, so it we'll call it unanimous (along with many other reviewers).   The sides were also fantastic. Loved the Yukon gold puree potatoes and asparagus, but we all agreed that the braised Brussels sprouts with smoked bacon was the standout.     Dessert didn't miss a beat, either. The monkey bread gets a lot of love, but I tried a new bread pudding that wasn't on the menu yet, and like the lobster bisque, it stood apart from every other version I've had of this classic. It was much lighter than most, and was the perfect ending to the meal.  That the service was uniformly excellent throughout didn't seem to have anything to do with my friend being a regular. Looking around at surrounding tables and booths, the servers were constantly moving, bringing dishes at the right time, refilling water and drinks, and asking how things were, just as they were with our table. Combined with the overall ambiance, the service created a very welcoming and comfortable atmosphere.   Others have touched on the prices, which are also on the menu, so you should already know what you're in for there, but I'll add this: It's not just the dollar amount, but the total value of the meal and the overall experience. For me, Craftsteak was top-flight in every respect and it'll be high on my list with every future trip to Vegas.

JGG3DCiaM_gIJIsP7p58sg.text: We will definitely return next time we're in town. The food, service, and ambiance were all excellent. Our wonderful server Sharon was attentive, making sure we were having a great experience.   I'd like to address the reviewer's comment complaining about the photographer. There wasn't a single nice venue in Las Vegas that didn't have photographers. When she offered to take pictures, we declined, and she left us alone.

HRfiGEnPZdqM0xX46O3RyA.text: Steak was outstanding as was the service. Loved the ambiance. Not much else to say.

1LT6CBVXExxAVk19OviXFw.text: My wife and I had dinner here last month.  We are both Top Chef fans and had been looking forward to trying this place for some time.    I feel led astray by the good reviews for this place.  The service was ok.  My wife thought not very attentive and had grown impatient with it by the end of the meal.  She pointed out our server had really only been by twice during the meal- when the food arrived and at the end- so maybe she was right.  I think the best part was the start.  The rolls here are fabulous.  I give them that.  Really delicious.  I started with the lobster bisque which was also very good.  I would recommend that.  But then the main course.  On recommendation I got the skirt steak.  Now I know skirt steak has a different texture to it but I thought mine was extremely tough.  I really didn't enjoy it and had to frankly spit a few bites out.  I wouldn't get it again nor would I recommend it as so many others here do.  I overheard a woman seated in the next table over also complain about how tough her steak was.  So I don't think this was an anomaly.  Maybe we both got bad cuts, I don't know.     My wife got the rib eye.  I tried a bite and definitely liked it better than my skirt steak.  But my wife thought it was just so-so, nothing great.  The sauce served with the steak was very good though.  That was probably the only saving grace.  I would have been happier with a different steak I think.  I wanted to try the souffle for dessert but just wasn't up for it by the end of the meal.  My wife and I shared some chocolate sorbet.  It was good but just sorbet.  We were both disappointed with the meal and decided we would not go back.  This place has a lot of hype behind it but frankly I have had much better steaks and meals at chain-type steakhouses.  For instance we have repeatedly gone to Smith&Wollensky in Vegas and never gone away disappointed.  There are so many choices in Vegas that are superior to this based on my experience.

Vmg9jZeGr5e4r2SMASqv8A.text: Huge disappointment.   When you go out for an expensive steak dinner, the one thing that matters most is the steak, right? If that is done poorly, nothing else really matters.   I went here with a party of 7, and 4 of our steaks were poorly done. Mine was so bad I had to send it back - twice! I ordered it medium rare, and it came back overdone. It was solidly medium, and probably on the well side of medium. At a Sizzler-type place I would have just eaten it, but this place is called 'CRAFTsteak', so presumably they should be able to get it right. I genuinely tried to be polite about it, and our waiter assured me that if I wasn't happy with it, I should absolutely send it back. I waited 20 minutes for the replacement, and when it came it was lightly seared on the outside and totally raw 1 millimeter in. That absolutely felt like a 'fuck you' from the kitchen. One other guy at our table also sent his first one back. At least his second came back right. Two others said theirs also weren't what they wanted, but they didn't want to bother with waiting for a new one.  The icing on the cake was the manager. He came by when my second steak arrived and had the gall to tell me that my black-and-blue steak looked 'maybe a little underdone' from medium rare. The most he tried was to offer us a free dessert. That's a straight-up Applebee's move, not what you should have to deal with at a premium place like this.   Two stars instead of one because at least three of our seven steaks were cooked the right way. The sides were fine, and our drinks were good. The service was mediocre.   A place like this should have better odds than a roulette wheel.

452x8WYCHQH9bT3bI2HavQ.text: Overall was disappointed by the steak. Was looking for perfection and it came short. Side dishes and dessert outshined the meat which just shouldn't be! Service and atmosphere was great, I had just hoped for better food.

nPrp0QVy5AQm6TlmWhI2PA.text: Here's the short version of the review: my friends and I ordered the domestic wagyu beef tasting menu.  We expected steak.  We were given melt in your mouth butter that looked and tasted like steak.  We were amazed.  Here's the long review: we walked in a little before our reservation time, and were instantly escorted to our table.  The place is dimly lit and well decorated, but whoever told them they to play cheesy elevator music at a fine restaurant should be fired.  I mean, seriously?  As soon as I walked in I felt like I should be hitting a close door button.  We got some rolls baked up in this little pan.  Cute, but also warm and buttery.  The domestic wagyu tasting menu is the cheapest of the three tasting menus, with the others increasing in price due to the quality of the meat.  The most expensive is the "real" Kobe beef tasting menu (wagyu, as I understand it, is non-Japanese "Kobe-style" beef).  We noticed it only came with three courses.  Isn't this supposed to be a tasting menu?  The waitress assured us we'd have plenty of food, enough to feed three "big" guys.  Jeez, was she right.  The first "course" was actually three dishes: a caesar salad, grilled shrimp, and an absolutely stunning kobe beef tartare.  Raw beef topped with a raw egg, mixed together and eaten with toasted bread.  Sounds gross, right?  Wrong.  It's f***ing AMAZING.  The shrimp and the caesar were both good, but paled in comparison to the tartare.  Then came the main course: three different cuts of wagyu beef: ribeye, skirt steak, and fillet mignon.  They were all amazing to varying degrees.  Each one was perfectly seasoned, so tender you could almost cut it with the side of your fork.  We almost came to blows over each quickly vanishing piece.  The skirt was the winner, and the fillet the loser.  We had a pretty philosophical conversation as to why, but the general consensus was that fillet mignon's strength generally isn't taste, but tenderness.  When you get to a piece of beef as awe inspiring, as tender as wagyu and Kobe, the strengths of fillet mignon tend to diminish.  The beef (and knife fights) behind us, we were pressented with desert.  Maybe I was way too full at this point, but the final part of the meal just didn't live up to the rest.  We got a plate of ice cream and sorbets (which included a wonderfully light pineapple sorbet that with a texture reminiscent of a frozen cloud), a chocolate molten lava cake (meh), a blueberry tart (double meh), a plate of sweet fruit (perfectly ripe and in season), and "monkey bread" with a side of caramel dipping sauce (the sauce was the dessert winner; we ended up dunking pretty much all our other bites of dessert into it).    It was pretty expensive (menu priced at $130 a head), but the amount of food, and the absolute quality of it all made it well worth it.  This place is pure class and exquisite taste.... just ditch the damn elevator music.

Gb2JecvEP74LFspyL9SOUg.text: Fantastic..  The Kobe beef sampler and braised short rib are a "MUST"..  Worth the $130 price tag for the tasting menu..  Every bite was better than the last..    I make it a point to eat at Craft Steak every time I go to Vegas.

lC9geNfXVX5blorj0LOwwA.text: Went last night while staying at MGM. Ate at bar and service was very good. Boyfriend enjoyed lobster bisque and I had caeser, which was good but some brown on leaves. My hanger steak at medium was yummy but boyfriends medium rare prime rib was def cooked medium so he was a little disappointed. While most of meal was really good, for the price, giving 3 stars.

wkHh2tHKglFF5ltayIhtug.text: Writing this review from memory of when I went in December ,I can still imagine the plethora of deliciousness that was placed on our table and our complete failure to eat half of what we got. Good job, Tom Colicchio!  Not sure if they still have this menu (I'm sure they offer a similar tasting menu year round) but when me and the boyfriend went, we got the family style tasting menu for $75/person.   The ambiance of this restaurant wasn't too spectacular. They just had booths, large tables, nothing out of the ordinary. But once we started getting our food, we started to really enjoy ourselves...  They start you off with these hot dinner rolls glazed in butter and dusted with some salt. OMG so good. And then comes the FIRST COURSE which included a lobster bisque, caesar salad, roasted red peppers, and proscuitto. The best of these was definitely the soup! I loved the many chunks of lobster in this creamy goodness.   The main course included grilled kobe surloin, angus beef skirt steak, and sea scallops. All were cooked very well and tasted delish! The side dishes that come with were the sweet potato puree, artichokes, and spinich. YES, you get ALLLLLLLL of these! This meal seriously could have served at least 4 people and all for 75/person!!   By the time dessert rolled around, we barely even touched it, although when I think about it now, I should've! We shared the monkey bread and some type of espresso ice cream. From the little tastings we had of it, it was very good!   We loved the meal so much that we took all of the leftovers back to the hotel room (where I completely passed out from food coma) and had to take them along with us on our 6-hour drive back home. I DEFINITELY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE!

kMIZtx3btueoqC_tg7D9Pw.text: Skimming through some of the other reviews, everyone talks about the food.  Don't get me wrong.. the food is TO DIE FOR.  I've eaten at the restaurant two or three times now and it has never, NOT ONCE, disappointed.  The service is always spot on, and the food is always deeeeelicious.  So.. go ahead and read the other reviews for what to order.  I'll review the adult beverages.  The martinis taste like candy.. literally, like an apple jolly rancher, or a lemonhead, or a raspberry popsicle.  These are the apple martini, the lemonhead martini, and the raspberry martini.  And the dangerous part is that they taste so delicious, you don't think twice about going for the second, third, or fifth martini.. even though it's $13 a drink (ouch.. don't they know we're in a recession?).  Despite the price of the drinks, they are worth every penny.  My last trip there I tried the espresso martini, and the first word that came out of my mouth was "wow".  And then "wow" again.  All I could say was "wow", to die for.  If you don't want to shell out the money to have a nice meal here (and you can easily drop a few bills on dinner), go for dessert.  Order the creme brulee with an espresso martini.    Sidenote: midway through my second martini, I started getting the munchies.  I wondered if I asked for bread if it would be free.. and indeed it was.  Not only was it free, but it was soft, buttery, lightly sea salted, and heavenly.  The end.

hXejdBPZu0ePylnFkKMHiw.text: If they had 4.5 stars, thats where mine would lie.  I went  here with 4 buddies of mine during my last trip to vegas.  My friend was a huge top chef fan so he insisted we check this spot out.  Our entire table ordered the Kobe Tasting Menu and I was not disappointed.  All the steaks were amazing, my two favorite was the Filet Mignon and Skirt Steak.  The appetizers that we were served was nothing impressive.  Roasted red peppers, Prosciutto ( I can get buy that at a deli), mixed greens, and an artichoke dish defintely did not wow me at all.  The sides were decent.  The desserts were amazing tho.  Make sure you get some Monkey Bread that was one of the best deserts i've ever had.    Overall, i go to a steakhouse for steak and they had some of the best tasting beef i've ever had.  Would definitely reccomend it.

lzR1VaC5G-mfIx7LokCQ5w.text: So I've been wanting to try Craftsteak for years and finally I had the chance to go during my bachelor party in Feburary  2010.  Unfortunately, our party wasn't seated until about 45 minutes after our reservation but we were served complimentary tequila shots during the hiatus which was fine with us.  The staff was incredibly friendly, understanding and showed lots of personality.  Despite the long wait, this is still one of my only 5 stars I've ever given on Yelp.  I ordered the Japanese A5 Wagyu medium rare and I swear to everything it made my soul cry.  So wonderful and perfectly cooked, this was an experience to remember.

gus94tYtmacdjk118frRTw.text: I stay at MGM quite often and never was up for steak  before.  After my dinner there I am quite disappointed that I never partook previously in the fabulousness that is craftsteak.  I selected the Platinum Kobe tasting menu, this is the middle tasting selection.  I am forgetting exactly what was served, but what I do remember was Kobe Beef Tartare, Scallops, Strip, Rib eye, Skirt selections, Potato Puree, Bread Pudding, and Chocolate Lava Cake  The stuff I was forgetting was also superbly prepared but not as memorable to me personally.  The service was outstanding and the wait staff was very helpful with the questions I asked.  I plan on visiting more of the many top notch steak joints I hear LV has just to see if they can match this meal or do it one better, its going to be hard though.

QNxToicuCwR7uteDqLNJSQ.text: Craft steak was flawless in every way.  I arrived with my party about 10 mins early just in case there was a wait.  As I sat there I noticed the interior, perfectly classic steak house, wood everything.  Dark oaks, redwoods and even pine.  Aw the faint smell of wood finish is unmistakable and wonderful when you sit down to a hearty meal.  There is just something about the smell of pine and oak that goes with a 12oz steak.  Our server came over to us promptly and introduced himself.  Charm filled the room, every wait staff had a smile ear to ear.   The Floor manager came over next.  We were all dressed in business attire and casual wear, nothing special at all.  After all it was 110 degrees outside so some of us were in shorts.  None of this stopped him from coming over.   He just came over to introduce himself and make sure everything was to our liking.   We started our meal with artisan breads. The favorite of the table was the kalamata rosemary bread. Wonderfully salty and airy, perfect way to get us to drink 2 more cocktails each.  A good restaurateur will understand the need to up sale through cocktails and a good way to do that is salty snacks,  I had the New York strip with Natural Ju and Thyme.   It came sliced into perfect  inch cubes with a  inch fat cap still attached.  All I could think was thank god you kept the fat on there.  I got a side of roasted mushrooms with my steak. I'm a sucker when it comes to mushrooms, especially when they are prepared as simple as possible. They were simply pan roasted in clarified..... also known as liquid gold.  All in All for experience, atmosphere, food and service they get a 5, but when I go into a place like this I expect nothing less then a perfect evening.

fRGHuyj3H1YgWJgIEdWcJg.text: I cannot say enought good things about Craftsteak.  My kind of place, the food is just well, perfect....the Sommeliers, so nice, so helpful...  I love BEEFSTEAK and Pinot Noir, so it was the Porterhouse, and Papapietro Perry Russian River Pinot...  Not cheap, but not outrageous either...  Enjoy!

1sSaSVRQp1Ibfxvory9c6w.text: After many visits to Gallagher's in nyny casino this trip we decided to make a trip to craft. We are certainly glad we did. Then service we received from a dream tandem of Victor and Edgar was exquisite. Spoiled was an understatement! The prices were reasonable for fine fining and premium product. Sides were were a little price for the portion size but taste oh wow. I had a 10oz filet butterfly and melts in you melt and yukon potatos. Arguable in my 34 years my best potatoes outside of grandmas. My better half had a surf and turf and lobster didn't even need butter with a side of finger lings. Nice selections of wines and all beverages. Finished off with a caramelized banana cake and cinnamon ice cream. No alcohol check was $165 so w/ service and my top a shade over $200. Well worth it. Eloozhun

F62QKCVGK2KpgAz4JQG9_g.text: Craftsteak was a class act from start to finish. The service was excellent and the food was delicious (although not quite able to surpass my favorite steakhouse, Harris' in SF). With most steaks around a very reasonable $50, it didn't break the bank either. The mushroom risotto was the standout dish of the night (and comes with just as much hen of the woods mushrooms as the equally priced mushroom side). The sweet pepers and the potatoes gratin were quite popular as well. The bearnaise sauce was not so good.  We called around 4pm without a reservation and they were able to accomodate our group of 9 at 5pm without a problem.

T6gYBTk2qDrmWUOs3gq4hg.text: This is probably the fanciest sandwich place.   I've heard about this place from the word and mouth of Tom Colicchio.  So I decided to check this place out for some brunch as opposed to going to another buffet.  It really does remind me of an upscale Quizno's with even better ingredients and quality.    Definitely a good way to start out the day.

qn9T2T4bMoAiCpTaup-eiw.text: I must say it was a great deal. Be sure to get the Summer Menu when you go and don't eat for like days before you go just so you can stomach it all in! For the full review and great photos of everything served go to kats9lives.com/2008/09/g... I will break it down simply what we got and what we liked. Be sure to make reservations before you go just in case there is a convention going on. Heck who are you kidding. It's Vegas, there is ALWAYS a convention going on. =P Summer Menu ~First Course Roasted Red Peppers = so-so good flavor *just a reminder I am a Meatatarian* Persian Cucumber & Watercress Salad = so-so and fresh Grilled Quail = SIMPLY FABULOUS ~Second Course Kobe Sirloin = good, but needed more flavoring... the meat was okay but I really wish you could have paid more to get filet mignon Roasted Chicken = goodI guess, needed more flavor as well Diver Sea Scallops = cooked well, flavor was fine ~Dessert 4 Ice Cream = the flavors were lacking and it was really icy Warm Fruit Crisp = so-so the crust could have been a lot better Cinnamon Monkey Bread = not bad, the sauce was good ~Extra Appetizers we ordered... Wagyu Beef Tartare = soft texture and flavorful Seared Foie Gras = good size, flavor was not bad Okay for $60 dollars per person you get 4 courses with 3 items in each course. It's like a 12-course meal! What a great deal! We really didn't need the extra appetizers because we were stuffed. There is just so much food that it's incredible. Maybe it's because we are a group of two? Still, tons of food and great. I will definitely be back again and if you have never tried then you should really go! I watched Top Chef when it first came out and I really questioned if Tom Colicchio knew anything about food. Now that I have been there I will give him props. When I was in NY his restaurants didn't look tempting but now my mind has changed. If you are looking for more people to make a party of 4 for the better tasting menus give me a call and I will be there! ^_^

O1IchmRpbD9U3lafY1Hk9w.text: The best things about this place: the mini dinner roles w/ sea salt, the short ribs, three philosophers beer, & our Ethiopian waiter!  It's difficult to find short ribs on a menu, so thank you Tom & co.  Great food, would recommend & go back for sure!

PP5XjEGVxI-8RSq3h5xNbw.text: Ok.  I'm going to go against the grain and say I wasn't really thrilled with the place. Granted that pretty much any restaurant at MGM can't go wrong. If there was a place that served smashed ass***** I bet you it'd be the best darn smashed whatsits around.  We dined here with two friends we were travelling with and I had high expectations with this place given my experiences dining at its neighbors added to the fact that Tom Chollichio was at the helm.  The service was average. Despite the price tag ($150 for just my wifes entree) I never felt like our service was above and beyond.  I ordered a plate of prosciutto to start and a filet. The prosciutto was good, but I expected something with it like cheese or bread. Something so I wasn't just cramming slices in my mouth.   My steak was relatively bland. I ordered medium  and what I got was pretty rare. I didn't mind enough to send it back, but I was a little shocked that a chef at this high caliper of a restaurant couldn't manage to cook steak to temp.   My wife ordered a huge...huge lobster tail, which on the flip side was not only amusingly large, but also very good!  The decor seemed to be showing sign of age. Not that I felt that it was out dated, but literally it was falling apart. There was a few rips in the seat fabric of our booth and the wall decorations were worn out.

hSg_SmaBDEtoa4OnkOTYRA.text: Its awesome like most people say. The service, the food amazing! My personal fave is the desserts.. OH I love me that Monkey Bread!   My best advice is don't cheap out and NOT do the wine paring. It adds SO much to the food! And the pours are LARGE not a flight.. but a HUGE 8 oz pour!

QlLsFsE-70poZXRuCS7-dw.text: Maybe I have been spoiled living in San Francisco or had very high expectations.  But Craftsteak was very mediocre at best.   The server was not knowledgeable nor could offer any helpful advice on what to order.  Halfway through the meal he disappeared and we did not see any waitstaff at our table for at least twenty minutes. Though at the end of our meal, a more pleasant waitress did show up.  The food was very bland, I felt that the asparagus was over cooked and the mushrooms still had a gritty feeling in them.  My beef ribs seemed like they were marinated in the dead sea.  Salt is not the answer for every meal.    At the end of the meal, my boyfriend and I were not pleased with the food and felt like we should have went to a mediocre restaurant like Outback down the street, because at least it matched our expectations.  My boyfriend wish we could go back in time and instead chose that route and used the money instead to buy me the matching DY ring that we saw a few hours ago.  Instead I have this yelp review.

kKLfefTrKkMEgxHclO-Ywg.text: The steak was very bland, and had no seasoning whatsoever.  The people sitting on either side of us had the same opinion.  My steak was also over cooked.  I was here a couple years ago and it was much better. The cauliflower side was very good and the salads were above average.

xxeXY8DemcMimzhdaVDgkw.text: Yummy for my tummy!  Pricey, but well worth it! Our group had one of those kobe beef tasting menus, supplemented by appetizers, side dishes and dessert. It was a lot of food - a lot! Even 12 hours later, I'm full! Nothing too fancy but just simply tasty food.   The wine selection was pretty extensive and even their selection of wine by the glass was pretty good. Service could have been a bit better.  Got this rec from some friends. Perfect place for a group dinner with a lot of money to spend =)

ah7m6OerUY6-QRghWL4Mzw.text: You get served by 3 waiters,  they give great recommendations and they will not let your glass of water get empty. The pork belly was amazing,  so soft like butter, one of my favorite dishes. The potato puree is delicious,  the steak was tender and juice, cooked perfect. The atmosphere is good, I liked the paintings of the cows throughout the restaurant.

Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2BrRMEtiWmrcVJcSzVlSJA.text: Seriously Tom Colicchio shouldn't be judging anyone or maybe he just sold the naming rights (and maybe has never eaten here)...  Las Vegas in general has been a big disappointment when it comes to celebrity and Michelin starred restaurants. I rarely find the Las Vegas versions to live up to the hype.  We had a little time to kill and we booked an early reservation before our flight. We own a rental at the Signature and this place was on our cheat sheet for discounts we get with our M Life Curated Living status (10% off).  We got the shrimp cocktail, the ribeye, brussels sprouts, and the broccolini.  The shrimp cocktail...hmmmmm.....OK if you get the shrimp cocktail at a steak place I'm expecting large if not monster size shrimp....what you get here is a small *pile* (5 or 6 shrimp)...the shrimp look exactly like the same shrimp I see in the buffet...seriously a small pile of buffet shrimp...  ...and that wasn't even the worst thing about the shrimp... If you are going to serve buffet shrimp the sauce needs to save the experience. You need an awesome sauce...NOPE! We got some sort of ketchup sauce (it was similar to the sauce you find in the supermarket in the jars with the super tiny shrimp but a lot more ketchup like)... but wait there is more...they were so cheap with the ketchup sauce you get a little spoon to sparingly rub some of the ketchup sauce on...  OK...this isn't going very well...  Then the ribeye, brussels sprouts, and the broccolini came out.  The ribeye was fine. Was it better than the steak at Denny's...absolutely! I prefer this steak better than the Denny's steak. Is it the best steak? no. Is it worth $60? no.  The brussels sprouts were OK in a trying to make brussel sprouts your kids would eat kind of way.  The broccolini was more disappointing than the shrimp cocktail. It was like someone halfway cooked it, dumped it on the plate, and then that same someone said oh $#@t this is suppose to have some red pepper and then sparely putting a little on the plate.  This experience began and ended with disappointment...  The only thing that saved this was the staff. The staff was amazing. So 5 stars for the staff.

cIy_GNSiuFzzp7jsQ9plHg.text: Wow! This place did not disappoint. Worth every single penny. We actually shared the ribeye, asparagus, and the amazingly delicious mashed potatoes. Sharing worked out perfectly. The entire meal was amazing and the environment was very comfortable.

hhpgVKFN2m4nESPaxAG0ZQ.text: This is what the gods eat. For a small fortune, you too can participate as well. Reserved for birthdays , anniversaries and divorces. There's beef, then there's colicchio beef. If you don't know then you don't know... Absolutely f ing amazing.

xmgg4Oac661T1ZdiBXiEsw.text: I finally made it here.  I don't come to the MGM a whole lot but when I do, I have a few of my "go to" restaurantS/pubs.    Today I finally decided to check out Craftsteak with a couple friends I've got in town for the Knights game.   We came here and were seated very quickly and served drinks. Once our drinks came we ordered.   The food came in a timely manner and WOW the food here is great.  I enjoyed a dozen oysters and some wine to start.  Then I got my steak.  The steak is one of the best steaks I've had in a long time.   The atmosphere, service, food and drinks are all on point and very enjoyable.  Everyone at the table enjoyed their meal and I'm sure we will all be back soon for more.    Thanks Mike!!!

FQZ3FKq-xb7CeAejXIzu0w.text: We wanted to wrap up a fun night in Las Vegas with some steak and TC's craftsteak did a decent job of this.  I have tried multiple steak restaurants from around the world and the T-Bone at Craftsteak was fairly juicy and delicious. The only downside was that it did not come with any sides and everything had to be ordered separately.  The Italian Buffalo Mozzarella salad we got was surprisingly small but the butter buns were a nice addition to the meal. Overall if we spent around UAD$120 for the meal in the picture.  Service was prompt and environment was nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 22 OZ. T BONE, DRY AGED &amp; ITALIAN BUFFALO MOZZARELLA, HAZELNUTS

nYrhwSyaCwjUE97EH1S4GQ.text: Chic atmosphere, unpretentious, attentive service, and delicious food.  Went to Craftsteak when we were in Vegas a couple months back for a nice "early anniversary" dinner.  Atmosphere is dark wood, mood lighting, and a very open dining room.  Going on a Sunday night, you might expect it to be quite.  Quite the opposite - it was a steady stream of patrons and stayed busy throughout our meal.  We kept our meal simple - Caesar salad, filet for me, bone-in for him, couple of sides, and dessert.  Each item was on point and delicious.  I would definitely consider going back again next time we're in town.

fOgqD6tD-vf8zYDFXboVRA.text: Omg, where to begin? From the overwhelming amount of waitstaff to the dark and loud interior, this place was a HUGE disappointment! The starters were tasteless, we had the beet salad - just beets on a plate and the foie gras which was ok but did not come with the usual toast points. Then the entree - we ordered the roasted NY strip medium for $67.00 which tasted very gamey and was mostly rare with lots of fat and little meat. Regret not sending it back!!! We ordered the grits as a side and had to return them because they were like paste and not creamy, buttery and rich. Really not worth the $200 bill, went to Nathans afterwards as we were still hungry. Save your money and go to Texas Roadhouse!!

4lZhkxSrP5isHY2lY49sKw.text: Very good service and the food was out if this world. Had the Porterhouse (pretty big) and it was a perfect medium rare. And as a person that typically eats with his eyes it was stunning coming out. Had to a few seconds to admire it. The sides are large can definitely share.   The one knock is we had a large bachelor group but had to split our party in 2.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GqwcRKRqw5ZLUxyYGQxFeg.text: Was really looking forward to a great dinner. But not here it seems. The menu looked promising and so did the restaurant. Atmosphere was good except the music. When at a higher end steak restaurant not really sure that Whitesnake or even Van Halen are appropriate. But we came for the food  The rolls tasted no better than ones you get at the supermarket. I ordered a NY Strip and the honey glazed carrots. Took too long for them to arrive. Steak was average at best. Nothing to justify the price for sure. The carrots were either not done or over done depending on which bite you had and they tasted blah. Again for $16 I expected amazing for the carrots.  Overall will not ever visit again. Outback beats this place!!

8TRzIgyOXH8hvNtGF6Zo-Q.text: I have been to many Zagat 5 star restaurants serving A5 Wagyu cuts and this was a bad experience from the start. the waitress was short and rude and tried to argue with me about the cuts of meat when I sent back my Filet A5 cut that was not an A5 cut telling me the skirt steak was their best cut. she was rud and unattentive. The Manager tried to smooth things over and i received a NY Strip A5 which was much better but nothing like the Wagyu cuts I have had in other locations at a far cheaper price point. It was a bad experience and arguing with me when I am going to put down a lot of money for dinner doesn't do well for a tip.  All in all a bad experience, I hope when and if i go back i will have a better experience.

v6_zDhzDivFOGb2_8P1NSg.text: Tom Colicchio is a certified culinary genius... I've had only the highest regards towards and utmost respect for him since watching him on Top Chef, but to experience his cuisine was a marvelous adventure...  His philosophy is to make simple food that is executed perfectly, and he does so flawlessly. The shiitake mushrooms were prepared beautifully, the sunchokes were crispy and cooked in a way I had never encountered (in the best way), the buttered salted bread... oh the bread. The bacon and egg salad was easily one of the best salads I've ever had. The waiter mixed the egg in front of us and, despite our confusion, we were very pleased with the result.. a salad abundant in texture, flavor and just pure happiness..  The steak was beautiful. Perfect amount of sauce, and worked incredibly well with both of our sides. I could not have enjoyed this place any more. Simple, perfectly executed food presented in a classy environment with Craft's signature lights to give a nice warm tint to the dining area. Top Chef may be a reality TV show, but Tom Colicchio is a real kick ass chef with superb talent and passion that shines through in his dishes. To Tom, and to my expanded stomach!

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunchokes
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Craft steak
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Créme brûlée

WJQFU3r95HHT1_4Y_YEfZA.text: This review references the Las Vegas outpost of the vast Craft empire!  I have nothing but respect for this growing colony of celebrity chef Tom Colicchio's.  Why? Simply because without regard to hype, hyperbole or the need to pander to artifice or pretention, chef Colicchio has created oases where the ingredient is the star and everything else from decor, service and even preparation collaborate to highlight that dry-aged beef or Kumamoto oyster.     The only man-made creation is the Monkey Bread of which Craft can be justifiably proud.  Do not leave Craft without luxuriating in this creation of corpulent flavor!  It is certainly the taste bud's equivalent of seeing the Northern Lights for the first time!  Texture, flavor, and aroma all collude to lead you to the inevitable conclusion that life, despite its pointy ends, is good after all and that yes, America can be great again.  Like I said, you'll find details about the service, ambiance and overall experience at Craftsteak in other finely crafted reviews by enthusiastic Yelpers, I just wanted to drop a few lines in as an editorial of sorts to flesh out the reasons for why Craftsteak means so much to me and why it should be more than just a chophouse to you.  Oh, by the way, reservations are a good idea.  Be kind, OpenTable already has this whole reservation thing distilled down to a few swipes.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster bisque
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burrata

vnUBY8zWTxk2-RzM9jWyXg.text: Without a doubt the best meal I've ever eaten. Not exaggerating here folk. If I could eat one food the rest of my life it would be the potato puree from CraftSteak. Everything was delicious (the almond green beans might be the only marginal option we tasted but...).   Our table had the braised short ribs, scallops and filet for main course. All were cooked to perfection and absolutely mouth watering. Starters and sides did not disappoint. The wrapped pears were just the right starter and the salads were light but don't fill up on starters as the meals and sides are enormous.   The wine was delicious, the potato puree is a must order and if you possibly saved room for dessert...well I don't know why they have a dessert menu because you won't have room.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eVXmXlzbFS3GdNbbG4DaXw.text: The reservation was easy to make. Overall, the staff treated us very good until the end of our dinner.  But, the rest of my evening was just average. Since I booked this far in advance, there should not have been any issues with me arriving 5-10 minutes late, even after I called to see if it was okay to still come. When I arrived, the hostess said we may not be able to take your party. Which was interesting because I had already spoken to her 5-10 minutes ago, and was told to come down---everything was fine. Also, the reason I was even late was that the place was so hard to find in the first place.  So, here's my feedback on the food. The filet mignon were very good. However, the mashed potatoes and asparagus was not cooked properly. The mashed had too much water and was like soup. The asparagus was too, too, chewy.   Worst part of the night was the 40th birthday dessert. They brought out two small chocolate chip cookies (the kind from a dollar store). This didn't bode well. This was bad...they could have just let me order something. I didn't care about it being free. The presentation sucked.  To that end, I recommend that you only eat the steak and order nothing else. And, show up an hour early. Try GPS to find this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interesting...!

odBAbxLVh48LKQ81RsKZEg.text: Great service, Quality steaks    My husband had been wanting to try this steakhouse for a while and it did not disappoint. We were delighted with the non pretentious service and quality cuts of steak.   We started with cocktails and the wagyu tartar. Unbelievable, the tartare was velvet. I can't really describe how delicious this was. Hopefully my pictures do it justice.   As mains we shared the 40oz rib eye. Cooked medium rare it was nothing short of perfection. This was a huge portion for two, could easily be shared with three to four people.  We had French fries and Brussel sprouts for sides. The French fries were forgettable but the Brussels were great    Order a bottle of Shafers wine which is always an excellent choice.   This is not a cheap steakhouse by any means. Bill was $500,  worth it for a great night out. Server was great. I would highly recommend for anyone in Vegas looking for quality cuts of steak.

S6qmkh6QfW5EpKT2LfkvnQ.text: Nothing has Changed!  We started with a nice glass of Champagne at the their beautiful bar. My wife and I shared a Caesar salad, an off the menu bone marrow with brioche toast points, the braised short ribs (the best we have ever had) along with the mixed mushrooms and the pomme puree. Accompanied by a bottle of Crozes Hermitage rouge. Still flawless service. Still prefect food.

59jU6K3E-_QLD1UguY92ow.text: Unfortunately we did not enjoy dinner here nearly as much as we should have. A $500 check for three people. Other steakhouses are, at a minimum, equal and more likely signficantly better and not as pricey. Wagyu quality good. Good service.

VKtqa4fTedxLWGncmWDlcg.text: Service was fantastic! Had the short rib with the potato puree and some other sides. Everything was great! We ended dinner with the flaming bananas foster which was so cool prepared tableside.

2Ax2XPnDMKHNtdtbcOq68Q.text: The first time I went to Craft was in 2015 while visiting Vegas for an event, it was sooo good I went twice that week, back to back. Now, every time I visit MGM, Craft has become a regular stop. Yet, each time I go back the overall experience gets worst every time. This year I have been to Craft twice.  The first time this year the food just didn't really meet my expectations that I had of the restaurant. First off, the bread rolls to start the evening were hard and cold as if they had been sitting out for hours. Usually the bread rolls were one of my favorite staples of Craft because they are usually soft and taste fresh and straight out of the oven. After being slightly disappointed of the rolls, it came time to order food. I was in a party of 5, and all of us were quite disappointed with our meals. For some reason, nothing that we ate that night seemed fresh. Now this might be do to the time we came in the restaurant as it was very close to the end of the night. But a restaurant is a restaurant and should take pride in every dish that comes out of the kitchen, no matter the time! This brings me to my next issue with Craft. Not too long ago, I went to Craft with a group of friends and family (a total of 7). This time the food was much better than my previous experience, and everyone cleared their plates completely. But, the Craft servers were very unintelligent. We had asked our server to set up an extra placemat for one more guest that was planning on showing up, our server set up the placemat but neglected to tell or inform that the kitchen was closing. So, upon arrival of our 8th guest, we had called over our server for him to take the order, but when he came over he said that the kitchen has been closed....I understand that the kitchen closes at a certain time, but, most restaurants inform the guests when the kitchen is closing so if there is anything we want we should ask for it now, ESPECIALLY since we had a placemat set up for someone who was planning on enjoying a delicious meal.   No feel from the staff

5oAe0aPZpSb6zdsuEvdTmQ.text: The environment here is not that classic, but the food sooo tasty, must try in Las Vegas

hnJaHbD3CDZfKBQ9OKir9A.text: Steaks are pretty solid, although far from the best I've ever had. Would recommend the wagyu skirt steak or dry-aged RR ribeye. We also had the A5 wagyu new york steak and pretty much the rest of the steak menu as well, but they were okay.   Lobster bisque is really fishy, don't recommend. Salads are also meh, don't really recommend. Can't go wrong with their potato sides as well. When in season, I hear their white corn is good.   Steaks would be better if the plates were dabbed in herb butter and about 2x hotter.   For dessert, get the monkey bread.   Steaks 4/5. Atmosphere 4/5. Service 4/5.

H52S6__8il9Skw7nDA7PCA.text: Hands down, best steak I have ever had. Seasoned to perfection, and the meat was so soft. You must try the steak with the mushrooms.   Also, the waitstaff was beyond professional. Next time you are in Vegas and would like an amazing steak, go!

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hQEMycsQm4LH5Lbh4LsKRQ.text: My husband and I were in Las Vegas this weekend and we made reservations to eat here, I do have to say that I was very disappointed. My steak was like leather and I ordered it medium rare. Then we ordered the Bananas Fosters and that was even worst, the waiter that brought it to the table was in such a hurry that the flame was ion no longer than 10 seconds how sad. I will not return to this restaurant. My husband and I have been to many steak houses from all over the world and what a disappointment.

IzOx_S9v9GZR814LL0Xqvw.text: Well done! We came here for Saturday night date dinner, had a reservation at 9:15 and they took us an hour early! Menu options are great! Highly recommend starting with the lobster bisque, creamy and flavor-filled! Martini's are also made perfectly (I had vodka, dirty) and comes with a top-off! For dinner, focused on the waygu skirt steak, mushroom medley, & potato puree. The skirt steak was cooked to perfection and melted in your mouth! And to top it off the service was impeccable (which I am a stickler for). Waiter shared a background on Tom Calicchio (I requested) and made some great suggestions, restaurant manager made his rounds to ensure restaurant satisfaction, in addition to constant coverage. Overall experience was definitely worth the slightly high prices.

IXHQL08HY4c007Tq2aAHAA.text: terrific food from beginning to end. Finally, a restaurant that holds True to the term "you get what you pay for" delicious rolls to start. I ate so much during the day ordered a lobster salad that I'd usually starve if I ate 5 of these, but it was delish. Best Ive ever tasted. Sampled a few bits of ribeye from family it was great too. Wish they would serve a side or two included on the steaks but not taking away a star for that. Terrific meal, great bar too. Without a doubt..the best caesar salad ever too. crisp romaine delish with dressing...excellent

C-5L-hMvlkZGs29T6GXJ6Q.text: So, I've had the pleasure of dining at this gem twice at the insistence of my co-worker. This is definitely a destination if you want to dine at a nice steakhouse in LV. Yes, I know it's a "hotel restaurant" but if you have that mentality you're missing out on the best things in life. First, their martinis are magnificent. And, both times I have had their steak tartare...this is significant to this establishment. The fresh quail egg does the trick. Moreover, I must recommend the scallops; they are extraordinary. You will find many great steak establishments will have equally great seafood. Stop here and enjoy a drink and an appetizer (especially the tartare) at least! Have fun!

mD6HjyALwx1Wm07iNiUF5A.text: I enjoyed my steak (granted i dipped it in the amazing mashed potatoes each bite). But my husband who has eaten at numerous steakhouses was very disappointed.  Says the meat is just average,  and with the exorbitant price tag makes it a double slam.  Service was great. The two is for the potatoes and service, otherwise it would have scored a 1. Go to mastros instead!

zVIMq_i60I4yCSHxI0YjZg.text: Excellent services with wonderful food. We ordered the family style dinner with ribeye and filet...  steak was great and a very enjoyable evening with my family here.   PS... I recommend change the music selections... too noisy...

Shksg4hNnGwwnDqoaEUXAQ.text: If you're graving for a good steak, this is it. You name it they got the cut for you. After a day of shopping with your wife, you deserve a good ribeye. The selection of wine is awesome. Don't go cheap! you don't want to wash that steak down with cheap wine. Their wine dude would help you pair your meat with a good fine wine.   Don't be surprise if you see T in this place.

V57RLEipFUzJwrUk8qN90g.text: Absolutely incredible! 18oz grilled ribeye is all you need but go ahead and add the broccoli, fingerling potatoes and corn! So freaking good! I would be mad if it cost this much and was bad but this meal was worth every penny!

hraQV1MrdGDVj8YEKfEYTQ.text: Very fancy steakhouse located in the MGM Grand. I had heard about the legendary lobster bisque, so I made plans to dine at Craftsteak during my next trip to Las Vegas.  The restaurant is very nice, and the servers were extremely attentive. I ordered the lobster bisque to start with, and it was incredible. Fresh chunks of lobster meat drowned in a creamy and delightfully complex bisque. Every spoonful was delicious, from the initial flavor to the aftertaste. I'm not sure what exactly is in that bisque, but it is seasoned beautifully. Easily the best lobster bisque I have ever tasted.  The Caesar salad with picked anchovies was quite good.  The steak was also very good. I ordered the Double R t-bone, and it was cooked perfectly. Definitely a sous-vide steak: charred nicely on the outside, and a uniform medium rare doneness on the inside. I wasn't crazy about the slightly sweet sauce that accompanied the steak. Other than that, it was fantastic.  Overall, this is a fantastic steakhouse. The steaks are great, but in my opinion, the lobster bisque overshadows the beef. Come ready to eat and ready to drop some dough!

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best lobster bisque ever
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster chunks about to be drowned in delicious bisque

9KLxUY_SiurXZ_FUX8s2xg.text: It took us a good 10 minutes to find this restaurant once we got in to MGM Grand but I'm glad we finally did! The service was excellent, the steaks were delicious and perfectly cooked, the bread at the table was melting in our mouths, and the sides of fries and spinach were lovely. We look forward to being back!

J1V40sirErlT7JNcmfBQ_A.text: Wow, such a good meal. I came here with my parents and  three of us ordered 2 orders of the Domestic Wagyu set dinners and were stuffed. Because we ordered 2 of the dinners we got 3 half salads (arugula, Caesar, and warm frisee), 3 half sides (potato puree, assorted mushrooms, baby spinach), 2 cuts of domestic wagyu meat (filet and ny strip) and a ridiculous amount of deserts.  The highlights for us were the warm frisee salad (blue cheese taste/smell wasn't overwhelming at all), the potato puree, the filet (meat was so so tender), and the cinnamon monkey cake. Honestly one of the best meals we've had in LV yet and our waiter Victor was so nice.   The only thing we would've done differently is order two rounds of the filet and passed on the NY Strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potato purée at the top was the best side
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Mignon (9.7/10)

r7szOX6j-hhBScRmuiPwsA.text: Awesome steak house. I had the bone-in Strip grilled. Fantastic. Tip: split the sides and salads as they are huge.

DO7RQj6vbix0yDYh4KU32g.text: Grabbed dinner here one night before catching Cirque Du Soleil's KA show and the service here is definitely the best on the strip. We decided to try the dinner special that had a little bit of everything for every course and ended up overwhelmed but it was all good. Unfortunately our eyes were bigger than our stomachs and because we were catching the show right after, we didn't take anything to go but I would definitely recommend the restaurant to anyone visiting.

GPFZp2RVx5QT9P8wyrZv4w.text: Good food here but the service left a lot to be desired.  On the server's recommendation we had the skirt steak which is apparently one of their top sellers. It was actually really good. Typically I'm not a fan of skirt steak but this was probably the best thing we ordered.  We also got a big ribeye - not very good but it was really cheap considering it was a bigger cut. You get what you pay for I suppose lol.  For sides and starters we did oysters, Caesar salad (mediocre), and arugula salad (pretty good).  For sides the mushrooms were the best. The corn grits were okay.  Besides the skirt steak, the free bread was also memorable.  For dessert we tried a bunch of different things. Can't really say anything was awesome.  The less than average part of the evening was the service! It was SO slow and I don't think the restaurant was that busy. We also asked the server to bring out one of the desserts w a candle so we could sing happy birthday and they totally forgot.  Doubtful I'll return here. Maybe we just ordered the wrong things who knows.

4mZbXhee-h_MxngfJ8T2zA.text: Food is rock solid but a bit overpriced. Wait staff nice but pushy. Christopher at front is a magic man. And if you want the best Old Fashioned you ever drank head the bar. Cant remeber the bartenders name but he is a damn rock star! And tey rhe hot salad. Perfecto

1QE5Gi0D1PQbRt8w0ZPoOg.text: Bartender here is incredible. I had La Vie en Rose, which was gin, cucumber, elderflower, and something else I'm forgetting...anyway, you could actually taste the flavors in it, which doesn't always happen.  The bartender gave us a menu while we waited and made recommendations. So we had the warm frisee salad that's tossed with a runny egg. It tastes like bacon and eggs. Yum! We also got two of each kind of oyster-- they come with 3 kinds of sauces.  Husband got the hangar steak, which was oversalted, but not enough for him to stop the meal to send it back. I had the filet mignon which was very tender. We also got fries to share.   The sides are a la carte and huge portions, so don't over order.  Service was friendly and the music wasn't too loud, which I appreciated. The tables were close together, but it was the kind of place where people started talking to the table next to them. Not us because we were obviously on a date, but I noticed that convivial atmosphere going on.

xK6j9zRdYB2KQQpSq5qbLQ.text: Great service. Joe is awesome. Definitely get the Monkey bread. We come here a couple of times a year from Phoenix and it is worth the trip.

Dndw2t0px_Q5YGXJKu_ZAA.text: Good food great service. Reservations recommended. You can walk in and find a spot in the bar to order from dinner menu. Free addicting salted top bread rolls on a cast iron pan. Ribeye has great seasoning cooked to perfection. Not as tender as dekmonico a but better tasting  Top dishes A5 wagyu rib cap ($$$$$) out of this world Bone in ribeye great seasoning Mash potatoe Bread pudding

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great Bread pudding.   Chocolate soufflé is too rich
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye scallops n bread

XZEfvq90B3LbZLPp2CJ_-g.text: We had a reservation and arrived 30 minutes early, planning on a short wait. They had a table openining and were quick to clear it and get us seated.  We had the Domestic Nagyu Chef's tasting.  Appetizer: - Shrimp Cocktail. Shrimp prepared perfectly and a cocktail sauce with perfect amount of bite.  Three small salads:  - Arugala Salad I am not a fan of Arugala salad, but theirs was excellent.  - Persian Cucumber and Watercress, was better than average.  - Itallian Buffalo Mozzarella with Hazelnuts, added a little twist that was very nice    Steaks: Ribeye and Filet for the cuts of meat. Both cooked to perfection and as very delicious.  Sides:  - Brissel Sprouts, in season so on everyones menu and they didn't dissapoint  - Au Gratin Potatoes, found out that my mother was undercooking the potatoes for my entire life. Both happy and sad at the same time, because I always loved my moms Au Gratin. Even if she were alive, I would have never told her this.  Deserts:  - Cinnamon Monkey Bread w/Vanilla Bean Ice Cream - Awesome  - Sorbets, Coconut Lime and Rasberry  - Chocolate Indulgence - Close second  - Farmers Market Fruit  The only let down to the entire meal was that they brought us four deserts when two would have sufficed... It is simply too much after that much provided in the prior courses.  The service was top nothc from start to finish. A must stop for anyone. I am glad we did the tasting because I would have missed out on some excellent items i would have otherwise not have tried.

3HrRj1AWwYVjB-LUfdFuFQ.text: We just left this horrible establishment.   I called to see if they had open tables tonight (9/18/13).  I was told, no problem, come on over.   It is my father in-laws birthday, we wanted a nice dinner.   When we arrive, the lady looks us up and down and says we have to wait and can eat at the bar. (I am not paying for a steak to eat at a bar)  We waiting over 20 minutes. The hostess seated other tables and then lied to us and said the computer system was down. After another 10 minutes, we left.   I'm not sure why she felt we were not worthy of a table.  What I do know is that I was completely disrespected and embarrassed at this restaurant. I will NEVER go back and will relay my experience to many others.

ZSt9dldLvZKpj2IhPKJo5A.text: Neither service or food was worth the price. Our table was forgotten for over 20 minutes and server returned to table irritated because we asked for her. Expected much more since Tom is such a ball buster on the food shows - perhaps he should dine in his own place more often.

-ErdycukewkkvldNxMLUxw.text: As an avid fan of Top Chef, I have watched Tom Colicchio on so many occasions shred a chef for failure to season food, especially not to use salt and pepper.  Imagine my surprise to find underseasoned food in every course at Craftsteak.  At $300 for dinner for two with one drink and one glass of wine, no dessert, I do expect better than this.    The starter of lobster salad was very good, just woefully underseasoned, lacking both salt and pepper and not tasting very much of the ginger alleged to be in the dressing.  My very expensive shrimp cocktail had a very faint taste of iodine which really surprised me.  Moving to the salad course, my partner's beet salad featured under-roasted and bland beets with no salt to speak of and a dressing so mild as to be nearly nonexistent.  My salad of persian cucumber was nearly undressed and the vinaigrette tasted barely of lemon juice and olive oil.  There was no savor to the dish at all.  Since everything is a la carte, here, $14 for unseasoned raw veggies is not the way to my heart.  I will say the short rib main was delicious.  My bone-in prime NY steak was a flavorsome cut of meat, but the absence of seasoning did not enhance the steak.  While the room was very nice and service good, underseasoned food in every course pretty much ruined the experience for me.  The side dishes were generous portions, but ran the gamut in quality.  Asparagus was bitter and a bit woody.  Grits were very nice if in need of a bit of salt.  The mushroom assortment was undercooked.  The Maui onions were the star side at our table.  Quite good.  Again, for what this place charges, they need better quality control.    I could not in good conscience recommend this place to friends, because at this level, the food ought to be well-seasoned and well-prepared, every course, every time.  I know "celebrity" chefs are too busy to actually cook in their eponymous venues, but they could at least hire executive chefs who would occasionally taste the offerings to find out what the line cooks are doing.  The wine list is quite extensive with some very nice offerings, but with such variable quality in the food, it would be frustrating to order a special vintage if the food was as uneven as we experienced.  In short, would not return here since there are too many truly wonderful places in Las Vegas.

41hDwWFL6NbglQmFOMxxSw.text: In case you were wondering, Tom Colicchio isn't just all talk on Top Chef.  This Texan girl gives major props to his upscale Vegas steakhouse.    Also, I still have dreams about the warm, butter-slathered salt-sprinkled dinner rolls that arrive at your table in mini cast iron pans.

zuMUWAduEq4COEcbnZ3XCA.text: Came here for my wife's 40th Bday. Been wanting to try them out because if their ratings and pics looked great. We've tried plenty of high end steak houses in and out of Las Vegas and this place is probably on our top 2 now.  Had the porterhouse and scallops. The Carmel sticky bun is a must for desert.

Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagu Tartar
