JJYHxcaQBOaC68Wnoktfqw.text: We went here with a group of 8 girls for my friend's birthday dinner.  Our waitress was great and perfectly interactive without being too much. She joked with us, almost brought us a $560 bottle of wine on accident, and very helpful in answering all our menu questions.  I ordered the short rib & Japanese eggplant. Short rib was melt-off-the-bone great but there were some parts of it that were way too fatty. Eggplant was good, and a very large portion perfect for sharing. I tried a bit of my friend's spinach which actually seemed a little bland to me. Wines were good as well.   The only thing that was a little absurd - our cake cutting fee was $64. I don't know if that's the norm (maybe it is) but it really seems crazy to me. Also, the restaurant was COLD. By the end of the night, all of us were shivering (although we were in going out clothes, so that might have something to do with it..)  All in all a very pleasant dining experience and appropriately priced (minus the cutting fee).

ysxjXsa3I79MVvTX9JMsNA.text: So they have an annoying French woman haunting you to purchase pictures.  I thought we were at Disneyland for a second.    Drinks were amazing at the bar and the service was excellent.  The kitchen failed us miserably.  I ordered the Wagyu steak and the cooked it to death, despite ordering it medium rare.  My wife ate her whole meal and I still did not receive my dinner.   I really didn't want it at that point and I never received it.  The manager comped our whole meal, which was unexpected, however that does not repay us for the 4 months we waited to eat here.  Tom needs to get off the TV and get back to this restaurant.  I really respected TC, but after this experience I may take a break from Top Chef episodes.  I really am losing faith in 'celebrity' chefs.  I would not gamble on this restaurant with your palate and wallet.  FAIL!

zDbbdKpgQJtelwlu-qRpQg.text: We chose this place for our christmas dinner because of the good reviews and also we were watching the show Ka afterwards so was convenient was well.  We made reservation and got seated right away. We got lobster bisque and roasted beet salad to share. The server offered to bring out the soup in two separate bowls which I thought was very nice gesture since he knew we were sharing it. Both were delicious and the bread must have come right out from the oven cuz it was hot and tasty. We shared the 18oz ribeye steak and got brussel sprouts and potato gratin as sides. They cut the steak for us so it was easier to share. The portion was perfect for us and even had leftover. Steak was cooked to perfect medium rare and the flavor was just right. not too overbearing like some steakhouses.  Everything came out in timely manner and servers were great! I highly recommend it if ur making a trip to vegas and want to treat yourself to a nice steak dinner!

f2zqxrFdmyOM2i_xEvxbmQ.text: I was in Vegas for Thanksgiving, so can you imagine how long the lines were for the buffet? (4-5 hours long around 5pm line up) My fiance and I decided to skip the buffet and make a reservation at Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak. What a great decision we made! Reservation was easy and the food was excellent! Because it was Thanksgiving they had a prix fixe thanksgiving dinner menu available with all your likings of turkey, stuffing, side dishes plus more. Although I love to have me some good turkey on turkey day, I already made up my decision to order myself a filet mignon. Good thing they didn't just served their prix fixe thanksgiving menu, the steak was phenomenal! So tender and perfectly executed! I loved it!  My fiance ordered the rib-eye and that was also very good. The steak had great marbling because the steak was tender and a bit of fat all around. It was good! But the filet mignon in my opinion was better.  The sides: we ordered potato puree and baby shiitake mushrooms. Both sides were delicious! Potato was creamy and certainly a good amount to share between 2 people. And last but not least, dessert! We had to go for their chocolate souffle with ice cream! Yummy! All in all, great service, great restaurant, great food, no wait!  Can't go wrong with a good steakhouse in Vegas!   Big fan of top chef, so glad I got to try tom's restaurant!

iSM8uNUTzBrVjoaZMyf77w.text: After watching Tom on Top Chef for so many years I was excited to try his steakhouse at the mgm. The decor is clean with masculine steakhouse touches. Tons of male eye candy having a boys meal together. The guys next to our table were hilarious and entertaining. I had the bone in new York med rare. Sides were the corn and potato puree. Steak was delicious, perfectly seasoned with a slight crust at the edges. The potato puree were so creamy and silky.  The corn was a little savory, a little sweet and added some great texture to the whole meal. The buttered rolls they bring at the beginning are addicting but so self control is key. Great crowd and great service.  It turns out that many vegas restaurants recycle their food waste for farms, that was an interesting fact that our server gave us. They were able to fit us in with a last unite reservation at 930.  Remember to show your mlife card for points.

yW91w5dCRx8n4pRrwNy5tQ.text: We had dinner here last Saturday night for the first time, and it was fabulous. We started with he lobster bisque and it was very good, with plenty of lobster in it, I ordered the short rib, which I loved and would absolutely order again next time I visit, my friends ordered the rib-eye, they were also happy. We shared sides of risotto (our favorite), potatoes gratin, asparagus, and mushrooms...all very good, but I would have been happy with just my short ribs and risotto.  The service was also exceptional.  Can't wait to come back next time I'm in Vegas.

CSz1IXZQbYivfkRRq_BgKw.text: Have to have it to their management team.. After an unfortunate incident they went out of their way to contact me and make it right. Can't ask for more tbh

XeBk_We90ZVVwAX8OqzD_A.text: Let me first start off by saying I am no one of importance. I'm not famous, attractive, wealthy or distinguishable amongst a crowd. I'm merely a novice foodie who studies the hospitality industry as it pertains to restaurants. From the moment you walk in, you're greeted graciously by the host as if you were one the aforementioned. The elite. If we had known the greatness of the quality of the cocktails, the wine, and of course the food, my peers and I would not thought twice of the slight 2-3 minute delay between being seated and the server introducing herself (Alexis by the way). Being knowledgable on all food and drink on the menu, she gave us what any appreciator of the art of restaurants could ask for; an amazing experience. From our initial drink order to last cup of French Press coffee and all the amazing food in between, service was by far second to none. The Mis en Place was on point to a T. Which we understand could not be possible without all the helping hands of the rest of the waitstaff; so on that note, thank you! In regards to food quality itself, you will not find a better cut of ribeye, NY strip, or filet in Vegas. Having selected the primary, the perfectly complimenting marbling of the ribeye was something to be noted for the ages that made this delectable, juicy, fine cut of meat one of a kind. Need I not forget to mention the Rosemary fingerling potatoes and the best au gratin potatoes I've ever had the opportunity to taste. As I see this is becoming lengthy, I'll leave on this last few notes. This restaurant is a must if you are ever in town. And while I'm certain service from everyone would be great, request the lovely and unforgettable Alexis. Thank you so much for an experience my friends and I shall never forget. It was the perfect military-going-away dinner I could ever enjoy. I'll definitely be back after boot camp.   Cheers,   Arram (Review writer)  Kyle (fellow diner)  Trevor (fellow diner)

DpcwT5djmsuEhCEPw_PWvA.text: Food was absolutely incredible, the only reason I give it four stars is because of the really high prices.  Probably some of the best steak I have ever eaten.  The experience of the 4 course meal was fantastic, our waiter was also very memorable as well, so nice and friendly.  The food is very very good just overpriced in my opinion.

VYUZCYi-WVQOih60Sr6jyQ.text: Visited Craftsteak during our MGM Grand stay back on 3/22/16.  The good: Very friendly bus boy  Waiter was friendly Great bread Drinks  The average: Our Steaks  Based on the prices, though good, i thought i'd be getting an A+ tasting steak, instead of just good.  The last steak on had was at Ruth Chris, which i'd rated an A+, Sorry i didn't hit  Ruth Chris in Vegas.

M_Z9JFX-gtABwKCOAuMmOA.text: Amazing food and presentation.   Often when I eat at nicer restaurants like this even though the food is great I walk away having spent  a lot of money and am still hungry.   Not this place. We chose to go with one of the family style chef specials for 3 and was blown away with the quality and quantity.  It covered 5 courses and was more than 3 big guys could eat.  I highly recommend it.

o0RSjkH8Eka-gPt68b5QCA.text: 5 of us made reservations via open table. We have made this an annual stop over the years and are always pleased by the team that takes care of us. Asking to split 3 steaks is always no problem for this crew.  Love the large cubes for my Makers Mark. The sides were perfect, and complimented the steaks nicely.  We ordered the ribeye and t-bone, they were cooked exactly as requested.  For the desert we sampled the Monkey bread.  It is the perfect end to a great meal.  We are looking forward to the next visit.

SvEFPUhhWAQox72ySXOgWQ.text: Disappointing.  We were in Vegas for one night and love a good steakhouse.  Started at the bar with a great Martini.  Then moved into the dining room.  We ordered the roasted NY prime, medium rare, risotto, mushrooms and brussel sprouts.  Steak was medium and sides were cold.  We sent it all back.  Took about 30 minutes to come back.  Everything was just okay, sprouts and risotto a little too heavy on the bacon and very rich.  Steak was a little tough.  Mushrooms were boring.  The service was Excellent and the manager was very nice and knew we were disappointed and brought us some delicious dessert...carrot cake... I would not go back.  Too many wonderful steakhouses to choose from :(

WpWBi2mJCfW4jfCn5Bt5Bw.text: This place was not that good, I spent 150$ on fried oysters, which were not good they didn't taste like nothing, the duck which was a good cooked meat that's all that I can say for a duck, the braised beef short rib was good, my wife had it she said it was nothing special. I personally liked the lobster hush puppies. And the last thing the Mojito was good that's the only reason I tipped good. I'd rather go somewhere else and spend 150$

F85tcqvxrenEfCVOhqWcxw.text: Unbelievable! The food was amazing!  Thr surf and turf was great! Christopher the the Maitre D was professional and accomodating. All the staff was efficient and friendly. The check was a bit steep, but worth every penny. Better than the Gramercy Park location.

hxuKX-Qn8bnfiPr3lQZpag.text: Oh. My. Goodness. Such awesome food. I can't remembert the name of the meal we ordered. You started off with (dinnerf or two) two salads, three starters (shrimp cocktail, heirloom tomatoes, and bruscetta). Then we each got to hoose our meats. One wagyu sirloin and one wagyu ribeye. These steaks were superbly cooked. Very flavorful and melted in your mouth. The steaks came wth three sides. Bacon and cheese grits (to die for!!), asparagus, and potato gratin. Basically, we were full half way throught he steaks.   After all that, you also got three desserts. So being as full as we were, we took them to go. He Cinnamon Monkey bread was exellent. Paula Dean would've loved the butter flavor. It simply melted in your mouth. There was also a chocolate cake and a fruit tart. All were yummy.   Was a great food experience. Dropped $500 for two people, but how often do you get to eat this quality of food? Definitely reccommend if you have the time and the money. Great experience.

Z9JnhRtJNMjKeijS_PwGqw.text: The best steakhouse ever! I have been to several chef restaurants in Vegas but this one by far beats them all! The steaks of course are incredible but the sides make the meal. We had the mushroom assortment and the risotto. Tge best risotto! Thanks Dan for making it fun too. You're a great manager! Thanks for the tip too, wink wink! We'll definitely be back again next trip as this is our favorite place to dine.

KQzXixZFPWwyo0IYC9gAHA.text: I'm a huge fan of steak as my reviews can attest to and so I'm happy to try them all out for you and report back!  This restaurant is by far one of the most beautifully laid out restaurants on the strip. The lighting, the wood accents and just the very low-key, mellow ambiance is just fantastic. I couldn't ask for a more beautiful place to dine.  Before I even get to the food I have to also say that the service here is incredible. You can always tell you're in an expensive restaurant. The wait staff just shines. It's no exception here. No empty glasses, excellent wine and drink selections and no waiting for requests. Being waited on hand and foot is exactly my style!  Onto the True beauty of this restaurant: the food. Yes, it's a steak restaurant, yes, there are many in Vegas, but none do food quite like Craftsteak. The originality combined with all of the other aspects of this place really elevate it to a different level.   The food choices are essentially the same for most steak houses. I had the bone-in ribeye and my associate had bison strip loin which I had never tasted. Mine was delicious. It was a nice size steak with just enough marbling to make it melt in the mouth without it venturing into that fatty, greasy taste. It had a nice seared crust that gave it a little crunch to go with the tenderness. Really a nice combo in the mouth. My associate's bison steak took me aback. I'm not a big fan of alternative meat, if you will. Bison just does not conjure up BBQ if you know what I mean. I see prairies and high grass, not a divine piece of meat on a platter. I'm happy to say I now see it both ways. Bison is extremely tender. I was expecting a gamey taste, the sort found on most wild animals (I know, bison are farm raised, but still - BISON?), but was happily surprised with the mild, tender meat that I encountered. I definitely think if you want to step out of your comfort zone you should try this cut of meat. Delicious.   As sides go they have an amazing assortment. My associate surprised me by ordering grits. I KNOW, RIGHT? I, being from Texas, know what a grit is. I will only eat it for my grandmother. UNTIL NOW. This was the best tasting grit I ever had! It was cooked so perfectly, so tenderly that I wanted to ask it why it didn't taste like this when I was a kid, but grits don't talk. Not even in Texas. So, these white corn grits were topped with bacon and Gruyere cheese and let me tell you if that's all you eat I will not tell anyone. They were an explosion of fabulous taste. I was shocked. I will never think of grits the same way again, I can assure you of THAT.  We also had the mushroom assortment and they were good, but they weren't done in a way that you'd ask for them again when you went back unless you're a mushroom nut. They were fine, I liked them, next.  No dessert here, but that will change next time I go. The assortment they had made my mouth water just reading them!  There is an incredible menu here. It's extensive, but don't take that to mean that they don't everything with flair. Nothing gets left behind here and that's surprising. You'll love it, though. Please bring me some grits when you go, okay? Don't tell my grandma.

h_diwv7fGp4gGnBy2M3fzA.text: Heard a lot of good things about this place and wanted a good steak. We decided to order the porterhouse and split it with some sided. We ordered it Medium and it was flavorful and fantastic, even though we should have asked for it Med + or Med Well because it was just shy of med. They brought us an amuse bouche while we were waiting in between courses, which I thought that was pretty classy even though we weren't waiting very long at all. All in all very good

jCRHkSbIOPWQE6Qz_tfJsQ.text: Excellent food and excellent service. We ended up paying over $800 for four people, but it was totally worth it. Their specialty steaks are delicious and just melt in your mouth

jEvlQ1C64kK48KlAYMB78Q.text: It's pretty damn good, but with all the great steakhouses in Vegas, I probably wouldn't go out of my way to eat here. However, if you're staying at the MGM, its a must try.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not too shabby

HP8P_v_biKna39bzyIjO5w.text: Once again Craft did not disappoint. There were 4 of us and we did the tasting menu. 4 different steaks with 4 appetizers, 4 sides & 6 desserts. Steaks were cooked perfectly and the waiter couldn't of picked better dishes for us.   Highly recommend this place!!

mVXwksMCJcqJj-ASTq3HRQ.text: My boyfriend & I dined here on our recent trip to Las Vegas.   We had been debating on which steakhouse to dine at as there were so many to choose from.   We narrowed down our choices from (Delmonico, Mastros (we ate at the one in LA last year) and Craftsteak).  We eventually settled on Craftsteak mainly because it had the most reviews (vs Delmonico) & Mastros was in an odd setting (in a mall),   Do I think we made the right decision with Craftsteak?  ABSOLUTELY.   It was perfect from start to finish.  We were running a tad late for our reservation so I called in advance to let the hostess know and she graciously seated us as soon as we arrived.   The ambiance of the restaurant was beautiful. It didn't even feel like we were in a casino, which I worried about.  We both started with starters: I had the Cesar salad  & my boyfriend had the lobster bisque.   The Cesar salad was just okay for me. I feel the price was steep for a salad (about the same for lobster bisque)-- & the anchovies weren't very good.  The lobster bisque however was so good. Warm, decadent, and great presentation. The server brought out a bowl of chopped lobster and poured the soup over table side.   The rolls were also very good. They reminded me of Hawaiian rolls, freshly baked with sea salt. I wish they asked if we wanted more because we gobbled them down quite quickly.   For our main courses we ordered the rib eye and the scallops and the pureed potatoes.  We shared everything. It was all cooked perfectly. The steak was perfectly juicy throughout. And the scallops were so evenly salted and cooked. The pureed mashed potatoes melted in your mouth like butter.   The whole dinner was a complete experience. We wish we saved room for dessert. But even though we didn't, they brought out a lovely panna cotta with a candle for my boyfriend who was celebrating his birthday.   Such a nice touch to a wonderful meal and experience.   Would definitely dine here again! Definitely one of the highlights of our trips. :)

vDd2iP6VZZktdLBrfLxs_Q.text: Considered giving 3 stars, but decided on 2. It wasn't the worst experience ever, the service was good and the ambiance was nice. The food was really lacking though. I heard all good things and the menu looked really good. I knew that being on the strip it would be overpriced, so it is what it is. For $100 I expected a phenomenal steak. What I got was slightly overcooked (not really that bad, just a little). Also, it was just meh. My friend actually got a $150 or so steak and it was the same. If you are going to have really high end cuts of meat they should be exceptional. These were average at best. With so many other steak options on the strip I would recommend elsewhere. This wasn't the worst experience, and after writing this it could easily be 3 stars, but I'm sticking with 2 because of how disappointed I was due to my high expectations before going

dthYB5pPooffOYIP6gdffA.text: $20,000 for a bottle of wine. I didn't order it, but I wish I could. So I settled for the $11,000 bottle of wine. I'm probably kidding though.  Everything about this restaurant was superb. I shared a 32 oz Porterhouse ($92) with 2 other people. We also got the Puree (mashed potatoes). This was more than enough for the 3 of us. We don't eat that much though, so don't think that with 32 oz will always feed 3 people. From these 2 items, the bill was $140 (after tip/tax). The steak was one of the best I've ever had. Its presentation was good and they even included the bone with the edible marrow inside it--legit.  Anyway, be ready to spend money here. While the food/service is exceptional, so are the prices.

-qlk89Hj3lZa9m5ijBXRew.text: Overall i think the service was great, but the food was just okay. Maybe it was because i had unrealistically high expectations from all the top chef episodes, but it was a little disappointing. Not to say the food was good, it just didn't stand out from the other high tier restaurants.  For a party of 6, we ordered a prosciutto and salad as appetizer, both were huge portions, much bigger than i thought they would be. For entree we split a kobe skirt steak, a porterhouse for 2, ribeye, and a 2.5 lb lobster with sides of mushrooms and brussel sprouts. I have to say, the stand out items were  the skirt steak and brussel sprouts.   All the food plus 2 bottles of wine (1 was comped because we moved our table to help someone in a wheelchair) came out to be around $600ish.

85l7eHiu0CF4ZLzAqVufrg.text: This restaurant was incredible. Great service and top notch food. You've got to try the lobster bisque. Unbelievable.   If you like scotch this place is scotch heaven. It has one of, if not the biggest selections, of scotch in the western United States.  Alexis was our server and she is a True professional and personable.   Craftsteak is a must!

sDOLNmo6feLtgMuzqRjlFw.text: Talk about overpriced crap. We chose a three course sampling. Our waiter lied to us about the cut of beef we were receiving in this sampling. You don't get to choose any of your starters, entree, or dessert options. DO NOT ORDER THE DOMESTIC WAGU OR A5 WAGU MEAT!! IT'S A JOKE, WASTE OF MONEY, JUST PITIFUL. Will probably never stay at the MGM again either for letting this be the class of restaurant they offer.

tb7EqHFtGez-SqXeetCE3w.text: How to start this review?  1st. Went and gave my reservation and was immediately sat at our table. 2nd wasn't sure what to eat but I knew I wanted a good steak so waiter suggested chefs menu. 3rd was expensive but after few questions went with it. 4th I left the selection up to him and boy did he did not disappoint 3-4 things off each course plus dessert selection to die for! With all that said this was easily best meal I've ever eatin. Yes it was expensive but well worth it. Think I will do it again before I leave Saturday.

1e2nSRbDwNDCJhewS9tsXg.text: This review pertains to the Restaurant Week Prix Fixe for $50.10.  The Skinny: solid steak house, good sides, pretty good desserts - however issues with serving sizes (4), service: great, warm and friendly (4), value: the prix fixe menus are the thing to get here... a la carte is very pricey and I wouldn't recommend it (3).  We used to hit Craftsteak when it was still just Craftsteak. The prix fixe menu was around $50-60 per person and pre-Top Chef fame. The reason why we loved it was the quality, the variety and the reasonable cost. Since then, they've steadily raised the prices to around $80/person which is way overpriced (plus they changed the beef to black angus... it used to be kobe.)  So we returned for Restaurant Week for it's more reasonable price point at $50.10/person. We had 5 people at our table and we were quite pleased by the spread.  Service was quite prompt, warm and efficient. Our server was pleased that we had come in for the Restaurant week event and was eager to help us use our vouchers for free drinks. The manager did stop by to greet us and ensure we were having a good time.  We were served the grilled quail, shaved fennel salad, persian cucumber/watercress salad, mozzarella salad for appetizers. This was followed by prime flat iron steak, grilled angus skirtsteak, sweet corn, yukon potatoes, scallops with the lemon vinaigrette and a dish of baby shitake mushrooms. (for more details, please see the above pics).  The grilled quail was tender, perfectly seasoned and absolutely delicious. As were all three of the starter salads. We actually received two dishes of the mozzarella salad although we would have preferred more of the fennel salad. Along with the piping hot butter pan rolls, all the flavours of the food worked together beautifully.  The two beef dishes were well-executed and I loved the springs of fresh thyme. The scallops had a wonderful caramelization on both sides.The corn was fabulous as always and we were given two dishes of this.   Although I really like the flavours of their Yukon Gold potatoe puree, I do like my potatoes to be a little less soft (albeit it's a puree... right? but still a little texture would be better). The shitake mushrooms were a very small serving size considering that this dish was to be shared amongst 5 of us. Same goes for the potato puree.  We had two rather large servings of skirtsteak and flat iron prime with relatively smaller portions of sides. I think I would have like more sides rather than so much beef.  Dessert consisted of five separate dishes: a peach pavlova, a chocolate panna cotta, a molten chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream, monkey bread with banana ice cream and a traditional cheesecake.  Of the 5 desserts, the monkey bread and the molten chocolate cake were my favourite. The warm monkey bread had a rich cinnamon, nut topping and was perfectly paired with banana gelato. The molten chocolate cake was moist on the outside, runny on the inside - just the way it's supposed to be.  The chocolate panna cotta was a little too firm texturally. While I did like the peach sorbet on top of the pavlova, the pavlova itself was a little too thick and thus felt very hard overall. The cheesecake was good but nothing special.  In essence, this is simple food is done right. The only problems were the proportions of the side dishes and some issues with the desserts. This results in a 4 star review.  I have to say, for $50, it's a good deal but certainly not $80ish as it normally is. Because we did the Wet Republic event, we got 30.10/person voucher plus a coupon for a free drink each. So overall, we paid $30ish per person (including tax and tip). It was great seeing our bill at the end.

EZIv0wSSfrckOsAL20w5TA.text: This is one of my most favorite restaurants in Las Vegas.   The skirt steak is UNREAL and pair that with their killer mashed potatoes or spinach and you have a recipe for a perfect dinner.   The service here always consistent and best in class, plus they make a perfect martini with blue cheese olives.  OH! and the bread! The gluten filled bread goodness is buttery crack that sets off all alarms in your brain that you are about to indulge in one delicious meal.

quGPWkUdQOyzOeJgctREww.text: My sister decided on Craftsteak for her birthday dinner- score.  The service deserves 5 stars I really appreciated how the waiter didn't pressure us to get more than we needed. He was honest about the portion sizes and suggested great appetizer pairings.   For 5 people we shared 2 sampler menus for the grade 7 wagyu (50/50 mix between  wagyu and angus) plus an extra side and it was the perfect amount...satisfied and borderline too bloaty to go out afterward haha  The dinner rolls were good with a sprinkle of sea salt on top. The butter was really interesting it kind of tasted like cheese...rich and delicious.  Appetizers: Prawns Frise bacon and blue cheese salad: man breaking the slighty fried egg and mixing it through the salad = heaven  Prosciutto ham + fig compote = the pairing was delicious  Caesar salad  Zee meat: So I ate wagyu for the first time in Taiwan and I remember it being melt on your mouth omg I want to faint delicious. However, I think since our meat that night was a higher ratio of angus, it didn't give the same effect for the ribeye BUT the flank steak was surprisingly so tender and perfect (and the waiter said it was a better cut for people who don't like their meat cooked rare)  Dessert: Sorbet Lava cake Cheesecake  Meh all okay, I did have major food envy for the table next to us' monkey bread.    Still dreaming about the australian grade 10 wagyu...one day.

gzYMoodGWlQpZEeK3CckCA.text: Went on a really busy night with reservations.  Hostesses were SLAMMED with people at the desk with demands.  I felt for them.  They were really nice, smiled, and did their best.   As for the dinner, order light on the sides.  We over ordered and had tons of food leftover.    Honestly, the steaks were A-OK.  I've had better at the premium steak chains.  The steaks were good, not great like at Ruth's in Anaheim, City Hall in Scottsdale, or DelFrisco's in Vegas.

S_shUpPcwNLgujo8eHNsgg.text: Always nice to spend anniversary dinners at nice Vegas restaurant.  For 200 bucks, I think I got a great meal. We were planning to get the tasting menu before we got to Vegas, but my friend and her bf went the day before us and didnt like it at all. So we went for the straight menu, our server Wallace (i think thats his name) was great. Also he introduced us to this Malbec that went so well with our meaty dinner!  We started off with the Wagu Steak Tartare, my first time trying meat tartare. WOW it was soooo good, and they give you a generous amount! My gf got the Surf and Turf, filet mignon and diver sea scallops. OMG she fell in love with the scallops. I got the rib eye that was cooked perfectly, with a side of asparagus that was nicely seasoned. I was so stuffed that I took half my meat back to the hotel. They also give you these personal sized A1 sauce. They gave us these little treats for our Anniversary + our sorbet desserts. Made us happy campers!  What an awesome dinner! Me and my gf have been 2 for 2 now on anniversary dinners in Vegas. I think the only reason I didnt give this place a 5 star is that they had served some people who literally looked like they came out of the pool area with their board shorts and drinks in hand. That kind of makes the place seems a bit tacky.   I was pleased at the food though, atleast I can say I ate at a top chef judge's restaurant. Tom gets a thumbs up!

JDYtzc0_THCbQHr72aG5Jw.text: After having heard Tom Colicchio pontificate week after week on Top Chef about his approach and expectations of food, we went to his Craftsteak restaurant, located in the MGM Grand Hotel, with something of a chip on our collective shoulders. Would his restaurant live up to the hype and high standards he espouses on Top Chef? After having enjoyed a dinner at Craftsteak, I can honestly and emphatically say, YES! And then some. This is how a Top Chef restaurant should be run. The food is exceptional, the restaurant decor is soothing and low-keyed, and the service is world-class without being stuffy or formal.   We decided to splurge and order the 3-course Wagyu Beef Tasting. If you are an adventurous diner, I highly recommend putting your taste buds in the hands of the chef. I suggest it for those die-hard foodies like me who enjoy the variety and surprise of a tasting menu selected by the chef. The Wagyu beef choice did not disappoint. It was in fact, Foodie Heaven. Yes, it was on the expensive side but well worth the cost. Every dish was well prepared and seasoned to perfection. The beef was tender and flavorful and there was plenty of it. I especially enjoyed the Wagyu Tartare served with small rounds of toast. And not to be outdone, Chef Colicchio has a genius for a pastry chef at this location. Of the four different desserts we enjoyed, the mascarpone cheese cake bordered on sinful, not to mention the velvety-rich chocolate sorbet.  If you're in Las Vegas and want the very best dining experience that this city has to offer go to Craftsteak. You won't be disappointed.

Tv1-BU8uKOFHqWWyruN2dA.text: This was my 5th time here. I was very disappointed. The prix fix menu was very boring and not very tasty. In the past I could cut my steak with a fork. I dont ever remember skirt steak as an offering but this time my skirt steak could barely be cut with a steak knife. Appetizers were all tasteless. Service mediocre. Dessert and cocktail were excellent though. Definitely not worth the $430 for just me and my wife. Time to start trying some of the new steak restaurants in LV.

xp858eJFrFooIvAHuotLnA.text: We had an awesome dining experience at Craftsteak in Las Vegas (Inside MGM Grand). All of the food was fabulous. The atmosphere was romantic and very chic. Exactly the type of place you want to go while in Las Vegas.  My date and I had a large booth all to ourselves.    Best of all, the staff is extremely knowledgeable about gluten and celiac disease. Our waiter went through the menu and pointed out the (very few) items that I could not have. The waiter informed us that the restaurant had pretty much done away using wheat flour to because of the frequency of diners with celiac and wheat allergies.  The chef and cooking staff are schooled on cross-contamination, too. Also, they have an excellent wine list and I had a champagne cocktail in place of dessert that was like heaven in a glass.

4nKSzPMKZ2hfo25PINr_mw.text: I actually had low expectations, as I had bad experience at Collichio & Sons in NY and the MGM shopping mall is not that amazing either. But was pleasantly surprised at this place. The space is large and beautiful so you don't even think about being in the middle of a shit mall. The staff is friendly. The food was great. The Waygu skirt steak was great and worth the $75. All the sides were yummy. Especially the grits. And the monkey bread dessert was amazing.

WT4C-a20Ldo5K-1x6JDWPg.text: I had dinner with my 2 adult sons both of whom are well travelled eating at the best restaurants in New York, San Francisco, etc. We had a tasting menu of wagyu beef which included 4 different appetizers, 3 different cuts of wagyu beef (all cooked to perfection), grits and vegetables, topped off with great desserts. Both boys exclaimed that this was the best meal either of them have ever had anywhere. Expensive but well worth it.

mOiC1nQ6pfOtmpFBmRv9HA.text: The service is amazing. They treat you like royalty there. Great selection of wines! The steaks are so savory, tender, heavenly, and delicious. The fresh bread they give you while you wait for your food and is the most addicting thing I have ever come across. It tastes too good. I got fried Zucchini blossoms/flower and it was so good. It went well with my steak! I would def. come back here again next time I'm in Vegas.

6sAvt5ncYW-CWcnfQy20OA.text: i can't believe it's been a whole year since i've returned..But the wait was worth every bite..If you have a chance check out the a5 wagyu rib cap, melts like butter in your mouth..Worth every $$$$ the service the atmosphere, it's one of the BEST steakhouses on the strip

ZBQ1KZjKt3r1FQM09Jjkhw.text: Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful!  I came in just to order and take back to my room, I ordered the NY Strip, Mashed Potatoes, and a salad.  They included fresh baked rolls. Just know that when you want a good steak, you pay for a good steak. Worth every dollar! Though I couldn't enjoy my meal at that moment, it was just as good the next day.  What can I say, what happens in Vegas, stays in Vegas...okay, I drank way too much and thought a steak and bread would cure my stomach, but just the thought of eating made me sick. lol it's okay though, my boyfriend had no problems helping me enjoy this meal the next day lol. The staff was friendly and very funny. They helped entertain me while I was waiting to take my order back to my room. The guys were friendly and all smiles. Wish I could remember their names. But when I come back we will be sure to dine in and get the full experience of this amazing restaurant.

cjtftzqq0wM0ii8WMo8Pig.text: 4 stars on everything other than their steak. Not that the steak was bad, but that would only register a 3.5 stars. Their cauliflower was crazy awesome, as were other sides and appetizers. Overall experience gets 4 stars.

KcQKaeAjbcwRrxIE2AaZ8w.text: First a special  thank you to the lovely server Alexis, and to the Mgr. Christopher. i had a 125 room and food credit from the MGM hotel for the awful experience there, so i figured i might as well use it and enjoy a wonderful dinner at this place, very nice lounge, i was wwatching all the food go buy and it all looked incredible, i have always wanted to try a 2 lb lobster i ordered that and a half half order of the buffalo mozzarella and the heirloom tomatoes, everything was delicious of course i couldn't eat it all,  i took half to the room and polished it off, at 6am for breakfast, what made this a very special place, , the server had told the  manager, that i had issues with the Hotel, and he most caring adn generously served me an entire bottle of wine with dinner, tho inonly asked for  a glas, he said take it with you,, , i will be going back to Vegas in Nov, and tho i wont return to stay at the MGM, i will be back to eat at Craft Steak House, lovely ambience, all the food served very artfully, even

BmS41DC_zTKbJ-Cgb3mieg.text: Eventhough so many people gave this place good ratings... I would say that the complementary bread deserves the big HYPE for this restaurant.  I went with a party of 6, which we all had very high expectations. The first let down was the atmosphere. The tables and chairs did not seem sturdy, I'm sorry call me picky, but I feel like if a restaurant is going to charge me $50 for a rib eye steak then I need the tables dressed with white lining and the servers with white gloves on.   The bread made up for the Ikea furniture, as soon as the bread hits your mouth theres a buttery sweetness with a hint of salty, melts in your mouth and warm comfort goodness.  I ordered the rib-eye with gratin potatoes with warm salad with bacon and egg. The salad was very good, unusual but delightful. The steak could have used alot more flavor and the potatoes was just okay (I've had BETTER). The only other thing that stood out was the short ribs and the broccoli. There was another dish which I can't remember the name, but it was a rosotto like dish with brown rice, butternut squash, mushrooms and other components that I can not recollect.   Lastly, which may seem very trivial to everyone else but my party seem to take offense to it as well. One of our friends needed his food togo so the server took his plate to bag it up. To come back with a "THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU" bag (YES THE SAME BAG) any chinese fast food restaurant would give you for togo order. Then to add insult to injury the server sits his plastic bag which has his food in it ON THE FLOOR!!! We all had this "WTF" look on our face.  This would be my last time coming here, I rather go to Ruth's Chris any day.

8QKWtV4welDJAvVs0fxhNA.text: Rating would be 3 and a half. Really loved the lobster bisque and spinach salad. Free range chicken was amazing. We also had the T-bone steak it was ok my father has turned me into a picky steak person it was good but not amazing. Service started out well but lacked after main course arrived. It was way better then STK but not as good as the Michael Mina stripstreak.

AXYVhCaH2sR9jpUVJNKPRg.text: Wow, Craftsteak deserves the full 5 stars. We had a 5:30 p.m. reservation as we were seeing a 7 p.m. show. They immediately seated us, no wait! The interior of the restaurant is simply elegant. The entire wait staff was efficient, friendly, helpful without being intrusive. The recommendations were spot on and honest. As soon as our waiter came over to take our drink order, he acknowledged our show time and assured us they would have us out in plenty of time, and they did.  So here goes the food...... Start with rolls, fresh, hot out of the oven melt in your mouth fabulous.  Starters: Mr. B started with the Lobster Bisque, it was cream based, delicious, full of tender chunks of lobster. I started with the Buffalo Mozzarella with pistachio's, amazing. The Buffalo Mozzarella was creamy topped with finely chopped tomatoes and pistachio's which added a nice crunch. Drizzled with a Balsamic Vinegar and a tad bit of olive oil.  Main Course/Side Dishes Mr. B then opted for the 6 oz. Filet and Fresh Australian Crab. The steak was perfectly cooked, the Crab well after Deadliest Catch we all have more appreciation for Crab, and it didn't disappoint, Yum!! The Younger B, chose the Bison Flatiron and I can't even begin to tell you how incredible the Bison was, both of them shared a bit with me. The side dish he ordered was the butternut squash risotto served with Hen of the Woods, which is a mix of unusual mushrooms. It didn't last long, gone in less than 60 seconds. Now for me, yes I know I can't top the other two, but I went the light route and ordered the side dish of Fall Squash Agnolotti, topped with mushrooms. It was very good and I enjoyed each and every bite.  The wine was delicious, and we all agreed it is by far one of the best meals we have enjoyed in a very long time. My compliments to the Chef and thank you to Tom Collichio for setting the bar so high, you have created a fabulous restaurant.  I will tell you, it is quite pricey, so know this before going. The wines by the glass are all over $12 per glass, the steaks are all over $35 and the side dishes are ala carte and priced anywhere between $12 and $15. All I can say is it was very well worth it and I can't wait to go back.

ZJLOYCDvofAYj5POGKkG3Q.text: We were celebrating an event, so we wanted to love this meal. It was supposed to be our big dinner out for this trip to Vegas. In fairness to the restaurant, one of our party was not feeling well, which coloured the experience. However, we did signal the server that we didn't want to order too much food so as not to aggravate the situation. Instead of advising us that the portions are large, the server kept trying to upsell us on more dishes. Since the sides being suggested were $24, it came across as an attempt to pad the bill. A simple word of warning would have prevented us from ordering dishes that left our table 3/4 full. What we had was fine, but not spectacular. I ordered the seafood sampler for two ($56), which was fine. One of our party ordered a ribeye that was delicious. The deconstructed caesar salad was average, as were the fingerling potatoes. The Brentwood corn was quite good.   Servers, please take note: your job is to provide customers with a positive experience. If you do, no complaint will be made over the cost of the bill, and your efforts will be reflected in the tip. If you don't, all that your guests will remember is how you allowed your greed to overshadow their fun.

-F8dqDYtKtEz2Z45LNbSVA.text: Since we were staying at MGM, we decided to try Tom Colicchio's CraftSteak for Valentine's Day.  Let me first say that the place was very nice and the service excellent.  We had two waiters...still not sure why, but a nice touch.  We started with a Caesar Salad which was average, but loaded with anchovies...some of us don't like anchovies, but the waiter did not ask when we ordered.  The sides were Brussel Sprouts and Fries, neither of which were more than average.  Now we get to the steaks.  We ordered one Filet, one NY Strip and one Rib-eye.  I ordered the NY Strip medium rare plus since the waiter said that medium was warm pink middle.  The steak I received was RARE.  I asked for it to be returned and cooked to medium and after a 10 minute wait (the others in the party felt uncomfortable waiting for my food to return) the steak was still rare.  I had to eat around the edges to avoid the raw middle.  In addition, the cut of meat had a vein of grizzle running through it.  The other two in my party said their meat was average...similar to what you would get at Outback Steakhouse.  Oh, the peppercorn sauce was below average as well.  The dinner rolls were excellent...wouldn't want to forget to mention that.  Considering everything was a la carte and the steaks were over $50 each, we got out of there at $300 for three with no appetizers or dessert.  Ouch!

quMwNGLJg1wCtzPxtkvvOA.text: The most memorable meal of my life was at Craftsteak! The Platinum - KOBE - Beef - Steak will linger on my palate until the day I die! Don't be fooled by the run-of-the-mill steak houses claiming that they serve KOBE beef. At Craftsteak you'll learn that there is a difference in grading KOBE beef, and enjoy a culinary experience you will never forget!

4_ktD-8b-WGy4vXH4AZCyA.text: I was in Vegas for a bachelorette party and we decided to do a nice dinner here before heading out on the town.  loved the ambiance and the staff were so incredibly nice. our table of six girls made up about 90% of the female clientele in the restaurant since many of the other tables looked like they were full of business men and guys out for their bachelor party. since we were planning on a long night out we didn't want to cut it short by eating ourselves into a food stupor. the staff were so nice and accommodating about us sharing our food since they said they usually serve family style.  Here's the food breakdown:  Oysters on the half shell: fresh, crisp, tasted like they were straight from the ocean.  No complaints there.  Frisee Salad: Basic salad. good nothing amazing, but I enjoyed it.   Porterhouse (shared 3 ways): Meat was definitely high quality and delicious! I like my meat cooked rare, but since I was sharing with 2 other people we went medium rare so the meat was a bit more done than I care for.  The meat was still flavorful and super juicy. We actually didn't even finish the porterhouse even among 3 girls with very healthy appetites!  Sides: We ordered asparagus, yukon gold puree, and hen of the woods mushrooms.  At a steakhouse I'm really all about the meat so quality of the sides are important, but not my main focus. I enjoyed the asparagus and the yukon gold puree.  I usually enjoy any and all foods, but I have to admit the hen of the woods mushrooms were new to me and definitely had a taste that I found peculiar and just didn't work for me, but everyone else seemed to enjoy them.   Dessert:  Table of 7 girls shared a chocolate souffle. IT WAS AMAZING.  Enough said... I'm not that big on chocolate but that souffle made me feel some feelings. ;)    Overall, food was consistently good and the offerings were fairly basic steakhouse fare. Staff was wonderfully attentive and nice. I would have appreciated a better $50-$75/bottle selection of wines.  I know it's a finer dining experience, but after dropping all that money on food a decent affordable bottle of wine would have made it that much better. :)

nDAV0qx939edkhPg21XFLw.text: Our dinner was a party of four. Atmosphere was comfortable & Service was impeccable. We started off with The lobster bisque- perfect! Our friends insisted on sharing the tar tar. Pleasantly surprised about the cured meat.  It was good! We ordered way to many entrees but enjoyed tasting the variety. From potatoes Au gratin, risotto, asparagus, and potato puree, everything was delicious. The waiter encouraged us to try their most popular, skirt steak. A-MAZ-ING!!! Wow. And very nice portions! We should have shared! I had the filet mignon. Very tasty but was wanting some more of the skirt steak! And if that wasn't enough, to top it all off, we all shared the monkey bread...Our friend had mentioned food coma before the meal. Now I know what he was talking about! Five stars all the way around!

zAsv8EQ-R_wwG3jnMs3_5g.text: I love CRAFT LA and this is the second time I have been to CRAFTSTEAK in Vegas. I will say, Tom Colicchio sure knows how to run a restaurant. Service is always impeccable and the food is worth the price. We had fresh clams to start ($3 each) and we ordered the NY Strip (bone in) and the Filet and both were cooked in juices perfectly. We even tried the grits and the turnips (who has turnips on the menu) and they both did not disappoint! It might be a little heavy of a dinner if you want to go out and party afterwards, but if you are craving steak, you need to come here in Las Vegas at the MGM Grand.

KtYEiE9LdIwtWsZegOenHw.text: Best grits I ever had! Broccoli was fantastic. Steak was cooked perfect. WOW, can't say enough

9qaQNS5vrvehx9WuxIljzw.text: My girlfriend and I loved our Craftsteak experience. Everything from the moment you are greeted till the time you leave is first class. I enjoyed a perfectly grilled bone-in ribeye. I am not a steak snob, but I know the difference between good and great and this one hit the spot!  Delicious!!! In a city of thousands of quality dining experiences, I would recommend Craftsteak in a heartbeat!

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 18 oz grilled bone in Ribeye

0gcaFVLlquxg412cKpXQTw.text: Incredible, excellent dinner while on vacation.  Perhaps the finest steak in memory.  Cooked to perfection. Also had the beets salad and charcuterie platter as shared appetizers. Superb!  Shared sides of potatoes, asparagus, and carrots.  Well 2/3 were great. Carrots were surprisingly tasteless.  Mostly tasted the char.  Service was flawless.  Very helpful in suggesting items and preparation (companion got the hangar steak and he suggested going with medium since its thinner-very helpful).  Nice, classy setting except tables were a bit too close. We were on the long couch near the back and tables so close you could very easily hear the next several tables.  Overall, these 2 problems (carrots and seating) are so minor I'll keep them at 5 stars.  Highly recommend.  A bit of a spurge but worth it.

r4rDvzqey7Po8uRNV1OoGw.text: This is the best restaurant I have been to in my lifetime! The dining experience was absolutely exquisite. Everything from the food to our service was amazing!

GlTteYKyndwx9mBl6CuEag.text: Had an amazing meal here. Wonderful service. Highly recommend. My only advice would be to go for the chef's selection menu.  Ignore the seafood and get a better grade of meat. Lobster was outstanding but everyone cooks lobster the same way. And you can get it anywhere. If you are here. You're here for the meat.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monkey bread dessert.
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster tail
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster tail portion of chef&#39;s selection surf and turf.

0HdHq9NThMGI09I6zg65xw.text: Man, I was so excited to come here but was so disappointed in the service and also the wine pricing.  We waited for someone to take our drink order - appetizer came out and we still didn't have a drink,. Finally got one.  Finished apps, drinks. Waiting, waiting. No one checked on us. our steaks came and waiter finally came over to get a second drink offer. For a guy that preaches service so much, and for these prices - i expect great service. I'm from Chicago so I expect high prices and the wine list is jacked up so high - and if you are going to charge that - service should be so much better. So disappointed - apparently doesn't care that much

7048o1cY6sQBc_-gnI88Pg.text: Arguably the best Steakhouse in Vegas. Overwhelmingly incredible.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ieE_eVZXP4HvpaHU1NvNLg.text: Easily one of the best steakhouses in town. In fact, it is one of the only celebrity vehicle restaurants worth anything. Craftsteak delivers consistently with service quality of food, execution and experience. The prices are high but acceptable, whereas most places in Vegas simply gouge you. I am a local who has eaten at most places here, and Craftsteak is one of the few that brings me back time and time again.

aELUAq2VgKiP93KJTDnl0g.text: Took my wife here for her birthday gift when we went to Vegas.  Was wanted a small dinner, but for about $200, they offered us a 3 course meal with a crap load of very very good food.  They gave us so much food, we didn't even eat it all.  For the first course, we got like 3 plates of unique salads and soups, 2nd course like like 3 types of very good steaks, and 3rd course was like 3-4 plates of dessert.  We were full by the 1st course, and force feed our selfs on the 2nd course, and we picked at our dessert.  I will go back again.  I got to Vegas a lot, so hopefully the manager sends us an invite for some specials...wink-wink, hint-hint!!!

1K4qrnfyzKzGgJPBEcJaNQ.text: Craftsteak is legit. Rachel, our server, was awesome.  She was so attentive to our group.   We brought our own wine but some of our party ordered cocktails - the French martini was delicious.   The table bread was served warm with the perfect sprinkling of salt and the butter was soft (important details here...nothing worse than hard butter with bread).  I ordered the $79 wagyu skirt steak which is a splurge but it was highly recommended so I had to check it out. It was delicious and could have easily fed 3 people. Good to know for next time! We got a variety of sides to share including the shishito peppers, cauliflower, Brussels sprouts, mushrooms, spinach and butternut squash. The lobster salad was fresh - perfect squeeze of lemon.  The shishito peppers were not my fave, there was something missing so I ended up salting them. The shrimp cocktail came with 5 pieces of plump shrimp for $23. The cucumber salad was tasty. We ordered a side of fries for the kids, I think I ended up eating at least half of the bowl. Ha. They were cooked perfectly with the right amount of crunch and seasoning.  Dessert was amazing. Apple cobbler with vanilla ice cream was delicious as was the souffle with caramel ice cream. I didn't try the monkey bread served with banana ice cream because someone was holding it hostage at the other end of the table.  As you can see, we ordered a good portion of the menu so I can easily say you should try Craftsteak for a special occasion. It ain't cheap but good eats.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. wagyu skirt steak

OCbqObSFhp7_TlTnoYbR7g.text: Truly the best meal I have ever had in Las Vegas and even more, perhaps the best steak of my life. They start you off with Hawaiian rolls served with clarified butter, you could make the trip here just for those. For entree I went with the domestic ribeye which was cooked to perfection. It melted in my mouth, so delectable and juicy. My boyfriend had the domestic Waygu NY strip and you could certainly taste the difference of the beef, unbelievably savory and delicious. For our side dish we went with the spring pea risotto...  risotto is a difficult beast to conquer - and craftsteak totally nailed it. If you are staying at the MGM Grand there should be no doubt in your decision making but to eat here. Worth every penny and would come back in a heart beat. I understand now why Tom Colicchio is such a great judge on Top Chef. Mad respect!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. domestic Waygu NY strip and anniversary complimentary dessert

vkU-AsQ5lxZCj-CIYpL_mg.text: I'd say except for the steak and chicken the dishes were good.  We got both the Ribeye and NY strip.  The steaks were just average.  Completely burnt on the outside and raw on the inside.  If steak is going to be bloody you better make sure that the sinew is cut out.  Don't know about you, but i don't appreciate chewing on sinew on raw meet.  They also needed more seasoning for such a big cut of meat, but there was none on the table.  Our tables ordered the chicken as well.  Other than me i don't think anyone else tried it.  i'm a sucker and have to try everything.  The chicken was dry and without any real taste.  The rest of the appetizer, side dishes, and desert were excellent...not enough to make up for the main entree.  This is my second time at Craftsteak.  I was disappointed last time as well.  Would not try it a third time.  Ended up going to another steakhouse on the same trip as i didn't feel that i had my fill of steak.

2-aLKsvMs4iwMNJrFoj6JA.text: This is one of the best steak houses I have been to on the Las Vegas strip.  The ribeye is melt in your mouth delicious. Can't wait to return!

HPu_SJlUWUid-pXZFVjRvw.text: Visited with my wife this past weekend and once again reinforced its position as one of my favs in Vegas over a long period of time! The food, service and wine is just tops across the board! After visiting a number of times and having to surrender and not be able to finish our meals, we finally got the ordering down right...an app to start, one stark to share and 3-4 sides and it was perfect! Everything is just executed perfectly and has been each and every time we have come. You just can't go wrong here.

XxuLjbsmoKWxdsJUb4XBPg.text: I had big expectations for this steakhouse as I am a fan of top chef! Lol We arrived as a bridal party group 5 min prior to reservation time and still had to wait to be seated. A bit annoyed by this, but the wait was not tremendous. The waiter was great... definitely knowledgeable about the menu and the food. We had a vegan friend who was able to get a plate specific to her needs which was awesome. The food was exceptional ... if you are a steak connoisseur .... you will not be disappointed! There was a large selection of wines and cocktails ...the ones we purchased were overall delicious. I gave it a 4/5 not because of the food ... but due to small things that could have been smoother. The wait time at the beginning being one, a few errors on 3 orders and the split check fiasco. At the end of service they brought out homemade cookies for the bride as a congratulatory gift which was super kind... and the host was nice enough to take a group pic for us. I would definitely recommend this restaurant!

CkpnYevFf9mQz-m7c3QX4A.text: Service was impeccable, 4 different people serving us. We received 4 bread rolls, they were so tasty. My husband had the braised beef short ribs, he says it was fantastic, we shared grean beans and pured potatoes, so very good flavor, I had the roasted chicken which was very flavorful. It was a very impressive dinner. We would definitely return. Great job to all the waiters and waitresses. We had our picture taken and purchased as it was a great Anniversary dinner. We chose not to have dessert as we had cakes in our room, however they brought a plate with happy anniversary written on it with two cookies.

A1qn1ybVG2V_bHec6DYTuA.text: Me and my wife went in for the special it was $80 per person and it was a three course meal if you want to call it that more like a five course meal. The quill was amazing as was the steak mashed potatoes and corn and everything else that came with it.  My favorite part of it was the desert as it came with four or five different variety of options that included ice cream monkey bread and a few other delicious items.  All in all you will not be disappointed guaranteed  Chris was very nice they really did go above and beyond.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entree

Ca6_iKhHkx3tK5ShRf6b7Q.text: Came here a week ago while my boyfriend I were on a little weekend get away to Vegas. We wanted to try a new steakhouse and I went ahead and made reservations for craftsteak. The inside is beautiful, dimly lit and very romantic. Our waitress was nice but seemed a little nervous, like she might have been new. Order a good amount of food but I can't say that anything really stood out of me. It was all just OKAY. The wagyu rib eye was good as expected but I wouldn't be back. There was something missing but I can't quite put my finger on it. I would stick to mastros.

P-G9xaM4Dn1eMzR1-tQIYA.text: I tried to keep my mouth shut but after reading some reviews, I just can't.  A party of 13 of us had dinner at this location on 11/13 for two friends birthdays.  I have to say the food was very good (not great), took forever to come out but the service was absolutely the worst ever.  Extremely slow, our waiter never asked us if we wanted a second drink, if our meal was ok and more... he was to busy hanging out with the 4 top table of friends he knew. I was fuming by the end of dinner but my friends didn't want me to cause a seen and ruin our night out. You would think a waiter would pay close attention as well as management to parties spending sever thousand dollars dine at their location. But after seeing other reviews, it's a pattern of this establishment.  Myself and the 12 others will never return to this restaurant. What a huge disappointment!

JtB6ja0K225a7dkfPLkRiQ.text: Came here to celebrate our anniversary and had high hopes since we've heard great reviews for the LA location. The restaurant was decorated nicely with classy decor. Our booth felt private and overlooked the rest of the tables.   The service was somewhat spotty. The hostess was pleasant, our main waiter was nice but seemed to have disappeared toward the end of dinner. The guys who brought our the food were very nice and attentive.  Appetizers: 1) sea scallops- came with 3 large scallops which were perfectly cooked; however the taste was lacking. It had a very light lemony butter taste but it just didn't stand out. I would not order this again.  2) wagyu tartare- this was one of my favorites. Delicious and flavored just right. Came with plenty of crostini to spread that delicious meat on. If you like tartare- try it!  3) rib eye steak- very big disappointment!! It was more than $50 and came lukewarm. Seasoned and cooked well but the temperature really killed it. It was also way too fatty and we had to cut large chunks of fat out to eat it. I love my fat but it was just too much.  4) braised short ribs- this was very flavorful and tender. I wish it came with some sort of starch to balance it out. Eating this by itself was a bit too salty and it was difficult to eat a lot of it.  5) risotto side dish- I really liked this one with red corn, prosciutto and cilantro. Great flavors and risotto cooked just right!  6) monkey bread for dessert- got this because of all the fantastic reviews. It cane warm and soft but way too sweet for my taste :(  Overall it was an extremely pricey meal for subpar food. I'm disappointed Tom!

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monkey bread dessert- very good but very, very, very sweet
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib eye (~$50): very tender and flavorful but came lukewarm and with way too much fat
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib ($39)- great flavor and super tender

6y5pAAZWFS7e94053t0qAw.text: Three course dinner ftw!!  I'm so glad that the fiance and I finally got to try craftsteak. I've been wanting to try this place for a while because we do love our steaks :) Our favorite place for steaks is Mastro in Beverly Hills. We've also had really great experience at CUT in Vegas. So this time we want to try something different and we chose craftsteak because of the reviews on yelp. We made same day reservation and we were seated immediately after we arrived.   The server was just alright, he explained the menu very quickly that we both were kinda lost on how the three course menu work. I felt like he shouldn't be in a hurry in explaining the menu, especially because we told him that it was our first time dining there. We have to ended up calling him back to explain it again. Thoroughly.  We got the domestic wagyu three course meal, and we wanted to get ribeye for both of us but he said that you can't have the same cut of steak in a table, which is weird. So we settled with New York and ribeye cuts. We are allowed to choose 2 salads and 3 sides. We got a wagyu beef tartar and a shrimp cocktail. The tartar was quite amazing (that was my first time eating it), the shrimps in the cocktail was huge and plump, the mozzarella salad was quite yummy and the pork belly salad was just ok (nothing special).   When the steaks arrived I realized that my ribeye was missing the fatty ring around it, which usually makes the steak much more juicier. I was a little sad, but my fiance's New York steak looks amazing! So I just let it go and moved on to try the sides. The Chanterelles mushroom was delish, the potato gratin was creamy and yummy, but the risotto was too cheesy and looked almost like Mac and cheese. We finished everything except the risotto, which was disappointing.   We were stuffed at this point and we almost forgot about the desserts. The desserts were chef's choice, so we didn't know what we were getting. The brought out 4 plates of dessert! Wow. We got the monkey bread with caramel and vanilla ice cream, the chocolate peanut butter mousses with chocolate ice cream, white chocolate ice cream and spicy (fruit) sorbet and a plate of mixed fresh fruits. We really liked the monkey bread and the mousse, but the spicy sorbet was bland.   Overall it was a nice experience to have and we would probably come back once we've tried every other steakhouse there is in Vegas. The ambiance was nice, the service could be better but it was prompt, and the food was really good for the most part. If you feel like trying this place, I'd recommend getting the three course meal for sure. You are going to be getting full size of everything and you will definitely be stuffed at the end. We spent a little bit over $300 before tips, but it was worth every penny because we got a lot of different things.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. monkey bread with vanilla ice cream and chocolate peanut butter mousse with chocolate ice cream
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. medium well Wagyu ribeye steak
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu New York steak

C3u8GZaLHYuC9Ch44zz_vA.text: Cool atmosphere. Great drinks. Larry our bartender is one bad ass dude! He took his time and explained the various whisky's. We tried an assortment of drinks from around the world. Can't wait to come back soon!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best drinks in town!
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Larry our bartender is one bad ass dude! He took his time and explained the various whisky&#39;s.
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool atmosphere!

nFNnOzpYCp7s4UO6nSunlA.text: Been coming here for over 5 years, and somehow it's miraculously better each time I come!! The chilled seafood platter and a glass of wine is the right way to start. The seared scallops are plump and perfectly seared, tender in the center. The steaks medium rare is the amazing -- any cut. A definite must if you're in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steaks on steaks
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared scallops topped with roasted fennel
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilled seafood platter

Skx8OODy7Mg9bOM-UDbUPw.text: WOW talk about great gourmet food!! Came here for a friend's 30th birthday and the meal was magnificent.   Every steak we tried was fantastic and the sides were so delicious.  Favorite steak was the filet and the New York Strip!  We also managed to try a few of the desserts and boy were they decadent. The appetizers are amazing. Scallops are a must have! DO not leave without having them.   Don't fill up on the rolls as that can be mighty tempting!

hmTOEF5J1bkUf6ZId_75Vg.text: Great food, super friendly and attentive staff, great drinks and ambiance.  I ordered the T-Bone Steak which was outstanding and very flavorful. My wife ordered the Filet Mignon which was tasty but a bit overcooked.   The complimentary bread was freshly baked - delicious. We shared an ordered of asparagus and half orders of the Mashed Potatoes and Risotto.  Probably one of the best risottos we have had.   The drinks were good - not overwhelmingly strong but very flavorful. The service was outstanding. The staff is very attentive and helpful. No complaints.   Recommend it for a group outing or for a dinner date... The place is good for both.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. T Bone Steak

73n37bkr2_7AaBHPTA-OJg.text: For as much as I like watching Tom critique the Top Chef contestants, I would think the food that his restaurant serves would be completely on point. I don't think anything was bad, but after paying $300, I don't think anything was particularly good either.   First, it's a little weird that there were people dressed in t-shirts and shorts there for dinner; I guess that's not Craftsteak's fault because it's Vegas and everyone does as they please.   The wine bottles are especially marked up, which really annoys me. I know that's how they make money and they have to build Tom's fortune and pay for his dome wax, but it really puts me off.   The food was mediocre. The filet that I asked for medium was medium well in parts and medium rare in the rest. Plus, it needed a lot more seasoning! What does Tom say? Simple salt and pepper! The brussel sprouts and potato gratin were slightly better seasoned but still needed a lot more flavor to be memorable. The of the desserts, the sorbets were very good, but the carrot cake was a bummer.   Take my advice and go to Mesa Grill instead!

vh6R7tSh2Jn9j44DRFEOAw.text: Outstanding.   The food was amazing and service top notch.   The tasting menu was so amazing. Salads , oyster and the butternut squash Devine.  The seafood trio is outstanding and dessert sensational.   Great evening. Great food

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate dessert
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sorbet
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Moneybread

EHE8IVDlugF1hV-uWUPWFg.text: I was in town for a "boys weekend" and suggested rather than blowing our money on gambling, we spend it on a good meal. I had not been here before, but I'm a foodie and know of Tom Colicchio. Our party of 4 came on a Sunday night and all I can say was our meal here was epic.   We ended up getting the Chef's Beef Selection of the Domestic Wagyu ($155 per person for two people) and Domestic Wagyu Surf &Turf ($185 per person for two people).  First course consisted of: Shrimp Cocktail, Sea Scallops, Wagyu Tartare, Wild Arugula and Warm Frisee. Wild Arugula was nothing special, but everything else was very good. The Warm Frisee was so flavorful and definitely our favorite.   Second course consisted of (Sides): Mushroom Assortment, Asparagus, Potato Puree, and Corn. Again, all were delicious, but standouts were the Potato Puree which was buttery and made you go back for seconds & thirds. Mushroom Assortment was yummy and nice to be able to compare the differences between each.  (Entree): Lobster, Ribeye, NY Strip, Filet Mignon and Skirt Steak. Lobster was fresh and cooked to perfection. Each meat was tastier than the previous one, but my favorite was the skirt steak that melted in your mouth and was to die for.  Final dessert courses consisted of: Assorted Sorbet, Chocolate Souffle, Bread Pudding, Monkey Bread, Chocolate Mousse and Farmers Market Fruit. All were delectable, but the Bread Pudding and Monkey Bread were top notch.  Service and staff were on point and our waiter was knowledgeable about the menu and attentive. We appreciated the table touch by the manager as well.  You really can't go wrong with any choices here. There was so much food that we actually couldn't finish all the meats and desserts. It's not cheap and you'll spend a pretty penny (our bill came to about $250/person after a drink, tax & tip), but life is too short to always eat at buffet in Vegas.   If ordering any of the Chef's Beef Selection - bring your appetite and be prepared to be in a food coma after. I'll definitely be back...

aVjoSowDVNv44_uuruUCUg.text: I would like to go back here to give it another chance since the entrees were absolutely phenomenal. The dry aged NY strip was perfect and the braised short ribs were the most tender I've ever eaten. The Lobster Bisque deserves 5 stars as well. The side dishes however were all lacking flavor and seasoning.  The potato puree was nearly inedible and did not add anything to the dish.  The risotto could have been mistaken for the cheese grits I had at MGM buffet earlier for Brunch.  The most disappointing part of the experience was the service. Our waiter was knowledgable and helpful in  choosing our menu, but after we ordered we didn't see him again.  No one one the wait staff came to our table between getting our food and delivering the check.   We talked to management about the lack of flavor in the side dishes and they removed them from the bill reconciling the experience enough to keep us pleased and wanting to give Craft Steak another try next time we come to Las Vegas.  When I see a renowned name like Tom Collichio I expect perfection.  This meal was not that but we were happy overall.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The NY Strip. Yukon purée, Brussels sprouts and risotto

jKpMuTwzh8E5ScsP2aFcnA.text: One of the best meals we have ever had.  And...one of the biggest price tags, but worth it.  I was with a party of 5. The service was exceptional, from checking in, to waiter, to manager and other support personnel.  We ordered the tasting menu for $125 and what a treat! All of the appetizers were great and we loved the sides (especially the corn). The only drawback was the baby squash which was fairly tasteless. We received steaks: New York, Filet Mignon, Hangar, Ribeye. They were cooked perfectly and brought to the table sliced up. Oh and can't forget the Parker Rolls, melt in your mouth delicious. Then the desserts came - chocolate mousse, pannacotta, ice cream and sorbet, monkey bread and a peach upside down cake - wow and worth it! All of this was paired with a Flowers Pinot Noir.  We all look forward to going again, not to be missed!

QDlfkL46ZzeNOGXRtkr6dA.text: Basic Basic Basic...We tried this place because we were heading next door to The Trop for a show later that evening and were celebrating our wedding anniverary.  Big mistake...we probably would have had the same meal at their steakhouse, for 1/2 the price.  Everything we ordered was bland and overpriced.  Wine list was extremely stuffy and the prices were outrageous.  We weren't on someone else's expense account so we chose to share items; Caesar salad-tasteless--very little parm and dressing was flavorless.  Not offered freshly ground pepper and one of our many waiters just dropped the salad and left.  Clams--these were pretty good, but again---they didn't do anything but shuck them, accompaniments were also basic.  18oz bone in ribeye--No crust and meat was very average at best.  Diver Scallops--these were OK.  They were a little under-cooked.  Monkey Bread was the best part of the meal, which was quickly brought way down by the peanut butter girl scout cookies they brought out for our anniversary.  Are you kidding me?  No comp on the Monkey Bread dessert, no "Happy Anniversary" as we were being seated.  No "Welcome Mr. & Mrs...." No welcoming attitude and appreciation for the business we were giving them or any recognition of our special day.  There are many better options out there if you want to spend $300+ for 2 people. As frequent Vegas visitors (4-5x year) this will not be on our list of "go-to's".

usWaDmBFEIUzVbmCWN1_sQ.text: Probably the worst service I have yet to receive in Vegas. That's quite a statement, as service here is pretty sub-par in general.   I came to Craftsteak with 3 other young people last night for dinner following an event and I can confidently assume that the service was due to age discrimination.   Our orders were taken and we were never visited again by the waiter until he approached our table over an hour later with "did you get dessert menus yet?" There was a very kind bus-lady taking care of our table to clean plates and silverware, but for $100 a sitting, I expect the waiter to come check on the table intermittently and have an ounce of personality. Food was fine, but I've certainly had much better at a steakhouse.    If you aren't fond of your job, the door is behind you. And if you think that young people don't tip or notice bad service, you're sorely mistaken. I will never return to Craftsteak and I will make sure that my colleagues and cohorts know, too.

jM7Y7eyufpBCK_-qGrWQZg.text: Amazing meal except........   Too much food.    We went with the tasting menu.    Lobster bisque was really good and had a lot of lobster in comparison to most.    We stuffed ourselves on the main course to the point we couldn't take it anymore, leaving almost have the entree course uneaten.  Just when we are ready to go,  they bring out the desert course.    With FOUR huge plates of desert (there were only two of us).    Go hungry..... And don't fill up on the bread.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desert.   The Monkey Bread was unreal!
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hanger Steak
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Filet

tAqxJhWbhnbgDWoVJ_4KxA.text: Best steak in Las Vegas hands down, favorite all around high end restaurant. Sides, appetizers, and desserts all done perfectly and they have a very good wine selection as well.

vQEXD63nrzq7e5oOEF4YCQ.text: What a wonderful meal and experience. After having to change our reservation 3 times due to messed up flights and conflicting engagements we finally made it in to the restaurant. We were seated at our table and promptly greeted by one of our 3 servers. She talked us through the menu and made her recommendations and left us to talk for a little while. We were then greeted by our busser who throughout the evening didn't let our water glasses fall below the halfway mark. Everyone was so pleasant and engaging.  Then came the food. They brought us those unbelievably, perfectly salty and savory dinner rolls with creamy butter to start. We ordered some oysters and the warm frisee salad and they came out perfectly. The salad was full flavored and delicious. We split 2 steaks and 3 sides and wow, the flavor profiles went through the roof! The steaks were cooked to perfection and were so tender and buttery that you could almost cut them with a fork. You must get the masked potatoes too. They were as creamy, sweet, and buttery as you could ever want them to be.  As we sat there talking about how full we were the server brought over the dessert menu. My brothers girlfriend commented that it would almost be foolish not to at least split 1. Naturally we order the toffee monkey bread and as they brought it out I realized that they were surprising me for my birthday, which is next week.
