-G6PY7H0pDjG0TFdXsgFJg.text: Made reservation for dinner and still had to wait 10-15min to get seated. It wasn't too bad of a wait since they temporarily sat us at the bar and football was on.   Everyone was really nice it seems like each table gets two waiters/waitresses so there's always someone to help us if we needed anything.   Overall experience with customer service was fanatic. However, the food there didn't really blow me away. Don't get me wrong everything was delicious, especially their lobster bisque! But nothing really exceeded my expectation in terms of taste. I wish they had a bigger/better dessert selection though.

li7cEQAGBJ0lbDFdQFhyBw.text: This was THE BEST STEAK I've ever had.  I don't write too many five-star reviews, and this is the first one where I use caps.  It is THAT GOOD.  It blows every other steak I've had out of the water, and that includes Peter Luger's in New York!  I had the bone-in ribeye.  Not only did they use a perfectly cut and marbled piece of steak, it was aged and cooked perfectly too to my liking.  Also it's cooked very plain and simple, with just enough seasoning and a little bit of demi glace sauce on it, just the way I like it, no overpowering sauces to ruin the natural flavors of the meat.  The sides were good too.  I don't usually order sides because I think they're a rip-off, but this place gives you good portions and the quality was very good, both the asparagus and the sunchokes.  But let's get serious, the main attraction was steak, and it was excellent!

lftDaqtn0Eh6Zd1jXbyoGQ.text: Loved it!!!!  Lobster Bisque. Persian Cucumber Salad.  8 oz. Flat Iron Medium Rare.  2 &1/2 lb. Lobster. Brentwood Sweet Corn. Baby Shittake Mushrooms. Potato Puree. 6 Selections of Sorbet. Chocolate Souffle.  Full Belly. Happy me! :)

1Q8rXrq8KmDiNR8X8cVcIg.text: OMG this restaurant is amazing! We both ordered the PRIX FIXE WAGYU SURF AND TURF. -4 very creative appetizers (kobe beef tartar w/ raw quail egg, caprese-like dish, 5 huge grilled prawns, colorful heirloom tomatoes)-I have no idea what they were called but all was soOOoo good! -3 entrees( med.rare. wagyu ribeye steak, waygu flat iron steak, lobster in saffron butter sauce) -3 sides (corn stuff, mashed potato,mushrooms) -3 very creative desserts (chocolate cake w/ ganache in the center + vanilla ice cream, pecan donut looking thing with pecan ice cream?, and some fruit mix thing. haha  At $155/pp it was a great deal for the quality and quantity!!!! Also had their martini with circo-dirty + blue cheese stuff olives $15! yummy! I believe my date had a stoli screwdriver $20. Which is such a rip-off.  Service was medicore...server couldn't explain to us in detail what  makes wagyu so special. And wasn't able to explain clearly what we would expect from this prix fixe selection. Also he was no where to be found when we needed him.   I had one of the best meals ever! 4.5 solid stars!!! Note this is my first time trying wagyu beef so I had to make room for anything better out there.

933dUqRPPAuth7QMDMejWA.text: Steak was great. I feel like you can get the same quality and service at any other major city. This is Vegas so you pay a bit more. We had a large group and we ate family style. Portions are big so we didn't mind sharing. I'd recommend the lobster bisque and if you are in a big group for each person to order different sides. Staff was really accommodating since we came in late and they help taking pictures. I was a bit worried about dress code and it is business casual I just had some dark jeans, collar shirt, and some casual shoes. I did see a few ppl in cargo shorts and a t shirt. I'm not sure how they enforce the dress code. It might have been just a late night or customers had just deep pockets.

BKRmBMzvomK2jFyJN-apZg.text: Great. Lobster sarad, Baby Spinach and Bone Rib-eye. Bar counter seats do not require pre-reservation.

-XxRZptJl7-gHf2vjUrKCw.text: WOW!!  Let's start with their fresh petite oysters! OMG, i can have more of that as my entree.  The ambiance is very elegant; beautiful lighting; made it perfect for any special occasion.  Glad that we went here on our first nite out on the Strip.  He had the NY Steak (which was crazy good) while i had Scallops and the asparagus was prepared in perfection. The services was pretty awesome too. Definitely a must go to for any of you celebrating something very special and would like something intimate.

suhDm-GkNvlcrn7Sf-sgBQ.text: Craftsteak is.. for the uninitiated, one of the Las Vegas strip's finest steakhouses.  Located at The MGM Grand, I think it is better than Gordon Ramsay at Paris, on par with Jean Georges at Aria and the strongest challenger to the throne of my personal favorite, Carnevino at Palazzo.  The sexy, elegant, and modern lounge and bar give way to a beautiful and relaxing dining room featuring an open kitchen, comfortable banquettes, lovely booths and ambience to match. This could be a five star experience, however there were some service issues that bothered me.  For instance, while the service was good per se, and professional, it was also a little stuffy and curt. Again, I felt as if a case of reverse age discrimination was in effect just because me and my dining partners look young and were a bit rowdy and loud as the night wore on, we were written off as poor customers. Excuse me but between the eight of us we probably know more about wine, food and service than most working at Craft, but whatever. Just don't speak to me like I'm an idiot. Hate that.  There were several attempts at choreographed drops and pick ups of food at the table and all staff members were clearly not on the same page and it made for some uncomfortable glares across the table as well. Awkward. Really? Instead of just dropping my food when it's hot, standing there till everyone is ready? I get it, I really do, but it was a little much.   It's not a Justin Timberlake concert or the NYC Ballet, it's running food. Gimme it. Drop it. I'm hungry!  For a party of eight doing a tasting menu on a reservation, and having industry connections, I thought we would have been shown a little more hospitality as was the case up and down the Strip all month. I believe we all felt the experience was a little rushed.   Not only did support staff hover around the table but before you could put your fork down from your last bite your plate was being whisked away and the next course being rushed out.  Another issue.. I don't know if this is just our server or everyone at the restaurant, but aggressively filling the bottled water and bring refills of cocktails without asking Is inappropriate. I've worked in Michelin starred restaurants,  I've worked at a Texas Roadhouse. I don't care where you are, you ask before bringing it. Maybe I didn't WANT five Dark and Stormies?  Anyway, aside from the rushed, curt service and blatant money grabs, the food was outstanding, the space is beautiful and that's why this place gets four stars.   We started out with six interesting 2006/8 Italian blends and a enjoyed a big, beautiful,  Bordeaux for dinner, but we never saw the Som, or we probably would've ordered more. Again, was it our Age?  We all ordered the American Wagyu tasting menu. From the brief, rushed description by our waiter, we were to get three courses.    For the first course, appetizers disjointedly flooded the table, and I recall the Handcut Wagyu Tartar as a standout amongst them. I recall also, the risotto underwhelming most at our table.  As second course, I remember trying numerous salads.. my favorites being the Italian buffalo mozzarella, pork belly, and pan roasted red pepper.   As the steaks rolled out, so did that lovely Bordeaux.. I wish I could remember the name of it, but I was three or four dark and stormy's deep, not to mention all that wine?  Steaks.. 14 oz pieces of marbled, juicy heaven from Snake River Farms, all varying cuts. As I mentioned there are a lot of places to get $150 steak in Las Vegas.. Carnevino, STK, Jean George's, Strip steak, Delmonico, Gordon Ramsay.. and of them all, Craft Steak is probably one of my top.. two or three.  A bunch of the usual sides were at the table but all I remember are the white corn grits. Oh god.. white corn, bacon, Gruyere, and chives and oh my God I could've eaten four more bowls.  Again before I could even rest my fork, my plate was being whisked way and dessert was brought out. Awkward.  A TON of delicious food hit the table for dessert, along with some nice Ruby Port. Cinnamon Monkey Bread, Vanilla Cheesecake, Farmers Market Fruit, Ice Creams, and Spicy Sorbet.   Well, that was a nice surprise. So the meal ended up being a pretty good deal now that I think about it.. considering my steak alone would've been $105.00 plus the appetizers, salads, sides, and dessert. Well we ended up ordering ton of wine and a bunch of cocktails so I guess the restaurant made out well, too.   If Craftsteak figures out their service glitches and hires some people that want to sell instead of take orders and make sure the Sommelier hits every table, they'd have a five-star restaurant. For now four stars. This is a Tom Colicchio restaurant figurer it out.

7T7TAvOHGmJmC8Gm85pfsw.text: Overall, the food was good but not it did not meet my expectations. I'm from NY and tried all the great steakhouses (Wolfgang's, Luger's, Quality Meats, and Club A). I anticipated Craftsteak to rival the other steakhouses but I thought it was second to the aforementioned steakhouses.   I had the rib eye and my wife had the sirloin. Again, both were good but not great.   Not sure if it was intentional but the bread they served in the beginning was hard.   Lobster bisque was pretty good.   Service was good which is what you would expect.

H2LextsJWPqxWNApxoomkw.text: I had high expectations of this place. The one thing I should say is that the service was fantastic. If you have not ever eaten at a high end steak house you would probably be pretty impressed. Although being a bit of a foodie, and having eaten at many 4 diamond establishments, I am probably a bit more savvy when it comes to fine dining than your average Vegas patron.  Like i said the service here was excellent. I have no complaints at all in that department.  A solid 4 stars there.  We started with the fries (which we were told were amazing) and the divers scallops. The fries were very good...an amazing culinary revelation? No. The divers scallops were pretty meh, scallop quality was decent no the best I have had. They lacked that flavor profile and pop they should have had.   I ordered the braised short ribs and my fiance the rib eye. Both were good but again not amazing, short ribs were not anything I couldn't have made at home.  Sides we ordered asparagus and potatoes au gratin, they again lacked that real pop I would have expected.  If you are looking for a real treat Strip Steak at Mandalay bay would be you best bet. That was up there with the best food I have ever had.

tD9ejiqp0TS53a-K0PyF-w.text: Started with spinach salad w/apricots, arugula salad and buffalo mozzarella salad which had hazelnuts and pimentos.  Spinach salad was clearly market fresh spinach but didn't have enough dressing to have much of a taste.  Arugula and Mozzarella salads were good.  The mozzarella salad included hazelnuts, which were quite tasty.  The steaks were as expected, good.  The 29 hour short rib was melt in your mouth good.  The potatoes and asparagus were good but not memorable.  The service was great and so was the wine.  Ambience was very cool as well.  Your definitely paying for the name, steaks were a bit on the pricey side.  It was good but I wouldn't go back, too many other James Beard chefs in Las Vegas not to try others.

eUD2Sh2BSO-aU4wRVVFx5w.text: The service and the food was excellent. We had Kevin as our waiter. He made wonderful recommendations. We both got the 18oz bone in Ribeye and it was cooked to perfection. The lobster bisque was to die for!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 18oz Ribeye!!!

LpAWmAjnSSLc8YEhAsFJKw.text: We really liked the oysters, and the surf n turf. The scallops were perfectly cooked. The 6 oz filet mignon was cooked perfectly too, but that was a very small 6 oz steak. The side dishes were a generous size though, and both the fingerling potatoes and the glazed carrots were delicious.  I had the key lime martini and it was the best drink ever. I swear, I could've had 10 of them!

CVH3cwPpBFwqeQDQz1mZ7Q.text: Good is amazingly fresh and delicious. The restaurant and open and comfortable! Loved our dinner and sorry to have missed Tom

cbpTqvBimk1vBb4us4tFDA.text: The heavens opened and angels came down singing songs of delicious meat.  I love steak.  I do.  I just love it.  I can eat it day in and day out.  Some of my extended family dined here and we were seated in a private dining area.  I think we totaled at around 15.  I apologize in advance for not being able to recall every dish that was ordered.  I know we started off with Maine Lobster Bisque, Risotto, and Potato Puree.  All were delicious but the lobster bisque was a bit too spicy for me to enjoy at length.  I know someone in my general vicinity had filet mignon, someone else had NY strip, another had lobster, and someone else took half of my rib eye.  Beyond that, I really couldn't say.  In any case, my rib eye (medium) was perfect.  Perfectly seasoned, perfectly cooked, and perfectly ingested.  As a side note, my cousin's adorable children (boy aged 3.5, girl aged 1.5) loved it here!  Service was good considering we were out of sight, out of mind.  Since we had two young children with us, we had plenty of requests -- high chair, small plates, etc.  However, they were very well behaved and loved the food (especially the risotto).

LwSSAxLsVE2uqEhYXqdX4Q.text: Really disappointing. My scallops had sand in them. My husbands steak was dry, as was our friend's. I would have been underwhelmed and not returned for half the price of this meal. There are plenty of great options in Vegas, don't waste your time or money on this one.

EFatdd60HxHH4ku1_10WRg.text: My buddy and I had dinner here on Sat/13 Jul about 8:30 pm - We showed up without reservations and they got us a table immediately (when my buddy checked on-line earlier the only reservation times available I think were 5:30 pm and 10:15 pm). - For drinks we got the "Billionaire Cocktail" which was only $15/ea.  Good cocktail made with Booker's Bourbon but since the drink was pink/red-hued and inside a martini glass it looked as if we were drinking Cosmos. - The complementary bread rolls come out toasty and tasty.    - I had the hangar steak (rare) and as a side the pureed potatoes.  My buddy had some steak and as a side small potatoes.  It was delicious and a lot of food so we couldn't finish either potato side dishes.   - Service was prompt and attentive.

MJm9AIGq_RugygCQcpYsfQ.text: Although I have been wanting to try Craft for about a year, I ended up here on a whim. This place exceeded my expectations, by far!   We began our meal with drinks. There were beers, cocktails, and wine. Tons of options at various prices. I ended up getting the prosecco, which was wonderfully crisp. We settled on the grilled calamari as an appetizer. It was OK, but nothing to rave about. I ended up ordering the surf and turf, which was FANTASTIC. This can easily be shared. The lobster sauce was buttery awesome perfection. However, I think the largest highlight was the monkey bread. An explosion of flavors for sure!   Overall, the food is great. The drinks are strong. The staff is knowledgable.

dguYyyydnSknnQUW6z4qlg.text: Really cool steakhouse. Lots of plates to share and different meats to try.   Ordered a Moscow mules and was a little disappointed it wasn't served in a copper cup but it was still mixed really well.  Started off with the prosciutto pear and the plate was perfect for 2. The pear was almost like a puree with chunks and you could spoon it on the meat.  Had the salmon and cous cous and ordered a side of fries. The salmon was cooked perfect really moist throughout and the fries were amazing as well they had a little kick to them.   Overall awesome place really cool vibes and great drinks!

AgnCkiGtNfOYL8tf4CgNVQ.text: Two dry aged NY strips overcooked.  Advocado salad appetizer was one dimensional.  Fries were boring and bland.  Asparagus charred.  Worst food experience of my life.

yduTZKUYWrbwtJ0gdXE7rg.text: Such an incredible experience. I have been twice now, both times doing the chef's tasting (highly recommend!). Food was delicious, service was impeccable and I recommend this place to anyone I know when they are visiting Las Vegas!

ZVlNJ9ibHvfZp8wYZ9JrRA.text: 5/5. Food was on point and we had a great time. We were in our own area since we had a large party, but the atmosphere was great and the service was quick. The waiters gave great recommendations and were happy to assist us. Had the lobster bisque to start which was amazing. For the main course I had the NY strip with asparagus which was cooked perfect. Would return.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_Ilfz1PIA1l0BFVkAjFxoA.text: This restaurant was a little tricky to find, although I seemed to get turned around a lot in Vegas.  They just don't seem to make it easy.   Ok, the ambiance in the restaurant was nice... dimmed lights.. not too loud.. well dressed people.  The food was Amazing. I had a 6oz filet w/ seared scallops. My filet was cooked perfectly medium rare & the scallops were like butter in my mouth! The sides were ordered al a cart, in which we got a few different veggies. We had a table of 6 people, but we ended up with so much food.  The portions to the sides were large (sharing size), and the main dish, I think was just the perfect size. The service was good, they always made sure to check on us to see if we needed anything.. and they never let our glasses come to an empty. It was a bit pricey, but This place was soo good.. I'd go back!

S40FHKXEuqKo8HVEsIs93Q.text: When is Yelp adding a 6th star? Another year, another 5 stunning meals. We went for my wife's birthday and were literally blown away. Marvin was amazing as always- remembered allergies, likes and what not. The whole team treated us like we were the only guests in the restaurant and it was hands down the best experience we could have asked for.

VwRsLTm3m1hFBYywNzPnQQ.text: Upon arrival, my girlfriend and I were greeted with such warm smiles from the hostesses and the GM Christopher introduced himself and shook my hand. My Man!  Shortly after we were seated, I was approached by Alexis who gave us our menus and their very extensive wine list. She went over the menu a little and gave us some time to think.   As soon as we placed our order, we were brought out four rolls. It was warm and buttery. Smelled and tasted amazing! For appetitizers, we had their shrimp cocktail and oysters. The shrimp cocktail was decent. Nothing bad about it. But their oysters were phenomenol.  My girlfriend ordered their 10 oz filet, which was great in size (most filets we've ever had were only 8 oz.) and also extremely tender. You bet she devoured it all. I had their 24 Hour beef short rib. It was absolute perfection. The meat practically cut itself, it was so tender. We also shared their asparagus and sweet potato puree for sides and both were very tasty.  Even though we were pretty stuffed, the monkey bread absolutely sold us. It cured my girlfriend's sweet tooth! My girlfriend wants to come back for their monkey bread alone, and of course to try more other their delicious items.   Great service, great food - what more can you ask for!

RP9SjZBraU-NdAYt6EOLCQ.text: Being a fan of steak + top chef + and Tom I knew this place was must for one of our vegas dinners.  Decor: 4.5 stars, dark, yet comfortable atmosphere. Trendy yet sophisticated they have filmed a few episodes of top chef here as well as what our waitress hinted the finale for this season was filmed here, can't wait ;)  Service: 5 stars hands down. Everyone was attentive, professional, fit the bill of a 5 star steak restaurant. It's really the little things that matter, for example when we sat down our outfits were all Black, waitress made note of this and switched out our white napkins for black napkins, it's little things like this that set the tone of a meal for me. Was it necessary? no, did it have me wowed? Yes! Again I'm easily pleased, it's the little things.  Food: ok so this is where things got tricky, some foods were 5 star heaven in my mouth amazing, others closer to 3 stars, I was very disappointed in some options, I had high expectations which weren't fulfilled in every category of our meal.  Start with the food that was "ok".  Sadly the steak to me was not up to par with my expectations or the fact that when coming to a steak based restaurant I expect it to "wow me". Ordered the ribeye and while I have no doubt that the cut was amazing it was pretty bland, plain, nothing memorable besides the presentation/massiveness of the meat. To me it was under seasoned, trust me I understand to appreciate the steak itself you don't want a bunch going on to take away from the meat but sadly I was left underwhelmed on what I expected to be one of the best ribeyes I'd ever have. It's not a good sign to be at an establishment like this looking for salt and pepper shakers.  Also a miss for our table was the roasted pepper risotto, under cooked! When a side is left untouched by 3 hungry women you know that says something.  Anyways, aside from the service being amazing I stuck with 4 stars for a reason despite my underwhelming steak.  **The Lobster bisque had to be the best I've ever had hands down! Everyone at the table agreed it was fantastic, so creamy and smooth with big chunks of lobster a must have, truly memorable.  Lastly the brussle sprouts side was to die for! Really tasty, the perfect amount of crunch & flavor, this was seasoned correctly. These dishes on the side really made up for what the steak couldn't deliver. Would I be back? Most likely not, but again the lobster bisque may have me reconsider.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red pepper &amp; buffalo mozzarella risotto
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Bisque
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye

eGmhe-x-HO-4hTK5vlxGvw.text: So while in Vegas I vouched to have at least one The Godfatheresque dinner. I was fumbling between Del Frisco's, STK and Craftsteak. Well what I went with is quite obvious now and it is a decision I do not regret.  The restaurant is located centrally within the MGM leading to the signature connector. Surrounded by the many shops that the MGM has to offer, this restaurant gives a welcoming vibe from the outside going in. The hostesses were super friendly and escorted us to our table, where I requested a seat change to a booth which they gladly moved us to :)  Service: George and Kevin are two guys I'd have to steal away from Craftsteak if I was opening up a restaurant in Vegas. Both were perfect examples of what 5 star service is. Genuinely attentive with smiles at every table visit. The lady running things with them could use a bit of a training session from them. 4.5/5   Food:  Ceasar Salad: Eh the lettuce was forgettable and the ceasar dressing was too. A replica of one you'd get at any other place in the world. The croutons were good though. 2.5/5  SALAD TIP: Their ranch is the best ranch I have had in my life..therefore I suggest you order a garden salad of some sort with ranch dressing.  Filet Mignon: The best. At the bite the tenderness was unmatched, miles ahead of any I've ever tried. The medium had the juiciness of a medium rare minus the red. Sauce-less but not an issue. 5/5...yes I 5'd a main dish  NY Strip (Bone-in): Juicy and a hypnotizing amount of flavor. I tried so hard to leave a couple pieces for small bites after my predicted night of hard drinking but I couldn't resist it. 4.5/5  Baby carrots: A good parent would bring their kids here for their vegetables serving. 5/5  Truffle Fries: I am sad to inform you that they were very mediocre. Maybe not enough people order them? I'm a 90's kid though, can you blame me? Forgettable but not terrible. Just okay I tell you. 2.5/5  Unfortunately I was too full for dessert, another tip, heavy meal it around 5/6 in Vegas, it's bad to exercise on a full stomach.   Drinks:  Cadillac Margarita (Don J): It's 2 for 1..based off alcohol content. Definitely a nice drink to keep that buzz going or started. 4/5  Lemonade: Meh 2.5/5  This was a great dining experience, Sad to say the only thing holding this from a 5 was the salad and the fries, that sounds so stupid doesn't it? The meats were some of the best I have ever had  and oh yeah the complimentary bread rolls..eyes open, mouth watering good. I'm so not a fan of repetition but I hope this place holds up for when I'm 55 and am too old and lazy to wander off yelp touring to try new stuff.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jF1GX6sTjZ60FioNE6LqJw.text: John on Friday was excellent, he had to deal with unruly customer and was very professional and courtesy in handling the scenario, apologized for the customer's behavior(he was belligerent drunk)and kept us on track for a great experience.

bCbF46pPVUlXdPVIIrYbVA.text: Tom, please pack your knives. I can no longer take you seriously on TOP CHEF.  Never have I ever been more disappointed in a steakhouse.   AMBIANCE: Stylish decently sized restaurant with stylish dining areas. I was taking everything in then saw COW FACES staring back at me. I found it pretty tacky and crude to have such painting stare at me as I eat their cousin but pushed thru because I made reservations for steak.  FOOD: The bread was dry and oversalted served with more butter. I would've been better off toasting Hawaiian bread and eating it with marinara. My date asked the waiter if they had MASHED potatoes (menu only offers potato puree) and he said they did. I rolled over laughing when our baby food was served. It was good but heavily buttered that it thickened so easily to make an odd texture halfway through our meal. We both ordered the ribeye medium rare. First of all the plating was so difficult because it was served on a pan which was unstable sitting on top of a plate. It kept rocking back and forth as I cut it so I just transferred the whole thing to a plate. Crazy concept serving steak on a plate i suppose. Anywho thee WORST part was that my steak. I'm not a steak expert but I couldn't even chew thru it. I was hacking through the steak to find a edible piece but left more than half uneaten.   Staff: Honestly felt like they could care less about me and had no knowledge of the menu. The staff was talking amongest themselves and I had to get up from my table and interrupt them to get their attention. They did the minimum bare minimum.  This was thee worst fine dining experience I've had in Vegas. I lost all respect for Tom critiquing food when his restaurant can't even get the service right.  If you'd like to be robbed of your money and eat terrible food, please go here.

QJc4i0I6YqwYcfVwiqPgqA.text: Craftsteak just jumped to number 1 on our list of Steakhouses. We've been to Gordon Ramsey's Steak and many others and Craftsteak beat them all. The price of the food was worth it! We started out with the lobster bisque, shrimp cocktail, and Caesar salad which all were delish! Then we went to our main course which was a couple of steaks with mashed potatoes , asparagus , and mushrooms. Followed up with dessert that comprised of a banana bread with ice cream. The atmosphere was great with their lighting, music and staff. Marvin and his team were awesome and very attentive. Marvin answered our questions about the menu which helped out a lot. Ask for Marvin's Team! We will definitely be returning to this place!

OYBVhhhIX2zD9iS-LoBdUg.text: Had a great meal last evening.  Everyone had the 14oz. Wagyu Ribeye.  It was excellent.  Salads and the variety of sides were very good as well. Had a great wAiter Peter who was very entertaining sharing his food and drink knowledge as well as personal industry experiences. He was actually from nearby my ancestors' home of Bern Switzerland. Overall enjoyable visit.

iJZ97-MlokhB-1ZwZtuNnw.text: Very underwhelming. We asked for the sommelier to recommend a wine. After a short discussion with what we thought was the sommelier, we found out we were speaking with a manager whom literally said, "If you don't like it, it's okay. We make a lot of money." The wine he suggested was extremely tannic and bitter so we asked for another suggestion. The actual sommelier came over and was extremely aggressive. It felt like we were getting grilled about our likes and dislikes until he said, "Do you just want what they have?" (Pointing to a bottle our friends had ordered). In addition to the poor wine suggestions, we ordered a medium steak. It came out very well done (not a single sight of pink). Aside from the disgusting arrogance of the manager and the disappointing food, our server was gracious and top-notch!

IqLNPgswt-2XjvSx37l6wg.text: This is probably my favorite steakhouse in the country and I really enjoy coming here when in Vegas.  First the dining room is spacious and swanky.  The service is very attentive and fast.   On to the food.  I always order the domestic Wagyu tasting menu- priced at $155 per person you get a corresponding number of cuts of Wagyu steaks depending on how many people order it.  For instance if two people order the tasting menu you can choose two Wagyu steaks and so forth.  You get to choose three appetizers/salads, lobster bisque is included as well as shrimp cocktail, steaks, three sides and they bring out desserts.  I highly recommend the warm Frisee salad, spinach salad and buffalo mozzarella.  Order the Wagyu ribeye and NY Strip- so rich and melt in your mouth goodness.  Please order them medium-rare.  Anything above it is doing it injustice.  Now, Wagyu steaks are rich so if you don't like that then the regular grilled steaks are fine too- just a different texture.   Steaks have a beautiful char and is seasoned perfectly with a nice crust.    The potato puree is so good but one order can feed four people so don't over order that.  The sides can all be shared.  By the time dessert arrives my belly is so full I don't touch it but it looks great.
