RzCrjjRSbrpWJ4lW66YXiw.text: Upscale restaurant, famous chef, priced accordingly. Ordered grilled bone in rib eye steak, side order of asparagus and mushrooms. The food was great! The service was just an OK. Very strange server who thought he was hilarious but in reality was nothing but annoying!

AaGviEdgk4xvN-3koaFwcw.text: If you're ever in Vegas, this is one of the best Streak places I've been to (and I've been to a lot in Vegas).  As expected, the service here is on point so I'll talk about the food:  -Apps here are amazing.  Bread here is amazing.  I will warn you, though, don't get suckered into eating so much bread or apps becasue you won't have much room for the actual dinner.  -We tried family style steaks, getting a little but of each steak craved up for us.  NY was good..Filet was juicy...ribeye was flavorful...but it is all in the flank. Yes, I said flank!  Ask the server put the flank next to you.  When you're done eating as much as you can, that's when you can offer the rest to the entire group.  Just think about it:  While all the amateurs are going for the filet, you'll be in steak heaven with the flank.  And yes...you can thank me later!  I can't wait to go back on my next visit in Vegas!

7_detWOhS2B2Ingma6hqcA.text: Greatest meal of my life.  We did the tasting menu, and every appetizer, side, main course and dessert was delicious.  There way too much food for the two of us.  My only regret is I have only one stomach.

SuoqNuKKXQLA8_IK6FSplg.text: Full disclosure, I was more than a little drunk when we came here for dinner so my experience in reality could be completely different than what I recall.  I was on a double date and my date and I arrived early so we ordered drinks at the bar. A dirty martini and a beer - $40. REALLY!? I'll admit that the bartender was AMAZING and offered me blue cheese stuffed olives and they were delicious.   Our friends showed up and they seated us at a table that was partially outside of the restaurant so we can see people walking by.  Not sure if I liked this or not, but I guess it didn't matter that much.  My date and I shared the NY Strip and ordered corn for our sides.  The steak seemed cooked a little more medium than the medium rare we ordered, but it was good.  Our sides were corn and scalloped potatoes. I was SEVERLY disappointed they didn't have mac n cheese. Fine dining steakhouse mac n cheese is the best!!    I had a really great time with my friends and my date, but the restaurant experience itself did not seem extraordinary for the exorbitant prices.

Tfh2_z-gjEi_wfUYPhFmUA.text: I was so excited to try this place as our fancy spot during our Vegas trip.  The service was impeccable!  Pretty fast, attentive and friendly.  However the food wasn't, sorry servers :/  The server said the ribeye was quite popular so we went with it, medium rare. Out of the seafood she recommended the halibut or scallops (should've went with the scallops).  The ribeye was ookay.  It was pretty chewy and and parts of it were really difficult to cut with the knife. It seemed a tad over medium rare, but I could not understand why it felt kind of stringy.  They cut it for us so maybe they didn't let it rest enough? I have no idea.  For the price, we expected perfection and I could've easily made something more tasty and tender :/ Also no sides come with it.  Halibut was overcooked.  I was so excited to see what perfect halibut tasted like. The buttery sauce was tasty, but couldn't really overlook the dry stringiness.  I was full after the steak and really should've just left it alone, it wasn't really enjoyable to eat.  I mean, it even -looked- overcooked when we got it.    We also got the arugula salad, which wasn't mindblowing. It was fresh, it was okaay. I had to have some grass to munch on.  In hindsight I should've  a) sent back both dishes or at least the halibut (but we were running late so didn't want to wait for a new order, and the dinnermate had finished half the halibut already & we were pretty full already) and  b) ordered the 24 hr braised short ribs (because it would seriously take skill to get that wrong), but my dinner mate doesn't like ribs. (WHAT THE FK I cannot even comprehend and must rethink the relationship.  Infuriating. Anyway.)  Probably the best part of the meal was the bread (well, smelling it for me, as I have a gluten allergy). Warm, fresh, buttery, beauuutifully crispy on top with sea salt and so soft inside. Jesus, I have never missed bread more.  Ah well, probably an off day/meal.

VxNBqjZWYDNGOH990AMQBQ.text: When we arrived at the restaurant they told us it would be a few minutes before our table was ready and we could wait at the bar. No problem. My husband and I ordered drinks and once our table was ready the hostess notified us and was ready to show us to our table. However, she made no offer to have our drinks brought to our table. Not that I was expecting HER to do it but she could've had someone else do it. It's awkward when you're at the bar, have your purse in tow, jacket on and have to carry a martini glass wearing heels to your table. That's my only gripe :)  Food and service thereafter was great. The best thing about this place is that they are completely fine with you splitting an entree. We shared the lobster bisque which they offered to split for us which was great! We then shared the rib eye which was cooked perfectly medium rare and ordered the risotto as a side. The food was really tasty and just the right amount without being overly stuffed. Our waiter and staff were all very good. The waiter even put a rush in for our food since we had a show to catch. Very nice of him.

MzrLQ8um9xqaZ1DMRoBBQw.text: Yo tom i f*cks with you and shit. Food was good. Steaks were good but they didn't make me want to slap my facking mama. Tom i want your bald head next time with a sliver of foie gras and jam. Then I want some more of that risotto though

8BS1K0MEynCCDLEEQXjbpg.text: I consider myself a steak connoisseur having been to many steakhouse establishments both chain and privately owned.  And to date, this place I consider to be the best steaks I've ever had.  The atmosphere is nice and warm.  The waiter was friendly and very helpful.  My wife and I decided to get the five course menu.  Everything from the appetizers to the desserts were fantastic.  But we're here for the steaks.  I had the bone in ribeye which melted in my mouth I thought they may have served me Wagyu instead.  Then my wife had the delmonico New York steak.  It wasn't as tender as the rib eye, but oh, the flavor...  All I can say is check it out for your self.

jsPujQ1rqHqwKDHs56oJ6Q.text: Very disappointed by the food and service at Craftsteak - definitely not recommended for a dining room experience.  Food: We had a party of 8, and 7 ordered steaks. All specified medium rare and 3 out of 7 weren't close. I opted for the special dry-aged bone-in filet (think this was $90) and it was way overcooked - nearly well done. What a way to ruin a $90 steak! Meanwhile, two others got the standard filet on the menu and both were far undercooked. I just don't understand how a place that is charging $90 can get steaks so wrong.  Service: Simply bad. Our food took forever, and we had to ask multiple times to get requests fulfilled. Worst was that I asked my waiter for the wine list three times and he never brought it. You'd think that surely by the 3rd request (if not the 2nd) an apology and making it his priority would be the correct action, but no, not even an apology was offered - and I had to ask someone else to finally get it, at the 4th time of asking. I also don't think I once got my water or iced tea refilled without having to ask for it. Again, given the price point, I just don't think this is at all acceptable.  The only saving grace (and why I add +1 star) is the wine list and cocktail list. There is an extensive wine by the glass selection including some premium selections (in part due to usage of the Coravin system) and fantastic spirits flights, including lots of great scotch (I opted for the Isle of Jura flight, which included 1oz pours of the 10, 16, 30, and 1976 varieties). So doing some of these at the bar might be OK. But I'd never consider eating here again - not with the inconsistent/bad execution and inattentive service.

JiSuepoP5RfV3Y4Zw1VlyQ.text: Came here for our anniversary dinner & not only had an amazing dining experience, but also officially found our all-time favorite steakhouse! Absolutely incredible customer service with attentive & knowledgable staff from start to finish with exquisite cuisine! What more can you ask for?  TO START: We had a cocktail each and the bread & butter they start you off with is amazing. Our waiter had to warn us to not fill up on it as we had a lot of food coming. Oh, but it was so hard not to! As for appetizers, we started with a WARM FRISEE SALAD (farm egg & smoked bacon), the MAINE LOBSTER BISQUE soup, & the SHRIMP COCKTAIL.   SECOND COURSE: We went for the DOMESTIC WAGYU, which comes with a 14 OZ SKIRT STEAK & a 14 OZ RIBEYE. We also added the LOBSTER to our entree, and got the POTATO PUREE (yukon gold potatoes with chives, highly recommended!), ASPARAGUS (lemon zested), SWEET CORN, & the ASSORTED WILD MUSHROOMS. Yes, we went all out.   DESSERT: We were caught off guard when they brought us out MONKEY BREAD, FARMERS MARKET FRUIT, SORBET SELECTION, & CHEESECAKE. We were so stuffed, we only ate the sorbet and ended up having to pack everything up to go! The monkey bread was his favorite, the mango sorbet was mine.   Everything about this place screamed quality. From the service to the drinks to the food -- it was all just hands down outstanding. I always recommend this place to anyone who asks about a good place for a classy dinner or a restaurant to get a good steak... two thumbs up & five stars all around! TOM COLICCHIO, WELL DONE! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert!
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfection!
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our steaks, plus lobster.

XyqiT0vBRUmzV96KeiNlrA.text: I can't believe I spent $600 for something I pooped out later...but it was totally worth it.    Went on Saturday 4-2-16 to celebrate my birthday at 5:30 PM.  I don't think it's possible to have a better experience than this restaurant offers.  We felt like royalty from the moment we walked up to the hostess stand.  It's everything I imagined a fancy dinner would be.   If you can afford it I'd recommend the tasting menu...there are many to choose from and they bring you a ridiculous amount of food.  I love their huge portion sizes.  It's not just the size but the sheer variety that the tasting menu affords that is so satisfying.    I got the domestic wagyu surf and turf and hubs got the A5 Japanese Wagyu.  For starters they brought us Caesar salad, prosciutto, mozzarella, and parker house rolls.  They were gonna bring out lobster bisque but I told them that was yucky and they brought out a shrimp cocktail instead.  Everything was amazing except for the mozzarella which was doused in roasted red peppers and peanuts (WTF?).  It really needed some bread or something but I'm not Italian so maybe I just didn't....understand.    Then came the steaks, lobster tail, pureed potatoes, asparagus, and assorted mushrooms.  The mushrooms are truly a sight to behold and contained hen of the woods, baby portabellas, and white beech mushrooms.  The asparagus stems were shaved for maximum tenderness and the steaks....OMG THE STEAKS....they'll CHANGE YO LIFE. The mouth feel and texture is unlike any steak I've ever had.  So tender...like chewing bubble gum.   The desserts were earth-shattering.  The monkey bread brought me to tears.  The carrot cake was the best I've ever had.  The sorbets were delectable and the fruit was....well....fruit.... but executed well and thoughtfully chosen.   Just do it.  TREAT YO SELF.  You won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing cocktail. Tasted like black cherries. 4-2-16
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Starters. Pass on the mozarella. 4-2-16
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing desserts. The monkey bread will change your life. 4-2-16

ZW2VFoAGict38L2cok0QNQ.text: I loved this place and had a more than stellar experience! This was a last minute dinner choice for my mother and I on a family trip to LV.  The hostesses greeted us warmly and we were sat immediately. Our server Stacy (I could be wrong, I'm horrible with names) came and introduced herself and was extremely helpful with the menu.  I ordered the best short rib I have ever tasted and my Mom ordereed the rib-eye, which she loved. The spinach, green beans and potato puree were amazing and there aren't enough words to talk about how great the rolls were!  Above the taste of the food, the service has to be mentioned. Our server and busser were both so kind and the manager (the newer one, don't remember his name) came over and spoke with us as well. All of them not only cared about our dining experience, but engaged in conversation as well.  I will definitely be back when I'm back in town!!

yFGaslkuQzT_u70f74tr5g.text: Everything here is amazing! From the service to the seasonal selections, you can't go wrong! We ordered a tasting menu and could not even begin to finish all the food. There was nothing bad on the table. The brussel sprouts were epic and the steak was bar none. I love the teams of servers in each section  of the restaurant.  I was really impressed with the timing of the courses. A truly fantastic experience.

X4x6VhdAQWbALKMmIFvxEw.text: Best meal I've ever had in my life. Also the most expensive. Every morsel of food we put in our mouths had us groaning with pleasure. The staff and host were exactly what you'd expect from a high end restaurant, polite, attentive, full of wonderful suggestions, and patient with us seeing as we are kind of small town folk and had never experience a place like this. We are concerned about what to wear but there was a Jimmy Buffet concert at the MGM that night so we were surrounded by people in grass skirts. I think you'd be as comfortable in jeans and a T shirt as you would in a suit and tie. Don't expect to spend less than $500. I would go again any time.

jlA_06LwbnGg5RMgkgVWkA.text: Anybody who says they want more bang for their buck doesn't know what they are talking about.  This place is the perfect steakhouse. Large price range, depending on the cut and quality of steak.   Friends and I did the $160 per person Domestic Wagyu chef selection.  There were 6 of us, so we received 1 of each of their 5 cuts of steak, and doubled up on the ribeye for 6 steaks total.  Served family style, pre-sliced, and perfectly medium rare.  Came with 2 shrimp cocktails and 4 other apps. we got to choose.  We also got to choose 6 sides to share and it included dessert.   $160 per person for all that. Amazing deal. Best dinner I have ever had.  Don't go anywhere else if you want an amazing meal.   Service and setting were outstanding as well.  Will be back next time in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 5 cuts of steak, along with some sides.

HKL1c5sj6qi5ftMdoOSJvQ.text: Lobster Bisque, Rib Eye, Arugula Salad all AMAZING.  Service was top notch. We enjoyed our dinner experience here and would definitely recommend.  Also the ambiance of the restaurant made the time even more satisfying.

fwMxpEqk1zeIN5bOro9X4g.text: Excellent meal. Menu changes daily. Shared avocado appetizer with the very best pickled cucumbers I have EVER had, filet and half orders of French fries, roasted cauliflower and fingerling potatoes. Everything was cooked perfectly. We each had the A Berry signature drink.   Wonderful meal before the show.  Excellent service.

Rj4TYGiZPrQLR5OmB1Yfxw.text: More buns please...  So I never stuff myself with the bread baskets but this place changes that! The buns with soft butter are phenomenal! They come to your table hot & ready to be devoured and you just can't say no to them.  This place is a lot of fun and noisy so keep that in mind when you're planning your evening. Sometimes it feels like you're dining with your neighbors.   The food is consistently great! Steaks are big & juicy and always flavorful. Sides you shouldn't skip would definitely be the Yukon gold puree & Maui onions. I love eating tender onions with my meat! The Caesar here is ok but not great and the carrots & spinach are ok as well. Shrimp cocktails are always fresh and if you weren't stuffed enough already, leave some room for dessert! The monkey bread with ice cream is sinful in every way but worth each bite. Great to share if you have a group of people! The chef also sends out complimentary nutty bar bites at the end of your meal which are perfect little bites for those who love sweets!  We enjoy coming here and each visit is a great one!

KE9ZhU87ff7h1DI5G6oTsw.text: All I have to say is, it was amazing. Excellent from start to finish! The bread is delicious, we ate 2 pans full. The steak was amazing, this is coming from someone who had a 800+ steaks in my life. My boyfriend and I shared a t-bone (med-rare) and it was mouth watering delicious. It was one of the best, if not the best steak I have ever had! Must get side if you can take the spice is the broccoli. But honestly, we tried a few sides, and you can't wrong with anything!

C5qs1aWYjzdd3QEEyeGpdA.text: Wasn't to impressed by my meal yeah it five stars dinning in service. But the food didn't impress me to much and is over priced.

Ig7_UbBcWjKLK225MnCcxA.text: I will never miss an opportunity to dine at Craftsteak, it is that good.  Food and service are amazing.

hU1FDRihw57nHIQjhdLQxA.text: I MUST give a 5 STAR rating for this place.  Been there 3 times in the last year. The ambiance is a romantic setting with dim lights throughout the restaurant with candle lit tables. From hostess to bus men, they were all outstanding and especially courteous.  The dry aged  Ribeye was fantastic and cooked perfectly  to the "T". I must say they have THE BEST Casear salad with pickled anchovies. I ask to have them cut the lettuce, otherwise it will be served whole which I don't mind either. And their Potato Puree and broccolini is OUTSTANDING! I would highly recommend this place for casual dining or intimate dining. FANTASTIC!!

Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potato purée
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Casear salad with pickled anchovies. Yum!

fIrfsHB2uNse_RLsGzkPTQ.text: Solid steak house. Our server was super friendly with some 21+ jokes ....tossing salads??? =O  Anyway, we had a huge group because my friends and i were in town for a close friend's bachelor party. They offered a special feast for the table that was top notch. The meat here is impeccable. SOlid place. Too bad the Craftsteak in NYC failed.

6901TMSC_lR1v6T67qH-dw.text: Overdue review of our dinner here 2 weeks ago. Vegas trip for my buddy's bachelor party. We were staying at the MGM and this restaurant was an easy pick since we didn't have to leave the hotel!  Craftsteak is a very spacious & hip/Sheik restaurant. Dim lights & warm earthy colors throughout. Our table was at one of the side rooms. We had a great gathering of friends and were very hungry after a full day of adventures !  Took a look at the wine menu, all bottles are in the $100+ range, except for two reds @ $65.. I think I've seen them at $15, but then this is Vegas so there you go. My old fashioned was like candy, Bullet bourbon $12.   The steak menu was impressive, I wanted a fatty steak to absorb the mayhem of cocktails I had and will have . Ordered 22 oz T-Bone @ $58, was able to eat half and shared the rest with the table. For sides ordered Cauliflower, was tasty and can't remember what the rest of the group ordered.   Great service, we had 3-4 people serving, replenishing drinks, taking photos for us.   Steaks were great, super busy & noisy, overpriced, but got the job done..

Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Large round table seated 6 of us. My side dish Cauliflower, red wine, and an old fashioned..
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium cooked T-Bone

wsR0oe0zkkWECjIZD2CK5g.text: This place was amazing. I had just finished a show and arrived 45 min early for our reservation however our table was not ready. I opted to sit at the bar...best decision ever!!!  I was greeted immediately by the bartender Michael with a warm smile and readiness to make my dinner memorable.  The Lemon-drop martini was icy cold and crisp followed by some East and West coast oyster. Watch out for the fresh horseradish...it's got a punch!  Onto the Warm Frisee salad which is a must have. It has egg, bacon and the most delicious dressing. The main course was Waygu steak with an assortment of 4 different mushrooms.  My fave was the Hen of the Woods.  Lastly the finale arrived...dessert. The Cinnamon Monkey Bread with Banana ice cream is just unreal! I would come here just for this!  I give this place a 5 star because the food was fantastic and the service level of Michael at the bar was the best. This will be my go-to place anytime I come to Las Vegas for steaks.

Ro7RS4b27OfxCsjseG9YNw.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas and I always make it a point to hit up Craftsteak for dinner at once while I'm in town.    We usually always order a bottle for Cakebread Chardonnay to start off the evening.  I then will usually start with a soup while waiting on my entree, one of the New York steak cuts.  I always enjoy their Maui Onions.  And of course, the Monkey Bread for dessert.  The service is always EXCELLENT!    By all means, check them out!!

QYn-4WlkAG_OrpOYnBBlyg.text: My absolute favorite steakhouse!!! I've had the best experience dining here!!! Steak always come out perfect and the sides are Amos's well.

gv5uxLI28VFbXrRa7vak1Q.text: Gorgeous, elegant ambiance and delicious, well-executed food. Came here for an early 5PM dinner before catching the KA show also located in the MGM.   Menu-wise it's fairly standard steakhouse fare with the appetizers and salads, different cuts of meat, smaller seafood selection and sides. They give you free bread--baked Hawaiian rolls with salt sprinkled on top. Very buttery and delicious. We ordered the Warm Frisee Salad and Organic Green Lettuces to start. The first is more of a rich, creamy concoction disguised as a salad. It is anything but light and healthy due to the generous amounts of blue cheese and bacon. It's very rich and savory and I enjoyed the first few bites but it did get overwhelming. The latter, contrastingly, is very light and refreshing with a lemon vinaigrette.   The steaks are separated into grilled and roasted. The roasted ones are first pan seared then finished in the oven FYI. All four of us chose steaks and I had the 10 oz. Filet Mignon medium. It was so well cooked that I enjoyed it very much even though it was a bit more raw than the pink I usually request. While some steak houses focus on seasoning and a more buttery meat, this place is more purist. The steaks are very simple and minimally seasoned but mouth-watering and delicious. Everything is served a la carte and also had the Brussels sprouts as a side. Brussel sprouts were very flavorful and rich.  For dessert we had the Carrot Cake and Fruit Platter. Carrot Cake was the perfect amount of sweetness with a yummy cream cheese frosting and the maple ice cream was a great contrast both flavor and texture-wise. Presentation of the fruit platter was gorgeous with all the fruits delicately sliced and arranged to create a colorful aesthetic.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carrot cake with maple ice cream &amp; fruit platter
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 10oz filet Mignon
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free rolls

Z6APcmMcNBSkd-XnNwqb1A.text: Absolutely unbelievable. We came here on a recommendation of the director of restaurants for mgm and dear gosh, AMAZING!!  I recommend being adventurous and letting the chef choose your meals. Everything was literally perfect. From for shrimp cocktail, salads, sweet corn to the steaks and seafood we were beyond words. My fiance and I eat at the best restaurants in the country. We never thought we would top a place in Napa we ate at a few months back. Especially in Vegas. This place exceeded anything I could have imagined.   I want to make sure I mention one of the best wait staff I have ever encountered. Brianna (hope I spelled that correctly) was knowledgeable and correctly attentive. Great smile and wonderful personality. Best service person I've ever had and that's saying a ton. Best moment of the evening is when Bri brought desert plates when I was completely done. She says, "you just relax or go put on some stretchy pants because it's coming!"  Absolutely hilarious and it made me beyond excited for the final course.   Desert was absolutely amazing. Dear gosh.   Kendall Dumford is the director of restaurants At MGM and is clearly an outstanding executive for this huge property. I can't recommend her or this place enough.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greatness is what&#39;s here.

pzyjTOJ4Fluq_K5nzRv2RQ.text: They have a 3 course menu option for parties of 2 or more. We shared 4 of these amongst a party of 9. You can pick the steak you want from that category, and they pick the starters, sides, and desserts, though they did accommodate some specific requests we had for sides.   Double R Beef $135/person. We ordered 2 of these meal sets, 1 with 18 oz ribeye and 1 with 16 oz NY strip.   Domestic Wagyu $170/person. We ordered 2 of these meal sets as well, 1 with 14 oz eye of rib and 1 with 14 oz NY strip.   We also ordered 2 plates of diver sea scallops $44.   First, they brought out bread and butter. The top has a nice crust that is slightly crunchy. A good contrast to the soft roll. We wanted it hot and fresh though, and it took 3 orders before it came out hot enough.   The first course was 4 salads to share: - Caesar Salad: I didn't try any because it had anchovies on it.  - Warm Frisee: I don't remember it being warm, but it was my favorite of the salads as it was very flavorful because of the blue cheese.  - Market Spinach: This was my second favorite salad. I think it had a raspberry vinaigrette, which went well with the peaches and walnuts.  - Wild Arugula: This one was OK. I think the server said it was ranch dressing, but I'm not sure. I don't like ranch, but I tried a little. It didn't taste super ranch-y, but I was so paranoid of ranch I didn't want more. I make no sense sometimes.   When the steaks came out, I forgot which was which and just tried a piece of each. I couldn't really taste the difference between them. They do precut it into strips which helps with sharing. Lately, I just haven't been super impressed with steaks I have out at steakhouses. I like the steak my boyfriend makes at home because he butter bastes it. Basically, I'm no expert on meat quality. Give me butter or good sauce with steak that's not too tough and I'm happy. Tangent aside, I thought the steak here was OK, but didn't find it that mouthwatering.   We received 4 sides to share. I'm not sure if the portion we received is the same size you'd get if you order a la carte.  - Brentwood Sweet Corn: This one was my favorite side, maybe my favorite item of the whole night. I wish I could have a whole bowl to myself.  - Potato Puree: Very smooth, but a little bland in my opinion.  - Heirloom Cauliflower: This was pretty good. A solid way to consume some veggies.  - White Corn Grits: I would've liked a creamier texture. The grits were a little too big and lumpy for my preference.   Finally, 5 desserts to finish off.  - Cinnamon Monkey Bread: I feel like this seems more like a breakfast item to me, versus dessert. I did enjoy the pecan toffee sauce it was generously covered with. I didn't realize it was served with banana ice cream. It tasted pretty plain to me.  - Sorbet: I think it was coconut, mango, raspberry, and strawberry. The raspberry was super tart. I think the mango was my favorite of these.  - Vanilla Creme Brulee: Creme brulee in upscale restaurants like this are usually a safe choice. Very creamy, but doesn't stand out.  - Vanilla Bean Cheesecake: I just had a small bite, and the cheesecake had kind of fallen apart by the time it came to me, so impression was kind of skewed from that alone. I can't say the taste was memorable.  - Chocolate Cake: I don't care for chocolate cakes in general, as it's just too much chocolate for me. I didn't know the ice cream was strawberry, as it was very plain in flavor again, like the banana ice cream.   *****  My Star Ratings:  1 Star - Terrible. Just thinking about it makes me angry.  2 Stars - Meh. Unlikely for me to return.  3 Stars - OK. Open to coming back, but wouldn't go out of my way to.  4 Stars - Yummy! Will definitely return if I haven't already.  5 Stars - AMAZING!!! Would plan my day or even a trip around eating here.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brentwood Sweet Corn
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potato Puree
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Diver Sea Scallops $44

u1V7iBFwRQsFGf0R5zJeow.text: What a disappointment!  Craftsteak used to be our favorite steak house to go to in Vegas. We used to bring our out of town guests here and celebrate our anniversary or special occasions. Stopped by last. Ohhh before heading to a concert.   Sat at the bar. Staff were all very nice and friendly. Place was super busy which is always the case here. But now staff just look over whelmed and short handed.    Ordered  Wagu  steak tartar, foie gras, salad and Chilean sea bass.   Steak tartare- completely flavorless. Wagu has a nice buttery smoothness to it and this didn't have any taste whatsoever. Even after adding pepper and salt. Worse part was it came with toasted French baguettes instead of something nicer like Melba toast.  1 Star  Foie Gras-  tasted frozen. Didn't have the richness you'd expect in fresh foie gras. Bland  Salad- drowned in dressing. It was 1/2 soup 1/2 salad.  Chilean Seabass-  I LOVE Sea bass, Chilean Seabass!  And this wasn't Chilean. Or if it was it was badly cooked. Or precooked, set out to sit for a while and then reheated when ordered!  Why reheat a piece of fish that takes 5 minutes to cook??      For the prices you're paying here you'd expect top notch quality and cooking.  Not anymore. Seems like this place has gone the route of many other Las Vegas restaurants and decided to choose profit over quality.  Welcome to corporate America!  I'm sure they will close down soon to remodel. And come back worse than how they were.   How about keep it simple. Great quality food. Cooked correctly.   I'd be embarrassed to put my name as chef here.

6ArdS18TGhVvsbPQuYAMrw.text: My food was fabulous. The Short ribs are nothing but fabulous. The sides were amazing and the atmosphere is beautiful. Maybe I'm annoying but I find it to be completely tasteless to have someone ask if I'd like my picture taken. At a high end restaurant like this I find this to be classless.  My friends chicken was subpar. Maybe it was his fault for order chicken at a steak house but honestly the check was kind of dry and had little to no flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot of braised short ribs! Literally amazing!
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken looked great but was just okay. Not worth it!

dF3i6ZRpW4nS3UOuERo6fQ.text: I was going to the Hugh Jackman show at the Grand Garden.  I made a reservation for 5:30 when I was in the area a month ago.  Open Table does not work for Craftsteak.  Later, I realized the show was scheduled for 7:00.  I also got an email saying that Jackman would take the stage promptly at 7 PM so be on time.  I am OCD when it comes to timeliness.  I was going to call and ask to move the reservation to 5 or 5:15 but instead, I showed up at the podium shortly after they opened at 5.  Telling the hostess that I had a 5:30 reservation, she said there would be a short wait.  She seated thew people with reservations for 5 PM first and then they showed me to my seat.  The section where I sat in the bar area have couch seating on one side and a chair on the opposite side.  I took the couch seat violating my "Wild Bill" rule but I had a perfect view of the Dodgers' game.  My servers were a man and woman--Team #14.  My iced tea was brought promptly and a runner brought rolls in a skillet and a pad of soft butter.  I ordered lobster bisque to start, a 16 ounce bone-in NY Strip for the main course with a side of hen in the woods mushrooms.  This is one place where they do half orders on sides--a big plus for me.  I asked for the steak to be cooked blue.  The lobster bisque was good--pretty standard fare that could have used more lobster pieces given the price.  Prior to the steak being brought, a runner stopped by and placed a warm dish on the table.  I wondered why but it soon became evident.  The steak was served in an oval platter and the meat had been cut from the bone-in cooking which saves the diner trying to get as much of the meat away from the bone without picking ti up and gnawing like I might do at home.  The steak had a nice char on both sides.  The thickness allowed for the interior to be very rare as I like. The hen in the woods side was good but I didn't find it as flavorful fungus as other types. There was enough pan juice that I took one of the rolls and soaked up some of the juices for extra enjoyment.  The server asked me about dessert.  He brought the menu and after a while came back and asked what I had decided.  Sensing I was in doubt, he suggested the cinnamon monkey bread which he said was "life changing."  Judge Judy would call that "puffing."  I decided to change my life and order the monkey bread--something I generally would not have gotten.  And then I waited, and waited, and waited--looking at my watch and the baseball game.  My timelines OCD was starting to kick in.  My server came by about 15 minutes later and seeing I didn't have dessert told me he'd check on it.  I told him we could just cancel dessert.  He went to check and came back and said pastry was AWOL (my word, not his), and he assured me it would be right out.  In a minute or so, a runner stopped by with the monkey bread.  The menu describes it as: cinnamon brioche, pecan toffee sauce, banana ice cream.  It's an individual portion and it's quite good.  The server brought my check shortly after and explained he didn't want to be a hold up after I was finished.  I was glad I waited.  This was a completely different dessert from what I would normally have ordered.  Thanks to my server for his help in getting my dessert and getting me out with time to spare for the show.  I was not charged for the dessert.  I noticed when I got home and looked at the sales slip.  From Now On, I'll make my reservation earlier.  This Is Me!  And, yes, I am listening to The Greatest Showman as I write this review.

-nEP-PZenRQWBlz5_a-DLQ.text: Wow! This is probably one of the best restaurants MGM has to offer. I was here twice in one week.   The second time we went, we got the tasting menu. It's definitely the way to go if you have a large group! Here's what we got:  Starters:  - ITALIAN BUFFALO MOZZARELLA (9/10): this was SO yummy!! I loved the simplicity of it. It's mozzarella, topped with diced red peppers, olive oil and hazelnuts.   - HEIRLOOM TOMATOES (8/10): pretty basic but still yummy! Just sliced heirloom tomatoes drizzled with salt and olive oil.   - SPINACH SALAD (7/10): also another basic salad. Still really good!   - SHRIMP COCKTAIL (9/10): SO yummy and fresh tasting!!   Main Dishes:  - RIBEYE, HANGER, FLAT IRON, & TBONE (10/10): omfg all of these were YUMMY!! I really loved the ribeye (always my fave), but the flavors overall were incredible. It was all also cooked perfectly.   - SEA BASS (8/10): this was good! A little on the fishier side than I'm used to. But still good.   - SALMON (8/10): I wish the salmon skin was crispier, but overall still good.   Sides:  - ASPARAGUS, SPINACH, & ASSORTED MUSHROOMS (8/10): all solid side dishes. Nothing really wowed me, but still great!   - HEIRLOOM CAULIFLOWER (10/10): now this was the side dish I loved the most! There's something about charred cauliflower that just tastes incredible. Definitely get this!   Dessert  - CHOCOLATE MOUSSE CAKE (9/10): this was sinfully good!!! I wanted to eat the whole thing. Lol.   We also got the Monkey Bread, which everyone loved (I didn't try it).   The service here is really good as well. The servers called us by name and everything. I'd definitely be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Heirloom Cauliflower
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hangar

CoXWjXuR3tltFSIv7zwUmw.text: My most recent trip to Vegas turned into a food and restaurant exploration.   Craftsteak was on my list.   Ive had great luck with Vegas steakhouses and I wanted to see what Tom Colicchio offered up.  The atmosphere and dress was semi formal, collared shirt expected.  We were promptly seated and shown menus.  The drink menu was quite extensive, with a very complimentative food menu to boot. I went with the dry aged tbone and a side of fries.  Just after waiting, we were approached by a female photographer who was absolutely insistent on taking out pictures... even after multiple denials by us. Pictures were taken and she left. This ruined our experience a bit, mainly with how pushy she was to take our photos.  The wait for food wasn't too long, around 30 minutes and the steak came out in a steaming skillet, pre-cut off the bone.  The smell, tantalizing! Cutting into the steak was like cutting into butter. Savoring every bite, I slowly chipped away at the steaks.  The fries... came out a over seasoned and were tough to eat.  As I grinded to a halt, I had to reminisce about other steaks Ive had and how this compared to other Vegas steakhouses.  The presentation was A+ but I was left craving some greenery or an addition to the steak that I had seen at other steak houses. Don't get me wrong, a slab of meat in front of me I will always be happy about, but an addition to the plate would be beneficial.  I compare CraftSteak to a restaurant like StripSteak and I almost always lean towards StripSteak.  CraftSteak is the more formal older brother... better service, does the meat properly, no frills.  StripSteak is more of a casual atmosphere with a bit more adventure on the plate.  Both fantastic steaks.  But... here comes Ms. photographer again.  Even after we told her we didn't want the photos, she put them in professional booklets, and pushed and pushed and pushed for us to buy one and the discount rate of (around) $70... no thank you.  Remove the photographer and I give CraftSteak a 4.5, without a 3.5 is where it settles.

hHcORO83UAD3mBM9NLHMxg.text: Third time here.  Such a under rated restaurant.  Service is great.  OLGA was phenomenal!!!!  Such a wonderful and kind person.  Order the brisket, hanger, corn, finger link potatoes and lobster bisque.  Very very delicious! Highly recommended!!

Ij9RO43qKGq1q40uKp5BAA.text: Ummm Yes!!!!  I will definitely come here again. Loved it!!!  Great vibe, great food.  Home run.  Loved every minute of it.  From the specialty cocktails to the homemade rolls delivered to your seat in cast iron little pans.  I ordered the diver scallops and homemade French fries.  Yep- still salivating over them now. Only thing needed was a touch of acid in the scallops which they happily brought me.  They they were perfect. Loved the individual salt and fresh ground pepper shakers at table side too.  Great experience!!!!

uQvSfCOJwd6NYkURVAiXpQ.text: I could be a steak fanatic at times but this place has some awesome juicy steaks.   We went in for work function and ordered bunch from the menu. So starting with the bread, oh my! Super duper delicious. I couldn't stop eating it.   We got some oysters and shrimp cocktail as well. Fries  were Just wow. Potato and couple of other side dishes.   Then I ordered a fillet mignon and oh boy, what a juicy piece of meat that was    I was very pleased with their service. And at the end very full. We couldn't even think of dessert at that point. But maybe next time. I shall return to this place again.   We did try their ribeye and surf & turf as well. All were super scrumptious. Will definitely need to come back here again to try other dishes, or the same dishes. Either way I'm sure I'll be one happy man at the end of it.

__OhPzNjjliiroJoz4balw.text: Food: 4/5 Service: 5/5 Ambiance: 5/5 Overall: A good place for a nice sit down meal.  The extended review...  Rolls - Well I always love me a roll.  A great way to start off the meal.  Potato Puree - Very creamy and tasty.  What can I say but you can't go wrong with mash potatoes right!?  White Corn Grits - Another tasty dish.  A nice texture to the grits as well as bacon...Yes Please!!?  Brussel Sprouts - I suppose the key to any brussel sprout dish is the bacon!  And once again this did not disappoint.  A very good option for some fiber.  Rib Eye - Tender tender tender.  Melt in your mouth texture and cooked to perfection.  Service: Friendly and attentive service.  Ambiance: A very nice setting.  I can't complain about the decor at all.

ZhvDnjzB6CmcT4MquecuXQ.text: Have been back a couple times and unfortunately it still misses the mark since our initial visits. The flavor is off on the steak and they Drenched our steaks in sauce. I am a firm believer in the the fact that a good cut of meat with salt and pepper should suffice and that you need nothing else. Sides were ok. I always love the beet appetizer, and the cauliflower side with garlic was amazing, but everything else was just okay. For the price, I would rather go to Prime at the Bellagio.

BajNuPTEL-o5BKnSovFB2Q.text: Overall very very underwhelming. I must say the restaurant is aesthetically beautiful but that's all it's got going for it. We got the domestic wagyu but it was nothing unique. It was very chewy and tasted kind of old. The sides we're very plain, the potatoes we got were just school lunch style potatoes wedges. I expected more from a James Beard winner, these dishes definitely wouldn't make the cut on Top Chef because they were so standard. We've seeked out steakhouses in Chicago, Miami, San Diego, LA and yes even Cleveland and Pittsburgh steakhouses are better then this.   We recently went to Stripsteak by Michael Mina in Miami another James Beard winning chef. All we could do is compare how the whole experience to food and staff was so much better than  Craftsteak. Honestly Craftsteak was such a let down.   I used to hold Tom in great esteem but now I think he takes advantage of his name to trick vacationers to overpay for his very basic restaurant. I would recommend you find another steakhouse in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu steak (big let down) with the very basic sides. Literally gave us school lunch style potatoes wedges.

G3QEFEb-E_yFn_AKfzGBog.text: A nice steak dinner is a must when having a bachelor party in Vegas, which brought us to Craftsteak.  Ambiance: Very trendy and modern; typical of Vegas. Great place for group meals, dates, business meetings, special occasions, etc...  Food: 1) Ribeye - 18oz ($63) was fantastic. Delicious, juicy, tender, and fatty. Way too much meat. I should've split the steak with someone. 2) Fries- thicker fries, but not as thick as steak fries. Seasoning was fantastic and addicting. 3) Mushroom medley - fantastic 4) Cauliflower - very crispy and amazing.  Service: Excellent as you would expect a nice steakhouse such as this to be since you're paying so much $$$$. Our server gave us a nice delicious gummy dessert for the bachelor.

eLm_tIk6aUUlUNZYXwnOcw.text: Why isn't there a 6 star option?   This is one of the best meals I've had in years, the food was perfect and the service is top shelf.   Lobster bisque to start off then a 16oz bone in Prime NY Strip, potato puree and asparagus followed by house made banana ice cream for dessert.   If I was about to get the electric chair this would be perfect for my last meal.  The staff was amazing, David and his team who served us made sure everything was perfect and it truly way. Bernardo the Manager went above and beyond to make sure we fully enjoyed our meal and I can't thank him enough for that.   Tom Colocchio knows how to deliver an unbelievable dining experience in his restaurants and it show in every interaction we had with his staff. This is what every other restaurant should aspire to be when they grow up.   Thank you Bernardo and the Craft team for making our night so incredible.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mCq-CHAr19nG9bx1dEokSQ.text: I love craft steak!  This is not your typical steakhouse. It had all the vibes of 'Vegas' if you know what I mean.  The husband ordered the A5 Kobe and let me tell you I ate more of his steak than my Wagyu!  Don't get me wrong my Wagyu was bomb as well. But nothing compares when you have the A5 on the table!  The sides were on point and complimented our steaks nicely. Service is exceptional and overall dining experience was wonderful.   I would highly recommend this steakhouse if you haven't already sampled the most delicious steak in your life!  Make sure to make a reservation, this is a Vegas eatery!  Cheers!

GcVZnG5CFqgHOBeJBEPVQQ.text: Oh man, where do I start. When my friends asked me to join them there, I needed to look this place up. I dont go to many steak houses, but was excited to have a night with good company. My friends were already in the restaurant, after I sat down within two minutes the waiter came for my drink order. When he came back he rattled off impressively the menu which is new everyday. I had the filet as did the girls, and we all shared fries, mash potatoes and carmelized sweet corn. We shared salads and the one i had had poached egg and bacon which i liked. On to the main course.....All I can say was that my steak was cooked medium well. That can be a pain to cook and I get it. This was the best prepared and tasting steak that I have had in my life! Cooked to perfection. The sweet corn was a different dish for me that I enjoyed as well. Throughout the evening we had a tag team of a Male and female server. They were on top of everything. Even though I didn't have room for dessert, we had a cinnamon roll with ice cream. Nothing extravagant, but was good. Not many spots impressed me like this one did. Atmosphere and lighting were good. Oh and did I mention the music selection? All of that made a memorable experience.

KqGX-E7_11INQ223TPeMKw.text: A must do if you are in the Vegas area. OMG. If you come with a decent sized party I suggest doing the party order. The chef chooses meats and sides based on a few questions. It does not disappoint.  Three of my adult family members did it and split it and there were still many leftovers. Make sure to get you steak at most medium, this is not a place tonorde a well done steak. And if you like mushrooms you will love their selection.

n6IOa_yzrqRs_LTID_rV9w.text: This is the only steakhouse I've been to during this short trip to LV. I chose it based on location and rating / reviews on Yelp. I showed up the moment the restaurant opened and got seated without a reservation within 5 mins. The interior is upscale, the waiters and staff know how to handle themselves around guests. I ordered fillet mignon and 2 sides: mushroom and potato.  After 45 mins of waiting (I was there by myself so clearly it seemed to be a very long time), I finally called the waitress to check the status of the dishes. She came back a minute later and said the food is almost ready, so 10 mins later I got the food. Veggies were delicious, much better than the steak :)  All in all, too pricey for the service I got - probably, won't return.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fancy!
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some cute lighters inside

5Xq5T6xUnlGpPUMJzJ8J0g.text: I went here with my fiance, and let me tell you that being a foodie and fan of Top Chef, this place is definitely one to go to.   This was a truly amazing meal and for this to be my first YELP ever I hope I do you Yelpers justice and don't forget anything.  We had a reservation for 9:00PM and waited at the bar until our table was ready, they were very prompt at seating us and got us a booth, we sat down and the waiter service was excellent, they got us the menus, the wait staff were all very knowledgeable and actually helped us to make our decisions.  Our waiter, Francisco advised us on the everything and asked us what are some things that we liked.  We decided NOT to go with the Chefs Tasting Menu as we weren't that hungry, because the portions are HUGE, so here is the detail of what we did have...  Bread:  They brought out these little pillows of bread in its own little baking tray, these things are AWESOME, soft and pillowy (is that even a word)! They had great texture, a little crispy on the top, very light and airy, and perfectly buttered and then sprinkled with a little kosher salt.  Sweet and salty and buttery all in one, I think we had about two or three trays of this stuff.  Appetizers:   Lobster bisque - we shared this and they even asked us if we wanted it in to be served in separate bowls which we did, and even then I still feel that it was a good sized portion, the bisque was flavorful and rich and creamy and smooth, with good amounts of lobster pieces in each bowl, my only regret is that I wish we got our own, because neither one of us wanted to share!!!!  Mains:  For me, I got the 16oz bone in rib eye, cooked to a perfect medium rare.    Fiance, got the Surf and Turf (Filet and  1/2 Lobster) also cooked to perfection.    Sides:  Hen of the Woods Mushroom - This was by far the BEST mushrooms that I have ever had and I LOVE MUSHROOMS, at first sight they didn't look too appetizing as they really don't look like your traditional mushroom side dish, but they are truly awesome, the texture is amazing, they were crispy and soft and chewy and melt in you mouth all at the same time, man I want some of these things right NOW, and the flavor wow I'M speechless.  Yukon Gold Puree - much better than your standard fair mash potatoes, creamy and buttery.    Desserts: We were WAY TOO FULL to have dessert, but from what we did see they looked amazing!  All in all this was one on the best dining experiences that I have ever had, and what's even better for me is that I have FINALLY turned my fiance into a foodie (she never really understood why I would watch the Food Network and Top Chef all the time) and now she wants to try out everything while we are here in Vegas.  My next review will be Hubert Keller's Burger Bar, but that's another awesome meal and review.    One last thing to mention as we were waiting for our check, at the table next to us sits down Pierre Gagnaire 3 star Michelin chef who just opened Twist restaurant at Mandarin Oriental in Las Vegas, the perfect ending to a perfect dining experience.

KUeehwZJyn8HHTmRrnDqlg.text: My friends and I wanted to splurge on a nice meal in Vegas.  Since we were staying at MGM anyway, we chose Craftsteak.  Unfortunately, we were complete idiots and decided to go to the Wynn Buffet for a late lunch that same day, and by the time dinner rolled around...none of us had an appetite.  [Before that, we had used whatever stomach space we had left to store some alcohol, of course.]    I ordered an appetizer - a cold, marinated mushroom salad.  I only managed to eat about 5 tiny mushrooms.  They were delicious, though.  My friends who had ordered "real" food enjoyed their dishes a lot...unsurprisingly, people raved about the steak.    I wasn't too sad about just eating mushrooms. ...Until I found out that it was owned by Top Chef's Tom Colicchio!  Now I want to kick myself every time I think about it.  Oh well...yet another reason to go to Vegas again...

yAe8wWsyT7UAszeA68NUAA.text: Had a lovely dinner here on a recent trip to Vegas - sad to say, the restaurant was only 30% full, much like the entire city, it seemed.  But, all in all, a good experience.  Service was friendly, efficient, and altogether non-obtrusive (although, ultimately, was the cause of my deducting a star...I'll get to that in a minute.)  Started with a well poured martini and the frisee salad - delicate frisee with sizable chunks of warm, smoky bacon, bleu cheese, and a warm champagne vinegarette.  It was a nice start to the meal, accompanied by warm fresh rolls that could have come from my grandmother's oven.  Delicious.  Ordered a bottle of Mollydooker and had the bone in ribeye cooked medium rare, ordered it on the rarer side of medium rare, and it was cooked perfectly.  Came out sizzling on its own small platter with a roasted shallot, and was seasoned to perfection, just enough salt, pepper, and (I believe) thyme.  Also ordered the side order of mushrooms (hen of the woods, shitake, and another that I am failing to remember - enoki, perhaps?) and the potato leek gratin - sinfully delicious.  My coworker ordered the shortribs, and really, really made me wish I had - although my steak was delicious, the shortribs were some of the best I'd tasted.  We finished sharing a delicate chocolate souffle with warm, perfect caramel sauce and ice cream.  Yum.  Not usually a dessert person, but it was really, really good.    While not among the best meals of my life, this would be a very solid choice if your carnivorous cravings strike while in Vegas.    So - why just A-OK?  Well...I know that times are a little tough in Sin City right now, but MGM has heavily advertised their winter tasting menus at all the restaurants.  Thus, while I was happy with my meal, what I really wanted was the tasting menu.  At an advertised $60 pp and $30 wine pairing, I was really looking forward to it.    However, when I asked our server about it, he said he'd never heard of it, and that the only tasting menus available were the kobe beef menus (part of the standard menu, from $135/pp - $255/pp before wine.)  Not the case, as it turns out.  That menu WAS availalble.  So, deducting a star for what I can only assume was either total stupidity or a deliberate gouge, turning my $90/pp dinner into $150/pp.  Either way - a star deducted.

UyRVWg62aLvMhMMVNWzqNw.text: Sadly, we were very disappointed with my husband's steak.  He ordered the wagyu ribeye.  It was chewy, lacked flavor and something was definitely wrong with it.  We aren't usually the kind of people to complain, but at that price, the lack of quality meat was completely unacceptable.   The wagyu skirt steak, on the other hand, was amazing.  We also really enjoyed the broccolini.  The lobster bisque was creamy and pretty good, and the wagyu tar tar was unlike anything we've ever eaten.  The wandering photographer added an unnecessary cheese factor that absolutely didn't belong in such a nice place.

4LtHIuN0_uTY0Cel_KAuRQ.text: This is my favorite steakhouse! The dining experience is always amazing. I travel to Las Vegas just to eat here. These are some of my favorite menu items:  Kobe beef tartar - rich and "eyes rolling back in your head" delicious. Beet salad - 4 kinds of baby beets, simply dressed and simply fabu! NY Steak - cooked perfectly every time and big enough for two people. Blue Lake green beans Polenta with bleu cheese - creamy and delicious. wild mushroom risotto  For dessert I usually order the ice cream and sorbet sampler...on my most recent trip I had the most amazing basil sorbet.  I cannot recommend Craftsteak enough.  Update:6/11/08  Was just there again last weekend...had the same exact items...still amazing as always!!!  Updated: 7/3/08  Just can't stay away! We ate at the bar because we had tickets to the 51's game. The service at the bar is just as amazing as in the restaurant. They serve the full menu and it is served just as beautifully and delicious. They changed the bread basket to fresh baked rolls served in the cast iron pan they are baked in. The rolls are fluffy and filling...be careful not to spoil your appetite. Craftsteak just can't do any wrong!

8kii8q5rhzbYCN2BBPXmog.text: Listen and Listen well. If you have a modicum of taste, if you have ever had a steak in Nebraska, if you like flavor, then aviod this poorly crafted steak place.  It's funny to think  that Collichio has the audacity to rip other chefs.  Craftsteak is no better than Outback.    There were so many infractions on the field here I dont know were to begin.    The first yellow card was waiting for an inordinately long time for service.  The waiter was slow and dilatory.  And, his explanation on mushrooms was not even an explanation.  I asked what types of mushrooms were listed and he said, "just get the assortment you will get all the mushrooms then."  Thanks Casper, thats a hell of an idea.  I could have thought of that one myself.  But, I would still like to know what types of mushrooms I can anticipate.   The second yellow card, came with waiting after I had finished my beer.  I was not asked if I would like another until the meal was served.  That was 10min after I finished my first.    Two yellows is a red.  Now you are a man down.  The thrid, fourth, and fifth yellows came in quick succession.  Some idiot in the back went hog-wild with the Sea Salt.  I thought they pulled the cow from the bottom of Salt Lake.  Ya know Collichio a little salt goes a long way.   If there is a chef in the world who can actually impart flavor on to asparagus, then he aint working at Craftsteak.  You know make the veggies exciting.  I guess Toby from Top Chef said it right, "its like the bland leading the bland."    The ribs and steak were not lean. They were infused with fat.  Our cows definitly had Type II diabetes.  They were the fatest cows in the lot.  Given their poor taste and texture, they were probably Nascar fans to boot.   I really wouldnt care so much but dont try to be a top notch steak house.  I've had better steaks in Portland, Omaha, and Worcester.   Save your money go for a mid range restaurant and buy your girl a nice gift.  But, dont even think about spending one moment in the most uncomfortable chair in the world just to eat this unsavory hodgepodge of mediocrity.  With so many infractions, all I can say is Chef Collichio please pack up your knives and leave.

HclhILSKHVoJnpuUT0ejnw.text: I apologize in advance for gushing...but I likely won't be able to help myself.  The meal I had at craftsteak last week was one of my top five meals ever...easily...and it was Vegas Restaurant Week.    Collicchio's menu had it goin' on.  The best part was that there was no choice involved because you were served EVERYTHING on the special menu.   A first course of roasted red peppers, arugula and some of the best prosciutto ever cured was paired with a delightful sparkling rose.  The main course was a trio of kobe beef sirloin, tender roasted chicken, and grilled diver scallops accompanied by yukon gold whipped potatoes (yum!), roasted sweet corn and sauteed shitake mushrooms and served with a perfect shiraz that surprisingly paired perfectly with each component.  The dessert was spectacular...and I am not usually a huge fan of sweet things.  Pineapple sorbet, mint chocolate chip ice cream, chunks of cantaloupe and pineapple, chocolate molten cake, and (my favorite) sweet monkey bread with a light caramel dipping sauce.  This course was paired with a lovely sparkling muscat.   W-O-W!  And wimpy portions these were not.  All courses were served family style and with just me and my fiance eating, we had plenty left over.  In explaining how full we were to his best friend he said, "I left meat on my plate."  If you knew him you would understand that this has likely never happened!  Of course we did make the mistake of arriving early to sit at the bar and enjoy some appetizers.  The grilled Hawaiian shrimp were fabulous!  We also tried the kobe beef tartare, which was ok, but didn't blow us away.  The consistency was pate-like and I think we were both expecting chunks.   For two cocktails and two appetizers we ended up spending more than it was for one person to enjoy all of the aforementioned food and wine pairings.  The bar bill was $90 with tip, but the full menu was $50.07 plus $20.00 for the wine...a True steal!  I can't say enough about the service at craftsteak, either.  Fabulous!  The servers, bartenders, and hostesses alike were all informative, professional, relaxed, and definitely not stuffy.  The restaurant itself is beautiful and very classy.   Lovely...super...totally worth it!  The regular menu is definitely pricey, so try to hit one of these deals or eat an appetizer somewhere else beforehand if you don't want to splurge.  If you do, go for it and enjoy!

m6Whyc1JBkdvzqAwSI0L-g.text: Went here last night and had a great time. Service was very friendly and attentive. Our table went with the Summer Tasting Menu which was the way to go in terms food and price. For sixty dollars we got the following:  1st Course: Grilled Quail Watercress and Cucumber Salad Roasted Red Peppers  Main Course: Diver Scallops in Citrus Butter Kobe Rib Eye x2 Roasted Chicken  Dessert: Molten Chocolate Cake 6 Different Types of Ice Cream and Sorbet (Coconut was the Best) Fresh Fruit Monkey Bread  We also add Fore Grais, Corn Soup, and Oysters to our meal and they all were excellent. This is the place to come for simple, perfectly prepared food.

btf_bn4cp73WAVS6ajzkFw.text: I thought my meal was mediocre at best.  The steak should have been 'definitely coming back' good but it wasn't.  Great wine list though!

SdDQZcbf2ExbRdp-T0Q33w.text: We chose the "domestic waygu chefs menu" partially because the a la carte is an overwhelming amount of choices, and partially because I think it's a better deal at $150 per person.  It was a staggering amount of food, but we asked and the maitre'd said very few had finushed the whole thing in his 7 years there. Speaking of waitstaff, they were as great as you'd expect. Our waiter suggested an outstanding wine pairing.  The whole experience was worth every penny.

WMt4MbkVVxS5mVWik450yA.text: *Stands up and applauds Chef Tom Colicchio and Chef Matt Seeber*  WOW! If I was on death row, and they asked me what my last meal would be, one of those meals would definitely be a steak from Craftsteak. I truly believe this is the best steak I have had in my life. I ordered the Rib Eye Med. Rare and my friend got the New York Strip Rare. Both were  charred to perfection on the outside and oh so tender in the inside. The thyme accented the steaks very well. That little sweet shallot on my plate paired nicely. I savored every morsel of steak in my mouth. I didn't want this meal to end.   We also had the pleasure to enjoy the Asparagus and the Potatoes Gratin. The Asparagus was not overdone like most places do, and the tips were crispy! I don't know how they got the body so tender and the tips as crispy as they were, but good job! No, GREAT job!  The ambiance was very nice! My friend and I shared a table that had a little sofa on one side ( that shared with table next us) which I enjoyed thoroughly.  I sat on the other side with the most comfortable chair in my life! Haha Service was impeccable, but would you expect less from this restaurant's owner?  Definitely the best birthday dinner ever! =P

eVWUy6mblojDMLKDgO1zbA.text: Top Chef: Tom Colicchio, Head Judge, Seasons 1-5  I was a little conflicted about the review to give this restaurant.  First, it is an absolutely fantastic space.  They really did a nice job with it.  One of my problems was that the servers totally upsold us on the amount of food we would need.  I'm a good eater, but I was so full by the time the steak came out that I barely had time to finish it.  My recommendation would be to go with the steak and a side dish or two, skip the apps and then see if you have enough room for dessert.  Having said that, I thought the hanger steak was very good.  The meat certainly takes center stage, and is well seasoned, but not overly so.  The steak was tender and beefy, just like a thin hanger ought to be.  I'd go back, but would change the way I ordered to enjoy it more.

WSrn54USUCuojpwCE8JLYg.text: Wow.  Wow. Wow.  No vegetarians or vegans allowed.  If you are a carnivore- this is the place to be.   My friend and I were sitting like a pair of assholes on the blackjack table for hours, shmoozing with the Pit Boss (Nick) at the Venetian, when our tummies began to rumble.  He suggested we check Craftsteak out...we obliged.. he made a reservation for us...and boy, I am glad we made it. I went with three of my girlfriends, and we ordered a feast... but, beware... the portions are GINORMOUS.   The Cesar salad was ehh... okay.  The oysters... INCREDIBLE. The french fries... to DIE for. The assortment of mushrooms... ya baby.  The braised short ribs... ORGASMIC. I'm not kidding... Amazing sex or Craft's braised short ribs? It's debatable.   I was insanely stuffed by the end of dinner... so I did not indulge in any of the desserts my friends did... however, I did witness them climaxing.   We ordered two bottles of wine... and the sommelier was kind of a prick... but whatever... he wasn't that good looking anyway.   If you are in Vegas... make a reservation!!! Craftsteak will not disappoint.

ezgNfvGM_JzR_t3L0PwMtw.text: I've been here for dinner two times. One of my FAVORITE places in Las Vegas for steak. The beef tartare w/ quail egg is(in my opinion) the best tartare I've EVER had!! We actually had a server from Hawaii, so that was cool being able to talk to someone from home. Great Food!!! Great wine!!! Great Service!!! I'll be back next time I'm in town!!  Aloha

hGehKzdx16GReLBRacrItw.text: If I were to write an accurate review of the food and how I felt afterwards, it would look like Helen Keller's twitter account; "UNGHHHHHHHHH CHARRRRFFFFFFF uUNNGNNGGGgggg."  Consider that the review I really want to write, but for the sake of information, here's another review.  My 2 friends and I got the Wagyu beef prix fixe menu. This came with 3 appetizers; buffalo mozzarella with roasted red peppers and hazelnuts in a balsamic vinaigrette, hawaiian prawns, and a delicious caesar salad.  The main course - the steak - was wagyu beef served in 3 different cuts. We went with the chef's recommendation, strip steak, new york steak, and ribeye steak. The beef altogether was over 2 pounds of meat. Steak was served with shallots, and the sides were shiitaake mushrooms, hen of the woods mushrooms, and japanese white mushrooms. We also switched out the mashed potatoes for french fries, and got a roasted corn side. Delish!  Dessert put the whole meal over the top. We got raspberry, watermelon, peach, and cherry sorbet. Also got a peach cobbler with peach sorbet on it, a "liquid" chocolate cake served with cookies and cream ice cream, another interesting peach dish, and a bowl of fresh fruit.  Altogether with tax and tip, the meal came to $180 per person. I definitely feel like I got my money's worth, although I'm still having trouble breathing from the amount of food that I consumed. I'm going to take a nap and then have a steak baby.  Five stars, don't miss this place.

AuTzo5wIuVJiKMzm56au2Q.text: Truly disappointing.  At $78 for a poterhouse for two, I expected something at least as good as Outback Steakhouse.  But what my friend and I got was a steak that looked really good, but tasted oh so mediocre.  The steak lacked any kind of juiciness and at one part of the filet portion had this gummy, sticky consistency.  Not something you'd expect from a expensive, well known steakhouse.  The only thing that saved the steak was the sauce bernaise, which was excellent.  But in my opinion, a great steak should not need the help of sauce to taste good.  The rest of the meal was hit/miss.  The quail was one of the best I've tasted.  The Frisee salad was horrible -- way too much blue cheese.  the Hen of the Woods mushroom was pretty good.  but after all, this is a steak place and should be rated on its steak.  If the steak cost $20/person, I would give it 3.5 stars.  But at almost $40/person, 2 is the most this place deserves.

u4HfoURd68U5v-D7zFBbVA.text: I was excited to go to Craftsteak because I am a huge Top Chef fan and it is Tom Colicchio's restaurant. Of course, he wasn't there, and is only there about 4x a year, but still... it was cool to be there! First of all, the restaurant is  gorgeous! It is decorated very cool and trendy. I liked how they had some repeating geometric patterns going on, and that there was just a subtle sophistication to it. It wasn't stuffy or fancy... just a very nice environment.  Now to the food: First of all, this place is $$! We would have never come here had they not had the winter tasting menu. It was a 3 course meal for $60/pp. On the menu they had a listing for apps, entrees, sides and then dessert. It mentioned it was family style so I assumed that everyone at the table would have to choose one for each category.  But I was pleasantly mistaken!!! Basically, you get everything! Everything, meaning, you got 3 apps, 3 entrees, 3 sides and 2 desserts! It was SO much food! I was so excited b/c I got to try EVERYTHING! When does that happen? They were also decent size portions... large enough that we really couldn't finish everything and we didn't feel bad.   Apps: We got to try the quail, which I had never had before and would have never ordered. It was delicious! So tender and perfectly seasoned with balsamic vinegar. There was also a yummy beet salad, a lettuce salad and a red pepper salad.   Entrees: Roasted Prime Flat Iron Steak: My favorite of the three. So tender and well flavored; Certified Angus Beef Skirt Steak: also, very good but I didn't really understand why we needed 2 cuts of beef; Diver Sea Scallop: Very tasty but nothing overly impressive.  Sides: Yukon Gold Potato Puree: My favorite! But how could you go wrong with this? Sauteed Shiitake Mushrooms: eh? just ok; Brussels Sprouts with Smoked Bacon: ditto  Desserts: For the desserts, they just give you random ones: We got this caramel nut roll... kind of like a cinnamon roll, served with caramel ice cream. It was really sweet, but tasty. My favorite was the other one, which was a chocolate lava cake served with espresso ice cream.   Overall, I loved that they gave us so much food! Everything was really fresh and high quality! It made for a really nice Vegas dinner. I will comment that the service was not outstanding, though. Still, I left Craftsteak very satisfied... and extremely full!

hwDlIBJcm3x7N6MHj83PnA.text: Of all the Vegas steakhouses, this is my favorite.  You can actually pick between dry-aged and wet-aged and grain fed and grass fed.  Their dry-aged steaks are excellent and my friends who like wet-aged say they are very good as well.  An edge that Craftsteak has are its excellent side dishes.  The only one who outdoes the Yukon mashed potatoes is Robuchon and not by very much.  The only restaurant that has better creamed spinach is the DC Palm which has a different recipe for creamed spinach than all the other Palms in the U.S.  There was one occassion where the service was a bit slow but other than that it has always been an outstanding restaurant.  It is expensive but worth it.

IYJ3rfFKBp1wV7XtKuNNJQ.text: An overall great experience at Craftsteak! I will have to disagree with the "dressy attire" on the top yelp profile... There were some diners who were dressed in almost "prom attire" then there was the drunk, wet people who stumbled their way from the pool in their ed hardy best and trucker hats. I guess if you come to dinner and pay close to $300 you should be able to wear whatever you want..  Our server, walter.. or was it wallace.. was great. He helped with wine pairing and course selection. The previous night another couple who we were in vegas with tried the tasting menu. She said it was the worst tasting menu ever and to stay far away from it. With that in mind the bf and I ordered from the dinner menu.  ::Appetizer:: Wagyu Steak Tar Tar ($22): Delicious! Absolutely Delicious! My boyfriend was a little hesitant in trying steak tar tar (we usually only have tuna tar tars) but that soon subsided when he tasted the creamy wagyu steak. It was topped with a quail egg and paired with crispy tiny bread. It was very good. The steak was so light and seasoned perfectly. I highly recommended everyone trying the steak tar tar (meat lovers only duhh..)  Surf n Turf ($62): Filet mignon with your choice of either half lobster, grilled prawns or diver sea scallops. I choose the scallops. I asked for my filet mignon medium rare, it came out medium... for a steak house with such an esteem reputation I would of expected that my steak would not be over cooked. I really couldn't complain though because the meat itself just melted in my mouth. One of the best filets I have ever had.   -Diver sea scallops: by far the best scallops hands down. 3 big scallops came next to my filet mignon. They were cooked perfectly and topped with a fennel salad. The presentation was amazing but the scallops were to die for!  My boyfriend had the Rib eye ($44) with a side of grilled asparagus ($12).  The rib eye was huge! The grilled asparagus easily can feed 2 people. He really enjoyed his rib eye.   For Dessert: -Sorbet ($6/each): We tried the Melon Sorbet and the Strawberry Sorbet. Best way to end dinner.. (each order of sorbet comes with 2 big scoops of sorbet. can be easily shared)  -Coffee: Served in a french press. For only $4, they give you about 4 cups of coffee..

4pPgjY_4SxIG4e-fpo_hfA.text: Worst steak I ever had.  Order 2 domestic koby beef shell steaks. Both came out cold   Steaks were fatty. Horrible trimming $108 a piece. Garbage.  Sides were terrible.  Came out cold.  Cooked kale was very salty. Corn grits were good but cold.  Ordered a $260 bottle of wine 2009.  Not decanted.   Terrible service. The waiters were very friendly and nice.   Over rated.

hiEFeqI_fsFQ8OSrdXRbtw.text: If you have the money and the time I would definitely recommend the chefs tasting menu.  I went into it thinking it was going to be little bites of food here and there. It started with our maitre d' asking if we wanted an alcoholic drink.  I decided to have sparkling water (two bottles in total) which I later came to find out was 8 bucks a piece.  It was a good addition to the rich food but helped our final bill climb. I can't remember all of the items that ended up coming to our table but every one of them was substantial and oh so tasty.  The mashed potatoes are a must have even if you are just having a steak get the potatoes you will enjoy them.  The meats including Wagyu skirt, strip and lobster melted in my mouth.  The lobster came with a parsnip butter sauce.  All I can say was oh my goodness.  It also came with the potatoes I mentioned earlier, asparagus, wild mushrooms and a grain of some kind.  When dessert came out they had brought several different plates and I was expecting to get to pick one.  OH NO they all were for me.  Cheese cake, two kinds of ice cream, chocolate mousse, seasonal berries and the ever so delicious monkey bread.  By the time the bill came it was just around 400.00 including tip.  The experience was worth it for this foodie.  My full tummy felt like it was going to burst for hours after and was pretty uncomfortable even the next day.

yZryfXPxoFLfosc9DNKBAA.text: Disappointed doesn't begin to describe it. I have had well-prepared steaks at fine establishments in the US, Argentina, Brazil... this was not one of them. The steaks came out cool. I understand steaks need to rest before serving, but this was out right cool. Also, I requested rib-eye medium-rare.. came out closer to rare but not a big deal. My wife requested medium, but this was closer to medium rare. For someone who wants a medium temperature steak, getting it more towards rare IS actually a big deal. Sigh, and for the amount we paid, not worth it. The quality of the steak was also questionable. Service was attentive and atmosphere was pleasant. Only bright spot was stepping out into the MGM Grand Casino, pulling on the slots once, and winning 40 bucks. Paid for the server's tip. One extra star for the well-prepared broccoli.

RypWXNN1YHKzrkFum6VB6g.text: A fantastic meal, great service, many menu options, and oh yah amazing food.  Very simple chic decor and proper ambient lighting.  Some highlights for us were the bone-in filet, kobe skirt steak, yukon gold puree potatoes, pistachio ice cream.  The hostesses were a little clueless...despite my confirmation number...but they pulled it together and got us a fab table.  Great portion sizes as well...just right...versus the typical steakhouse I just ate a bowling ball feeling.

B7wx7-4aq7qWSAxAkoS8vQ.text: So this place has a big, fancy name to live up to -- I guess it's owned by one of the judge's on Top Chef or something...  I tried this place a few weeks ago while on vacation in Vegas. Unfortunately, I was really disappointed.  The decor, the wait-staff, the ambiance -- I figured this place was going to rock. But when the food came out and I took the first few bites, I was surprised to see how AVERAGE the food was. Honestly, I could have eaten as good at a place in the Bay for 1/10 the cost. A dinner for four girls ended up being nearly $500 (yes, we did get two bottles of wine, but neither were more than $50)...  I felt this place was completely over-priced for the quality of its food. I guess the place has a great "name," and I think my friends loved it because they felt like they were 'supposed to,' but steer clear! SO many better places to eat in Sin City (and for so much cheaper).

j9lO0IpST2jbZqpsCWEvRg.text: Please pack your knives and go...here!  As critical as Tom Colicchio can be on Top Chef, it's hard to find anything to dislike about his restaurant.   Unlike some Vegas restaurants, the atmosphere makes you feel as if you've truly escaped the casino madness and entered another world. The service is top notch and the food was outstanding. Their wine list is overwhelming, but if you look around you can find a decent bottle for under $100.   For appetizers we ordered oysters (fantastic!), the yellowtail hamachi (very fresh, although the citrus did overpower the fish a bit), and the lobster bisque (absolutely perfect - we ordered one to share for the table and they brought it to us in four small cups - nice touch).  I had the wagyu skirtsteak and it was by far the best skirtsteak I've ever eaten. The yukon potatoes were amazing and the fries were perfect.  For dessert I highly recommend the monkeybread - it was amazing and the pecan/brown sugar ice cream was so refreshing.
