-vowaRkx8p03FI3j_AZGWQ.text: Craftsteak Vegas was amazing!  Marvin was our server but so much more!  True definition of a host!  He made our evening absolutely memorable.  Food was outstanding.  Highly recommend Craftsteak for everyone.  Food was great but it was definitely the service that put it over the top.  Slightly disappointed with the bar service.

7psGSD29NrAR6946cC2InQ.text: I was a bit apprehensive ratting here because it is vegas and sometimes these restaurants do not live up to the hype.  I was happily proven wrong on this one.  The food, service and ambiance was outstanding!   I ordered the Ribeye and the recommendation of our waitress. Oh and by the way I wish I recalled her name because she was one of the best waitresses I have had.  We actually had a team of people waiting on our table but she was the lead and did amazing.  Back to the food. The Ribeye was cooked to perfection and the flavor needed no additions.  I was full half way through due to the size but I could stop eating so I finished it.  Everything is al a cart so we ordered sides of asparagus, puree potatoes, and broccolini.  All were good choices and I would order again.  To start we ordered Friseea salad with bacon and blue cheese.  Yummy is all I have to say about that.  Oh and by the way it's family style so order accordingly cuz it is a lot of food.   It's expensive but worth the price. Ill be back!

x-uNbI4WHIQa3_amKVmNaA.text: This place was GOOD, but was it $67 steak is the best steak I've had good? No. My husband and I dated the grilled ribeye and it was good, but not great. The service was awesome and the food was good, don't get me wrong. But I don't think I'm willing to pay that much for one of their steaks again.

WEg1TMUZdMwv_RD5AEJolA.text: Coming from Chris Santos' Beauty & Essex the night before where we experienced outstanding service- we (my boyfriend and I) were expecting this to be even better and it was a little bit of a let down.   The restaurant itself is nice but not breathtaking. The service was friendly but clumsy and confusing. As we sat down we were introduced to three people who would be helping us as a team (which was very cool) except they didn't work very well as a team. We were greeted multiple times as if we had just sat down, asked the same questions again and again (have you been here before? is this your first time in vegas?) yet no one explained the menu to us- as they have a vague family style option in a box in the corner that must be explained as it has little to no actual information in it.   For drinks, we both got Old Fashions with the well whiskey which is Makers Mark. They were HUGE (yess!) but SOOOOO SWEET. Way too much simple syrup, but we didn't send them back (I actually enjoyed it).  We ordered the foie gras to start- literally all it said on the menu was foie gras, no description of the dish. When we got it, our server set it down without describing it at all. We just stared at this dish of what looked like braised peaches? maybe grilled? maybe nectarines? in some kind of sauce? with seared foie. No bread to eat it with. Very strange. There was no texture at all, the peaches were mushy, the foie was severely overcooked and nasty (and we loooooveeee foie). We had to send it back and we felt horrible. We were not offered anything else in replacement of our sent back appetizer. And in fact the manager came by and touched both the tables on either side of us but not our table at all- so so weird, did no one tell her? was there no communication about this?   30 minutes later our entree come out- steak, corn, potatoes, mushrooms. It's not until now that the manager comes over to apologize for the foie. Luckily, the steak is a perfect rare and is absolutely delicious as with the corn and potatoes. Mushrooms are only okay.   The bread, btw, that is complimentary, is GREAT. The butter could use a quick pinch of finishing salt but whatever.  2 people: 2 cocktails / 1 entree / 3 sides /  (they comped the foie) $160   TL;DR- there are probably better steakhouses in Vegas

bMspv4T68gn44i34mpHCYA.text: Excellent experience, Need to try the Flatiron Steak, and the Divers Scallops! The culinary experience is very good, not excellent, but very good. Our friends enjoyed the Ribeye steak, and it wad cooked to perfection. My wifes Flstiron was amazing. The service here is good and the Wait staff is very attentive. I do recommend it, but there are classier joints if thats what you are looking for. And that is why i rated a 4

M-GNicQNMYsSGaHRnqaMcQ.text: One word could describe our meal at Craftsteak: Mediocre.   I'll start by saying that I've eaten at some of the best steakhouses in Las Vegas and was hoping that I could add Craftsteak to the list of my favorites. I was wrong.  Our party of 3 arrived at around 845pm and was promptly seated by the friendly waitstaff. We all opted for the tasting menu which was around $100 per person. The tasting menu included a salad,  an entree, two sides, and dessert.   It wasn't until about 920pm until our salads arrived. I opted for the Caesar Salad, which was decent but not overly impressive (as also indicated by other reviews). It was basically just a large piece of lettuce with some croutons, bottled dressing, and anchovies on top.   Our dinner didn't arrive until close to 10pm. I don't mind waiting usually but over an hour until our main course arrived is ridiculous. Here's the breakdown of what I ordered:   Hangar Steak: The hangar steak was cooked perfectly but was not seasoned. We had to request salt and pepper.   French Fries: The french fries sounded delicious on the menu description but basically tasted like McDonalds fries sprinkled with paprika. Don't be fooled by the mouth watering menu description; these fries are average.   Shiitake Mushrooms: Mushrooms were dry, tasteless, and also lacked seasoning.   We all were so disappointed with our meal at Craftsteak and expected so much more from a Tom Colicchio restaurant. We finished with our meal and informed our server that we were skipping dessert because it was now close to 11pm and we had somewhere we needed to be by 1130pm.   Next time you're in Las Vegas skip Craftsteak and stick to STK at the Cosmo or Smith and Wollensky's next to MGM Grand. You won't be disappointed in those choices.

krKDReWcIiu3wTREr2kdfw.text: Steak was perfect, waiters were wonderful and food was delicious! Had the waygu tartare, grilled ribeye, roasted by strip, baby shiitakes and spinach. Delish!!!

ANG6q8VqRcbrgktws8oOgA.text: It's just OK and overly priced. I would not spend 1,000 dinner for 5 here. I'd rather go gamble that at the table games lol.

i4B6oy7NQY3IL5oOkDeQvg.text: Made a reservation for 8 pm on a Sunday evening.  We were greeted right away by the hostess and sat at the bar waiting for our table to be ready.  We were about 10 minutes early for our reservation but ended up waiting about 25 min before we were seated.  Our server was friendly and very knowledgeable about the menu.  Overall the food was good.  For a steakhouse my husband was a little disappointed in the steak.  Although it was very tender it lacked flavor.  The sea bass I ordered was above excellent!  The brussell sprouts and asparagus were very tasty sides.  Overall it was a pretty good experience.

FiQhJyQyDNlCRsBFBvrPUg.text: This place is amazing, especially for big groups.  The sides are all absolutely delicious, great for passing around the table.  The wine list is decent, but is probably the only aspect of this restaurant that isn't utterly flawless.  The 14 oz. domestic wagyu ribeye is among the finest steaks I've experienced, worth every penny and then some.  Great service, dazzling atmosphere.  Everyone's a winner here.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 14 oz. domestic wagyu ribeye

1nGTGhyeH00KZ66pKwc72Q.text: Beautiful place. Didn't have any reservations and they sat us pretty quick. I ordered the Diver Sea Scallops. They were DELICIOUS!!!!!!! The staff was super friendly and constantly checking up on us. The manager came up to us to make sure everything was great. He was super nice! The mashed potatoes and asparagus were quite delicious. I will definitely be back here again. Loved everything about this place from the front desk staff to everyone here at the restaurant. It was just good vibes all around. This place made me smile constantly lol. Thank you!!!

qvhoRrUrjlVrR21MTDoR3A.text: This is definitely my all time favorite fancy steakhouse in vegas. If you are ready to splurge on some good meat this is the place to go. All their cute if meats are yummy from their flank steak to their sirloin and of course my favorite the bone in ribeye! YUM! From the beginning of the experience with the bread to the main entree everything is so tasty. I've gone here for date night with the husband to multiple girls nights and bachelorettes, and every time the service and food were on point.   This place is pretty pricey but definitely worth it. The bone in ribeye is shareable with some apps, salads and sides.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pbi3H3mxncas4sf7StCIFA.text: This was one of the best meals I've ever had. Period. The entire experience, food and service, was exquisite. Did I mention the buns were the best buns I've ever had my entire life?? Omg. They were baked in this cast iron skillet. The outside was slightly crisp and brushed with butter on top with sprinkling of rock salt. The inside was warm and super soft. Perfection! Ribeye was amazingly good. Cooked to medium as requested. Did you know you can have a half order of fries? Yes. Mushroom assortment was good but we liked the shiitaki mushrooms the most. And the lobster bisque can be split in two. They serve it table side with chunks of lobster in your bowl. It was a great dining experience and would love to return one day. Definitely lives up to Tom Colicchio's name!   Oh forgot to mention that our waiter was really kind and attentive and went out of his way to answer a question that had nothing to do with the restaurant, which was where the ride sharing pick up location was. He spoke with another staff member to confirm the info he was giving us. That place runs like a well oiled machine.   My only dislike is that it was dark but that's me. I don't like to eat in the dark.

X_B-7ldVHw-M76SSwpR4dA.text: Still the best.    Great service.   Phenomenal steaks. Been stopping here for over a decade now, will always stop here when in town.

XvKgoWBiCB7iWMHUUtgyvw.text: We have eaten here a few times and definitely the best place I have ever eaten at.  This is the place that I judge the service of all other restaurants by.  They really know how to make you feel special. The service and food is something I have never experienced before.  This is my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas.

GxEx0RW8UU70V0YI3QHAEA.text: Service here was excellent.  Love the ambiance too and great for special events like anniversary, birthdays and even for a large group with friends or work meetings.  Their Two Barrell Whiskey was excellent and they smoke it in house. I highly recommend you try. My favorite dish was their arugula pine salad. Really refreshing along with their Monkey dessert. We attempted their steak but the order had a few hiccups.  However, they comp our dessert, my French pressed coffee and my coworker's drinks were on the house which made the experience memorable.   Make sure to have a reservation as they get super swamped. If you don't, come after 9:45pm which I was told they should have a few table openings especially on weekends or convention  week.  Cheers!

-GZwUrkyqkO_jCLikIcClQ.text: I like Craftsteak because it has steak sourced from places that make it really unique. The A5 Wagyu from Japan never disappoints. And it shouldn't for $250! The scallops are excellent and tastes like the ocean.   The service is excellent each time I've eaten here. The ambience is modern and lighter toned than most steak restaurants.  The one thing that I would change is the lobster bisque. I would prefer to see large chunks of lobster.

ZKgzv_gto0g8peTggUZxKg.text: I planned a 24 man bachelor party here and it was amazing! We had an all star meal and service. Anyone thinking about a large group dinner and want great food and drinks this is the place!

o642iavQ0P1bDl5zaHYwzw.text: Nothing and I mean nothing comes close to the Craft Steak experience. We have made Craft an annual destination for 14 years and like the steak it has only gotten better with age.  It's hard to put into words the experience of dinning at a place that has changed with the times yet maintains the "Vintage Vegas"  vibe so perfectly.....oh and the food is pretty good too

pfHIH_7Fa4Fd5LNAlv48Qw.text: The food is exceptional! I got a 10oz filet perfectly cooked. Wife got the diver scallops, perfectly cooked. We shared a grits with gruyere and. Bacon and it was amazing...  The waitstaff was friendly and prompt.   Only negative is the liquor prices(30 for a beer and a glass of cheap wine) ....but I guess it's Vegas so who cares!

jwLu235eNOg4CuQRTcqe_w.text: This place is an amazing place and experience. We decided to come here for our anniversary and the service was top notch. We got the special where you can pick your course meals for appetizer and meats for smaller portions and dessert is chefs pick. The only bad part is that the appetizer is to be shared with the 2nd person since the special is for two people at the price of 130/person  We got the cucumber salad with avocado which was very delicious, along with this beet salad which was good but thats IF you like beets lol. Not my forte though and the last appetizer dish was tomato topped with vinaigrette and herbs which light and tasty.  Now for the meats. The filet mignon was superb and out of this world. It was so moist and juicy, and it was butterflied to perfection. I though it was gonna be dry if they did that but surprisingly it was not. It was super delicious. My hubby got the t-bone steak med rare and he love it.  Lastly, the dessert course is so yummy and let me start by saying Wow. They gave us 4 side desserts lol and of course smaller portions but omg so yummy and we ended up so full that we still tasted all of them and ate half because they were all so tasty.  I would recommend this place to try it for the experience and the price is worth it to pay too. The servers were so helpful and friendly and it was top notch. I would love to come back again and eat here.

qMrbd3WUeYwpfALEwWO3vA.text: We came in for a party of 14 and all of the food/drinks were very good.  A couple people in our party ordered their steak medium/medium rare and it was much closer to the bloody side, but still great tasting.  The staff/management had a hard time accommodating separate checks, which was a bit odd. C

sviPdRHLOtjjD3LJUs2-_w.text: My husbands been wanting to try this place every trip we make to Vegas but I'm usually looking for cheaper venues, but knew it was time to let him indulge! We were not disappointed! Great service and advice on everything from our drinks all the way to dessert, which we didn't need but couldn't pass up! Our steaks were prepared perfectly and loved all our sides.

c9KAlzmhSSGSqHyfMkEfzQ.text: We had the best time here last night. My first time having ribeye (I usually get filet) and it did not disappoint! It was flavorful, juicy, and very satisfying. For sides we had corn, carrots, and fries, and although I just had a small of each (I'm on the keto diet) they were delicious. The wine was great and so was our waitress Briana. For three people, we did end up paying like 500.00 with the tip, so it is a little on the pricey side, but Yolo. Haha.

hWns_crLpCl-xiHicvxmdQ.text: Been here many times and it never disappoints.   Went with friend last night and shared a dry aged grilled ribeye and the dry aged roasted t-bone.  For the money, the ribeye was a bit better this evening, but both were amazing.  Shared the pureed potatoes,  grilled asaragus,  and hen of woods mushrooms.  Loved everything.     We sat at bar because restaurant was booked for night.  Had a great dinner while trying a few different bourbons.     Always my go to steak in vegas and this will continuue.

wkvuLoPYY-J9qddO_Z_B-w.text: Overhyped and totally underwhelming.  What a terrible disappointment it was.   I have no doubt that the ingredients here are top notch. I in no way doubt the chef's ability to make food into art and his overally ability to make people want to inhale a week's worth of fats, sodium, and choloesteral, and calories into one seating--BUT this was certainly an off night for the whole establishment as a whole.  So terrible--that it's highly unlikely that I would ever give this particular off shoot of the Tom Colicchio family again.  And I LOVE Tom Colicchio.  Oh--to boot--there was a rather shocking event (or 2) that only helped to deteriote my opinion of this establishment.   I made reservations for 7 people for Saturday night at 6pm. We were all jazzed up about dining here.  We were greeted and seated immediately at one of the round tables.  After going through the menu and drooling over everyone's choices--we ordered the following:  Rack of lamb, 3 T-bones, NY strip, Filet Surf and Turf, Ribeye, 2 caesar salads, Yukon Gold mashed potatoes, and fries.  We asked the waiter if he thought that would be sufficient and he chuckled and said we could feed a small nation.  Sounds good.    Food Bread--B+:  Fresh hot buns sprinkled with sea salt.  Winner.    Caesar Salad-- A:  You can't really go wrong here.  Very tasty--especially enjoyed the anchovies.  Very light and not overly dressed.    Yukon Gold Pureed Potatoes-- D:  We all saw the pictures before hand.  We saw the layer of melted butter sauce that drowned this particular side.  It spoke our language.  This dish really proved to us that just because it's swimming in butter--it doesn't mean it's going to good.  The glutton in all of us echoed the same thing--Fail.  Aside from butter--this really didn't taste like much else.  If you got lucky--you had some chives.  Bland and rather tasteless.      Asparagus--A:  Look, I love asparagus so it in all ikelihood was going to get top marks from me--but these were superb.  Young, tender asparagus in olive oil and cracked pepper.  These were so succulent, and the flower had a perfect dry "crisp" bit to it.  HUGE fan of this dish.   Strip--C minus : I asked for Medium Rare.  Waiter told me it will be slightly bloody and I told him I partially wanted it to Moo when it got to the table.  My steak came out well done.  Yes--well done steak.  No red, no pink--just brown.  I don't think I need to go into detail about how this tastes.  Okay--i'll give you one word--dry.   I wanted to send it back, I wanted to sent it back so badly.  But I didn't.  I was dining with a group of friends, and I didn't want to make a scene.  I wanted everyone to enjoy their meals.    I can't go into detail about how everyone else felt about their food since I only took a small bite out of each dish.  My feelings--good, not great.    For most of the meal, we all seemed to come upon a general, silent concensus--This was craftsteak?  Not only did no one rave about the food, but no one even said anything all too complimentary.    Now--at the end of the meal, we all burst.  We all expressed our disappointment in the food.  Mediocre.  Nothing stood out.  Tasty? Yes.  But for the same price--I would gladly dine at Mastro's, Mortons, or Delmonico's (which despite its lower rating here on Yelp, is a wonderful and top notch establisbment).  Whereas we originally planned on ordering all the desserts--we were all so disappointed we decided against it.    So--a girlfriend and I both didn't finish our steaks.  They offered to pack our steaks for us and said complimentary sweets would be served soon.    No more than 4 minutes after our waiter left, a man a yeard away from our table slips/faints/whatever and hits his head on the wheeled cart.  We were shocked.  My boyfriend gets up to make sure the gentleman is okay, but is stopped short when the waiters and the fallen man's friends rush to his side.  It's a frightening.  He is obviously dazed, and it becomes apparent that he is now bleeding.  A staff member rushes over to his aid with more napkins and a bucket.    We are all in shock--as was the entire restaurant.  But we were the closest--only 4 ft away.  Then the man started to vomit.  It didn't stop.  3 times--and we had front row seats.  He was finally moved to a different part of the restaurant and awaited the ambulence.  No one addressed the incident with us--even though we had a front row seat to the bleeding and the vomit.  We ask for our take away boxes--and after coming up empty handed the first time, returns to tell us it has been thrown away.  Now these were in no form dinky portions.  It was half of our entree. He apologized and said he would have the kitchen whip up new steaks. He brought out 2 boxes 15 later and we left.  It wasn't until we got back to our hotels did we see what were in the boxes--1/2 cut up strip, asparagus, and rolls was what we got for my strip and 1/2 her t-bone.    Massive fail.

3Kq9docTrS4MVShYuKmQNw.text: "Too... much... beef...."  I don't think those words have ever escaped my lips before. There was entirely too much good beef there, what with all the other accoutrements that came with the meal.  We did a sort of "steak flight" a multi course meal deal involving Angus Beef and Kobe Beef, which... damn, I'm still reveling about.   The decor and style of this place just broods a sort of richy masculinity, a veritable playboy-ness of being strong and forward without encroaching on metrosexuality. It's as if a Wall Street broker made a down town Manhattan version of what he thought a rich style Texas steak house ought to be.  All in all this is a place you go to for either an impressive meal, or to impress others with your super credit line, and flashy new suit. It works kinda ok for a romantic meal, but over all, it's a great food dining destination.

id5_54Pviq7LsKNgObfZ7A.text: If you go to Craftsteak there's really only one dish to focus on:  Braised Short Ribs.  Quick story:  I used to live/work in Las Vegas for MGM Mirage.  This is the parent company that owns lots of hotels, including the MGM Grand.  When I first started, I met with the VP of Food and Beverage at MGM Grand and as we walked the hotel to discuss the restaurants, he told me "Todd... if you want a steak, don't go to Craftsteak.  The steak is good, but it's actually better at SeaBlue.  You go to Craftsteak for the Braised Short Ribs."  My Yelp friends, this dish is the F'n bomb!  You will literally die right there in your chair at the MGM Grand.  The short ribs are braised for hours until they are so tender you can barely get them out of the copper pot they are delivered in.  The juice/sauce is heavenly as well.  The steaks are great too.  I think the VP undersold them.  Great ribeye, filet and many other cuts too.  If you have the budget, I highly recommend the Chef's Tasting Menu.  Just ask them to swap one of the lesser steaks for the short ribs.  Or even better, get your meat on and order the short ribs in addition to whatever comes with the tasting menu.  The appetizers, sides and dessert are phenomenal as well.  One of my favorite places to go for steak.  Service is impeccable, the wine selection is outstanding.  The only negative part is the cost.  Being inside a major Vegas casino makes this an expensive place to eat!  But I find it well worth it.

q8PG0gy9wnIefqWelQWWnA.text: Oh...my...gosh....  This was the BEST meal of my life.  After KA we had dinner reservations at Craftsteak, which is Chef Collichio's (from Top Chef :) ) restaurant.   We decided on one really nice dinner during our trip and I am SUPER happy we decided on craftsteak.  We had a 3 course meal which included the BEST scallops I've ever had in its first course.  The kobe steak tartar was absolutely amazing as well.  For main course we had kobe skirt steak, kobe ribeye and 2 pounds of maine lobster cooked in saffron butter.  With each bite I seriously had to grab Kieran's leg and squeeze it because of the excitement.    For dessert we had a chocolate mold cake, sorbet/ice cream, fresh fruit and a cherry/peach cobbler.  All were very good, I found a seriously liking for the ice cream/sorbet combinations.  The service was exquisite, I love how they took their time.  The ambiance of the restaurant was very nice, very chic and the menu just kept it simple and delicious.  I understand now why Chef Collichio is so admired and why he has the right to "judge" all the chefs on Top Chef.  He knows food, he knows flavor.

sygmRhNoEol3rjKOiODyeg.text: Blog for full review of food - as this was a comped return visit I higlighted the service issues here.  As previously stated, after complaining to the GM (at that time a Mr. Jason Bartucci) with hopes that future visitors would not deal with such service we were provided a profound apology and an offer to refund the cost or to come back for a compensatory meal on the house - at the time I declined these options but on further review, a year after many fine dining experiences, I reconsidered.  In a city with so many great options I would not generally be the sort to 'forgive and forget,' but returning with my two friends - both who love steak - and remembering how good the food was I made contact with the restaurant through the MGM website.  While Mr. Bartucci (and our server) had apparently since been dismissed from the restaurant, my e-mail was answered by the new General Manager, Sebastien Vallet, who invited the three of us back for the chef's tasting with wine pairings on the house.   Taking our seats we were almost instantly met by Mr. Vallet, a gregarious and friendly man in a great looking grey suit (vastly differing from the black/white clad servers,) who promised us a fantastic meal and confirmed that I did not eat beef while my friends most certainly did.    Within moments our waters were filled - bottled water without even requesting, and our server and his assistant came to our table to once again confirm likes, dislikes, and anything we may need.  In order to not belabor service issues too much I will note a couple of issues here that, despite their obviously being overly attentive to our table, were less than impressive.  First, while Sebastien stopped by multiple times, our server spent vastly more time at a table of well clad businessmen while the assistant served as our primary server throughout.  While not "unfriendly" our assistant's grasp of the English language was poor at best, wines were not described as presented, and this was officially the only restaurant on my trip to Vegas where I had to fill my own water.  Another service issue presented itself later, but otherwise I have to say the team clearly "went out of their way" to please us - yet despite that fact, the service at Mastro's, CUT, Carnevino, and myriad other fine dining establishments vastly outpaced Craftsteak - their "average" being better than Craftsteak's "best."  Browsing around the restaurant I was amazed at how many hockey jerseys were present - clearly not the "business casual" Craftsteak desires.  Arriving from our assistant server without any description (approximately 1 minute later our main server showed up to tell us what the dishes were) our mains and sides were served with a red wine of which I'm unfamiliar and neither myself nor JT enjoyed - Brad thought it was decent.  Featuring mains of a 16oz Ribeye, a 12oz Skirt, and Divers Scallops with Fennel and sides of Yukon Gold Potatoes, Sweet Corn, and Wood Roasted Asparagus this is where the other service issue came up.  As previously noted, I don't eat steak - that doesn't mean my buddies do not eat scallops.  Featuring only five scallops (we received three of the exact same dish as an appetizer last visit) and my friends each deserving to try at least one I explained to our server that this wasn't acceptable and, surprisingly, met some resistance - apparently my thin frame made him think I can't eat.  Asking if any other fishes were available I was told only tuna - again the same prep I'd had last year (there was lobster, I saw it on another table, but clearly they weren't giving this away) and inquiring about birds or pork I was told only chicken (I know they had duck and pork loin, I saw the nightly menu) so I requested the chicken.  Consenting, begrudgingly, the server asked if we wanted anything else and I emphatically stated some mushrooms would be nice.  While it took about 15 minutes to prepare, the dishes were indeed brought by yet another server - someone who actually smiled (aside from Sebastien.)  Myself - I was pleased with the food again, but still less than sold on the service given the fact that they were clearly "doing their best" and still seemed a little less than in-step with other restaurants of their caliber.  When it was all said and done Mr. Vallet stopped by to see how everything had been and I told him it was good - because it was.  It simply wasn't "great."  Leaving a nice tip for our service team (perhaps had they known we'd be leaving a good tip the primary server would've been more available) we made our way out of Craftsteak for the last time.  Impressed enough that I plan to check out Craft the next time I'm in Los Angeles or NYC, Vegas has plenty of other options in the meats market and if I were attending repeats I'd head to CUT or Carnevino first.
