MYzT6U-6_Eyz1L7LTWrWsQ.text: We looked at the menu online before going and were looking forward to sharing the porterhouse for two. When we got to the restaurant, we were disappointed that the porterhouse wasn't on the menu. My husband got the ny strip and I got the filet. Both were delicious! Tender like butter. We had blueberry cheesecake and peanut butter chip ice cream for dessert. Both tasted homemade and soo yummy. Service was great and good was delish.

da3qAmdIMGsN8iGoc1cugw.text: I had one of my Vegas dreams come True when I got to have dinner at Craftsteak. Mr. Hottie arranged the evening all I had to do is show up and look pretty! I arrived in the midst of fighting a migraine. Not good. I wasn't sneered at because I walked in with a bottle of Coke and a bottle of Excedrin as my accessories next to my purse. We were seated immediately. The table we were seated at was an end part of a VERY VERY large booth if you can picture it. So we were facing another party and were almost too close to them. I was hoping for something a little more intimate. We were left to sit for a tad too long. Nothing major, but it was noticed by both of us. I had time to go to the restroom and come back before we were greeted. Our waitress was very nice (and I forgot her name). We started out with a cocktail (glass of Prosecco for me) while we looked over the menu. Our waitress came by to check on us and to suggest that we try the Summer Tasting Menu. She even PROMISED that we would not be disappointed. At first, we thought we would pick one of each offering from each course. Wrong. We got the WHOLE menu! We went with that and added the wine pairings to go along with the courses. Let me list what was on the menu and my thoughts:  First Course  Shaved Fennel Salad: Zesty and fresh  Grilled Quail, Vincotto: Yum, very flavorful  Buffalo Mozzarella, Red Pepper Caponata: This was pretty good. Nothing earth shaking  Persian Cucumber Salad: I wasn't a huge fan, but it was personal taste more than anything.  Main Course:  Prime Beef Flatiron: This was my favorite cut of meat served medium rare and full of flavor. Very well seasoned  Angus Skirt Steak: WOW another steak! I wasn't as thrilled with this cut, surprisingly. It was still good though.  Diver Sea Scallops: Perfectly cooked. The scallops were sweet and firm.  Sides:  Yukon Gold Potato Puree: Thrilled to have had these. If you want me to be happy. Take a simple dish, and make it WELL. These were so good!  Sauteed Sweet Corn: Another winner. The corn was sweet and juicy!  Roasted Shiitake Mushrooms: Not a winner. The mushrooms seemed to be overcooked, and rubbery.  Dessert: I can't remember what it was, unfortunately. Mind you, I had wine with every course. By the end I was filled to the brim and VERY happy!  Since we were the last reservation seating for the evening, we basically shut the restaurant down. Keep in mind, this is a leisurely paced dinner, not a quick bite. Craftsteak was a wonderful experience. Not everything was perfect, but it was very close! I will go back to eat there in a heart beat! Craftsteak brings up memories of an old school steak house, but their menu items are fresh, modern and not to be missed!

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A great meal

N3nxXTnvpDgPcBzrQXDWCw.text: "Have you ever done 69?  It's the BEST."  It's the red head sitting at the table to the right of me talking with her girlfriends.  And no, this wasn't some metaphor for how good the steak was.  She was talking about sex.  "What about sex when your legs in the air? The motion--it's so amazing."   The four of them--chic young professionals, like the crew from Sex in the City minus ten years, impeccable make-up and evening wear--could have passed for porn stars.  And no, I'm not a chauvinist.  On the table to the left of me, there were 8 salivating males, a pack of alpha dogs, peering over constantly like hungry jackals as if our table was completely transparent.  It was just a matter of time one of the guys mustered the courage to leapfrog our table and exchanged a few words with the ladies, "Where are you ladies going tonight?  I heard great things about TAO.  Yeah, you should check out LAX."  He went nowhere fast.  A few minutes later a couple other guys came over from the table behind us to say hi.  Before you know it, the girls were getting free scoops of sorbet.  On the way out, two of the girls even went to another table to sit on an old guys lap and take pictures, even though his wife was at the table.  There's certainly no scarcity of meat Craftsteak.  In fact, it's a food marathon.  Dinner at Tom Colicchio's Vegas establishment was hearty to say the least.  My girlfriend took me here as a belated celebration for landing my new job.  And my, did we celebrate.  We went for the surf and turf dinner sampler for two which included kobe tartar, tiger prawns, Caesar salad, Kobe skirt steak, Kobe rib eye, a two pound lobster, and desert which included chocolate cake, ice cream, sorbet, and a sugary puff pastry with a sweet dipping sauce.  I could go on and on about the taste and presentation of each dish.  Take my word for it, it was pretty good.   The obvious problem was that we couldn't finish it all.  The waiter reaffirmed, "Nobody ever finishes the sampler dinner."  That left a bittersweet taste in my mouth.  Dinner and drinks came out to four bills.  The waiter could have warned us that we had ordered enough food for three or that we were going to walk out with the most expensive doggie bag ever (luckily our hotel had a fridge).  Had we been served an adequate amount of food, I would have been a lot happier--Craftsteak loses one star for overkill.

rWT1n61AAWJfqFYwpww4wA.text: If you're planning to do a dinner and show here in Vegas, then the KA and Craftsteak package is the way to go. ($175-$199 PP). Show tickets themselves are around $125-$150.   Craftsteak was simply amazing. The stars speak for themselves. We had:  Appetizers Grilled Quail Roasted Red Reppers Mixed Lettuces  Entrees Hangar Steak (shared)- get it medium Roasted Chicken - juicy juicy juicy Diver Sea Scallops   Sides Yukon Gold Potato Puree  - I didnt expect it to be so good.  Roasted Shiitake Mushrooms - i usually dont eat these, but i gobbled them down.  Roasted Asparagus  Desserts Monkey Bread w/ice cream - very sweet Crumble Berry  Cheesecake w/ice cream  You get fresh warm bread with your meal. They have a wine special for $30. They give you 3 different wines, 1 for each entree.   Like women walking out of a spa.....I felt pampered and fullfilled. The food made love to my mouth and spooned with my stomach.   I'll be back!

6azZvM8NQg_T0Zr_KInxmA.text: It was the most amazing dinner I've ever experienced! My parents, brother and I spent the weekend at MGM where everything was COMPED!   We decided to take advantage of this "free" weekend and make reservations at the renowned Craft Steak (my brother is obsessed with Top Chef). Our party of 4 ordered the Chef Tasting Menu- Kobe "Surf & Turf" (3 courses) at a whopping $155/person which is changed on a daily basis by the Chef.  We also ordered a bottle of $100 wine (you cant drink water with a meal like this).   1st Course Appetizer:  - Kobe Beef Tartar- amazing flavors, reminded me of ahi tuna. I loved the raw egg on top which gave it a nice rich flavor.  - Roasted Red Peppers with olive oil - Grilled shrimp - Caesar salad  Entree: -Kobe Steak  (3 types)- Rib eye, Sirloin, and Skirt Steak. All was perfectly cooked and incredibly tender. IT was my first experience with Kobe beef and I was very impressed with the quality of the meat.  - 2 Lb. Lobster sitting in a bowl of butter sauce...mmmm...butteerrrr...  Side Dishes: Grilled mushrooms, carrots (BEST EVER, perfectly cooked and sweet, this was my Mom's favorite dish), grilled asparagus, and Yukon mashed potatoes (melted in your mouth, very rich, mmm buttteerr).   Dessert: -Berry Crumble -6 diff ice creams and homemade sorbet - my dad's fave dish! He's still raving about the sorbet.  -Chocolate cake with melted chocolate in the middle - my bro's fave. - Bread pudding- MY FAVE! Very rich and perfectly baked.  - Blueberry tart   Anyways, the bill came out to a total of $900 (including tip) and we were definitely more than satisfied with our meal. Even the espresso and coffee (french pressed at your table) was incredible.   My dad asked "So, would you come here again if we had to pay??"  YES!

buH3VMi88MEKNX7VLTi0YQ.text: Great food, great service! I went with my girlfriends last week during our last night in Las Vegas.  The restaurant had a great atmosphere - quiet and intimate where we can talk and laugh without having people give us dirty looks for being too loud.   We had ordered the 32 Oz porterhouse, the Diver Sea Scallops with the shaved fennel, the potato puree and the mushroom assortment.  The steak was delicious! We had ordered it rare and it was indeed rare and not overcooked.  Only complaint was that one side of the porterhouse was quite fatty (made it feel really heavy), but other than that it was great.  The scallops were cooked perfectly.  That was probably my favourite dish! It was tender and literally melted in your mouth. I could've had a whole plate to myself.  The potato puree was creamy and I loved the chives that they put in the potatoes.  Mushroom assortment was good also as there was a good variety of mushrooms however, it could've used a bit more salt.  Nothing is worse than under seasoned dishes.  It also could've been that the other dishes we ordered had such an intense flavour that the mushrooms just sort of blended in and didn't really stand out as much. Nonetheless that dish wasn't terrible but it wasn't as outstanding as the others.  The service was great.  The waiter came to check up on us often enough (but not to the point where it was annoying).  Our water glasses were always full and they were there to walk us through the menu, recommend dishes etc.    Unfortunately we were too stuffed to even have dessert, but the dishes we ordered were enough to fill 4 of us with leftovers.  Overall great experience, and would definitely come back again!

2vMkbU6Bu0IgYNi0euz-Hw.text: Yup. So this was definitely the best meal I've had during my 29 years on this planet. My research for the best steaks in Vegas ultimately landed me at Craftsteak and boy I'm glad that research paid off. I am not even exaggerating that I didn't know food could be this good, it is really inconceivable the level this food was on.  We wanted to go big and not cut any corners, so we decided on the domestic Wagyu meal for a minimum of two people. At $170/person, they are not fooling around and my expectations were very high and they were exceeded every step of the way. Our waitress, Sharon, was extremely attentive and charming. She would stop over and see how we were doing, provided excellent information on the food which was served and really seemed to care that we were enjoying ourselves. I like to sip a cocktail when I choose to get one and Sharon asked if everything was alright with it because I was drinking so slow. I've never had someone check to see if my drink was alright, really tremendous service. Her accompanying waiter, Peter (I think, so sorry!) was also very attentive and charismatic.  Appetizer course: Wagyu beef tartare, sliced prosciutto and figs, cucumber salad, and a frisee salad with egg and bacon. Every single item was delicious but that bacon frisee salad, WOO boy. You would think a bacon grease vinaigrette would be heavy and filling, but man it was the perfect balance as a dressing for the salad. I don't usually fill up on greens or really anything before a steak meal but I pretty much ate the entire platter myself. As someone who has never tried tartare before and wouldn't normally order it, I'm glad I gave it a shot as well.  Main course: Wagyu filet, Wagyu skirt steak, pureed potato, Maui onions, seasoned broccoli. The Wagyu skirt steak lives up to the hype and then some. This was the most tender, juicy steak I've ever had. Pair the steak with the potatoes and some onion, it really was the perfect bite of food in my opinion. Portion was very generous for two people and I'm really surprised at the amount of food we were able to put down. By the end when I remembered dessert was coming, I didn't think I'd be able to eat another bite.  Dessert: If you can believe it, I somehow managed a third wind for dessert. Monkey bread, mango & raspberry sorbet, lime cheesecake, assorted fruit. While the entire dessert assortment was exceptional, the monkey bread was really something else. Amazing pull-apart pieces covered in a caramel sauce (I don't like caramel, that's how good it was), and some chopped up nuts.. what a bite. You could tell the cheesecake was made fresh in-house. The lime whipped cream garnish and pie crust added a ton of flavor.  I really cannot say enough good things about Craftsteak and our experience. Yes, it is expensive but you're getting some of the highest possible quality food in the world here. Save your allowance (and appetite) and give this place a go.

EV1Z2OGSz2Zpeys6O8vv0Q.text: Great service. You have to try the sweet sea salt bread it's amazing. They offer a variety of sides and steaks. The tasting is worth it. Restaurant has two sides, one is more formal and another is casual. Lobster bisque was ok but they did come with actual lobster pieces. They have lots of wines. Service was great. There was a lot of people attending to you.

j-bElaJKJ7Z2c4aP_YWmOA.text: Vegan review. Good option on the strip to take a meat loving buddy. I had the vegetable platter which was way more delicious than it sounds, the roasted pickled onion in particular was incredible . Husband had a T bone and gave it a big thumbs up. A bit on the pricey side for what you get

jWTx1mG7vSVQ0dPDF7lFkQ.text: I must say this started to be a zoo of an evening.  We were late for our reservation.  We called to Craftsteak know we would be behind a few minutes due to the fight going on.  The phone operator told us that CraftSteak was  not excepting any calls & that I would have to walk to the restaurant to let them know I would be late.  I asked than for the concierge desk, hoping to get them to help me.  I was told it was closed for the evening.  So when we got to the hotel 20 minutes late, I went straight to CraftSteak.  I explained to the hostesses what had happened.  They directed me to the manager Jim.  What a great staff.  They were wonderful, forgiving & thankful we had made it to our reservation.  Jim was kind enough to buy a glass of champagne just for us showing up & for our troubles.  It was an amazing end to our evening.

aE4nlET-icLQk-9w-QvDgQ.text: My wife took me here for my Birthday and it was probably one of the top three presents I have received! The food was ridiculously good. I think cows might go to this restaurant to accept their fate. Al a carte menus are a gamble in my opinion as because if you don't do everything well it'll show! Craftsteak does everything well. The service was top notch too. Ask for Juan's area if you can, he treated us like family.

5tFabI5PI3JaPIqQa7C9_Q.text: Tom Colicchio's is a very expensive steak house. It is worth the money. The place is stunning. The service perfection. You will be attended to yet not rushed or bothered. Start with the oysters on the half shell. They are served with a great little sauce that has avocado and it is fantastic. They offer Wagyu steak and the most wonderful pork belly appetizer. It is so wonderful, you will be in heaven. The wine list is extensive and, in my opinion, over priced. Have a drink instead.  They have great deserts and the atmosphere is relaxing and quiet. Do not go there dressed in shorts. This is a fine dinning experience. Treat it as such. Enjoy.

Mwmanb-L_vwjH866namZAg.text: First, I'm a big Tom fan. I've watched every episode of every top chef season, and my honeymoon was also on a top chef cruise.   I had high hopes for this restaurant and they did not disappoint. More than anything, the advice was fantastic. David and Patricia were predominantly helping us, and they were both wonderful. Patricia was especially attentive and personable.   The food was terrific. My husband and I did the three course menu, Japanese wagyu. We were impressed at how many options were brought out with each course. Everything was tasty and cooked perfectly.   We would recommend dining here, but our favorite steakhouse is still Wolfgang puck's Cut in Beverly Hills. For now, this is our new vegas favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PsgXqrwYiGhXtS6dBWb1gA.text: The most amazing lobster bisque in the entire world. The ambiance is so laid back yet so classy. Absolutely love this place even though I'm not a fan of meat. Their corn side is also to die for, and their cheesecake is killer. Highly recommend this place.

wf44RheZtoyO8My-xS3mpw.text: What a difference 4 years makes....  My husband and I dined at CS for the first time 7 years ago and we had nothing but great things to say about the food and impeccable service. We returned 4 years ago and had a similar experience, which is why it's become a regular stop for us when we come to Vegas and why we recommend it to our friends and family. Times have definitely changed.  Is CS under new management?  Our first clue should have been the week it took for them to respond to an email. My husband wanted to bring a bottle of wine that was listed on their wine list, but it was a different vintage. We wanted to make sure it was ok. It took them a week to respond.   When we arrived the hostess was very nice. Our table wasn't ready so we went to the bar. There were about six people at the bar and two bartenders. No one was waiting for a drink except us. Bartender one ignored us, and wouldn't make eye contact.  He talked to one couple and started clearing and cleaning glasses. Bartender two was trying to avoid eye contact and finally acknowledged us. He made our drinks, and walked away without saying anything. Then bartender one swooped in behind him and put a check in front of us. When our table was ready, bartender one asked us if we were ready to pay the check. I said no, please transfer it to our table. I wasn't about to tip this guy directly and frankly, he should have asked if we wanted it transferred. I've waited tables, I know how it works.   Our experience with our waiter and sommelier wasn't a lot different. These guys were two of the least friendly staff I have encountered. They gave us the bare minimum in our exchanges. We had to ask for more champagne to be poured because they took the bottle from our table. Don't get me wrong. We only asked after waiting five minutes.   The final straw was the timing of dinner. We were still eating out appetizers and they brought our dinner out. Bad timing. Again I have waited tables. This isn't rocket science and these are suppose to be the best of the best here.   The rest of the staff was great, friendly. The food was top notch. But something is lacking here now. It feels like the heart is gone. One of the main reasons we come back is the service. It's been impeccable in the past. Normally I would be in the process of putting my glass down and it would be refilled. They seemed like they just weren't paying attention.   I hate to say it but I think this is our last time here. I'm happy to pay the money for a great meal as a treat for us, but I don't want to do it somewhere I don't feel welcome.   CS needs a change in management. If this was just one person having an off night, I understand. But four people. It's the culture of the restaurant.

UiLIacYE_SJdCMyshZ4MPA.text: Fantastic service. Waiter made great recommendations, and the meal was one of the best in a very long time.  I'll be back next time I'm in Vegas.

9dMxkS4DAfAj6ORx80XfHw.text: Celebrated our anniversary. Everyone was very welcoming and attentive. Opted for the double wagyu surf and turf which included 2 types of waygu (we chose skirt steak and ribeye) and a seafood (we chose lobster), appetizers, sides and dessert. EVERYTHING was delicious!

mzgStDK6WyY7Eun2NQ5tPw.text: With so many great steak houses in Las Vegas Tom yet again comes on the scene with another mediocre place. Bland. Bad service. Over priced. Go to Vic & Anthony's or Delmonico if you want a real 5 star steak house experience.

0nUlmwML5zl7Pvdf1wwTSA.text: I came here with some work people after CES and would highly recommend a reservation. We had one but we were still sat a few mins after. The server was great and the prices were similar to a Morton's or Ruth's. I had a ribeye which was pretty damn good but not nearly as good as Morton's. The brussel sprouts were life changing tho. Would highly recommend those as your side dish. I wouldn't go back unless work was paying for it again though.

kg5pHaylo5ZUIgO_pDzbwQ.text: Being a huge fan of Tom Colicchio's AND steak, I was excited to try out Craftsteak in the MGM on my recent visit to Vegas.    First off, expect to drop some money on this place.  But for what you spend, you will receive exceptional service and superb food.  My boyfriend and I were greeted by an incredibly warm, and friendly hostess who promptly had us taken to our table.  Immediately upon sitting down, we were greeted openly and our drink orders were taken.   Service was incredibly attentive without being push and our questions about the, somewhat, confusing tasting vs. a la carte menu were answered patiently.  We had:  The Shellfish Sampler (for two) - plenty of food for the both of us, seafood and the seaweed salad were all fresh and served with sauces which complimented the shellfish nicely; however, were not needed as the flavor was so lovely.  The dinner rolls were nothing special - honestly, they reminded me a little of the dinner rolls you can get from the store and pop in the oven at home.  Crusty on the outside, soft on the inside.    I ordered the Black Angus Filet - was cooked perfectly and was incredibly tender.   Since we live in Chicago which has its fair share of AMAZING steakhouses, I hold steak to a high standard when dining somewhere known for steak - Craftsteak did not disappoint.  I continued to eat the filet long after I was full simply because it tasted that good.  My boyfriend got the Seafood Trio and generously shared one of his scallops with me.  He managed to happily devour everything else on his plate; however, the scallop I did try was out of this world - the scallop could be cut with the side of your fork and simply melted in your mouth.    Besides the mains, we decided to try to Brussels Sprouts -  The Brussels were cooked to a perfect tender-crisp and the bacon was a wonderful compliment.  I highly recommend Craftsteak if you are looking for an upscale steakhouse while you are in Vegas.

iuTSiz8LlcKAT5JGYT06Jg.text: The perfect meal  I've read the reviews.  I've seen the pictures.  I've heard the stories.  Now it was time for me to try the hyped and well reviewed wagyu skirt steak.  And it was magic.  I can definitely say it was the best steak I've eaten.  More tender than any filet I've ever had and richer than any ribeye.  My wife loved it so much that she legitimately got steak drunk.  We're not usually a dessert ordering couple, but the steak was so damn amazing I thought I'd roll the dice on the toffee monkey bread and brown sugar sour cream ice cream.  Again, it was magic.  I loved it.  I got a bit full towards the end, but soldiered on because it would be unpatriotic to waste a bite of this food.  Food aside, we loved the staff.  Everyone was so incredibly friendly and helpful.  The busser who bagged our left overs even threw in extra rolls in case we wanted to make sandwiches.  Those little details make all the difference.    The perfect meal does come with a hefty price tag, but it was well worth it for the overall experience.  I'll do this meal every time I'm in Vegas.    Do yourself a favor and make a reservation here.  I have yet to find a nice steakhouse anywhere that even comes close to the overall experience you get at Craftsteak.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. AMAZING Cinnamon Monkey Bread with Brown Sugar Sour Cream ice cream!
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect medium

dio37_1ef8ujxYS9gHfiTg.text: This place deserves a solid five star because: 1. They give you a 5 Star Service. From the beginning to the end, our server was being attentive. 2. Their food was amazing! I asked for medium rare for my filet mignon, and it came out exactly the way I wanted! 3. Great ambience. The whole place felt cozy and I loved the music they played.   Two thumbs up for this place!

iNoOGcwpV-hl9C6fKq9tww.text: We got the ribeye, 40oz to share. The 40oz was perfect to share between 2 ppl. This steak was actually completely different than any steak I've had previously. I thought it was good, but nothing spectacular. I wish it was more melt in your mouth tender. I liked that it came with the bone marrow but it was too salty to really enjoy.  The service was wonderful though. Super attentive and efficient.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NOpY_Px7eQ2q3cUkoCJyOQ.text: I come here once a year, usually on my solo Vegas vacations as I live a couple hundred miles away in California. But this year I had the opportunity to bring an amazing date with me. We started off 6 oysters, and ended up ordering more oysters after we finished our first six. They were so fresh and delicious. It was her first time having oysters, and she enjoyed. We then split the bone in rib eye cooked medium, with a side of the potato puree and asparagus. The steak was very juicy, even cooked at medium ( I usually get medium rare when I'm not sharing) and the charred flavor was awesome. The side dishes whet well with the steak, especially when you drench them in the steak juice. Now the part I would like to elaborate on was the exceptional service I received from every staff member. From the hostess to all of the staff at the front of the house that provided us with service; they paid exquisite attention to detail and were so friendly and hospitable. Thank you for making this a dining experience to remember. 5/5 for food and service

-oCOv1-1DSAVYLP9KZgvIQ.text: 7/20/19 I came here for my birthday on this day, they have great service and great food !! Most likely the best steakhouse i've ever had ! I got the Filet Minot and it was chewy and perfect, so was the butter corn

2Ml2kYKs4eBgJ7s1b3P_zA.text: This is now my most favorite steakhouse in town. Great for celebrations and special occasions, definitely be ready to splurge. Our waiter Tom was very helpful in suggesting sides and cocktails to try and the surf and turf I chose was absolutely amazing- the wagyu steak just melted in my mouth-  Be ready to allow ample time to enjoy the dining experience- this is a dinner not to be a rushed!

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing  Japanese Wagyu Surf &amp; Turf

iaHw7faVWUUssn0_TkZQtQ.text: I love trying new restaurants. This place really impressed me! I had the filet mignon, asparagus, carrots and fingerling potatoes. The filet came in a cast iron pan with onions. I loved the flavor of the onions and the steak was perfectly cooked. I usually don't like asparagus but, these were fantastic. The best asparagus I've ever eaten. They weren't too thick or too thin and had butter and garlic. The carrots were a variety of purple, white and orange and glazed with honey. They were sweet like candy. The potatoes were a little salty but, cooked perfectly. I liked the little potato balls. The bread they serve looks like rolls but, tasted like croissants. Yum! I highly recommend this restaurant.

PBMfZgofxHhLj6OKtJW-7w.text: Go A5 or freaking go home.  You'll easily drop a dime on betting on the Seahawks or throwing the bones but won't spend $250 on piece of the best meat on the planet.  To eat this prime cut of perfectly marbled and grilled meat, is unmatched.  Our starters of prosciutto/fig and spinach salad were good, but my mouth and taste buds were waiting for the my main course.  Once it arrived and taking the first bite of my wagyu, i was in HEAVEN.  OMG that first bite of the end piece which is seared to perfection an five sides and seeing that pink marbled yumminess, you just have sit there and savor the moment.  This is your typical steakhouse with mostly male servers and wait help (have you ever noticed that in fine dining establishments, all men).  Great attentive service.  Ill definitely be back for the Wagyu and because it in my home casino, MGM.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn risotto
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A5 New York strip
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A5 New York strip

MhuMc9nPyDg5dN2iwUl4VA.text: I was truly underwhelmed by the quality of food we received. A few incidents that made me never want to go back. 1st we asked the server how were the fries. Instead of telling us the fries tastes like Red Robin wedges, he said they were the best thing since sliced bread. 2nd, for a high-end restaurant, you already pay a premium for the food. You don't expect to be nickel and dimed for the customer service. There was a photographer walking around offering to take the picture for each table. However, she will not take it with your camera. For the price we paid, we assume the picture will be given as a memento. Nope, each print cost $25. This is a high-end restaurant, not a county fair or amusement park. Charging for instant polaroid is tacky. We will not be back.

fZXW6mQrRaJzt36wLsB_SA.text: This was incredible. The food was top, never before better steak and lobster. Desert was incredible and service was impeccable. Cost, very high. $500 for two is high but a treat and worth it. The Wagu was unbeatable! The lobster was incredible. The oysters were some of the best ever had! This was a special dinner for me and my love and I'm so glad I chose this place. 5 stars if you truly are into GREAT meat and service! I'm going back,

Wp9M1QD98J96D5gEudXahA.text: I never ever thought this day would come. This was my reference restaurant. I compared everything to this place. It has been my go to place for years.  I have been going there since it opened. I have had many many many tastings there and they were all above and beyond. In fact I walked out of certain restaurant in LV and they fixed it. The male Gm has on more than one occasion made me very happy.   Tonight however. Came in for a late night dinner. Intention of sharing an A5 wagyu NY strip, foie grass and some sides.  Not very hungry, but upwards of 350-400 dollars for a meal. Ok so the server idk his name.  Convinced me to get a A5 tasting.  Like he should.  Upsell best you can.  I bought in. And ordered.    Food comes and at first a small table side lobster bisque comes alone. Immediately after it hitting the table a huge plate of prosciutto, a warm frisse salad and some other salad. Ok soup 2 salads and a cured meat.  My entire table had no more room.  I stopped the expo, and said we have a tasting menu which he responded "yeah these are the apps" and continues to drop food.  I said " if you were sitting would you want all your food to be dropped at the same time. He said no then I said take some of this away.  What do you expect me to do with ALL THIS FOOD?   He says don't eat it all. I'm shocked.  Crazy amounts of food for a tasting.  The server returns and I say" just charge me for what I ate.  And we will go somewhere else. Anyways the AGM. Female is making all kinds of gestures and when I approach her.  She was acting like a 12 year old.   And getting loud. People all looking at me like I assaulted her. She's getting louder and louder. Calling the GM from across the room.  He approached and She dismissed me like I wanna nobody. Soooo.  I just said. We just want to leave. I had a Diet Coke and am willing to pay for it. He said it's ok. I left.   Those of you who know me, know I don't lie or embellish my reviews.  I will never  return to this place.  For what would've been at least a 1k meal. Don't treat me like I don't matter.    Hope someone important sees this.  Such a shame on how one persons bad night can ruin a whole experience.

nqoYdB2Y9yvupDrpVZzjDQ.text: Fantastic. The food is outstanding! Loved the steak, pureed potatoes, rolls, Caesar salad, everything! The service is wonderful, attention to detail is amazing. Would love to go back!

yzGXZTAgZEvkfBpeghePhA.text: Great Steakhouse  Perfect dining experience. Eddie and the wait staff were the best. My glass never got half empty. The food is excellent, from the salads to the sides we perfectly prepared and served. Best Ribeye I can remember. Everything is prepared in house, even the mint ice cream. Can't wait to go back.

lxLZMXMhuo_hd2jHe1Q2fg.text: Thank goodness for clients, because if it was just for my husband and myself, I think I would have to think long and hard about the cost.  But hey, it's a client meeting, and they expect the best and Craftsteak delivered.    We all had one of the 'meal deals' that comes with an entree, three salads, three sides and dessert.  We ordered some Frank Family Cab+ some Prisoner Cab to pair.   It was all stellar.  We were overstuffed, but soooo happy.  We ordered the bone in rib eye, scallops, mushroom mix, Caesar salad, the potato puree, lobster bisque and some other things that were top notch.  Service was the best.  All totally worth the roughly $250 per person.

XM17x49gGlKyu6_r1u3kwQ.text: I'm a bit of a foodie, I wanna try the tar tare and the strange combinations that are only available at an upscale joint like this.  I went with a mixture of ladies of varying foodie strengths.  We ate steak and potatoes and corn and it was all delicious.  We had the frisee salad and it was wonderful, a bit heavy on the dressing but it worked.  The tar tare was very good.  The bread rolls are also very very yummy.  The steaks are large and we all loved everything.  The braised ribs made my poor crock pot ribs seem like peasant food. The potato puree was yummy, we had a nice discussion on it's consistency and I think I would have liked it a bit thicker but other people preferred it's thinner consistency.  Drinks and wine were enjoyed and it was a merry old time.  Not sure we'll be back but I do recommend this place.  The bar area when you walk in is nice, a bit more causal than main dining room and would be good for impromptu visit.

bzFnfbH5t9p3VOmnIOXCUg.text: Craftsteak willl always hold a special place in my heart as my first Vegas steakhouse experience. My husband took me here for my birthday and the restaurant seated us in a corner booth which was nice. The feel of Craft is swanky and upscale. The real stand out was the monkey bread dessert that I'll dream of forever.  We started with some tasty cocktails that hit the spot. The hot buns and butter arrived. I loved how the bread was served, especially that it arrives warm and buttery.   For my entree I had the filet which was flavorful and tender. My husband had the bison which is a less tender meat, but he enjoyed the taste. I tried some, but didn't find it to be my cup of tea. We shared broccoli and scalloped potatoes. The broccoli was cooked well and the potatoes were really yummy. We definitely killed the potatoes.   Dessert is a must and was definitely my favorite part of the whole meal. The monkey bread was to die for and would make dining here worth it.   This is an above average restaurant with above average service and food.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. THE monkey bread.
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bison
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scalloped potatoes.

oPOGbmUKKXrcJ1QKy9DWMw.text: Very disappointing! I've been to many high end steak houses in the Mid West and Craftsteak would not rank in the top 10.  The good : All the sides we tried were very good. But at $15-$22, the sides should be good. The risotto was the favorite. The mashed potatoes are also very good. The Caesar's salad was a classic with real anchovies.   Service was decent but a little slow at times  The bad : I had the grilled NY strip bone in ordered medium. After a lengthy wait. The steak came out way past medium. I sent it back. After another 15 minutes another steak came cooked properly. My wife finished her meal however before my second steak came. But the steak was the worst $50 steak I've ever had. For a dry age steak it was very tough. Even with the steak knife it was hard to cut. Most high end steakhouses will trim the gristle and fat from the outside of the steak but not here. I only ate half of my steak.   They offered nothing for the inconvenience, no free desserts or discounts on the meal. Just a sorry.   We made reservations at 7:45pm. There are plenty of tables available when we called. We got seated next to the bar, in the bar really. Terrible seats! Loud and constantly getting bumped by people at the bar.   This is not what i expected from a Tom Colichio restaurant.

n2vD62PAoDbkMsZR8nYzfQ.text: Amazing meal. Chose the chefs selection for myself and hubby. We won at the Bellagio and wanted to splurge on an excellent meal. Worth every penny. The key lime martini is everything in the world. Try it.

OFc6EDbotfBtjwu-4fm2TQ.text: This is the 3rd time going to Craftsteak and it has to be the best steakhouse in Vegas. Executive chef Michael Chapman set up a tasting menu that was fabulous. The handcrafted cocktails are delicious we started out with lobster bisque a variety of appetizers. The short ribs are in a class all their own the New York strip, scallops the pureed potatoes, cauliflower, root vegetables, this place is a must stop for anyone that wants an excellent dinner. The service is impeccable and the feeling of the room is somewhere you want to be. I couldn't have picked a better menu then the chef provided.

caRo_PnwcRttgemQfylPWA.text: WOW. ABSOLUTELY hands down the BEST food you will have in your life. cocktails are amazing and the service is OUTSTANDING. we did NOT want to leave. INCREDIBLE. we will definitely be back!!

HmDepkiE6PdE0i3I4G_k-w.text: A top tier steakhouse serving proper man size cuts of phenomenal beef.    Top tier?  IMHO there are four in Vegas: Craftsteak, Cut, Prime, Stripsteak.  All offer a great variety of cuts, breeds, providence, and aging that showcase the best flavor of each.  All beef, well trimmed and cooked perfectly to temp with a great sear every time served in a steakhouse proper environment.  Solid but simple sides and a killer wine list a must.  That said, the steaks:  14-28 day dry aged USDA Prime steaks and butchers cuts (rib eye, porterhouse, t-bone, NY strip, filet, flat iron, hanger, skirt), domestic wagyu, and Japanese A5.   Go with a group, order several and share.  Quality and flavor speak for themselves.  You can't go wrong with any.  Top props to the dry aged porterhouse with its brooding beefy flavor, Snake River flat iron for its very tender yet sweet and meaty flavor, and the A5 rib cap with its very sweet, unctuous mouth feel and clean beef finish.  Best kept secret?  24 hour braised beef short rib.  Perfect.  Meltingly tender without being stringy.  Well glazed.  Caramelized flavors with a beefy core.  Hard to pass.  Simple sides that compliment the steaks.  Do not pass on the mushroom assortment.  Shitake, French horn, white beech and hen of the woods all simply sauteed.  Toothsome, wonderfully earthy flavor that adds an umame punch to all the dry aged steaks.  Carrots in a lightly citrusy local honey and butternut squash in a bourbon maple glaze heightens the metallic flavor, the sweet sour Maui onions add a wonderful earthiness and enhances the natural sweetness.  Relatively standard salads and starters if you must.  The warm frisee with egg and smoked bacon a great way to whet your palate for the carnivorous meal to come.  Good selection of very fresh oysters.  Craftsteak boasts the best selection of single malts in the city.  10-50 year, page after page of whiskeys.  As an aperitif, paired with the meal or a night cap.  Indulge.  A great wine list with many non-American producers offers great alternatives for those wanting something more traditional.  Vegas resort pricing.  Outstanding steakhouse friendly and proper service.  Advance reservations a must.  Dining at the bar is an alternative but be warned, it gets crowded during the peak of dinner service.  Visit after visit, Craftsteak delivers.  Worthy.

vxRcdWpEY0lE-ErIpnrdUg.text: This steakhouse is absolutely wonderful! I honestly don't think there is anything bad on the menu.   I had the beef short ribs, that melted in your mouth to perfection. I wish I could make those at home myself! The party I was with ordered steak options. I tried each and they were all amazing.  Great place, clean restaurant, staff was lovely to our entire party (including a child) and the ambience made the whole experience that much better.   I would come back but not for awhile! Expect to spend some $$

fAaiIaydrEatWwLQdauPSA.text: The WORST $400 meal ever. If I had paid $50 for this meal I would have been sorely disappointed.  First, the steak and seafood. The Hangar steak was cooked into tasteless charred little chunks. The NY Strip was sub-par. I guess they are known for serving everything in a pan so the customer is responsible for scraping the food off the pan and into the plate. That was surprising and unappealing. Plating food is part of the fine dining experience. Schlepping an $80 steak off a pan and into your plate as the grease spatters onto your clothes is strange.The diver scallops were delicious. So yay?  The sides: The french fries were chunky and soggy. The Hen of the Woods mushroom was literally just mushrooms thrown on a plate. No seasoning, no sauce.... NOTHING. The potato puree was decent, but unimaginative. Same for the charcuterie. We asked for one extra roll and they added a charge for "extra cheese" $4 to our bill. Cheesy.  After dinner: Our French dinner guest asked for a "little coffee" at the end of her meal and they brought her a huge french press of coffee. After dinner. At 11 o'clock at night. WTH? Our waiter brought us some complimentary cookies at the end, which were chocolate chip cookies that tasted like they were straight out of a paper box.Then our waiter just disappeared. Never saw him again. We couldn't get anyone to close out our tab or help us. We waited a solid 20 minutes and then flagged a couple waiters down to help us wrap up.   This meal was so bad it made my husband angry. The disappearing waiter act was pretty crazy too. I would never recommend this restaurant to anyone and by the recent reviews, it seems like the sub-par food and service is a problem there right now. Try another spot.

mPU1ESp4lGB-PUux6RwBMg.text: I was completely WOWed by my experience here.  This place is HUGE for an upscale steakhouse AND the service is great.  The only negative about our experience was that I noticed something floating in my water and I asked for another and said it may be a bug and the server said "It's probably a gnat we have those here in the desert".  Working in the service industry - even if it is a bug, DONT tell me it is!  Good lord.  We started off with cocktails and the beef tartar which was delicious.  The flavor was amazing!   I had filet mignon which was great and for sides we had the potatoes au gratin.  We had the monkey bread for dessert which was out of this world!  It basically melted in your mouth.  The way the restaurant is laid out it made for a social dining experience and we ended up chatting with the tables around us which was fun!  Other than the "bug" incident my experience was astounding and I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious monkey bread for our Birthday Celebration - Best dessert I&#39;ve had!
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Tartar

b5L43tFzg6Nz3mxdooLMJA.text: Stayed at the MGM and didn't feel like going anywhere else for dinner so I ended up at Craftsteak. Overall, pretty good experience!  We started with a bowl of the Maine Lobster Bisque. It was one of the best that I've had! I think that it would have been better with a little less of the Tarragon, but the soup itself was outstanding!  For my entree, I had the the New York Strip cooked medium rare. Damn good steak! Also had a side of the roasted corn which was pretty good.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster bisque
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted corn
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium rare New York Strip

GOKr3WZ3t4yJfr_IO-wJpw.text: Why take a 9:30 pm reservation if you are going to kick us out at 11:00 pm? So rude.  Told us to come back the next day at 5 pm when they open if we enjoyed it so much.

NV17hL7T4nkTI9lVJfIs-Q.text: I am not a big fan of steak restaurants and was out numbered by my coworkers when we voted on where to dine. Craftsteak impressed me. The food was very well presented and prepared. The service was superior , which only added to the experience. I had never tried True wagyu beef and I am glad I did. Truly an excellent steak. Do not and I mean do NOT skip the monkey bread at the end. One of the best desserts you will ever have!

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A 5 Japanese Wagyu

9cFTNBUIkV_C-zySf0-yJg.text: The Craftsteak in the MGM Grand is one of the best steakhouses in Las Vegas. The food is awesome and the staff is great. Pricey, Its great for a romantic dinner, come dressed up. Make a reservation first, it does get busy!

FnYjq0XxACz6LlTD-o94lA.text: What a great dinner.   In our large-ish group, hardly anyone ordered the same thing and all of us left fully satisfied.   Great selection of cuts and sides and drinks (and non-steaks for those who prefer other options).  The steaks were perfectly seasoned and prepared, and an absolute joy to eat.  Sure, you're going to pay top dollar... but that's the case for pretty much any place on the Strip, and this is one of the few I would want to re-visit.  In the world of steakhouses, Craftsteak is a winner.

Egki9Q0m84SbmTIcaRkLMg.text: Let me just say...its been two days since our party has been there. We are STILL talking about the food! There are really no words actually, just moments of pure silence....food porn now completely understood. My husband and I went to Carnevinos @ the Venetian in January and although the dinosaur steak we had there was good, the steaks here were FAR more superior in flavor. Everything we had, the flavors were just enhanced tenfold, never masking what the natural dish was. Food will never be the same, we all need therapy now. Everyone had a great time and we will make a trip out just to eat here again.

sgzWJy80Qc7meHI1NFRkKA.text: Poor Example of a High-End Steakhouse. Overpriced, $58 10oz Filet was not only tough, but lacked any flavor. I thought it was just a bad cut of Steak. The NY Strip across the table was also flavorless. Very Expensive, even for Vegas. Don't waste your time or money on this place. Definitely would NOT return.

Mxax70DqdktPcF4_unl6NA.text: So let me start off by saying that I'm a big Tom fan, and wanted to say nothing but the best things about his restaurant. The only good thing I can say is excellent service. A+ for service. The food was lackluster to say the least. For that price, there needs to be some luster.  Mushroom was bland, steak was blah, and the rest forgettable.  The experience (and that is what eating there should be for that price) is disappointing. Not terrible, but disappointing.

A2XeNJtqjdXHRLF1A_rgfg.text: My go to steakhouse in Vegas. My family and I go here all the time while we are in Vegas. The Kobe beef here is to die for. The staff always takes good care of us here. Can't wait until our next visit.

wECqOaYy5rvMCqH9wOjoaA.text: Great high-end steaks in the heart of the MGM Grand strip.  We went during a business conference in Las Vegas.  The dinner was for a personal celebration and the bill easily came up to 200.  We each ordered a steak and shared a side of asparagus.  I had one beer, the other person, a wine.  My steak came out great (a T-Bone) and was prepared medium.  The person I was with ordered a filet and it came well done instead of medium as ordered.  They re-made the steak for her but a bit of a bummer.  We started with appetizers of oysters.  The quality of the food was fantastic and this is a great place to wine and dine in either a business meeting or a personal party but be prepared to pay premium prices for the location and quality of the cuisine.

lGeUqCWH3Dko4SedaWCw0Q.text: Amazing food and incredible service!  I have eaten here several times and it has always been a 5 star experience.  The price points are validated by the portions and quality of food. Steaks start at $40 and up.  Even though this is a steakhouse they have delicious scallops and seafood. I am pretty sure everything on the menu is organic and farm raised. My favorite sides are the potato au gratin and the Brussels sprouts.   If you want to splurge do the tasting menu (it will run you about $150 ish but it's worth it). It is plenty of food and changes depending on what the chef wants to serve.  It's best to choose this option if everyone at the table wants to do the tasting menu (I think they don't want people to order one and share with the whole table).  The ambiance is very elegant without being pretentious.  It is also great for large groups.

IdP4N03stcy_GkSl0yjUfA.text: This is the best place for a large group in Vegas.  We had 10 in our party.  Our waiter recommended that Chef's Beef Selection with the domestic waygu. It was the meal of my life.  We basically got the entire menu family style.  We got an array of appetizers.  Then we got several salads.  We got 2 versions of 5 different steaks with basically all the sides.  The steak was out of this world delicious.  It was great fun to try the different cuts. The sides were delicious, but we were trying to make room for the steak.   Finally, it finished with a several delicious deserts.  It was incredible.  Worth every penny.  For a large group for steak, there is no better place in Vegas.  The wait staff really takes care of you.

dQx4RjFobVfv_GABaxZ_JA.text: Hands down the best dining experience of my life!!! From the second we got there the service was superb. Our table wasn't ready yet so we had a drink at the bar first. The bartender was incredibly knowledgeable and gave me a great glass of wine. Once seated the waiter took us through their menu point by point and made us feel very comfortable with everything.   We ended up going with a tasting menu with the Japanese Wagu beef. It started with a salad tasting menu. Each was better then the last. We probably got full just on the salads!!! The next course was the beef with the sides. We got the New York Strip and a Filet. The sides were the asparagus, mushrooms, and the mashed potatoes. Everything was melt in your mouth amazing, including the beef!!! I don't think I've ever eaten a steak that good and I don't think I ever will. When dessert came we were almost comatose with the amount of food we had already had so we just took it to go and went to our suite and enjoyed it later. Once we had digested a little of our amazing dinner!!!  A must go to while you're in Vegas!! Can't wait to try the Craft in LA!!!

gTNbCBRvclZN2dFJlUacsw.text: I must first start off and say I've never had steak before. I was advised by my friend if you're gonna have steak, you might as well have the best. So we decided Tom Colicchio might know a thing or two about steak. Therefore if you are a steak connoisseur, look at someone else's review!   Pros: Very nice casual atmosphere  My water glass was always filled... always... like if I just think about my water I see a water person waiting in the corner ready to refill my glass  Very little noise,  not like creepy deserted quietness, more like a nice low murmur.   Waiter and all the staff we met were very kind and courteous about everything  Cons:  I don't know if it'll be too memorable. The food was good, the service was good but when I come back to Vegas again I'm not going to be like "I have GOT to go to Craftsteak, like OMG gurl."  4 stars

g7wgiPmrR70NUw3WQA8wvw.text: Thanks to Yelp, I had one of the best dining experiences at Craftsteak. If money isn't an object, then by all means, splurge!!!  The following was ordered:  Wine: Pinot Noir, Patricia Green Cellars, Reserve, 2007: VERY smooth, and I'm not customary to drinking reds. Currently searching for this wine in San Diego, I enjoyed it this much...  Craftsteak Chef's Winter Tasting:   Appetizers: -Grilled Quail with Vincotto: YUM, this was the best appetizer dish out of the 4. Tasted like game hen. Spices were up to par on this dish.  -Buffalo Mozzarella Cheese and Red Pepper Caponata: I enjoyed this cool appetizer. My 2nd fav...  -Mixed Baby Lettuces: Just a regular cucumber salad to me, but refreshing.  -Shaved Fennel Salad: Tasted just like pickled, crunchy noodles. Not a fan...  Main Course: Grilled Angus Skirt Steak: Medium rare, juicy, and very tasty! 2 different cuts of beef and both were excellent.  Roasted Flat Iron Steak: Medium rare, and also very juicy and tasty!  Diver Sea Scallops: Huge pieces and delectable!   Sides: Yukon Gold Potato Puree: Smooth and buttery Baby Shiitake Mushrooms: Great over the steaks, however, very scrumptious alone  Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Could do without   Dessert: Chocolate Souffle Hot Fudge Sauce & Caramel Ice Cream: DELICIOUS!!! I was in chocolate heaven!!! Vanilla Bean Cheesecake Blueberries & Lemon Poppy Seed Tuile: I'm a fan, although I loved the souffle the best!!!  The service was excellent, and everyone was very friendly, proper and helpful. I heard that this place gets packed, and for a week night, it was getting there. Enjoyed my experience, and hope to come back soon!

MoPP2IswgPBzD7eLcvY7Iw.text: Craftsteak was amazing. Definitely worth the money and worth all five stars. We were a bachelorette party of 4 ladies who were on a time crunch as we had tickets to see Boyz II Men at the Mirage at 7:30. One of the great things about this restaurant is that you can make a reservation via Yelp/Open Table or on their website. And our time was 5:45, I believe.   For appetizers, we tried the Diver Sea Scallops. I LOVED THESE. They were so flavorful and perfectly seasoned. So perfectly cooked as well! Honestly out of the world, and certainly the best scallops I have ever had. It's definitely a dish you must have and try whilst here.  We also had the organic lettuces with lemon vinaigrette. Good salad, but very large pieces. I didn't care too much for the lemon, but that's on me and not on the restaurant.  I split the Free Range Chicken au jus with my girl friend and that was moist and tender. Seasoned very well. We had french fries and the Brentwood sweet corn as sides. French fries were your typical french fries, nothing extremely special, but still delicious. That corn, however, also amazing! Never thought to saute corn and green onions together, but it was innovative to me, haha. The seasonings they used were on point though.   Very immaculate service from the chefs and staff. I would go back again and again if I lived in Vegas. We were in a rush for our show, so our poor waiter was rushed by us. We tipped him generously though and hoped he didn't think we hated his service, he was excellent. He even brought us dessert and congratulated my bride friend.

V9m2-9SRvE0aQlnbXf7Mpg.text: this is a steak house that I'd wanna go back to again...  services were awesome, decor and all the settings are comfortable - witness a gentlemen kneel down and propose to his lady - how romantic was that?   i had the domestic wagyu flat iron - 8 oz, just the right amount, tender and soft that it really melt in your mouth... definitely recommend - even the onion was yum.  also got a taste of my friends' rib eyes and filet, they are both very tasty too!   selection of wine was okay - i thought they were a little overpriced. didn't get to try their appetizers or deserts but their sides (spinach, potato, assortment mushroom) are all pretty average.  would definitely come back if i get a chance again with an empty stomach (and a fat wallet)  to try their appetizers, cocktails and deserts!

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VrfJevDh2hPgKYMTuMb0UA.text: As the epicenter of the Strip keeps migrating north, the MGM Grand in general just doesn't seem to have the pull it once did.  I feel the same way about Craftsteak.  This was probably amazing in 2002 when it opened...  ...but, I think the more recent hotels on the Strip learned from the MGM and really raised the bar.  The steaks at Craftsteak were good, but the overall environment, experience, and location just can't compete with the likes of Prime, the SW steakhouse, Botero, the Eiffel Tower restaurant, etc.  The tables near the entrance felt like eating in a mall.  Just didn't work for me.

C33FZTtMIgcNGMjCeAdeEA.text: Amazing. Simply fantastic.  Cannot say enough wonderful things.  My husband and I were in Vegas for our anniversary and decided to do a little celebrity chef steak comparison.  We ate at Craftsteak and Gordon Ramsay steak.  Craftsteak was the Hands Down winner in every category!   Food was incredible.  The cheese grits were to die for.  Steaks were simple and well cooked.  Food presentation was lovely.  Monkey bread for dessert was yummy!!    Where Craftsteak really stood out was in service.  The servers used a partner system, which worked great.  I believe our two servers were Marlon and Bleu.  One spent time walking us through the menu and the other took our order.  I liked this approach because it allowed one to make recommendations and the other took the order so you didn't feel badly if you didn't take their recommendations.     Overall, fantastic experience at Craftsteak - will definitely return on our next trip to Vegas and will certainly be recommending to friends.

gDkUuMKC9l17_X3udf_6yQ.text: LOVE this place!  This place offers the best steak I've ever had! Everything literally melted in my mouth like butter. We had the waygu, rib-eye, oysters, and more. Exceptional dining experience to the core. The wine list is superb. The atmospher was romantic and the lighting was on point. My favorite sides are the potato au gratin, grits, and brussel sprouts. I did not have any bad dishes there. The service was great, and our waitress was very attentive!  If you are in need of a date spot, this is definitely a place you should select! Plus, KA and David Copperfield are in the same vicinity. Anyone who wants the best slice of meat on earth should definitely stop by here!

aZFlEh3COA1qiOhxWhiQVA.text: I am not a regular meat eater so when I detour I try to make it memorable. Taking a detour at Craftsteak certainly went well beyond that expectation. We went full out and did the Chef's Beef Selection and went for the Australian A5 Wagyu that was served family style. Yes, we had salad, sides, dessert, and even two selections of beef with the whole experience. What all of the details were, however, are all a blur. The main focus was the beef and I must say it was quite amazing.  It was cooked to perfection and the texture and taste were something I have never experienced before. The service was extremely friendly and attentive as well. Bottom line it certainly exceeded my expectations and I would definitely do it again though if I did I think I would try to change it up a bit -- maybe the surf and turf? Who knows, I just would not want to wreck any exaggerated memories that build up over time for the meal we had since it is going to be hard, very hard, to match the experience again.

Psbq4eThdabJRZ5KHwCq7w.text: Best meal I've had in a while! We had the filet with the risotto and street corn for a side. Everything was amazing! The service was top notch. Wayne Brady sat two tables down from us and I felt we received the same attention and service as he did. Would definitely recommend!

jOUK7SI7kUHvct9GPGFvqQ.text: I was really disappointed by my experience at craftsteak.  Ate here with 5 of my dearest oldest friends for my bachelorette weekend.  Huge fan of top chef, and when I discovered tom collichio owned this place I just had to try it for our big saturday night meal.  We are all big foodies.  And no, I was not wearing a veil and tiara or any blinking jewelry.  We are all in our late 20s early 30s and were well behaved, at least til the end of the night when we had consumed several martinis and bottles of vino.  We may have been laughing loudly but we never got rowdy...and we were practically in a PDR for chrissake so I could've mooned the table next to me and only about a dozen or so people might see.  Not that I would.  Just sayin, we were hidden away.  All that being said...service was freaking awful.  Our server was an older gentleman, and he was downright rude.  If 18% gratuity had not been tacked on, I honestly might have gone 15% (which I NEVER do being a former server and bartender myself..I have maybe done this once in my life!).  I ordered the surf & turf - a splurge - but usually one of my favorite things to eat.   The filet was a tad undercooked for medium rare, but I kinda like it in between rare and med rare so it was fine by me.  One of my friends couldn't handle it!  The lobster was so rubbery and chewy and coldish and flavorless...did it come out of the fridge?   Side dishes bored me (and everyone).    My opening salad was good - but only because we shared a ton of starters and I mixed the mozzarella salad with the tomato salad to make my own caprese.  I think one of my friends enjoyed her short ribs.  Nobody raved about anything.  Except maybe the hot sticky buns that come out in the beginning.  Truly sad we did not enjoy it!  Should've eaten elsewhere.  Will not return.

aa1z5nrKC4XDUmeUTuA60A.text: one of the best steakhouses i have ever eaten at. if you're going with a group of 4 and money is no object, i'd suggest doing the kobe tasting menu. it's 3 courses but the amount of food is so generous. especially the desserts. personally, i don't think the upgrade to surf and turf is worth it. unless it's a 2 pound lobster tail or the sea scallops. sometimes the prawns and crab legs surf options are little too rich because of the butter poaching. my favorite thing on the menu is the kobe skirt. also if you like your whiskey on the rocks, the restaurant has an icemaker that makes a 2 1/2 square inch cube.

Z3RCMMULPanaH0TrgN86Dg.text: This place is great! I had heard about it through Top Chef and know that they have one in LA, but was told that the LV location was the cream of the crop. Coming here for my birthday weekend I made reservations for 6 with no problem. We arrived and were all floored by the decor and how busy it was. They have an extensive selection of choice scotch and burbon that you dont see many places, as well as a wine selection that will wow even the most seasoned drinkers. We all decided to go with the domestic Wagyu tasting menu ($130.00 per person) and the result was nothing short of phenominal. The chef selects the best available cuts, sides, salads, apps and deserts but asks you before hand if there is anything you cant live without and  anything you allergic to or dont want. They brought out the salads and sides first: great buffalo mozzerella with 25 yr old balsalmic, ceaser, confit with bacon and blue cheese, arugala, etc....everything awsome. Next came the steaks and sides: Hangar, New York, Fillet, braised short ribs, T-Bone (enough for 10 people) along with asparagus, 4 different types of mushrooms, beets, potatoes....the list goes on and on. When the waiter came by and told us to make sure and leave room for dessert everyone laughed and gave him the old "yeah...right" look, then the desserts came out. Lava Cake, Eight different types of ice cream and sorbet, cheescake, monkey bread and fruit plate (all some of the best desserts Ive ever had). We all left feeling full and if I had one complaint about this place is that we ate so much no one wanted to go to the foundation room after we were dome because everyone was so stuffed. The service was spot on and despite being very crowded, everyone got taken care of promptly when they had a request. Tom Collichio should be very proud to be the owner of this joint, I have told several people since I have been back that it was definetely one of the best meals I have had in my life!

mHvyWq4oDppLZSJqFmyjig.text: I went with a party of 10 and we all go the kobe tasting menu.  We only enjoyed one of the cuts.  I can't remember which cut it was.  I'm guessing it's the skirt steak.  The rest of the cuts were just ok.  For the money you spend here, I would expect all the cuts to be at least "good" if not "great."  I would not recommend this restaurant to steak lovers.  You're better off going to the SW Steakhouse at the Wynn.

kUEBRvoi_3ZjSK4XfwQX6A.text: Steak heaven, no doubt about it. The filet I had wasn't Kobe but it could have been. The Yukon gold potato puree was amazing (better than Joel Robuchon) and potato heaven. Excellent table, service and vibe (a little busy). Superb wine list. This is a great place to take a date or have dinner with friends. If you stay away from the Kobe menu the steak menu prices are very competitive $35-$50 depending on the cut. Craftsteak is highly recommended.

XsbxVKrAYZakpE946WHHwQ.text: Great food!  Great service!  A little pricey!  Good Ambiance!

1aSObNe46KBb5ZxekI_6lQ.text: My girlfriends and I are HUGE foodies and huge Tom Colicchio fans.   My issue was that the three of us came to restaurant ready to spend money on a fantastic meal and the entire meal felt rushed.  Our server made it clear that the kitchen was super "slammed' and made us feel as though we didn't have the luxury of time to enjoy the various courses of our meal.    He almost audibly sighed when we decided to order extra oysters and one of the servers had a conniption fit in front of us when he came to the table and saw that we were still eating our apps.  To top it all off - we decided that we would do a "taste test" between the Kobe Rib Eye and the "regular" filet.  It was very disappointing to say that while both steaks were good there was no wow factor for either.   Then we discover that our original server left without introducing the new server.  It was very obvious that the staff were ready for us to leave and this was disappointing since we spent quite a bit of money there and weren't really made to feel welcome.   We left not talking about the great food - but about the disappointment we felt.

BmuvnikOvGD_TjynHyzZuw.text: The food was amazing, though I've never been so full in my life! We decided to splurge and ordered the three-course tasting menu featuring domestic wagyu beef. After asking us which appetizers and cuts we were particularly interested in, our waiter proceeded to bring us four full appetizers, two 10-12oz steaks, and three deserts. He remarked to us, "we don't like to do those down-sized tasting portions like french restaurants.". I'll say! Everything was delicious--probably the best steak house food we've ever had, including not only the melt-in-your-mouth amazing filet mignon, but knock-your-socks-off sides of roasted corn, creamy mashed potatoes, and mixed mushrooms--and the service was impeccable, but on reflection I wish they'd given us slightly less food and charged us slightly less money. When the food is that expensive (and yummy), you really want to eat it all, but no one should really eat that much in one meal, even if it's by Tom Colicchio.

4jP27-LVxv9Gt3b8grT7Ww.text: We went last night, was great food. The salads were amazing especially. The Frizee salad is to die for and they have the best caesar salad i have ever had and i get it everywhere i go. The steak was good as well, i got Filet Mignon for 56$ and my girlfriend got the short ribs. There was only two issues I had with the restaurant. The ambience and decor was lacking in my opinion, and although the steak was good, I would have liked to have had something more than just a piece of meat, perhaps with some type of dressing, or culinary work done to it other than just cooking it. The sides are also pretty plain. I would go again, but just for the salads.

0TZNkpc6s6TU6XwrVQX2lw.text: Went to craftsteak with a group of about 7 people.  The steak and pork were overdone and way too salty.  We had all been to our share of steak houses in NY and it just seemed like the prices were not justified by the food.

5HGbhAzCXDngWSTckGBtuA.text: When spending over $200 for a dinner I expect it to be fabulous.  This dinner was "OK".  The steak was luke warm, the tuscan kale so salty I couldn't eat it and the scalloped potatoes bland.  Very disappointing and I will not return with all the steak places to choose from in this town. If you are going to tout yourself as being great then you should be great for each and every customer all the time.

Ok6QeUcqsyAh3I2qwC200w.text: I LOVE CRAFT STEAK!!!  Everytime we go it gets better and better.  The filet is to die for and all of the delicious sides makes it challenging to not order them all.  The service is one of the best and the ambiance it fabulous.  I highly recommend for romantic dinners or a group of friends.

FXDNXYcFs6yAOg1heVB8Mw.text: We went to Craftsteak on Christmas Day for dinner. We had eight people in our party, so we were able to sample a variety of items. We had reservations at 5:45 pm and were seated promptly.  Setting: the restaurant itself was very attractive and pleasant. Noise level: average for a higher end restaurant. Wait staff: Friendly, knowledgable, and helpful. Were not overly intrusive and were willing to split the bill in half, giving us two separate charges. Food: Very good to excellent. Tried veal, ribeye (both the individual 16 oz and the 32 oz, bison, hanger steak, and veal. Got the quail, Maui onions, asparagus, sweet potato and mashed potatoes. The dessert was chocolate, monkey bread, and sorbet. As mentioned overall the food was terrific. The only marginal item was the bison. Three people ordered the bison and one of the three was bit overcooked. The best item was the hanger steak, really juicy, tender, and tasty. Having been Ruth Chris, Morton's, and a variety of high end steakhouse in our local area, I think that the quality of the food (main course and sidedishes) at Craftsteak is a least one or two notches above these other establishments. Cost: Average of $80 per person-without any alcohol. In summary, if you want a really good steak and are willing to pay the price, Craftsteak is a good choice. The four stars is for the quality of the food (very high) and the cost(also very high). Would have given it 5 stars if the cost had been $10-20 less per person.

lBBRt3bq3p7rxgAuI9h1bg.text: Pretty basic steakhouse. It was good, but nothing wowed me to the point that I will have to visit again. Flavors were good, everything was cooked properly. Service was good but forgettable.

e27aIHdHBnjLFTr5jPRE3A.text: Came here a few times around 6 years ago before I'd even ever heard of Tom Collichio and there wasn't any show called Top Chef.  So so fun to go here with a group of friends and get the tasting menu.  Just like some of the other reviewers said, it is a great meal for sharing.  Service is great, food is great, and the cornucopia of desserts that come out leads to a very festive time.  Pricing for the tasting menu is pretty strong but they have a right to be proud imho.  I wish I could give you more specifics but it's been a minute since I've been there and quite a few rough nights of drinking in between.

iaU77yJgXdUK7zabO2zhJQ.text: Went for 5 year anniversary.  Wouldn't suggest taking kids, however there were some there.  Tried their Summer Tasting for $59 a person.  It was really good.  Being a lover of rib eye steak, I have to say the skirt and flat iron steaks were very nice.  The corn has got to be the best corn my husband and I have ever tasted.  Mashed potatoes were a little buttery, but still very pleasant indeed.  Cheesecake, amazing with thin graham crust.  (I don't like thick crusts, overpowers cheesecake for me)  So much food, though.  But we were able to take it with us and it was a great 2 am snack!!  I would definitely go back!!

g7C1z_XH53loTKUH_wp8wg.text: i've been here a total of two times. the first time was a really long time ago that i don't even remember what i got. the second and most recent time was for nadia's bday dinner. we ended up getting the summer dining menu and i have no idea what entailed of that but it was yummy. when i sat down there was a magical shot of vodka in front of me. where did that come from? who cares. just drink it. ok. well, that and my martinis got me going throughout dinner. did i mention TJ at the bar?! he was awesome. made my dirty martinis with vodka and it tasted great. i also got extra olives which were quickly eaten my m drunken company. ok, back to dinner...the mashed potatoes we delish. the corn was sweet and tasty. the meat was tender but not enough of it. i don't there was enought food for our entree but tooons of dessert that didn't even get touched. next time...more entree and less dessert please.

n6SpujaB6JJx98G3PvQNtw.text: This was an amazing dining experience, you certainly pay for it, but I have no regrets.  We ordered the 130/person "tasting  menu".  It's not really a tasting menu since they give you full sized portions for each dish.  After having bread and the first three dishes of the first course, I was pretty satisfied.  The diver scallops from this course were the best I've ever had, truly amazing.  The next course was delicious murder on my stomach.  There was just so much food.  We had 2 steaks (the strip was fantastic), potato puree, assorted and grilled shrooms and corn.  Everything was well executed and simple, showcasing the exceptional quality of the ingredients.  Thankfully the dessert stomach kicked in because we were given 4 full sized desserts.  A truly divine bread pudding, 4 scoops of delicious gellato, a wonderful cheesecake with cumquats and a bowl of blackberries.  The bread pudding was a serious stand out.  My wife, who hates bread pudding, wouldn't stop eating it.  I had to clamor to get my share.  There goes my playstation 3 money, but like I said, no regrets.

KIXqEdaR-2F30-v9QZazQQ.text: Ate here back in January 2011. We had huge expectations leading up since this was our showcase dinner for our entire Las Vegas trip. An excellent steakhouse with a nice atmosphere. We ordered the braised short ribs and hangar steak with a side of the yukon gold potato puree. The food was absolutely excellent and we could not from taking bite after bite. We also celebrated our anniversary here. They shared with us a nice desert plate of chocolates with "Happy Anniversary" written on the plate with chocolate sauce. For desert we ended up trying the monkey bread dish and it was just as excellent as the main course. One con with the restaurant is the photo person who comes around to all the tables and asks to take your picture and then tries to haggle with you later to purchase the picture they had just taken with you. The picture is nearly priced as much as an entree...ridiculous. We definitely want to come back and experience more of the menu. We would also love to try the desert tasting here too.

_OY5pI-FXFWUuVdYj8T3eg.text: I Have been hearing about Craftsteak forever and finally took the plunge. glad i went? yes. would i go back? maybe......let me start off by whats great. wine list. however this is a place to buy the bottle not the glass....the group i was with all prefer different types of wine so our wine by the glass selection was very limited. I had the surf and turf- filet and scallops. both were really tasty, simple but cooked perfectly and really generous portions. not the best i have ever had but right up there with the best. starters- ceasar salad (good but not great), mozerella salad(really good) , the bread was amazing. we had the white corn as a side and it was really really good- i dont eat corn so for me to say this is saying a lot. the potatoes au gratin though....meh at best. i think the real issue i have with Craftsteak is how completely overpriced it is, how uncomfortable the chairs are just really left me wanting more....and with so many other notable chefs so close I don't see a reason to return.

mszidMZopQzDW52VEtLX2A.text: Very disappointing meal...  We take a yearly trip to Vegas and always have a steak dinner on the last night.  We've hit a them all on the strip, but this is the first time I've been truly disappointed. They were out of a few of the items on the drink menu. The steaks were mediocre at best. In particular the prime NY strop was extremely bad. No flavor at all and there was so much fat and connected tissue that I couldn't even eat 3/4 of it. Upon telling the staff, they were in different. No apology or effort to make it right.  I've had better steaks and service at your middle of the road steak chain on the side of the highway. I would not return and would recommend going elsewhere. On top of everything else they have a photographer walking thru taking pictures of you like you are at an amusement park...quite tacky!  Go

CWCip3tHPv6nDUtuhkKRpg.text: Craftsteak in the MGM was a great last minute find during the iheart music concert. We arrived a few minutes early for our dinner but was seated around 15min later. I found the menu options a bit confusing with the Chef's Beef Selection Three Course Menus option. It turned out to be cheaper for everyone to order alacarte and get the beef of their choice. The food was prepared as ordered. The ribeye and salad was great. My biggest concern was the 2.5hrs it took to complete a salad, main entree and dessert meal.

SlKFT4o06FslZFFhm2Zd7g.text: We ate at Tom's in Las Vegas for an anniversary with our parents. Between the four of us we had the 10oz fillet with lobster, the T-bone with lobster, lobster bisque, fingerling potatoes and asparagus and drinks.  I personally had the 10oz fillet with lobster. I would rate the steak a 7 out of 10. Ordered it medium, it came medium to medium well with the outer part more on the med-well to well side (tough to cut, which should never happen with a fillet).  Overall I would say it was a fairly good meal, not great. I would, however, like to point out a glaring issue I had with the restaurant. I would consider this to be fine dining as our bill was over $400 with tip. In any fine dining restaurant, your tables should not be placed 4 feet from the bar. I had guys yelling in my ear and was elbowed in the head (some may say I deserved it...). We did see other tables experiencing this same issue.
